freends set downe breefe discourse parcell thing obserued reading manifold antiquity perused toward furniture chronologie haue yet hand first verie loth yeeld desire first thought selfe vnable want skill iudgment suddenlie hastie speed take charge vpon secondlie bicause dealing therein might prooue hinderance impechment vnto mine owne treatise finallie giuen ouer earnest studie history iudging time spent hinderance vnto necessarie dealing vocation function wherevnto called ministerie importunate reasonable excuse could serue put trauell condescended length vnto yrkesome sute promising would spend void time spare whilest inforced tarie citie vpon thing satisfie request stand lieu description countrie part also assured help could purchase thus hope good although gaie successe went hand withall almost one leaning altogither vnto memorie sith book parted fourtie mile sunder order also spent part michaelmas hilarie termes insuing inforced thereto say business compelled keepe citie absent selfe charge though meane season repaire vnto poore librarie great dignitie matter required yet far greater printer hast would suffer one helpe none smallest obtained herein commentary leland somtime collected state britaine book vtterlie mangled defaced wet weather finallie vnperfect want sundrie volume secondlie gat knowledge thing letter pamphlet sundrie place shire england discordant amongst themselues especiallie name course riuers situation townes oft greater trouble reconcile one orderlie pen whole discourse point contained third aid grow conference diuers either table secretlie alone wherein marked thing talker agree wherin impugned ech choosing end former reiecting later one desirous set foorth truth absolutelie thing deed likelie true last comfort arose mine owne reading writer haue heretofore made mention condition countrie speaking wherof make account successe extraordinarie cōming sundrie treatise supposed extant seeme pronounce may well said modestie say farder selfe treatise beare witnes howbeit refer successe wholie vnto purpose description rather giue notice thereof come passe penning chronologie whose crums fell verie well framing pamphlet processe therefore booke honor regard substance declared must need confesse none mine owne lordship haue consideration barbarous composition shewed herein may boldlie claime challenge mine owne sith man slender skill defraud reproch due vnto meere negligence disorder euill disposition matter comprehended certes protest god honour neuer made choise stile word neither regarded handle treatise precise order method manie would haue done thinking sufficient truelie plainelie set foorth thing minded intreat rather vaine affectation eloquence paint rotten sepulchre thing neither commendable writer profitable reader affaire troubled writing hereof manie know peraduenture flacknesse shewed herein better testifie howsoeuer done whatsoeuer haue done haue especiall eye vnto truth thing rest hope foule frizeled treatise mine prooue spur others better learned skilfull chorographie greater iudgement choise matter handle selfe argument life time doo peruse againe possible also honour mislike hereof haue mine owne trauell eysight viewed thing doo intreat deed must need confesse vntill late except parish dwell vnto honour kent london borne vnto oxford cambridge haue bene brought vp neuer trauelled 40 mile foorthright one iourney life neuerthelesse report thing vse authority either haue performed person left writing vpon sufficient ground said whatsoeuer wanting mine may like sort honour take offense rash retchlesse behauiour vsed composition volume much scambled vp maner dare presume make tendour protection therof vnto lordship hand consider singular affection honour dooth beare wise trauell set foorth profitable thing lie hidden therevnto doo weigh mine owne behalfe bounden dutie gratefull mind one hath manie sundrie way benefited otherwise make recompense cut occasion doubt therevpon exhibit penned vnto lordship tuition vnto whome may seeme anie wise acceptable haue whole desire first notwithstanding great repugnancie seene among writer hath taken vpon authores perbeet atque librum ❧ historicall description iland britaine briefe rehersall nature quality people england▪ commodity found comprehended three bookes written w h diuision whole earth chapter 1 read earth hath beene diuided thrée part euen sithens generall floud common opinion isnoah first diuided earth among sonnes noah limited bestowed vpon three son iaphet cham sem preserued arke giuing vnto portion thereof séemed good neuerthelesse reteining souereigntie whole still vnto himselfe albeit yet left vncertaine seuerall part bounded whome tooke name time attributed certes word asia europa africa denomination giuen late speake vnto doubted whether sithens time noah sea hath sundrie place wonne lost added diminished whether europa lybia one portion westerlie region late discouered called america third part counting asia second selfe region atlantides plato others want traffike thither time supposed dissolued sunke sea writing appeereth long timethe diuision earth yet certein • ie knowne reckoned asia europa africa full perfect diuision whole earth parcel onelie huge iland lieth east atlantike sea whereof first diuided second tanais riseth rock caucasus hideth selfe meotine moore ocean sea last mediterrane red sea otherwise called mare erythraeum men especially learned begin doubt soundnes partition bicause lesse part greatest thrée ioined ilands maine lie vnder north southpoles double quantitie vnto found discouered diligence trauellers hereby appeereth either earth exactlie diuided time past antiquitie el true diuision thereof came hand notice posteritie ancestor haue hitherto laboured cimmerian darkenesse vtterlie ignorant truth whereabout indeuoured shew trauels knowledge writing peece confusion also found amongst ancient romane writer notwithstanding large conquest sticke mire successor able appeereth treatise deliuer set downe veritieuariance among writer diuision earth salust booke de bello iugurthino cannot tell whether africa parcell asia scruple varro booke de lingua lat litle incumbred end concludeth whole earth diuided asia europa africa excluded driuen place silius also writeth africa one yet resolued wherevnto leane aut ingens asiae latus aut par tertia rerum wherein lucane lib 9 sheweth himselfe far another iudgement ascribeth europa saieng maner tertia par rerum lybia si credere famae cuncta velis si ventos coelúmque sequaris par erit europae nec enim plus littora nili quàm scythicus tanais primis à gradibus absunt whereby saie may well vnderstand time augustus tiberius claudius nero romanes yet resolued diuision earth part indeuour remooue credit antiquitie hath deliuered yet loth continue maintaine corruption may redressed thinke good giue foorth new diuision probable better agreeing truth therefore diuide whole fiue seuerall parcelsthe earth diuided fiue part whereas belforrest hath foure prefat lib 4 reteining common diuision first three vnto fourth allowing onelie portion lieth north magellan streicts hyperborean ilands lie west line longitude late discouered frobisher called hir maiestie meta incognita likewise manie ilands within 180 degrées westward beginning common line longitude whereby parted diuision allotted vnto asia portion selfe made equipollent greatnes far excéeding either europa africa fullie much quantitie vnited laid togither fift last part antartike portion hir ilands annexed region meane lieth vnder south pole cut america fourth part magellan strei • t africa sea passeth cape good hope cape di bon • speranzae countrie lesse large limit bound africa america therefore right worthie called fift howsoeuer shall please curious mislike diuision also adde albeit continent hereof doo extend selfe vnto verie antartike point lieth long table betwéene two sea later vnder south poolethe form • fift part may call maine sea vnder aforesaid pricke yet without sundrie ilands also adioining vnto inner sea destitute manie experience hath béene late confirmed furthermore whereas describers earth haue made description hath reached litle nothing peaceable sea without antartike circle found theuet others extendeth selfe northward trace small number league euen maner equator much westerlie part thereof america supposed reach northward far antartike article africa dooth southward tropike cancer small portion ground maruell obserued heretofore haue written excuse themselues ingratitude portingals spaniard haue purpose concealed manie thing found trauell least séeme open gap dooing otherwise stranger enter conquest ilands also lie peaceable sea scattered iaua greater lesser sumatra iapan burneo c number refer still vnto asia without compasse 90 degrées eastward line longitude aboue 180 doo ile laurence number vnto africa within said proportion wishing little alteration may yet yéelding vnto confusion whereby truth diuision hereafter impeached whereas virgil speaking iland saith et penitùs toto diuisos orbe britannos author vnwoorthie read perusedunto portion britaine referred certeine vnto portion earth ilands thule sundrie like scattered north sea ascribed bicause excluded sée rest whole earth haue thought good facilitie sake diuision refer lie within first minute longitude set downe ptolome europa reason requireth aforesaid line shall henceforth meta partition ascribed america albeit come verie neere vnto aforesaid portion may otherwise without preiudice numbred may thinke dealing either superfiuous procéed wot foolish curiositie world growne apt readie iudge hardest euerie attempt forsomuch purpose conceiue imagine meane season therefore shall suffice say time albion mother rest ilands hir daughter lieng east line longitude still ascribed vnto europa wherevnto good authours heretofore writing owne proper naturall situation also haue amisse referred position circuit forme quantitie ile britaine cap 2 britannia britainhow britaine lieth maine terme english toong brutania pronounce reason letter first syllable word antiquitie sometime deliuer ile lieng ocean sea directlie ouer part france conteineth picardie normandie thereto greatest part little britaine later region called time past armorica situation thereof vpon sea coast vntill time companie briton either led ouer romane emperours flieng thither tyrannie oppressed iland setle themselues called britaine name owne countrie whence aduentured thither hath ireland vpon west side north maine sea euen thule hyperborean east side also germane ocean passe dailie trade merchandize onlie low country belgie miserablie afflicted betwéene spanish power popish inquisition spice betwéene morter pestell also germanie friezeland denmarke norwaie carrieng hence thither bringing thence hither necessarie commodity seuerall country doo yéeld meanes besides common amitie conserued traffike mainteined necessitie partie abundantlie reléeued conteineth longitude taken middest region 19 degree exactliethe longitude latitude ile latitude 53 degrées thirtie min opinion haue diligentlie obserued day faithfull report writer haue left notice thereof vnto v learned treatise perpetuallie remembred howbeit whereas setting downe two line haue séemed varie placing diuerstie remembring name sundrie city townes whereby affirme haue seuerall course part haue thought good procéed somewhat another sort diuiding latest best chard way two equall part neere possible bring passe wherby middle latitude product caerlile newcastell vpon tine whose longest day consisteth sixtéene houres 48 minuts longitude newberielongest day warwike sheffield skipton c dealing mine opinion easie indifferent likeliest meane come certeine standing situation iland touching length bredth samethe compasse britaine find variance amongst writer piere point douer vnto farthest part cornewall westward 320 mile thence againe point cathnesse irish sea 800 wherby polydore doo gather circuit whole iland britaine 1720 mile full 280 lesse caesar dooth set downe except difference betwéene romane british mile indéed wherof hereafter may make farther conference martianus writing bredth britaine hath onlie 300 mile orosius hath 1200 whole compasse ethicus also agreeing plinie martianus solinus hath 800 mile length breadth commeth short account 120 mile like maner dion seuero maketh one 891 mile wit broadest 289 narowest 37 finally diodorus siculus affirmeth south coast conteine 7000 furlong second wit à carione ad promontorium 15000 third 20000 whole circuit consist 42000 time reckon breadth douer cornewall aboue 300 mile length douer cathnesse 500 neuerthelesse must measured right line otherwise see said diuision hold forme fashion ile thrée corneredthe 〈◊〉 haue deuised like vnto triangle bastard sword wedge partesant broadest south part gathering still narrower narrower till come farthest point cathnesse northward narrowest endeth maner promontorie called caledonium orchas british morwerydh aboue 30 mile ouer dailie experience actuall trauell dooth confirme old writer giue vnto thrée principall corner cragspromontories britaine point promontory iland thrée seuerall name vnto kent cantium cornewall hellene scotland thereby take occasion seeke true place wherof yet maner ignorant meane part bicause haue sound author dooth leade mée knowledge furthermorethe distāce maine shortest vsuall cut haue iland maine douer farthest part kent eastward vnto calice towne picardie 1300 mile rome old time called petressa scalas though like better blacknesse breadth sea aboue thirtie mile course frequented vsed common safe passage come countrie france diuers realm hath beene vnknowne old time vnto roman part vsed two hauens passage repassage fro although finde diuerse came also bullen landed sandwich place coast toward west betweene hide lid wit romneie marsh old time called romania romanorum insula auoid force wind weather often molesteth seafaringmen narrowe sea best liked safegards betweene part holland also certeinlie appéere much lesse common map countrie haue hitherto set downe ancient name denomination iland cap 3 diligent perusall treatise haue written state iland find first séemed parcell celtike kingdomedis samothes whereof dis otherwise called samothes one sonnes iaphet saturne originall beginner thencefoorth long called samothea afterward processe time desire rule began take hold mind men ech prince endeuouted enlarge owne dominionsneptimus marioticus albion sonne neptune amphitrite surnamed marioticus bicause dominion laie among ilands mediterran sea plutus lower ground neere vnto shore contrariwise father iupiter dwelled high hils néerer heauen hearing commodity countrie plentifulnesse soile made voiage ouerthe first conquest britaine finding thing onelie correspondent vnto also farre surmounting report went iland long yer inuaded force armes brought subiection 29 yeare grandfather decease finallie changed name thereof albion whereby former denomination samothes grow mind fall vtter forgetfulnesse thus iland bereft time hir ancient namebritaine vnder celt 341 yeares also hir lawfull succession prince descended line iaphet vnder continued space 341 yeres nine prince chronologie following shall easilie appeere goropius neighbor verie nice denomination iland point huge volume originall antwarpe lib 6 buchanan also followeth part brought great doubt whether britaine called albion word alb white alp hill bodinus lesse troubled fetching ab olbijs wresteth ab albijs gallis inconstancie appeareth gotthadamca liber 7 taketh lesse paine bring britaines denmarke whereby name iland called vridania freedania brithania bridania tanquam libera dania another also dooth fetch originall spaine breta signifieth soile earth walke darkenesse doo often straie bicause wot whither go euen doo men whilest séeke extenuate certeintie history bring v altogither vncerteinties coniectures like maner haue welshman come french one question vnder walli nisia gallis spanish colonie doo greatlie bewraie ouersights erre endeuour fetch albine imagined daughter forged dioclesian wherewith ignorant writer haue late little stained historie brought sound part thereof discredit mistrust hereafter speake somewhat also neptune waie sith haue made mention place shall altogither impertinent wherfore shall vnderstand excellent knowledge art nauigation nauigation went reputedneptune god sea skilfull prince liued time therfore likewise courage boldnesse aduenturing fro decease honoured godthe maner dressing ship old time protection trauelled sea committed charge rude also making ship wherewith saile time part flat bottomed broad lacke better experience calke trim builded vsed naile ouer rawe hide bulles buffles like kind nauie say first samothes albion arriued iland vnto doth séeme thing impossible northerlie artike region doo naile ship iron vtterly want wooden pin el bind plank togither verie artificiallie bast rope osier rind trées twig popler substance vessel either fir pine sith oke verie deintie hard amongst wooden anchor speake neuerthelesse common gothlanders ship wrought wicker sometime vsed britaine couered leather euen time plinie lib 7 cap 56 also bofes made rush réeds c neither haue iust occasion speake ship made cane sort staurobates king india fighting semiramis brought 4000 fought hir first battell water euer read vpon riuer indus losse ouercome hir power nauie either drowned burned furie hir souldiers proceed said albion gouerned countrie space seauen yeares came passe brother bergion killed hercules mouth rhodanus said hercules passed spaine celtes go ouer italie vpon occasion gather among writer vnworthie remembred happened time lucus king celtslestrigo lestrigo issue osyris grandfather placed ouer ianigenes exercise great tyrannieianigenes posteritie noah italie onelie ouer owne kingdome also molestation prince inhabited round intollerable maner moreouer little incouraged dooings neptune fatherneptune xxxiii sonnes thirsted greatly leaue xxxiii sonnes settled mightiest kingdom world men alreadie conceiued opinion gotten foot region whatsoeuer would long yer meanes onelie establish seat also increase limit better maintenance themselues posteritie euermore short therefore giant great prince mightie men world conspired slaine aforsaid osyris onelie obstacle vnto tyrannous dealing hercules sonne surnamed laabin lubim libius reuenge father death proclaimed open warres going place place ceased spoile kingdomes therewithall kill great courage fell hand finallie hauing among sundrie ouercome lomnimi geriones spainelomnimi geriones vnderstanding lestrigo sonnes yet remaine italie directed viage part taking kingdome celt waie remained season lucus king countrie also maried daughter galatheagalathea begat sonne hir calling mother name galates galates kelt said chronologie haue spoken large meane time albion vnderstanding hercules intended make warres brother lestrigo thought good possible stop tidebergion therefore sending brother bergion orchades also reigned supreame lord gouernour ioined power sailed ouer france arriued therepomponius mela cap de gallia long yer met hercules armie neare vnto mouth riuer called roen rhodanus happened cruell conflict betwéene hercules men like haue lost day maner wearied long warres munition sore wasted last viage made spaine herevpon hercules perceiuing courage souldiours somewhat abate seeing want artillerie like cause fatall daie present ouerthrowe hand came suddenlie mind defend himselfe throwing stone enimiestrabo lib 4 whereof laie great store scattered place policie sooner published hearkened vnto put execution whereby preuailed end hercules wan field enimies put flight albion brother slaine buried plot thus britaine rid tyrant lucus king celt deliuered vsurper dailie incroched vpon building sundrie city hold placed among alp called owne name also euen owne kingdome side lestrigo greatlie weakened slaughter brother inuention hercules like sort commeth iupiter father vnto hercules indeed none osyris feigned throw downe stone heauen vpon albion bergion defense sonne came thicke vpon great drop raine haile haue descended aboue man well knowing waie turne force came fast great violence go forward albeit albion power thus discomfited slaine yet name gaue vnto iland died still remained vnto time brute arriuing héere 1116 christ 2850 creation world onelie changed britaine beene called albion space 600 yeares declare souereigntie ouer rest ilands also lie scattered round called maner albion said time britanniarum insula maximum greatest iles beare name britaine plinie also confirmeth strabo first second bookes denieth vtterlie denieng iland tooke hir name brute doo affirme rather called rich mettals sometime carried mine world growing vibius sequester also saith calabria sometime called britannia ob immensam affluentiam totius delitiae atque vbertatis found heerein contend written p pritannia opinion absolutelie denie willinglie leane vnto none peremptorie maner sith antiquitie historie carrieth withall vnto former iudgements cause reiect also deriue aforesaid denomination britona nymph following textor prutus prytus sonne araxa britona borne creta daughter mar fled sea thence onelie escape villanie minos attempted rauish make hir one paramour forsake authoritie galfride would rather leane report parthenius whereof elsewhere haue made large rehersall altogither impertinent discusse whether hercules came iland death albion although ancient monument seene late heare cape hartland harcland west countrie called promontorium herculis old time diuers british antiquary doo gather great likelihood also sith presence absence maketh nothing alteration irishman drawing manie men captiue chaines smallie auailable therefore passe ouer incident purpose neither spend time determination whether britaine beene sometime parcell maine although well séeme haue beene bicause generall floud noah doo read ilands hils vallies wherfore wilden arguis also noteth philosophie tractation meteor verie likelie onelie caused violent motion working sea time floud augustine well considered would neuer haue asked creature liued ilands far distant maine could come arke de ciuit lib 16 cap 7 howbeit end concludeth another matter profitable demand speedie timelie inhabitation thereof mine opinion wit inhabited shortlie diuision earth read capteinie companie portion assigned vnto noah partition made whole among posteritie neuer ceased trauell search vttermost part vntill found bound allotted seene vewed limit euen vnto verie pole shall suffice therefore onelie haue touched thing manner farre returning purpose procéed rest concerning denomination ilandyet time ptolomie notwithstanding brute haue said changed britaine manie hundred yeares brutus doo find anie men attempted change againe vntill time theodosius day ualentinianus ualens endeuoured remembrance two aforesaid emperours call valentia marcellinus saith deuise tooke hold among common sort retained still name britaine vntill reigne ecbert 800 yeare grace first reigne gaue foorth often aduenture hither rob steale ireland finallie called meat picts roman named painted body helpe britain planted themselues part vnto time portion land cannot cleansed find also scot reputed receiue scot dominion much pronounced enimies roman disturber common peace quietnesse prouinces england saxon became first acquainted ile meanes piracie dailie practised vpon coastes begun aduenture themselues also vpon sea thereby seeke wealth gotten west part maine neighbour alreadie spoiled lamentable barbarous maner howbeit neuer durst presume inhabit ilandthe hurt forren aid vntill sent man bodie doth deliuer neuertheles symmetrie taken well proportioned face rectum orbiculata fornicata prona resupinata lacunata repanda doo far degenerate true proportion forme beautie comelie hereby also make face taken strict maner tenth part whole bodie frō highest part forehead pitch chin vse word face difference wherby 9 part taken say crowne called vertex haire turneth circle space rule truelie taken meane crowne highest part head pitch nether chap multiplied nine length whole bodie would easilie appeare shew selfe full like maner find elbow top midle finger 4 part whole length called cubit wrist top finger tenth part length shinbone ancle fourth part one cubit top finger third ioint two third part face top forehead obseruations willinglie remember place end anie carcase proceed therefore example read bodie king arthur found yeare 1189 two foot higher anie man thatsyluester gyraldus came behold finallie carcase william conqueror séene manie yeares since wit 1542 citie cane twelue inch longer iudgment saw itconstans fama gallorum anie man dwelled countrie testimony note togither bicause proceed christian writer whome nothing farther distant set purpose lie feed world fable time also whilest francis first reigned ouer france man séene aquiteine whome king party made gard whose height man common heigth might easilie go vnder twist without stooping stature incredible moreouer casanion writer time telleth bone briat giant found late delphinois briat 15 cubit diameter whose scull two cubit breadth shoulder foure himselfe beheld late second war france wherevnto report ioan marius made bookes de galliarum illustrationibus writeth carcase giant found farre rhodanus 22 foot long scull sole foot dooth yéeld sufficient testimonie also calameus commentary de biturigibus confirmeth lesse adding found 1556 dooth baptista fulgosus lib 1 cap 6 saieng farther graue seene farre valentia discouered violence current rhodanus said casanion like sort speaketh bone man beheld one whose téeth foot long eight pound weight also sepulchre another neere vnto charmes castell nine pace length thing incredible v eiesight confirme owne time carcase reserued somerset pull downe verie foundation carried stone thereof strand build house two bone haue séene beside whereof beholding tooke great heed bicause minded haue vse proportion therefore speake richard vnderstand yer went england let make axe none therewith cleaue saracen bone head sooth wrought full weele thereon twentie pound steele came cyprus land ilkon axe tooke hand c could speake also difference betweene british celtike language speach ancient briton celt great affinitie one another either one leastwise either nation small helpe interpretors might vnderstand readilie discerne speaker meant opinion celt spake greeke british toong resembled spoken grecia homer reforme see men doo speake without authoritie therefore reiect celt properlie called galles speake gréeke cesar letter sent rome vse language intercepted might vnderstand vnderstand galles skilfull language without interpretor yet denie celtish british speaches might haue great affinitie one another british aboue greeke doo appéere certeine word first tri three march horsse trimarchia whereof pausanias speaketh atheneus also writeth bathanasius capitaine galles whose name méere british compounded bath ynad signifieth noble comelie iudge wheras saith reliques galles tooke vp first dwelling isther afterward diuided themselues wise went dwelled hungarie called sordsai inhabited within dominion tyroll brenni whose seate mount brenhere parcell alpes else signifieth word iscaredich british whence word scordisci commeth diuided hereby sundrie like testimony gather british celtish speaches great affinitie one another said cesar speaking similitude likenesse religion nation doth also auerre tacitus vita agricolae like sort plainlie affirmeth else must need galles inuaded italie greece meere briton whose likenes speech gréeke toong need make anie triall sith man hope readilie denie appianus talking brenni calleth cymbres gather also celt briton indifferentlie called cymbri owne language else briton right cymbri vnto daie doo refuse called name bodinus writing meanes originall euerie kingdome nation discerned setteth downe thrée way whereby knowledge thereof found one saith infallible testimonie sound writer description site region third relikes ancient speech remaining later force must conclude spéech briton celt sometime either one verie like one another else must follow briton ouerflowed continent vnder name cymbres peraduenture associat voiage mixed inuasion dane norwegiens called cymbri cymmerij writer doo remember also euident plutarch likewise confesseth vita mary man knew whence cymbres came day therfore •••• eeue came britaine maine well knowne vnto meane euen vttermost part north may appeare furthermore slaues dailie brought thence vnto country called daui daci making whereof nation hath euermore delited yet extant time wherby difference betwéene ancient present language may easilie discerned notwithstanding among nothing found set downe anie sound full likenesse old time betwéene celt british toongs little helpe thinke old celtish haue fauour gréeke soeuer matter standeth british speach came ouer iland sure could neuer extinguished attempt roman like sort bishop abbats clergie men admitted vnto anie ecclesiasticall function among v came religious house beyond sea end vse english toong sermon people court also grew contempt men thought small dishonor speake english brauerie tooke hold last likewise countrie euerie plowman euen verie carter began wax wearie mother toong laboured speake french counted small token gentilitie maruell euerie french rascall came hither taken gentleman onelie bicause proud could vse owne language say exile english british speaches quite countrie vaine time king edward first wit toward latter end reigne fox sundrie learned excellent writer haue fullie accomplished ornature great praise immortall commendation although doo greatlie séeke staine fond affectation forren strange word presuming best english corrupted externall termes eloquence sound manie syllable excellencie english toong found one south part iland wale greatest number said retaine still owne ancient language north part said countrie lesse corrupted therefore reputed better owne estimation iudgement also proper v englishmenenglishmen apt learne forren toong sith meane language neither rough smooth vtterance may much facilitie learne language beside hebrue gréeke latine speake naturallie homeborne country yet side falleth wot meanes forren nation rightlie pronounce without great note imperfection especiallie french men also seldome write thing sauoreth english trulie pastime read natalis come like maner speaking affaire dooth clip name english lord rest dooth bréed admiration stranger doo hit vpon likelie cornish toong whose countrie briton call cerniw haue speach like sort owne hath déed affinitie armoricane toong well discusse yet mine opinion corrupted kind british albeit far degenerating day old either doo méete welshman able first vnderstand one except od word without helpe interpretors maruell mine opinion british cornewall thus corrupted sith welsh toong spoken north south part wale doth differ much selfe english vsed scotland dooth spoken among v side iland haue said alreadie scottish englishscottish english hath beene much broader lesse pleasant vtterance nation hath till late indeuored bring perfect order yet maner englishman themselues speake part beyond trent whither great amendement language extended selfe howbeit time scottish language endeuoreth come neere altogither venedotia gwynhedh g • inhed otherwise called dehenbarth demetia vse cōmonlie name south northwales short processe time third sprung vp verie middest betwéene thencefoorth called powisy shalbe shewed either wherby morwing morwinner gwynhedh northwales cadelh demetia southwales anaralt powisy giraldus doo remember howbeit came passe diuision cadelh suruiued brother thereby became lord portion paine peuerell first lord whittington conquest win part hundred ellesmore welshman enterprise desperatlie wounded man hight life yet last eating shield wild bore got appetite recouered health william issue two daughtershelene mellent wit helene maried heire alans mellent refused mariage anie man except frist tried knight prowesse herevpon hir father made proclamation daie place whatsoeuer gentleman could shew himselfe valiant field marrie mellent daughter haue hir castell whittington sufficient liueliehood mainteine estate euer report spred fowkes de warren came thither red shield daughter sometime one lord ross called kudall bare good fitzhenrie clarke hir father kitchenthe originall fitzhenries made carie hir awaie horssebacke behind onlie manhood sake presentlie tried pursued ouer taken made light held cloke whilest killed draue hir father men flight awaie go till hir father conceiuing good opinion fitzhenrie act receiued fauour whereby familie came vp thus much waie mailrosse whereof may suffice sith mine intent make anie precise description particular wale onelie shew region laie sometime knowne gouerned countriedemetia third kingdome demetia southwales sometime knowne region syllures wherevnto also persuaded ordolukes laie east part thereof extended region euen vnto sauerne howsoeuer matter falleth demetia hath sauerne hir south irish sea hir west part east sauerne onelie north land powisy whereof spake late region also caermarden old writer call maridunum cair maridunum chéefe citie palace belonging king southwales vntill last forren ciuill inuasions enimies prince thereof constrained remooue court dinefar cantermawr situate neuerthelesse vpon riuer tewy wheron caermarden standeth place far better defended high hils thicke wood craggie rock déepe mari region also lieth pembroke aliàs penmoroc shire whose fawcons haue béene old time much regarded therein likewise milford hauen whereof welsh wisards doo yet dreame strange toy beleeue shall one daie come passe nation much giuen fortelling thing come beléeue blind prophesies haue béene made old time man accompted learned wale supposed haue spirit prophesie scotland day two kingdomspictland scotland picts scot besides orchades whereof one consisted picts called pightland pictland irish race named scotland hope wise man readilie denie whole region portion ile beyond scotish sea also diuided picts laie east side scot west ech seuered either huge hils great lake riuers ran south north betwéene séemeth also first two kingdom diuided rest briton riuers cluda forth till desirous inlarge dominion draue briton ouer solue twede became march betwéene nation wherefore case plaine saie two procéed order rehersall rest particularkingdoms south part ile limiting shire lie néere otherwise shall vnpossible leaue certaine notice likeliest quantity seuerall portion first kingdom therefore begunne kent henghist 456 christkent henghist thereof called kingdome kent cantwarland limit thereof extended selfe farther said countie cheefe citie whereof dorobernia cantwarbyry canturburie indured well néere space 400 yeares made earledome heretochie vnited inas vnto west saxon athelstane sonne first earle heretoch maister lambert historie kent dooth gather verie probable coniectures part iland first inhabited samothes afterward albion howsoeuer case standeth sure hath béen onlie doore whereby roman saxon made entrie vnto conquest region first caesar entred iland vpon eightéenth cal 14 september foure day full moone himselfe confesseth fell 17 18 moneth twelue day equinoctiall apparant tarrie time aboue eight ten day britaine platforme cannot denied entrance said region east part kent onelie place knowledge christ first brought ouer vnto v whereby became partaker saluation darkenesse mistie errour true conuerts vnto light bright beames shining truth eternall benefit euerlasting comfort second kingdome conteined onelie sussexsouth sax esta part saie surrie ella saxon first held also erected chéefe palace chichester destroied andredswald 492 christ continued space 232 year ceased verie least kingdome rest founded ile comming saxon saie truth conteined little aboue 7000 family within erection kingdome gewisses west saxon notwithstanding king sussex pretended made claime laie west kent south thames vnto point corinwall haue often read third regiment east saxonseastsa • erkenwiin trinobantes kingdome began vnder erkenwijn whose chéefe seat london rather colchester conteined whole essex middlesex part herfordshire indured also much pricke 303 yeares diuided east angle onlie riuer stoure houeden others doo report continueth separated suffolke euen vnto time although said riuer growne verie small greatnesse hath béene time past reason countriemen make small accompt riuers thinking carriage made horsse cart lesse chargeable waie herin far deceiued elsewhere make manifest declaration fourth kingdome west saxonswestsax called bicause laie west part realme essex east sussex south began yeare grace 519 vnder cerdijecerdiic indured vntill comming norman including last wiltshire bar keshire dorset southampton somersetshire sussex briton held vnto point cornewall became first dorchester vntill time kinigils winchester chéefe citie kingdome birinus moonke came england said kinigils gaue dorchester land within seauen mile toward maintenance cathedrall sea meanes whereof himselfe remooued palace winchester first kingdome began vnder idabrennicia aliàs northumberland ida 548 christ called northumberland bicause laie north riuer humber comming henghist ida onlie gouerned earl heretoches heretochy till said ida conuerted kingdome conteined region séeme time past either wholie apperteining brigants whereof said brigants possesse greater part cheefe citie like maner yorke beda capgraue leyland others doo set downe ad thereto extended humber vnto scotish sea vntill slaughter egfride northumbers time picts gat hold betweene forth twede afterward descending scot meanes vtter destruction picts hath béene sithens vnited crowne england possession meere english time béene crueltie picts also recouerie certeine houre made sicilien euensong slew euerie english man woman child could laie hold vpon within aforesaid region escaped narrowlie saued themselues flight afterward yeare grace 560 parted twainedeira ella vnder adda yeelded vp portion lay betweene humber tine vnto brother ella according father appointment called deira southumberland reteining rest still vnto owne vse diminished title wrote himselfe king northumberland howbeit 91 yeares revnited againe continued vntill alfred annexed whole kingdome 331 ida 878 birth iesus christ sauiour seauenth kingdomeeastangles offa à quo offlingae called eastangles began norwich 561 christ vnder offa people region long time called offlings included norfolke suffolke cambridgeshire elie continuing 228 yeares flourished onelie 35 yeares perfect estate liberte rest consumed vnder tribut vassallage mercians souereigntie thereof held great honour till dane gat hold spoiled verie sore became miserable remained till king westsaxons vnited crownes saie grantcester cambridge towne erected hir ruines chéefe citie kingdome norwich wherein may well shew discord writer cannot resolue scruple take region also one icenes yet part cannot yeeld bodie king againe great estate thus made perpetuall circulation reuolution soules much like vnto continuall motion heauens neuer stand still long yeeld one representation figure cause also diodorus countriemen vnto without danger offered vp sacrifice god maner plees also france iuuenal witnesse saith gallia causidicos docuit facunda britannos howbeit taught v logike rhetorike also sophistrie togither faile one tittle whole processe laborious repetition dealt order matter religion ciuill affair historicall treatise setting downe lawes vsed like order letter almost grecian whereby easie séene reteined kind writing druiyus originall founder religion iland hath béene void letter learned men euen sith first inhabited would ad thing particular also apparell sith dealing withall nothing profitable reader passe ouer signifieng neuerthelesse distinguished sundrie dauises common sort estimation among people whosoeuer ware druiysh weed might walke would without harme annoiance honour aduersaries proceed thing death druiyusbardus bardus sonne fift king celt succéeded onelie ouer said kingdome also father vertues whereby verie likelie winding wrapping vp said religion afore remembred sort verse first deuised excellent poet lesse indued singular skill practise speculation musicke two many suppose verie author beginner although vniustlie sith poetrie song vse floodgen 4 21 also harpe pipe iubal inuented could neuer performed without great skill musicke procéed cheefe estimation druiydes remained end among briton onelie knowledge religion fame bardes called bardus excellent skill musicke poetrie heroicall kind song first conteined onelie high mystery secret point religion little difference also betwéene druiydes bard degenerate till farre degenerated first institution became minstrel feast droonken meeting abhominable sacrifice idol sang commonlie diuinitie puissant act valiant prince fabulous narration adultery god certes time fond vsage thereto verie name bardes yet extinguished among briton wale call poet musician barthes doo also ireland sulpitius also writing lucane remembreth saith word bardus meere celtike signifieth singer howbeit roman iudging nation beside themselues rude barbarous thereto misliking vtterlie rough musicke bardes entred farre contemptuous mockage melodie ascribed word bardus vnto fooles idiot whereas contrariwise scythian dwell within northweast part europe vse word verie honourable maner calling best poet heroicall singer singebardos couragious singer capiteins delited musicke albardos dagobardos rodtbardos one lame musician lambard aboue whose skilfull ditty germanie vnfurnished heare vnto daie quizqueia new spaine iland indie call men boitios rime arcitos steed harp sing vnto timbrel made shels sonnet ditty either perteine vnto religion prophane loue commendation ancestrie inflammation mind vnto mar whereby appeareth small difference betwéene boitios bardes finallie sort lucane first booke writeth thus among like saiengs well toward latter end vos quó que qui fortes animaslucan li 1 bello que peremptas laudibus longum vates dimit titi auum plurima securi fudistis carmina bardi et vos barbaricos ritus morémque sinistrum sacrorum druiydae positis recepistis ab armis solis nosse deos coeli numen vobis aut solis nescire datum nemora alta remotis incolitis lucis vobis authoribus vmbrae non tacitas erebi sedes ditisque profundi pallida regna petunt regit idem spiritus artus orbe alio longae canitis si cognita vitae morsmedia est certe populi quos despicit arctos foelices errore suo quos ille timorum maximus haud vrget leti metus inde ruendi ferrum men prona viris animaeque capaces mortis ignauum est rediturae parcere vitae thus sée glasse state religion time first inhabitation iland long continued soundnese originall author left good sooth cannot say yet certeine time albion arriued religion earst imbraced fell great decaie whereas iaphet samothes child taught nothing else doctrine learned noah cham great grandfather albion disciple vtterlie renouncing follow step gaue mind wholie seduce lead hearer headlong vnto error whereby posteritie onelie corrupted iland filthie trade practises also mankind generallie became vicious life vngodlie conuersationwhat doctrine cham disciple taught cham successours procéeded first sorcerie witchcraft execution vnlawfull lust without respect sex age consanguinitie kind branch odious abhominable root streames deriued filthie horrible stinking puddle howbeit notwithstanding manifold lewdness follie aegyptians first reigned taught whilest liued alone great estimation whereas nation contemned abhorred wickednesse calling chemesenua chemesenua chem min cham made god impudent infamous wicked cham onelie builded citie vnto called chem min also death reputed god calling highest seuen planet name next beneath osyris sonne likewise honored vnder name iupiter certes custome begonne aegypt old timetranslation mortall men heauen began generallie vse almost euerie place processe time famous worthie prince died ascribe forme star vnto person end name might neuer weare memorie called translation heauen starres forme starres dedicated vnto properlie said haue seat among god toie much like catalog romish saint although one written celestiall immateriall orbes sheep skin verie brickle paper yet estéemed euerie prince would oft hazard attempt vttermost aduentures thereby win fame life death might merit haue place heauen among shining starres howbeit euerie called god could obteine benefit haue béene star enow heauen haue serued turnes wherfore another place time imaginedcyril aduersus iul lib 6 sect 8 reigned second calling semones god grace fauour people semones dici voluerunt saith fulgentius vocibus antiquis quos coelo nec dignos ascriberent ob meriti paupertatem sicut priapus hyppo vortumnus c nec terrenos eos deputare vellent per gratiae venerationem also third place say earth god dwelled noble men officer good gouernours lawgiuers people yet thought worthie second first companie iollie diuision thus sée generall maner idolatrie honoring starres brood inferiour god hatched first folly processe time came also britaine name saturne iupiter c shall appeare hereafter sith haue alreadie somewhat digressed matter go yet little farder shew foorth originall vse word saturne iupiter hercules c whereby honor shall sée little errours gentils onelie one point also root confusion found among ancient historieswhich properlie called saturni ioues iunones hercules certes vsed yéeres partition earth made noah 133 yeere floud beginner kingdom erected called saturni whereby came passe nimbrote saturne babylon cham aegypt foorth sundrie country eldest sonnes also succeeded called ioues nephewes sonnes sonnes reigned third place hercules meanes followed euerie kingdome saturne iupiter hercules hir owne anie like sort another order among daughter married yet commonlie vnto brother god himselfe permitting vnto time floud end earth might thoroughlie replenished sooner furnished inhabitant euerie part thereof sister therefore wife euerie saturne called rhea iupiter iuno isi io isi io iuno one beyond also latter harold would indeuour deriue petigree prince potentate supposed dutie sufficientlie performed brought orderlie vnto saturne wherat might cease shut vp trauell likewise opinion grounded amongst heauen earth onlie parent vnto saturne rhea knowing doubt themselues meanecoelum coelus sith denomination heauen ogygesogyges sunnesol paterpater deorum deorum like onelie ascribed vnto noah astydea terraterra earth vestavesta aretiaaretia moone luna mater deorum deorum mater like vnto tydea wife hereby sée saturne reputed euerie nation oldest god first prince iupiter next hercules third therfore sith name dispersed beginning ouer maruell confusion ancient history dooings one mixed another impossible distinguish sunder haue spoken end men may see god pagan honored thereby religion posteritie cham bring ouer britaine vntill comming likelie anie grosse idolatrie superstition enter among v deifieng mortall men honoring starres erection huge image beside sorcerie witchcraft like whereof chemminites worthilie called autors neither error anie thing amendedfrō whence brute learne religion comming brute doubt added deuises vnto companie learned graecia whence also brought helenus sonne priamus man excéeding age made préest bishop thorough new conquest atchieued britaine brute idolatrie superstition still increased among v insomuch beside druiysh bardike ceremony also came albion brute himselfe countriemen either brought hither abroad dailie inuented home new religion rite whereby came passe stead onelie immortall god whome samothes posteritie preach time past dis samothes made god honored said samothes himselfe vnder name dis saturne also iupiter mar minerua mercurie apollo diana finallie hercules vnto whome dedicated emittuntur igitur cometae diuinitus reuocantur dum supra no conspecti quamdiu placuit deo inferuntur c plato referreth change happen commonwealth certeine diuine force resteth hidden sundrie od number whereof period consist true god created thing number weight measure incomprehensible maner vnto fraile humane capacitie neuerthelesse appointed three haue rule work wherefore must ascribe change force like sort vnto rat ilandrat iland wherein manie monstrous rat anie horsses beast happen come thither left negligence one night sure deuoured eaten vp without hope recouerie moreouer anwall anwall brier brier ilands like sort void good furniture cony onelie excepted brier wherein village castell parishchurch bringeth foorth lesse store hog wild foule rat iland doth rat whereof greatlie maruell north brier lieth rusco rusco hath labell byland stretching toward southwest called inis widdon inis widdō rusco verie neere great mary hath moreouer hold parish within beside great store cony wild foule whereof make much gaine due time yeare next vnto come round ilandround iland mile ouer lides lides iland wherein parishchurch dedicated saint beside cony wood wild foule two later indifferent store notho notho auing auing one situat south another auing halfe mile ouer iust halfe lesse notho tyan tyan later great iland furnished parishchurch small plentie cony heares martines tyan come martines ile wherein faire towne ile selfe next vnto rusco greatnesse verie well furnished cony fresh spring also betwixt mary ten smaller reach northeast southwest knolworth knolworth sniuilliuer sniuilliuer menwetham menwethā vollis 1 vollis 1 surwihe surwihe vollis 2vollis 2 arthur arthur ile iland guiniliuer guiniliuer nenech nenech gothrois gothrois whose estate diuers howbeit one accounted great comparison yéeld short grasse méet sheepe cony doo also rest greater iles likewise whose name commonlie townes church standing sundry lake neuer without great plentie wild foule iles sylley supposed lesse beneficiall lord anie soeuer within compasse ile neere vnto coast also wild swinewild swine sylley iles supposed notable safegard coast cornewall diuerse great store tin likewise found like maner plentie fish taken among beside feeding swine withall man shall haue penie london ten grotes howbeit cheefe commoditie made reigh drie cut peeces carie ouer little britaine exchange salt canuas readie monie merchandize doo stand need like trade haue also buckhorne dried whiting heare sith author report flatlie auouch passe ouer fish season time thus haue viewed richest wealthie iles sylley whence must direct course eastward vnto mouth sauerne go backe againe vnto west point wale continuing still voiage along vpon west coast britaine till come soluey whereat kingdomes part foorth must touch ilands lie vpon west north shore till come againe vnto scotish sea owne dominion point cornewall therefore promontorie helenus helenus called thinke bicause helenus son priamus priamus arriued brute lieth buried except sea haue washed awaie sepulchre vntill come vnto mouth sauerne haue none ilands doo know heare one litle byland cape peninsula counted place yet sith haue spoken shall vnderstand called pendinas beside compasse thereof aboue mile remembred farder thereof standeth pharos light therein ship saile coast night also verie point said pendinas pendinas chappell saint nicholas beside church saint ia irish woman saint belonged late lord brooke gesse lord mountioy enioieth also blockhouse péere eastside thereof péere sore choked sand whole shore furthermore y vnto carantokes insomuch greatest part byland couered sand sea casteth vp calamitie hath indured little aboue fiftie yeares inhabitant doo affirme also two rock neere vnto tredwy another farre tintagell many common sort doo repute take iles wherefore one desirous note thinke best omitted proceed come meane vnto sauerne mouth meet two holmes one called stepholme flatholme formes béeing déed parcel ground low soiles fit little else beare grasse cattell whereof take name holme old saxon word applied place also stepholme lieth south flatholme foure fiue mile first also mile halfe two mile thereabout length neither mile halfe breadth doo seeme broadest séeme worthie placed among ilands yet othersome opinion altogither base reputed amongst flat rock whatsoeuer sure oft annoie passenger merchant passe repasse vpon riuer neither doo read iles lie east saue onlie barribarri dunwen first called one barroc religious man gyraldus saith flight shot shore herin also rocke standing verie entrance cliffe hath little rift chine vpon side wherevnto man doo laie eare shall heare noise smithes worke forge sometimes blowing bellowes sometimes striking clinking hammer whereof manie men haue great wonder barri feight shot shore maruell mile compasse situat ouer aberbarry hath chappell dunwen called church dedicated welsh woman saintdunwen called dunwen standeth lieth two mile henrosser right neuen hath within two faire mil great store cony certes sand increase fast hereafter hath done late vnited maine within short season beyond toward coast southwales lie two ilands larger quantitie holmes one called caldee inis pyr caldee hath parishchurch spire steeple pretie towne belonging countie pembroke iurisdiction one dauid wale leland supposeth ruines found therein haue béene old priorie sometimes called lille cell belonging monasterie dogmael saie nothing hight londylondy wherein also village towne iland parson said town onelie captaine hath thereto weife distresse commodity belonging little aboue sixteene mile coast wale though thirtie caldée yet serueth informed lord king deuonshire moreouer iland great plentie sheepe cony therewithall verie fine short grasse better food pasturage likewise much sampere vpon shore carried thence barrel albeit scarslie fourtie housholds whole yet inhabitant huge stone alredie prouided may kéepe thousand enimies bicause possible anie aduersaries assaile onelie one place dangerous entrance voiage also met two ilands one called shepes ile rat ile first little plot lieng point baie come blockhouse standeth north verie entrie milford hauen vpon eastside north also shepes ile betwéene stacke rocke lieth verie middest hauen another point rat ile yet smaller former commodity found yet cannot tellschalmey schalmey greater lesse lie northwest milford hauen good waie belong crowne inhabited bicause often spoiled piratesschoncold schoncold ile ioineth vnto great schalmey bigger onlie passage ship parteth whereby supposed one leland noteth lie milford hauen beside also found bateholme stockeholme midland gresholme iles doubling wellock point came baie saw saint bride iland another sound betwéene ramsey point member penbrookeshire vnto dauids matter concerning church leland commentary england lib 8 saieth contained thrée ilets whereof bishop dauids owner greatest chanter dauids claimeth second archdeacon cairmarden dooth third verie excellent pasture sheepe horse horned beast lacke vpper téeth nature whose substance conuerted nourishment horne therefore cannot bite low next vnto ile came mawr mawr iland mouth mawr scant bow shoot ouer enuironed low water fresh high salt also excellent catching herings procéeding still course fetched compasse going north toward west turning againe coast countrie leadeth vntill sailed full south leauing shore still right hand vntill came vnto couple iles doo lie vpon mouth soch one distant gessed mile neither anie greatnesse almost worthie remembred first came vnto called tudfall therein churchtudfall without anie parishioner except shéepe cony quantitie thereof also much aboue six acre ground measured pole next penthlin myrach mererosse penthlin situat maner betwixt tudfall tuidall shore herein verie good pasture horsses wherof take name giuen vnto next vnto come vnto gwelyn guelyn little ile lieth southeast fall daron daren thing small quantitie yet almost parted mids water next vnto bardsey iland lieng ouer periuincle southwest point promontorie northwales merlin syluestris lieth buried whither rest monk bangor flie saue themselues 2100 fellowes slaine saxon prince quarell augustine monke citie caerleon chester raced ground since reedified againe anie purpose ptolomie calleth iland lymnos briton enlhi therein also parishchurch report goeth hence cast gathering still toward northest till came caer ierienrhod notable rocke situat ouer mouth leuenni wherein standeth strong hold fortresse else towne village certes could well discerne whether bicause wind blew hard southwest morning mistie mariner doubting flat couched far thence hasted awaie vnto anglesei whither went apace readie wind euen owne desire iland tacitus mistaketh doubt mona caesaris dooth ptolomie appeareth latitude situat two mile shore northwales paulus iouius gesseth time past ioined continent maine ileanglesei cut wale working sea onelie cut working ocean sicilia peraduenture italie violence leuant practise king reigned thereby also saith inhabitant constreind first make bridge ouer till breach waxed great passage could anie longer mainteined thing doo either touch purpose make smallie present description ile comming matter anglesei found full great wightanglesei nothing inferiour rather surmounting also caesar calleth mona fruitfulnesse soile manie hundred fold old time reputed taken common granarie wale sicilia rome italie prouision corne like maner welshman themselues called mother countrie giuing mind wholie pasturage easie lesse chargeable trade vtterlie neglected tillage men leaned onelie fertilitie iland corne whence neuer failed receiue continuall abundance gyraldus saith ile anglesei lesse sufficient minister graine sustentation men wale mountaines called ereri snowdoni northwales yeeld plentie pasture cattell whatsoeuer within aforesaid compasse brought togither left vpon contained moreouer manie townes welnéere day yeare conuerting cantreds haue accompted three gyraldus saith howbeit haue beene say 363 townes anglesei great part reckoning vtterlie shroonke far gone decaie verie ruines vnneath séene discerned yet séemeth méetlie well inhabited leland noting smalnesse hundred comparison time past addeth far remember six anglesei menay maltraith liuon talbellion torkalin tindaithin herevnto lhoid saith also welshman named king england king london till better instruction bring farther knowledge anglesei many townes village whose name yet cannot orderlie atteine vnto wherefore content selfe rehearsall many hebrides part old writer déed placed hebrides hemodes hemodes called acmodes sée plinie mela martianus capella plutarch de defect orac diuers call hebudes acmodes albeit writer varie number speaking 30 hebudes seuen hemodes fiue ebudes solinus follow authoritie howbeit late scottish writer doo product summe 300 ilands sometime belonged scot sometime norwegian sometime dane first manaw haue intreated next vnto alisa desert ile yet replenished cony soland foule fit harbor fisherman time yeare lie vpon coast thereof herings next vnto arran verie hillie craggie soile yet verie plentifull fish coast wherein verie good hauen ouer mouth whereof lieth moll also small defense seafaring men seeke harbor part came fladwa pladwa lesse fruitfull stored cony bota bura botha eight mile long foure mile broad low ground yet verie batable wherein good store short indifferent pasture hath also towne called rosse castell named camp also another called marnech iland mile length halfe mile breadth low ground also yet verie fertile mouth likewise glot lieth cumber lesse farre sunder one another fruitfull inough one corne platyceraton auon another iland lieth mile cantire verie commodious ship wherof called auon saie portuosa full harbor therefore dane time past great vse haue raclind kyntar cray gegaw six mile length mile halfe breadth dera full déere otherwise vnfruitfull therefore thinke called ile déere old timescarba scarba foure mile length one breadth verie little inhabited thereinto sea betwéene ile déere swift violent except certeine time easilie nauigable past come certeine ilands great fame lie scattered bellach gyrastell longaie fiolas thrée yarues culbrenin duncomell lupar belnaua wikerua calfile luing sele ile sound last thrée fruitfull belong earle argile slate ile haue slate called tile made therin nagsey isdalf sken later also called thian wicked herbe growing greatlie hurtfull colour much vnlike lillie sauing wan féeble colour vderga king ile duffa blacke ile kirke ile triarach also ile ard humble ile greene ile heth ile arbor ile gote ile cony ile alias idle ile abrid ile bird ile lismor wherein bishop argill sometime held palace eight mile length two mile breadth without mine also good mettall also ile ouilia siuna trect shepey fladaw stone ile gresse great ile ardis musadell berner sometime called holie sanctuarie vghe ile molochasgyr drinacha ouergrowne bush elder vtterlie spoiled ruines great house haue heretofore béene found therin like sort wijc ranse caruer tract also yet thrée intreat ofila ila mula iona first one hath béene least accounted much aboue 24 mile length breadth 16 reaching south north yet excéeding rich plot ground verie plentious corne cattell déere also lead mettals easie obteined either people industrious soile yéeldable wood fine trie iland also lake swéet water called laie also baie wherein sundrie ilands therevnto another lake fresh water wherein falangam ile situate wherein souereigne iles sometime dwelledround ile néere vnto round ile called consultation court sometime holden wherein 14 principall inhabitant minister iustice vnto rest whole disposition thing committed vnto might rule vnto benefit ilands also stoneheape iland called heape stone therein south side also ila find moreouer colurne mulmor osrin brigidan corkerke humble ile imersga bethy texa shepeie naosig rinard cane tharscher aknor gret ile man ile iohns ile stackbed west side thereof also lieth ouersey whereby runneth perilous sea nauigable certeine houres merchant ile vsabrast tanask neff wauer ile oruans hog ile colauanso mula right noble ile 24 mile length manie bredthmula rough soile yet fruitfull enough beside wood deere good harbrough ship replenished diuers sundrie townes castels ouer columkill also hath two riuers yeld verie great store salmon riuellets altogither vnfruitfull beside two lake iland likewise euerie ilands castell sea beating vpon ile maketh foure notable bay wherein great plentie verie good herring taken hath also northwest side columbria ile doues southeast era verie commodious fishing cattell corne moreouer woorth noting ile aboue rest hath plesant spring arising two mile distance shore wherein certeine little egs found much like vnto indifferent pearles colour brightnesse thereto full thicke humour egs carried violence fresh water vnto salt within space twelue houres conuerted great shels take mother pearle except deceiued iona sometime called columkilliona fame estimation nothing inferiour anie although length excéed little aboue two mile breadth one certes verie fruitfull commodity climat wherein standeth dooth yeeld beareth name columbus abbat whome haue spoken large chronologie somtimes also two monastery therein one moonks builded fergus another nun parish church beside many chappels builded scotish king prince gouerned iles english gotten possession ile manaw bishop see erected old monasterie columbus whereby iurisdiction iles still mainteined continued certes remaine yet iland old burial appertein • ng noble family dwelled west iles thrée aboue accompted notable haue little house builded vpon middest hath stone whereon writtenregum tumuli tumuli regum scotiae burial king scotland saie fourtie eight interred another intituled word burial king ireland bicause foure lie place third hath word written thereon graues king norwaie eight buried also fond suspicion conceiued merit columbus howbeit processe time malcolme cammor erected abbeie donfermeling gaue occasion manie successor interred iland lie six iles dispersed small quantitie altogither barren sometimes giuen king scotland lord iles vnto abbeie saint columbus soa albeit yeeld competent pasturage shéepe yet commodious egs great plentie wildfoule breeding doo laie within samethe ile shrewes ile shrewes woman sober head doo call also rudan next vnto rering also shen halfe mile mula whose bankes doo swarme cony hath also parish church inhabitant doo liue dwell mula also eorse arse belong vnto saint columbus abbeie two mile arse olue iland fiue mile length sufficientlie stored corne grasse without good hauen ship lie harbor also colfans iland fruitfull inough full cornell trées far also gomater stafa two kerneburgs mosse ile old brittish speech called monad saie mossemosse ile soile verie blacke bicause corruption putrefaction wood haue rotted thereon wherevpon also small plentie mosse bred ingendered people like maner make fire said earth fullie good english turffe also long six mile toward west tirreie eight mile length thrée breadth one plentifull kind commodity beareth corne cattell fish seafowle aboundantlie hath also well fresh water castell verie good hauen great vessel lie safegard two mile also gun coll two mile also gun passed calfe verie wooddie iland foure gréene iles two glasse skie ilands ardan ile woolfes great iland reacheth east west sixteene mile length six breadth full mounteins swelling wood asmuch much inhabited seafoules laie great plentie egs whereof may gather number listeth upon high cliffes rock also soland géefe taken verie plentifullie beyond foure mile also ile▪ horsses little hog iland altogither vnfruitfull falcon custome bréedeth therevnto without conuenient hauen farre also canna egga little iles later full soland géefe likewise sobratill apt hunt méet anie commoditie reaped thereby come skieskie greatest ile scotland two fortie mile long somewhere eight place twelue mile broad moreouer verie hillie hilles therevnto loaden great store wood wood pasture field corne cattell besides commodity small heards mare whereby raise great aduantage commoditie hath fiue riuers verie much abounding salmon fresh stream altogither void prouision inuironed also manie bay wherein great plentie herring taken time yéere hath also noble poole fresh water fiue castels sundrie townes aie iohns dunwegen nicholas c old scot called skianacha winged named skie lie certeine small ilands also rausa batable soile corne gras conie iland full wood cony paba theeuish iland whose wood théeues lurke rob passe scalpe ile full deere crowling wherein verie good harbour ship rarsa full béechen wood stag length seuen mile two breadth ron woodie ile full heath yet hath good hauen hath little iland called gerloch mouth thereof therein lurke manie théeues farre ron wit six mile also flad tiulmen oransa buie lesse buie fiue little trifling iles whose name haue notice come vnto ise pretie fertile iland oue askoome lindill foure score mile skie towards west ling gigarmen berner magle pable flab scarpe sander uateras later hath noble hauen great ship beside sundrie commodity nine last rehearsed vnder dominion bishop iles come barbar iland seauen mile length vnfruitfull grasse corne chiefe commoditie thereof lieth taking herring abundantlie one baie iland lieth islet therein standeth strong castell north part hereof also hill beareth good grasse foot top riseth spring running sea doth carrie withall kind creature yet perfectlie formed liken vnto cockels vpon shore water falleth sea take vp kind shelfish water gone suppose ingendred increased manner betwéene barre uisse lie also ilands orbaus oue hakerset warlang flad two bay haie helsaie gigaie lingaie fraie fudaie friskaie uisse thirtie mile long six mile broad therein sundrie fresh water one especiallie three mile length neuerthelesse sea hath late found waie cannot kept banke three score foot flowe leaue seafish behind lake also fish bred therein almost like vnto salmon sauing hath white bellie blacke backe altogither without scale likewise great harbour théeues pirats eight mile beyond lieth helscher appertinent nun iona haue hasker verie plentifullie benefited seales taken time yéere thrée score mile also hirth whose inhabitant rude good science religion yet iland verie fruitfull thing bringeth foorth shéepe farre greater elsewhere found big fallow deare horned like bugle haue tailes hanging ground owner ilebaptisme without preests sendeth ouer bailiffe midsummer gather duty préest saie masse baptise child borne since time yéere precedent none go ouer bicause voiage dangerous doth father take paine baptise owne home rent paid commonlie dried seales sea foule whole ile aboue mile euerie waie except thrée mounteines lie vpon one part shore dwell iles see part thereof past uisse came walaie soa strome pabaie barner ensaie killiger two saga hermodraie scarfe grie ling gilling heie hoie farlaie great little ise sein sein lesse tarant slegan tuom scarpe hareie seauen holie ilands desert bréed nothing kind wild shéepewild sheepe often hunted seldome neuer eaten stéed flesh haue nothing tallow anie flesh vnsauorie men care eate except great hunger compell suppose wild sheepe tamed bicause horrible grenning thereof taken bastard tiger haire betweene wooll sheepetigers haire goat resembling shacked yet absolutelie like vnto neither maie also beast capitolinus calleth ouis fera shewed time gordian emperour albeit take camelopardalis hereof make warrantise also farre garuell lambe flad kellas two bernars kirt two buy uixaie pabaie two sigrams ile pigmeiesile pigmeies like sort two church whereof one dedicated saint peter clement beside monasterie called roadill soile also ile indifferent fruitfull reape profit vnder ground aboue digging neither woolfe fox serpent séene iland yet great wood therein also separate one part likewise plentie stag farre lesse quantitie north part iland also riuer greatlie aboundeth salmon part also called lewisa north half ile well inhabited toward sea coast hath riuers lesse plentifull salmon halfe also great store herring taken whereof fisher men doo raise great gaine commoditie lesse plentie sheepe doo sheere plucke euerie yeere yet ground part verie heathie full mosse face thereof verie swart blacke space foot depth corruption wood time past haue rotted therefore time yeere conuert turffe burne néede shall serue yéere hauing well doonged meane time slawke sea sowe barleie selfe place turffes grew reape verie good corne wherewith liue féed plentie whale also taken coasttithe whale verie tithe hath béene knowne one yéere amount vnto seauen twentie whale one greatnesse notable also part ile great caue two yard déepe water sea gone aboue foure highest ouer great number doo sit sex age hook line catch time infinite deale fish wherewith liue maketh also idle past sixtie mile come vnto rona ron take last hebrides distant said fortie mile orchades one hundreth thirtie promontorie dungishe inhabitant ile verie rude irreligious lord also soile dooth limit number housholds hauing assigned vnto number greater smaller sort cattell shall spend inioie owne prouision send ouerplus yéerlie vnto lewis cheefe paiments consist great quantitie meale verie plentifull among sowed vp shéepes skin also mutton sea foule dried resteth ouer aboue themselues spend happen people iland lord booke rate dooth come vnto send also ouerplus like maner vnto mean liue alwaies plentie receiue vice strange country neither know heare anie thing doone elsewhere owne iland manie whale taken also vpon coast likewise replenished seale porpasse either tame fierce abash sight looke vpon neither make anie hast flie presence beyond ile 16 mile westward another called suilscraiesuilscraie mile length void grasse without much heath growing vpon hir soile yet manie cliffes rock therein couered blacke mosse whereon innumerable sort foules bréed laie egs thither like sort manie doo saile lewissa take yoong time yeare able flie also kill drie eight day space returne home againe great plentie fethers fathered voiage one thing verie strange noted iland colke foulecolke foule little lesse goose kind commeth thither yeare wit spring laie hir egs bring vp hir yoong till able shift themselues get awaie togither sea come vntill time yéere next insueth season also cast fethers answering tribute nature vse hir mossie soile wherein woonderfull sée fethers haue stalkes neither anie thing hard séene couer body wooll downe till breeding time saie wherein left starke naked orchades whose first inhabitant scithiansorchades came iles gothes inhabit spark yet remaining among language doo declare lie partlie germaine partlie calidon sea ouer point dunghisbie number eight twentie saie thirtie one yet saie thirtie thrée orosius plinie saith fortie belonging crowne scotland rest whereof héeretofore haue made report since crossed ouer mouth solueie streame come countrie certes people island reteine much old sparing diet therevnto goodlie stature tall verie comelie healthfull long life great strength whitish colour men feed vpon fish sith cold extreame part ground bringeth foorth small store wheate maner verie little fuell wherewith warme winter yet séemeth time past ilands also haue béene well replenished wood without either trée shrub stéed whereof haue plentie heath suffered grow among rather thorough negligence soile selfe yéeld bring foorth trées bush store hath beene time past root yet found digged ground doo yéeld sufficient triall otes haue verie plentifullie greater store barleie wherof make nappie kind drinke indéed verie readilie cause stranger ouershoot himselfe howbeit may vnto v lieu miracle although drinke neuer strong themselues vnmeasurable drinker none yet shall easilie séene saith hector anie drunkard among themif speake truth either frantike mad man dolt naturall foole meet weare cockescombe vnmeasurable drinking confessed also buchanan noteth whensoeuer anie wine brought vnto soiles take part thereof aboundantlie addeth moreouer haue old bole call magnus bole first preached christ vnto farre greater quantitie common bole great may séeme reserued since lapithane banket onelie quaffe drinke anie bishop commeth vnto offer bole full drinke able drinke vp quite one draught assure themselues good lucke plentie neuerthelesse excesse often found common sort penurie maketh frugall priest richer calling succour pirats also verie often exchange vittels commodity rather feare want power resist ilands lieng scattered anie necessitie gain doo get men truth thinke themselues haue little need furniture owne soiles doo yéeld offer vnto also read inhabitant ilands ignorance excesse vnto part stéed physicke labour trauell medicine disease molested incombred withall like sort want venemous beast cheefelie doo delight hotter soile kind ouglie creature ewe also full increase doo vsuallie bring foorth two three foure lambes whereby account anelings bring foorth one rather barren kept anie gaine wild tame foules haue plentie people account rather burthen soile benefit table haue also neat gotes whereby abound white meat butter cheese wherein next vnto fish chéefe part sustenance dooth consist also bishop orchades hath see pomona chéefe ilands wherein also two strong castels hath béene superstition people almost one hath one church least dedicated mother christ finallie little vse physicke quarter lesse store éeles least frog horsses bred amongst commonlie much greater ass yet labour trauell man shall find verie elsewhere able come neere much lesse match holding iournies sea ilands verie tempestuous onelie strong wind influence heauens star contrarie méetings working west ocean rageth vehementlie streicts vessell able passe safetie amongst ilands also small low commoditie reaped anie scarselie sufficient susteine one two men barren full rock nothing else mosse bare shingle wherefore onelie thirteene inhabited made account rest left vnto sheepe hight kirkwa also two pretie hold one belonging king bishop also beautifull church much building betweene two hold church taken two townes one called king bishop towne whole iland full cliffes aliàs dunachisbie two houres space swiftnesse sea tract ile fiue mile long hath faire port called saint margarets hauen passe two desert iles lie towards east wherein nothing found cattell call holmes betwéene doo séeme ioine togither tide gone neuerthelesse certeine single double ile ten mile length highest hilles séene orchades lie eight mile rauals two mile pomona saint donats scotland full néere vnto east side thereof cobesa dooth maner ouershadow siapiusa also ile six mile long lieth within two mile cracouia toward east west side pomona lieth rouse six mile length east eglisa wherin saie patrone magnus lieth interred hense southward lie uera gersa far uester fourescore mile hethland papa stronza also eightie mile hethland uester middest also tract lieth far fara saie faire ile old english faire eie within sight well hethland orchades reason three insuperable rock apparant verie poore iland yet yearelie robbed commodity hath flemish english fisherman passe coast thereof time yeare catch fish prouision country next vnto greatest hethlands iland called maine sixtie mile length sixteene bredth full rock whose coast onelie inhabited innermost part lest vnto foules aire mile toward north lieth zeale twentie mile length eight bredth wild suffer creature liue thereof bred therein betwéene iland also maine smaller ilands found ling orne big sanferre hense nine mile northward usta twentie mile long six bredth plaine pleasant inuironed swift terrible sea betwéene also zeale uie ure ling also towards west two skenes chalseie nordwade brase mowse west side lie west skenes rottia papa lesse wunned papa ualla tondra burra haura haura lesse maner manie holmes dispersed heere whereof haue notice call shetland shotland iles buchanan nameth third member diuision vncerteine skewes fetch norwaie speech gothish dealing forren merchant doo gather anie wealth verie often bestow vpon furniture house weight measure germaine maner countrie verie healthie wholesome late man found maried wife one hundred yeares age able go fishing bote one hundred fortie late yéeres died méere age without anie disease dronkennesse heard among yet meet make good chéere verie often neither doo read anie great vse flesh foule although ilands haue plentie anie mention corne growing part therefore steed bread drie kind fish beat morters powder bake ouens vntill hard drie fuell also bone fish yéeldeth taken coast yet liue themselues suppose much felicitie thinking great péece happinesse farre distant wicked auarice cruell dealing rich ciuill part world herein also like vnto hirthiens one time yeare commeth priest vnto orchades vnto iurisdiction doo belong baptiseth child haue béene borne among since last arriued hauing afterward remained two day taketh tithe prouide paie great scrupulositie fish commodity paie none returneth home againe without boast troublesome voiage except watch time iles also great plentie fine amber hadamber hector saith producted working sea
