birth sonne iames afterward king scotland called iames fourth resigned right title whatsoeuer either ancestor either presently hertofore might haue herafrer may haue vnto aforesaid péeres appéereth charter shetland iles vntill come southward scarre lieth buquhamnesse find mention anie ile situat vpon coast neither greatlie thence vntill come forth leadeth vp sterling neither thought safetie v search farre thule whence excellent brimstone commeth thereto store ilands lie vnder northerlie climats whose secret situation though partlie seene time haue yet bin perfectlie reueled discouered anie bicause great aboundance huge ilands ice mooueth fro vpon shore sundrie perilous gulfes indraughts water much knowlege doth concerne purpose wherfore casting came last firth forth call scotish sea wherein passe seuen eight first called maie second baa garwie third doo séeme inhabited also holding course toward england passe another ile wherein faux castell standeth far skill serueth last iland scotish side compassing whereof able discerne whether flat shallowes number ilands without name confusion situation lacke true description mine owne ignorance hath troubled meruell therefore haue béene oft ground among ioifull come home againe although thames mouth natiue citie taketh name troie yet english dominion good interteinement much franke copious better harborough wherein rest wearie bone refresh ease wether beaten carcass first iland therefore commeth sight passed berwike somtime called lindesfarne holie ilandlindesfarne holie iland conteineth eight mile place much honored among monasticall writer bicause diuerse moonks heremits spend time therein also bishop see lindesfarne long season afterward translated chester stréet finallie duresine dunelme durham first erected oswald wherein placed aidanus learned scotish moonke came hither ile called hij whereof beda speaking third chapter third booke noteth although said hij belong king northumberland reason situation néerenesse selfe either reading helpe alreadie purchased gotten euen happeneth tractation water whose head course length bredth depth chanell burden eb flowing falles thought haue made perfect description vnder report also imagined course taken want instruction hath béene largelie promised slacklie perfourmed sudden iniurious deniall helpe voluntarilie offered without occasion giuen part must need content selfe obseruations haue either obteined mine owne experience gathered time time men writing whereby full discourse whole vtterlie cut steed mangled rehearsall residue set downe left memorie wherefore beséech honour pardon imperfection rudenesse labour notwithstanding altogither vaine sith error maie prooue spurre vnto better skilled either correct inlarge occasion serueth leastwise take hand absolute péece worke better direction shall incourage thereto entrance beginning euerie thing hardest beginneth well hath atchiued halfe purpose ice lord broken hencefoorth easie shall come wade rest sith facile est inuentis addere continue finish great matter building attempt laie foundation platforme anie noble péece workmanship though rudelie handled purpose began thamesthamesis description ilands doo like famous riuers making mine entrie said riuer selfe whose founteine men make much adoo time past true head nilus till late yet descried neuer found tanais whose originall neuer knowne shall whilest one placeth another none deale exactlie wherefore leaning men writing haue set purpose sought spring thames affirme famous streame hath head beginning side hill standing plaines cotswold one mile tetburie néere vnto fosse high waie called old sometime named isi ouse although diuerse doo ignorantlie call thames euen rather foolish custome anie skill bicause either neglect vtterlie ignorant named first hence runneth directlie toward east good riuers méeteth cirne churne brooke called latine corinium whereof cirncestercorinium towne commeth doth take denomination hence hasteth vnto créekelade aliàs crekanford lechlade radcotebridge newbridge eouesham receiuing waie infinit sort small streames brooke beckes water rundels side towne diuideth selfe two course one goeth straight botleie hinkseie godstow village farre latter spreadeth selfe also sundrie smaller branch run farre yer reunited beclipping sundrie pleasant medowes passeth length oxfordcharwell supposed rather called ouseford riuer • eteth charwell litle whence originall branch doo ioine go togither abbandune aliàs sensham abington call although part first came néere towne doth nowsome write maine streame brought thither ranne betweene andredeseie culenham till branch thereof led thither maine streame thorough industrie moonks beside testimonie old record thereof yet extant séene decaie cair dour dorchester selfe sometime throughfare wal • west countrie london insued vpon fact easie seene hence goeth dorchester thame ioining riuer denomination looseth name isi ouse whereof ousencie oxford producted thenceforth called thamesis thame goeth wallingford redingpontium time past number bridge called pontium albeit english name doth rather proceed rhe reesaint marie ouer rhee saxon word watercourse riuer maie séene ouerée sutherée ouer ree south rhee skilfull doth readilie appéere yet hold altogither probabilitie likelihood word sutherée called sudrijc wit south kingdome wherevnto part thames bound holdeth denomination either said church name foresaid countie affirme likewise reding called greeke word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ouer flowe certes neither coniectures contemned last cōmeth neere mine aid affirme onelie course euerie water selfe also ouer flowing time past called rhe saxon inhabited iland euen daie essex haue oft obserued lower ground rage water haue béene ouerflowen people beholding haue said rhe haue said riuer albeit word riuer deriued french borrowed latin without corruption brought vnto giue notice farre deceiued call aforesaid church name marie auderies marie ouer isi ise procéed course noble streame howsoeuer matter stand hath passed reding receiued kenetkenet commeth hilles lie west marleborough thetisthetis commonlie called tide commeth thetisford hieth sudlington otherwise called maiden head windleshore windsore eaton chertseie erkenwald bishop london sometime builded religious house cell doo read chertseie hasteth directlie vnto stanes receiuing streame waie called colecole wherevpon colbrooke standeth goeth kingstone shene sion brentford bregentford méeteth brane brene another brook descending edgeworth whose name signifieth frog brittish speach upon also sir iohn thin sometime statelie house maruellous prouision inclose reteine fish come samebrene brentfoord passeth mortlach putneie fulham batterseie chelseie lambeth london finallie going thence vnto sea taketh lée waie vpon coast essex darnt vpon kent side riseth néere tanrige commeth shoreham vnto derntforddarwent wherevnto craiecraie falleth last medwaie notable riuer mine opinion watereth south southwest part kent whose description omitted heereafter place hauing maner bréefelie touched noble riuer brooke fall adde particular description last themselues whereby course also shall seuerallie described satisfaction studious yer take hand insert word two commodity said riuer performe much breuitie possible héereby also finding whole tract course head fall thereof sea appeareth euidentlie length thereof least one hundreth eightie mile measured iourneies land course longest thrée famous riuers ile nothing inferiour vnto aboundance kind fish whereof hard saie three haue either plentie greatest varietie circumstance duelie weighed write riuers country skilleth neither diuerse doo inuent strange thing noble streame therewith nobilitate former placesthe iust distāce betwéen one tide another whereby common difference betwéene one tide another found consist twentie foure minuts wanteth twelue whole houre foure twentie experience dooth confirme like sort sée dailie triall tide equall heigth greatnesse full change moone haue greatest flouds ordinarie course diminish change ful vnto first last quarter afterwards increase againe vntill come full change sometimes also rise high wind north northeast bringeth water vehemencie bicause tide filleth chanell commeth scotland ward thames ouerfloweth hir bank néere vnto london hapneth especiallie ful change ianuarie februarie wherein lower ground custome soonest drowned order flowing like sort perpetuall moone vpon southwest north point water london highest neither doo tide alter except rough wind west southwest doo kéepe backe checke streame entrancethe streame oft checked hir entrance land east northeast doo hasten comming thereof else extraordinarie occasion put ordinarie course northerne sea fill said riuer naturall returne flowing doo happen eft among refer haue sildome obserued also sensible chopping thrée foure tide one naturall daie wherof vnskilfull doo descant manie thing euer small matter doo fall often soeuer course streame doth happen disturbed yet two seuerall time age moone water returne naturall course limit time exactlie polydore saith riuer seldome increased rather neuer ouerfloweth hir bank landflouds herein verie much deceiued shalbe apparantlie séene hereafter riuer put hir right course water must necessitie swell white water run downe land bicause passage cannot swift readie winding streight course landflouds also doo greatlie straine finesse streame much great landfloud shall take haddock hand beneath bridge flote aloft vpon water whose eies blinded thicknesse element cannot see become make shift saue themselues death take hold otherwise water selfe cléere comparison next vnto sea subtile pure great riuers excellent comparison request whose zeale vnto countrie héerin cannot remember much rather meaneth imitate ortelius somewhat beside hath holpen name townes riuers kentish part run would god plat finished rest procéed darwent therefore rising tanridge goeth titseie toward brasted receiuing ech side towne seuerall bankes riuer rill goeth nockhold shorham kinsford horton darnhith dartford derwentford taking craie left hand coms orpington bycraie marie craie paules craie north craie craiford long yer fall thames passed fall brooke world sée plentie serephium groweth vpon kentish shore whose description fuichfius hath little halted whilest giueth foorth hearbe argentaria serephium betwéene maner likelihood neuerthelesse notable said hearbe translated garden receiueth another forme cleane different first yéelded grew vpon shore therevnto appeareth fat foggie substance maketh thinke physician take distinct kind wormewood whereof controuersie ariseth among next water falleth thames west wauie iles rill great fame neither long course rising coringham runneth manie mile east south yer fall mouth riuer doo describe would haue spoken one créeke commeth cliffe another runneth downe haltsto mary sith vnderstand backewaters serued let passe skilfull course thus much riuers fall thames wherein haue doone maie would mine owne satisfaction till came head lechlade vnto lieu farewell ascribe distichon apollonius rhodius writeth thermodon huic non est aliud flumen par nec tot agros vllum dimittit riuos quot fundit vtrinque next vnto thames haue midwaie watermidwaie whereof find two description first beginneth thus midwaie water called latine medeuia write bicause course therof midwaie manner betwéene london dorobernia call canturburie british hight dourbrée thereof rochester sometime called durobreuum old charter haue seene conteining donation sometime made monasterie saint andrew ceadwalla find saxon called riuer wedring also towne standing betwéene malling east farleie wedrington wherein rie standeth manner byland peninsula experience doth confirme leland men likeliest opinion riuer called limen peter cornhull saithlimenus doth issue andredeswald head thereof knowne certes hospitall cause relinquishing moistnesse soile verie oft ouerflowne whereas king high waie laie sometimes wilton licence obteined king richard bishop salisburie remooue passage vnto new salisburie like maner vpon occasion maine bridge made ouer auon harneham exchange waie also old salisburie fell vtter decaiethrée town decaied changing one waie wilton head towne shire furnished twelue parish church grew poore village small reputation howbeit onelie cause ruine old salisburie sith read two whereof first salue vnto latter take whereas giuen townesmen wanted water old salisburie flat otherwise sith hill verie plentifullie serued spring wels verie swéet water truth matter therefore time ciuill warres souldiors castell chanons old sarum fell od insomuch often bralles fell last sad blowesan holie conflict happened therefore rogation weeke cleargie going solemne procession controuersie fell betwéene certeine walkes limit one side claimed denied also hot intertainment ech part last castellanes espieng time gate betwéene cleargie towne coiled returned homeward feared anie gang bound yeare héerevpon people missing bellie cheare woont haue banketing euerie station thing commonlie practised religious old time wherewith linke common vnto anie man may lead whither bellie latimer said beefe bread beere conceiued foorthwith deadlie hatred castellans able cope force armes consulted richard pore bishop effectuallie long yer meane chanons began new church vpon péece owne ground called mirifield pretending serue god better safetie far quietnesse could doo church begun 1219 nine twentith aprill finished expense 42000 marksnew salisburie begun yeare 1260 fiue twentith march whereby appeereth aboue fortie yéers hand although clearks translated new towne 1220 third yeere fraie people also séeing diligence chanons reputing harmes owne inconuenience earnest sid • néere vnto prelats therefore euerie man brought house vnto place thus became old sarum yeeres vtterlie desolate new salisburie raised vp stéed thereof great decaie also harnham wilton whereof spake late neuerthelesse séeme new citie altogither void great hinderance water second edward second held parlement sudden thaw great frost caused water fast arise euen high masse time water came minster onelie ouerflowed nether part came vp king pauase sate whereby became wetshod end inforced leaue church executour masse least haue béene drowned rage indured space two day wherevpon seruice could said said minster returne againe whence thus digressed auon therefore departing salisburie goeth burtford longford taking water afore mentioned waie goeth stanleiesturus dunketon craiford burgate fording bridge kingwood auon christes church finallie sea yer come litle beneth christes church haue said hauing maner passed christes church head come fall burneburne little brooke running stourefield heath without branch whence proceeded next fall come vnto poolepoole whose mouth vpon shore southwest bale thrée mile poore fisher towne called sandwich saw péere little fresh brooke verie vtter part saint adelmes point fiue mile sandwich another baie lieth west lilleworth heare profitable harborough ship wite poole winburne foure mile standeth almost ile hauen hauen selfe also man measure circuit wanteth little twentie mile gesse view going therefore betwéene north south point sée water left brunkeseie iland castell left hand within said point passing pole leauing créeke bicause hath fresh came holton kesworth beheld two falles one called north south water north streame hight piddle hearepiddle riseth alton goeth thence piddle trench head piddle hinton walterstow yer come birstam receiueth deuils brooke commeth thither brugham melcombe deuilish townedeuit • thence goeth tow piddle ashe piddle turner piddle taking yer come water runneth helton middleton milburne biere hide pole hauen water marianns scotus speaketh except deceiued south water properlie called frome framefrome riseth néere vnto euershot going downe fromequitaine chelmington catstocke receiueth rill beside rowsham wraxehall goeth chilfrome thence maden newtonocus méeteth owke riseth either two mile aboue hoke parke kenford great pond within hoke parke going tollards falleth frome maden newton go one thence fromevauchirch crokewaie frampton muckilford receiueth néere vnto rill aboue upsidling nicholas sidlingsilleie grimston hence goeth stratton bradford peuerell beneath bradford crosseth silleie aliàs minterne cherne brook one chanellminterne▪ cherne whereof first riseth vpper cherne parish minterne méeting aboue middle cherne go nether cherne forston godmanston aboue charneminster frome meane time also frome brancheth leaueth iland aboue charneminster ioining againe néere dorchester goeth dorchester forthington yer come beckington meeteth another becke runneth thereinto winterburne stapleton martinstow heringstow caine stafford thence goeth without anie increase yet beckington knighton tinkleton morton wooll bindon stoke beneath stoke receiueth issue luckeford lakeluckford whence also passeth eastholme warham baieséeke wilie brooke goeth west burie pole hauen fall went arme point slepe saw litle créeke owre beheld comming againe toward entrance saint helen furleie castell went abroad maine found selues libertie past pole hauen lest handfast point peuerell point adelmes chappell came last lughport hauen whereby also luckeford lake portion ground last remembred left maner byland peninsula called ile burbecke wherein good store alum hard stone like sort going still westerlie came sutton point créeke vnto waie wilemouth king welcombe twentie mile pole whose head full foure mile aboue hauen northwest uphill side great hill hereinto entred saw three falles whereof first greatest commeth upweie bradweie radipoole receiuing afterward second ran east chekerell likewise third maketh ground betwéene weimouth smalmouth passage almost iland little barre sand hauen mouth great arme sea runneth vp right hand scant mile aboue hauen mouth shore right goodlie warlike castell made hath one open barbicane arme runneth vp also mile baie point land passage portland little course pibble sand goeth vp also said passage vnto abbatsbirie seauen mile litle fresh rondell resorteth sea somewhat aboue thischesill head point chesill lieng northwest stretcheth vp thence seauen mile maine narrow banke right line vnto southeast abutteth vpon portland scant quarter mile aboue newcastle nature banke often wind bloweth vehementlie southeast often sea beateth losing banke soketh wind blow corner anie long time togither portland left iland hath béene southwest wind dooth appaire banke northwest dooth barre vp againe pretie note townelet waimouth lieth streight milton side place water hauen small breadth rope commonlie tied one side shore another whereby ferrie men doo guide botes without anie helpe ore procéed purpose mouth riuer doo ship often come succour going portland point thereof called rase sailed along shingle till came saint katharins chappell saw fall water came downe blackdéene beaconward portsham abbatsburie thence went another fell sea neere birton descended litton chilcombebride nature hath set mouth riuer maner betwixt two hils little cost would make hauē vnto bride brute port pretie hauen riuer selfe serued sundrie water riseth halfe mile aboue bemister goeth bemister netherburie parneham melplash briteport taketh two water east one chanell one riseth east nettlecourt goeth porestoke milton askerwell runneth longlether hence also bride going toward seasimen taketh simen west commeth simensburge whole streame soone falling sea leauing pretie haue next port charechare serued two rits one confluence beneath charemouth cheefe head riuer leland saith marshwood parke commeth downe whitechurch runneth west wootton méeting beneath charemouth towne said dooth fall sea came cobbe beheld lime waterbuddle townesmen call buddle commeth thrée mile north lime hils fleting vpon rockie soile falleth sea certes hauen héere could sée quarter mile west southwest towne great costlie iuttie sea succour ship towne distant coliton fiue mile heere ended voiage auon conteineth whole coast dorcester dorcetshire next must enter summerset countie see water first water méet withall summersetshire axeaxe riseth place called knoll longing sir wainbroke goeth axeminster beneath crosseth yareyare aliàs • rte commeth buckland whitstaunton yarecombe long bridge stockeland kilmington bridge receiueth brooke south runneth dalwood axe hence axe goeth drake musburie culliford yer come altogither culliford méeteth water riseth aboue cotleie goeth thence widworthie culliton receiuing rill also procéedeth confluence aboue culliford bridge axe thence hold togither maine sea whereinto fall vnder root winter cliffes point almost mile sunder westerlie called berewood lieth within halfe mile seton toward east named whitecliffe saie time athelstane greatest nauie euer aduentured iland arriued seton deuonshire replenished alien sought conquest iland athelstane met incountered field ouerthrew six thousand aforesaid enimies one also remained aliue escaped battell without deadlie verie gréeuous wound conflict moreouer slaine fiue king interred churchyard axe minster part king england killed eight earles chéefe nobilitie also buried churchyard aforesaid héervnto addeth bishop shireburne like sort slaine battell began brunedune neere coliton indured euen axe minster called brunberie brunburg daie thing happened sunne lost light continued without anie brightnesse vntill setting planet though otherwise season cléere nothing cloudie hauen time past haue heard hath béene sidmouth called sidde rillet runneth thereto likewise setonsidde seton passe ouer sith none yet hath béene sometime notable one albeit present betweene two point old hauen lieth mightie bar pibble stone verie mouth riuer axe driuen verie east point hauen called white cliffe thereat also verie little gull goeth sea whither small fisherbotes doo oft resort succour men seton began late stake make maine wall within hauen haue changed course axe almost middle old hauen haue trenched chesill thereby haue let axe haue taken maine sea heare none effect attempt come vntocolie seton westward lieth coliton two mile west northwest whereof riseth riuer colie going aforesaid towne passeth colecombe parke afterward falleth betweene axe bridge axe mouth towne axe riuer west bereworth point lieth créeke serued farre remember fresh water commeth hilles south soutleiesid branscombe sidmouth hauen next thither commeth fresh water mary said hils goeth mary aforesaid sidburie betweene saltcombe sidmouth maine seaautrie aliàs ottercie west great hillie point called downesend betwixt downesend pointlet named wereford little baie selfe like sort full mile downesend vpward hauen kingswere towne standeth another pointlet betwixt wereford second baie somewhat moreouer aboue kingswere towne goeth little créeke vp land maine streame hauen called waterhead verie fit place vessel made like sort halfe mile beyond landward goeth another longer créeke aboue also greater either called gawnston whose head halfe mile maine sea compassing thereof runneth tor baie riuer dart darent read derenta muth dartmouthdart commeth dartmore fiftéene mile aboue totnesse verie large plot another wild morish forrestie ground ermore selfe moreouer water verie swift thorough occasion tinworkes whereby passeth carrieth much sand totnesse b •• dge choketh depth riuer downeward hauen selfe almost spoiled mariner dartmouth accompt kenning plimmouth darent therefore proceeding place vprising goeth bucklandashburne whence goeth buckland hole soone aboue gabriell stoke méeteth hartburne runneth vnder rost bridge two mile aboue totneshartburne another saith ratter harberton painesford asprempton darent yer long also commeth corneworthie grenewaie ditsham darntmouth towne whervnto king iohn gaue sometimes maior vnto totnesse thence betwéene castelles finallie sea hence went stokeflemming another water commeth blacke auton second falleth east slapton coasting baie start point saile almost directlie west till come saltcombe hauen certes port hath verie little fresh water comming therefore meruell though barred yet head riseth neere buckland goeth dudbrooke standeth betwéene two créekes thence hieth charleton taketh rill whose head commeth south north shereford finallie hath another créeke runneth vp ilton last falleth north portlemouth whose head néere baie last afore remembred maketh sorie peninsula haue heard said come awneawne whose head hils farre aboue brent towne whence goeth dixford wood loddewell hache aunton thorleston sea gulfe wherein ship doo ride walled ech side chained ouer time necessitie south side hauen blocke house vpon rockie hill touching riuer selfe riseth hils west cornewood commeth downe short course thrée mile newenham issued ground newenham also runneth plimpton soone stourestoure aliàs catwater stoure ariseth northwest shepistour goeth frō thence memchurch hele shane bickleie eford taking plim runneth downe one vnder name plim vntill go past plimmouth fall hauen south east plimmouth aforesaid haue oftentimes trauelled find cause whie manie riuers england called name stoure first supposing growne corruption dour brittish word streame rested thervpon resolued season afterward finding word méere saxon stouremare prouince subiect duke saxonie yéelded another opinion whereby conceiue said name first deriued saxon returne purpose plimmouth selfe standeth betweene two créeks serued anie backewater therefore passing ouer two enter thamer dischargeth selfe aforsaid hauen going therfore vp streame part parteth deuonshire cornewall first riueret met withall east side called tauietaue tauie head whereof among mounteins foure mile aboue peter tauie beneath meeteth another water west two gwinnowes thence also point saint gwinnowes wood halfe mile thence except memorie dooth faile goeth salt créeke halfe mile east side hauen head bridge called lerine bridge créeke selfe like maner bearing denomination lerine creeke caracs pill créekein middle créeke cell ciret islet longing sometime mountagew priorie halfe mile lower east side said hauen goeth vp also aboue mile halfe land caracs créeke poulmorland mile likewise goeth vp scant quarter mile land yet head parteth selfe twaine poulmorland weto bodnecke village halfe mile passage repassage commonlie fawy bodnecke pelene point créeke goeth vp fullie thousand pace land mile thence poulruan quarter mile poulruan tower force marching tower fawy side betwéene doo heare chaine hath sometime beene stretched likelie inough hauen hardly two bow shot ouer verie point land east side mouth hauen called pontus crosse panuchecrosse shall amisse place somewhat intreat towne fawy called cornish comwhathcomwhath situat northside hauen set hanging maine rockie hill length one quarter mile except memorie deceiue renowme fawy rose war vnder king edward first edward third henrie fift partlie feat armes partlie plaine pirasie finallie townesmen feeling themselues somwhat ease strong purse fell merchandize prospered new deuise trauelled place merchant country made resort whereby within grew exceeding rich ship fawy sailing time rhie winchelseie time king edward third refused stoutlie vale anie bonet although warning giuen doo portgreues ruler townes herevpon rhie winchelseie men made vpon cut long taile hardlie interteined fawy pirate saie aduenturers driuen home againe small losse hinderance fauour found fawy men also immediatlie vpon bickering token victorie ouer winching aduersaries riding ripiers called mockerie altered armes compounded new wherein scutchion rhie winchelseie quartered beside foyens called gallant fawy foygallants foy fawy whereof little reioised peraduenture greater bootie thus much fawy towne wherein sée great successe often commeth witlesse rash aduentures returne againe purpose whence haue digressed hauing desire finish vp voiage leaue fawmouth go forward iournie therefore past hauen come trewardith baie lieth land betwéene canuasse blacke head point hereabout leland placeth vrctoum promontorium saw fall two small brooke one verie far distant another first entring west trewardith east saint blaies directlie curwarder rocke except mistake compasse neither anie great course longest full thrée mile halfe wherfore sith neither branched anie great quantitie make long haruest little corne spend time may well spared past blacke head came austell brookeaustell increased water commeth aboue mewan within mile confluence fall sea pentoren whence went blacke rocke dud •• point till came chare hay falleth pretie waterchare whose head two mile aboue saint tues thence went méere salt créeke till passed graie rocke gi • • raith baie anthony point leland maketh accompt enter falamouth hauen fala riseth little north penuenton townefala going westward till come downwards toward saint dionise goeth thence melader saint steuens grampont goldon crede corneleie tregue moran tregu •• falleth hauen good indifferent force course fala least séeme omit creekes betwéene anthony point go little backe againe fetch mani • come remembrance entring therefore port haue créeke runneth vp saint anthony toward saint gereus another goeth land east saint mary castell forked head passing meane time great rocke lieth verie midst hauen maner third point triangle betwéene saint mary castell pendinant thence cast said castell came another créeke falleth east second aboue saint iustus third ardenora fourth rilan hauing visited order come backe againe tregonnian going vpward betweene taluerne till came fentangolan found confluence two great creekes beneath saint clements whereof one hath fresh water comming downe mer • another truro increased sundrie branch though one anie greatnesse therefore vnworthie handled pole hole standeth vpon head almost easterlie kenwen truro stand aboue confluence two fourth falleth west certeine hils fift sixt little créeks fresh haue lesse language talke spend saint caie saint feokes créeke whose issue betwéene restronget créeke trurie sée cause make long spéech yet remember towne feoke standeth betwéene boths caie feoks also called saint rising aboue perannarwothill comming thence kirklo falleth falamouth northeast milor standeth vpon point betwéene milor créeke milor creeke next restrongetmilor call milor poole whence went trefusis point found great fall perin branched top hath perin towne almost verie confluence thus much collection fall somuch leland hath taken paine description riuer suffer perish sith matter conteined therein worthie remembrance although deliuered order thing selfe requireth verie point saith hauen mouth hill whereon king hath builded castellfala called pendinant mile compasse almost inuironed sea sea couereth ground low small mastrie make pendinant iland furthermore lieth cape foreland within hauen mile halfe betwixt maister killigrewes house one great arme hauen runneth vp penrine towne three mile verie entrie falamouth hauen two good mile penfusisleuine moreouer leuine priselo betwixt saint budocus pendinas good hauen barre sand procéed first creeke arme casteth northwest side falemouth hauen goeth vp perin end breaketh two armes whereof lesse runneth glasenith viridis nidus gréene nest wagméere penrine saint glunias parish church penrine like sort side penrine créeke breaketh arme yer come penrine vnderstand also stake foundation stone haue béene set créeke penrine litle lower wharfe breakech armes howsoeuer standeth betwixt point trefusis point restronget milor créekemilor goeth vp mile land church good rode ship next creeke beyond point restronget wood called restronget going two mile vp mainerestronget breaketh two armes like order betwixt restronget creeke trurie two créekes one called saint feokess feoks saint cay caie next vnto trurie créeke goeth vp two mile creeking principall streame breaketh within halfe mile trurie casting branch westward euen hard newham wood creeke trurie diuided two part towne trurietrurie créeke hauing brooke comming downe bridge towne trurie standeth betwixt like sort kenwen stréet seuered said towne arme clements street east bodie also trurie creeke breaketh another eastward mile crurie goeth vp mile halfe cresilian bridge stone verie entrie mouth créeke rode ship called maple rode fought long since eightéene ship spanish merchant foure ship warre deepe spaniard draue frenchman harborow mile halfe aboue mouth crurie creeke another named lhan moran morans church handmoran créeke goeth vp quarter mile maine streame hauen maine streame goeth vp two mile aboue moran créeke ebbing flowing quarter mile higher towne cregowie found bridge stone vpon fala riuer fala selfe riseth mile west roche hill goeth graund pont saw bridge stone graund pont foure mile roche hillgraund pont two little mile cregowie betwixt fala taketh course cregowie passe downe bodie hauen falamouth mouth lanie horne pill créeke south side hauen mile remember goeth vp halfe mile principall streame hauen lanihorne pill also place point sand mile waie fortie acre thereabout peninsula called ardeuerauter water créeke runneth south southeast part little thing halfe mile vp land créeke hemmeth peninsula dooth seeme greater mouth west creeke peninsula vnto saint iustes creeke foure mile like maner saint iustes pill créeke signifie one thing saint mawes creeke mile halfes iustus mawes point betwéene called pendinas créeke saint mawes goeth vp two mile east northeast land beside ebbeth floweth farre mill driuen fresh créeke resorteth halfe mile head downeward hauen créeke maner poole whereon mill also grindeth tide mile beneath south side entereth créeke halfe mile countrie barred maine sea small sandie banke another mile yet lower little créekelet euer créekes doo run certeine bankes belong fala meruellouslie well woodded hitherto leland whose word dare alter feare corruption alteration iudgement past falmouth hauen therefore quarter mile beyond arwennach maister killegrewes place standeth brimme shore within falmouth came little hauen ran vp betwéene two hilles barred wherefore could learne whether serued anie backe fresh water thence went polwitherall creekepolwitherall polpenrith parted two armes polpenrith wherevnto riueret falleth riseth farre thence goeth maine streame pengwenian point hence sailed loo mouthloo call lopoole narrower fall sea betwéene sea hailston riseth aboue sethians comming downe wendron hasteth hailston helston whence onelie called loo betwéene helston head men call commonlie cohor riuer leland saith thus lopoole two mile length betwixt maine ocean barre sand thrée foure yéeres weight fresh water working sea breaketh time maketh wonderfull radnor shire méeteth come newton powisie otherwise called trenewith find british language come trenewith cannot eschue right honorable giue one note waie touching originall ladie bedfellowes ancestrie came hence surnamed newton onelie grandfather sir iohn newton either dwelled borne otherwise right name caradoc doo corruptlie write cradocke respecting rather shortnesse pronuntiation true orthographie writing word certes caradockes haue béene yet linage great honor antiquitie seruice land also sometime belonged part noble gonnoanies summersetshire order descended newton good sooth cannot tell procéed riuer past newton runneth foorth landilouarne foorth till come fall mule whose head edge radnor alsomule thereto passage kerie lanmereiwtjc also procéedeth till meet kenletlenlet camaletcamalet taketh also tatetate tadbrooke water rising hilles mile bishop towne whole course thereof seauen mile head haue often heard also find two description whereof one borrow leland saith pretie brooke running vale mountgomerie comming within halfe mile place chirbirie priorie stood falleth sauerne mile thence rilles saith run hilles thorough mountgomerie mile sauerne shorelan idlos likewise lan idlos brooke méeteth withall within foure mile head speake thinke sufficient touch estimation onelie leauing rest maie hereafter deale thing particularlie time trauell maie reueale truth hitherto leland whose word dare alter another noteth camalet kenlet run liddiom sned churchstocke chirbirie walcote winsbirie sauerne hence confluence goeth fordon leighton landbreuie toward meluerleie méeteth sundrie water one chanelltanet peuereie murnewie whereof one called tanet verie pretie water whereinto peuereie murneweie doth fall descendeth hilles west matrafall farre lhan filin auerneieauernie ioining beneath abertannoth aboue lannamonach neere vnto ditch offamordant long yer méet mordant brooke loose name soone ioine mix water head mordant issueth lanuerdan hilles diuerse saie parish church crosse oswald oswester sometimes stood certes oswester thirtéene mile northwest shrewesburie conteineth mile within walles hath like sort foure suburb great stréetes one called stratlan another wuliho third beterich wherein one hundred fortie barn standing row belonging citizen burgess fourth named blackegate stréet thirtie barn mainteined corne haie also brooke running thorough towne crosse comming simon well bow shoote without wallsimons becke going vnder betweene thorowgate newgate running vnder blacke gate another ouer whose course baderikes bederich gate standeth therefore called bederich brookebederich third passeth willigate newgate fall togither crosse brooke mile lower south mordant runneth said oswester hence also goeth mordant towne betwéene uske ouerthrowne rage riuer six twentith yeare king henrie eight vpon saint hughes daie great snow yer come receiueth birthin right hand pretie water descending two head whereof first northwest manihilot lanihangle pentmorell next vnto ioineth elwie aboue lanbadockeelwie whose head east penclase running westward penclase lanislen langowen beneath landewie taking brooket ragland castell commeth downe thither ragland parke bendeth southwest vntill come uske crinkling towards south going lanhowell méeteth three rilles come marthenie chappell whereof first lieth right hand left midlemost falling farre lantressen haue béene informed mouth romeneie mouth taffe two mile certes taffe greatest riuer glamorganshire called ptolomie rhatostathybius gesse citie taffe selfe good countenance sith indued cathedrall see bishop course water like maner verie swift bringeth log body trées withall wooddie hilles doo seldome cruth bridge peeces much made timber repaired lighter cost wheras hard stone countrie would hardlie able amend riseth brechnockshire among woodie hilles two head whereof one monuchdenie west mounteine first called taffe vaure goeth capell lan vehan uainor morlais capell nantie ioining southwest beneath morlais castle go martyr tiduill toward lannabor waie taketh northwest brooke called cunnon commeth brechnockshire abardare afterward rodneie comming quarter shire runneth estridinodoch crotched brooke therefore diuided rodneie vaure rodneie vehan ioined taffe doth run withall eglefilian castle coch whitchurch landaffe cardiffe sea far pennarth point also laie dooth bid welcome vnto chanell streame furthermore marthellie hasteth kemmeis yer come caerleon chester south taketh two water right hand first commeth downe north betweene landgwie landgweth lhan henoch without anie increase beautifull streame called auon thus described find among pamphletsauon auon riseth hilles séeme part monemouth brechenocke shire sunder rill receiued blorench hill northside running downe thence capell newith triuethin receiueth water south almost equall course quarter countrie processe time anotehr little one side yer come lanurgwaie lanihangle whence goeth euennocke penrose uske go caerleon must note course streame ioining beneath quenocke chappell descendeth said hilles foure mile aboue landgwaie langweth dooth make iland aboue caerleon penrose standeth much romane coine found sort influence one séemeth draine deuised man kéepe citie violence water otherwise would oft annoie past caerleon runneth crindie maister harbert dwelleth carieng another brooke withall riseth north tomberlow hill descendeth henlis bettus chappell runneth forth newport welch castle newith thence vnder bridge thrée foure mile course sea taking ebowith water withallebowith méeteth almost verie mouth fall riseth edge brecknoch shire leland saith high winceland two head one called eberith uehan eberith mawr haue beene informed course first head blamgrent confluence passe togither lanhileth comming west tomberlow hill crossing rill north east waie taketh thereabout serowieserowie runneth trestrent lesse race hitherto ebowith quarter confluence goeth risleie rocheston castell next thorough parke greenefield castell long yer fall sea last issue doo find countie beareth name monemouth old time part region silures romeneie orromeneie corruptlie call nonneie goodlie water head march betwéene monemouth glamorgan shire head hereof aboue egglins tider vap hoell otherwise called fanum theodori church theodorus whence commeth manie spring taking one bottome water called canoch romeneie till come romeneie receiueth water east side west diuerse small beckes whereof three one called ifra betwéene rising brathetere chappell fourth cōmeth capell gledis kethligaire first betwéene faldraie lanuabor sixt seuenth come bedwas eight ouer bedwas selfe chappell martin cairfillie castell thauan confluence runneth maghan keuen mableie romeneie yer long crossing becke north west commeth aboue lisuan lamssen roch falleth sea six mile wishe albeit mouth therof nothing profitable ship yet also march betwéene silures glamorganshire laie falleth sea mile almost taffelaie riseth hilles aboue lantrissent region verie hillie whence comming lantrissent auercastell runneth coit marchan parke lambedder bride lhannihangle saint fagans elaie hilles side men often enter walke large space brooke selfe one plentifull commodious found wale along side also uendraith uaur shall find great plentie seacoles great hole head uendraith uehan men vse betwéene rill call also cultlell saie knife hereof riseth merrie tale welshman lieng place abroad night cold weather peraduenture verie well occupied demanded hostesse breake fast next morrow inne laie night precedent bicause came soone hir house yer anie hir maid vp oh good hostesse quoth contented laie night dangerous estate slept betweene two sword long knife heart meaning indéed laie betwéene two riuers brest towards south neere head cultlell passe ouer iests leland speaketh riuer called gwiliegwilie riseth falleth maketh certeine report wherefore requisit proceed according toward southwest full halfe great scalmeie elsewhere described betwéene willocke point also scalmeie directlie west midland ilemidland ile full great gateholmegresholme two rock lie north south scalmeie one called yardland stone mewstone shall greatlie requisit stand discourse sith may hardlie taken ilands euen like sort may iudge bride ile southwest calthrop rode likewise gresholme whereof find short description gresholme lieth directlie west scalmeie whence saile thither south side must néeds passe mewstone rocke north scalmeie must leaue yarland stone left hand wherto note well situation ilands alreadie named confer ramseie dauids land shall find produce two dangerous point including brid baie wherein notwithstanding greatnesse 1000 peril fresh brooke deale withall finallie hauing doubled willocke point thought good altogether leaue baie vnsearched lestwise sée ilands might found long entred beheld one men countrie call bride ilands bride iland verie little place situate néere land came galtroie rode thence went little hauen doluach hauen caruaie hauen shirelace rocke carnbuddie earnaie bay portelais found betwéene ramseie point sound likewise little ile almost annexed maine middest thereof meane sound rocke called horsse mile north ribbie rocke lieth south east ramseie infortunate ten seians colt thanked god neuer came backea fort dangerous rock lieng row vpon west end southwales called bishop clerkes thence passing stephans whitesand bay saluted bishop clerk went procession left side loth take anie salted holie water hand came last point called dauids head ptolomie calleth octapitanum promontorium except deceiued gentle reader giue leaue staie insert word leland touching land called dewies dauids land whereof men may peraduenture haue vse word therefore past hauen point demetia casting coast come dewies dauids land dewie dauid • one ptolomie calleth octapitanum promontorium read separated rest countrie much maner although grant may diuerse little creekes betwixt newgale dauids head betwixt dauids fischard beside héere mentioned register house turne therefore milford dauids land beginneth newgale créeke serued backe fresh water howbeit baie creeke betwixt milford hence foure mile saluach creeke otherwise called sauerachsaluach whither fresh water resorteth mouth also thereof good rescue balingers meane register saith thence go dauids land besides also leland third booke talketh lhinnes pooles asmuch purpose speake lake lhinnes passe ouer hasting teifie latine tibius ptolomie tuerobius tiuirobius next riuer serueth purpose yet forgetting touch gwerne came saint dauids head coasted along toward southeast till wée came ouer saint catharins going northward bread hauen strombles head sailed thence northeast north langlas head flat south cow calfe two cruell rockes left left hand coasted ouer abergwin fischardgwerne found fresh water named guin gwerne whose course maner directlie east west uremie hils pont uaunt lanichair vntill come within mile foresaid towne riseth flat north perselie hill whence goeth pont vaine lauerillidoch lanchar landilouair abergwine abergwerne read abergwine cast dinas head till come fall neuerneneuerne newport standeth head riuer aboue capell nantgwin whence runneth whitchurch yer come kilgwin taketh little water riseth short wrenie vaure thence go foorth one vntill come newport cardigan hauen next fall stumble wherein lieth litle iland ouer north point hereinto also commeth teifieteifie tine noble riuer riseth lintinie fraught delicate samons herein else riuers britaine castor beuer found procéed verie hed thereof saie foure mile aboue stradflore luitie hath run thence little space receiueth brooke southeast commeth lin legnant confluence runneth stradflore abbeie forth penlooke cardigon shire wherevnto hath become march euer sithence came kellam confluence matherne come cardigon shire hauing passed cardigon point iland denomination lieng west thereof came vnto fall airon thrée mile beneath lancleereairon riseth mounteines chappell called blam peniall belonging landwie breuie thrée foure mile tiue bank runneth lamberwooddie langitho tregrigaron hill henuenneiearth arth next fall great thing neither anie long course yet somewhat crotched riseth three foure mile within land slopewise comming lambaderne treueglois falleth sea northeast aberarth past arth hauing staied bicause found harborough came next vnto wereie riseth two headsris aliàs wereie aboue whose confluence standeth towne named lanihangle redrod whence goeth lanigruthen laristed ocean went ystwith riseth blacke mounteins aboue comerstwith whence runneth certeine milesistwith vntill come vnto ispittie istwith lananon laniler lan nachairne sea taking withall first meleuen ridall redholl farre shoreredholl whereof haue description ridall riseth top plimlimmon hill lake named lin ridall whence going toward spittie kinwen crosseth one water north another beneth southeast goeth lanbeder vaure till come aberistwith istwith ocean hauing thus viewed istwith taken selues againe sea crossed salke salique brookesalique whereof find memoriall salique brooke descendeth like sort blacke mounteins going ummaboue toward gogarth gogirthar receiueth massaliquemassalique thence goeth sea southwest originall hence went lerie indraught great quantitielerie neither commodious gesse yet may deceiued anie ship harborough riseth toward lower ground blacke hils going lanthangle castell gwalter runneth thence northeast ocean receiuing rill waie hilles lie northeast course stand vpon trifle thus haue brought selfe caerdigan shire vnto wiewie limit betwéene merioneth certeine space entred mouth thereof gat vp head minding description come downeward rest doo good manner time want information possible performed ariseth south part snowdonie goeth foorth right lammothwie mowdhewie mathan laith comming downe dinas mathew receiueth two rilles northwest third comming mailroid called cludoch northeast holdeth crossing angell water west boundeth mongomerie shire partromis till come romis beneath water taketh towin passeth lambrin mawr talgarth goeth mathrauerue crossing another north foorth lanworing méeteth kerig one side gwidall commeth dorowen maine riuer goeth pengo beneath taketh influence southeast called dulas another northwest thence hasteth magenillet machenlet first crossing leuennie southeast secondlie peniall northwest thirdlie einon fourthlie kinar fiftlie cleidor thrée last rehearsed falling southeast last hauing course langwinhelin sea mine instruction vpholdeth séemeth men iudgements part northwales westwales sunder latine hight deuus welsh british dift dewie whereof latine doth séeme fetch sound procéed rest falles water found countie going therfore northwestward come fall frō north called towen merionneth mouth difonnie streame pretie riuer rising hilles aboue lanihangle west castell traherne receiueth ridrijc commeth chadridrtjc hill tallillin castell treherie difonnie southeast fetching course lanegrin sea within fiue mile thereof past cast sarnabigh point till came lingouen becke barre faire water therefore worthie diligence described yet called bar head rather moth derie two chiefe head called riuer descendeth six mile west lin dée hath issue betwéene raran vaure hilles situat haue ioining two heds barre name originall receiueth rill northeast called cain another beneath comming beurose wood holdeth towards south betweene laniltid kemmor abbaie till meet little west dolgelth auon vaure comming also woodland soile taking rill gwannas hasteth northwestward dolgelth ioine barre met receiue kessilgunt hirgun course foure fiue mile falleth sea hauing watered verie hart inward part shire hence crosse skethie runneth corsogdale lanthwie aliàs lanthonie lambader receiuing artro aboue lambader doth fall sea southeast point flat south landango towne situat side turning passed aberho named riuer hoho falleth sea commeth thither alpes hils snowdonie mounteins lesse fertile grasse wood cattell fish foule famous alpes beyond sea whereof writer doo make honorable report hence sailed abermawr mouth mawrmawr commeth like sort snowdonie taketh diuerse riuers whose name doo knowartro vnto artro brooke whose head commeth north east course receiueth gedar north side holdeth till fall sea windlesses maketh passeth come traith vehan fall drurid pretie riuer comming march caernaruonshire passing festimog soone taketh cunwell uelenrid holdeth deckoin falleth said traith two rilles lie south hereof haue issue also make small accompt bicause quantitie great next vnto haue traith mawr whereinto farles hath issuefarles riuer proceeding snowdonie snowdon hils descending bethkelerke lanwrothen without mixture anie water course passage parcell march also betwéene merioneth caernaruon shire traith mawr passe krekith come another water descending north lanstidwie moie whose mouthes néere togither halfe mile land dooth seeme kéepe sunder come vnto erkeerke pretie brooke descending madrtjn hils whose mouth two lesse quantitie selfe doo séeme haue confluence whose course doo come along west northwest southerlie called girch hellie except memorie doo faile casting toward south coast lieth saw abersoch mouth soch riuer vpon right handsoch mouth whereof farre south thereof lie two ilands northerlie called tudfall penrtjn leland obserue would set downe british name townes village water passe writing want language hard choose rather shew falles rising corrupt denomination writing yet vse word englishman doo giue vnto often british name easie found sounded going point leauing gwelin ile right hand come daron riuerdaron wherevpon standeth aberdaron quarter mile shore betwixt streicts streame called menaie betweene angleseie maine méeting first gornaie commeth snowdonie treuennian lake passeth lanunda sea menaie streame south crocke next meet saint commeth lin lanbereie mirith horsse brooke two mile moilethon riseth well called full mile thence moilethon bowe shot aberpowle whence ferrie botes go termone angleseie aberpowle runneth thrée mile landconte hath head much sooner past twolune came notable riuer called lune loine booke statute hath lonwire anno 13 ric 2 cap 19 giueth name lancaster lonecaster lunecaster much romane monie found diuerse stamp whose course dooth rest described followeth whereof haue two description first set downe leland master moore catharine hall cambridge deliuered vnto next exhibit giuen vnto one hath taken paine saith search view verie latelie speake lune saith master moore commonlie called loine riseth crosseho dent dale edge richmondshire thrée head north also dent dale garsdale vplandish towne wherein séene manie time great store red déere come downe feed mounteins vallies thereby runneth water afterward commeth sebbar vale likewise brooke méeting garsdale water little lower go one dent dale becke riuer afterward called lune lane haue verie often noted beside water also mentioned receiueth foot sebbar vale great brooke commeth worth betwéene westmerland richmondshire taking aforesaid chanels dooth run seauen mile yer come dent dale foot hence entreth lansdale corruptlie called peraduenture lunesdale runneth therein eight nine mile southward dale kirbie hitherto master moore leland hath exemplified parcell letter mine note writeth hereof mannerburdecke burbecke water riseth wustall head west going wustall foot skalegbreder admitteth breder descendeth thither breder dale hence burbecke goeth breder dale aboue new parke maketh gate aughton laughton skirton lancaster excliffe awcliffe soddaie orton sea thus haue description lune make conference election pleasure sworne neither next fall called dockerdocker peraduenture leland dooth call keriekerie farre wharton rich kitson borne riseth north docker towne going barwtjc hall increased come sea falleth lune water lunesands next come bitham becke riseth far bitham towne parke hilles great number goates kept mainteined likelihood resorteth end linsands past find forked arme sea called kensands first diuerse water doo run one chanell foure principall head one comming grarrig hall another frō west whinfield ioining first east side skelmere parke third called sprot sprota riseth sloddalesprota commeth downe west skelmer parke two brooke haue aforesaid parke betwéene fall fourth east barneside verie farre sunder fourth last called ken commeth kentmers sideken ken moore poole mile compasse verie well stored fish head whereof baronie kendall westmerland going stauelope taketh rill chappleton inge leauing colnehead parke east passeth barneside kendall helston sigath siggeswijc leuenbridge milnethorpe sea certes ken pretie déepe gesseth name brooke rather cole coruecorue iudgement coniecture verie likelie life oswijn otherwise féeble authoritie word colbridge alwaies vsed corbridge whereof thought good leaue short aduertisement countrie also thrée vale dale whereof men haue doubted whether théeues true men doo abound saie riddesdale tuidale liddesdale last part scotish without march england neuerthelesse sithens diligence cheefelie maister gilpin finallie learned preacher grace god working haue béene called obedience zeale vnto word found haue well profited present former sauage demeanour verie much thereof passeth west akeland helen akeland andrewes akeland bishop akeland goeth newfield willington neere vnto place also somewhat beneath sunderland crosseth one brooke southest het croxseie moonke weremouth monasterie sometime standing wherein beda read wrote manie bookes world appeareth mouth eight mile durham six newcastell thus passed entered bishoprijc yer come mouth almost two mile ouer passing rill runneth castell eden hardwijc likewise hartlepoole towne lieth ouer sea maner byland peninsula meet prettie fall groweth riuer increased two water whereof one riseth northwest moretons goeth stotfeld claxton dawlton going breerton owtham grettam finallie ioining within two mile sea make prettie portlet know securitie thesethesis riuer beareth féedeth excellent samon riseth langleie forest betwéene rabie castell standorpe whose name haue knowledge procéed past ramforth runneth betwéene persore cliffe waie croffs bridge taketh skerne pretie water riseth trimdonskerne goeth fishburne bradburie preston braforton skirmingham burdons haughton darlington finallie meeting cocke becke dare falleth beneath stapleton come croffs bridge séeme leland calleth gretteie grettie thorpe riseth sundrie headsthorpe aliàs leuand wereof one aboue pinching thorpe whence goeth nonnethorpe stokesleie second hath two branch placed kildale standeth betweene finallie méeting beneath abie leland aber gesseth hath denomination higher confluence trent ouze beside leland sundrie ancient writer haue noted v certes noble arme sea although properlie called ouze ocellus euen nuke beneath ancolme yet contented call humber humbrus umar king scithians inuaded ile time locrinus thinking make himselfe monarch god hath time time singularlie prouided benefit britaine businesse came passe past stanton saith goeth burghleie uffington tallington maxeie déeping east deeping comming waldram hall brancheth two armes whereof goeth singlesole receiueth nene cambridgeshire going dowesdale thence goeth wickham sea taking withall right hand sundrie dreanes thus farre next past come another fall water wash descendeth directlie whaplade dreane whaplade towne holland bicause water small importance passe thence hasting nene noble riuer middest thereof place certeine swallow déepe cold middest summer man dare diue bottome thereof coldnesse yet winter neuer found haue béene touched frost much lesse couered ise next therefore described auonauon otherwise called nenenene said author describeth maner nene beginneth foure mile aboue northampton nene méere riseth two head ioine northampton riuer citie countrie beareth name although pronounce hampton auondune errour committed also south auondune may easilie see another place leland describeth said riuer maner auon riseth nene méere field going oundale peterborow diuideth selfe thrée armes whereof one goeth horneie another wisbech third ramseie afterward vnited againe fall sea verie farre lin finallie descent water leaue great sort ilands wherof elie crowland merfland chiefe hitherto leland howbeit neither description touch course riuer full set downe third shall supplie whatsoeuer doo want auon therefore arising nenemere field increased manie rilles come northhampton one aboue king thorpe whence goeth dallington northhampton receiueth wedon staievedunus till haue described riuer wedon therefore riseth turueie till come length bedford manie windlesses méeteth another streame increased manie water inforced make imagined staie also view seuerall course supposing selfe looke downe highest steeple bedford whence best meane view anie countrie wheresoeuer note followeth certes east side began speculation saw one came potton met withall néere becliswade another grew two water wherof one descended baldocke hitchin ioined beneth arleseie thence went langford edworth third beheld like sort two head wherof one farre wood endthese rise far michelborow one higham parke wooburne howburne ioining flitwijc go flitton receiue antill brooke chiphill chicksand come shafford whence taking aforsaid langford water go foorth becliswade sandie blumham neere vnto themisford vnited ouze purpose againe ouze goeth berkeford winteringham méeting wareslie becke runneth neotes saint nedes verus old time goluesburg capgraue saith vita neoti paxston offordesstoueus godmanchester old time called gumicester séeme hath béene towne farre greater countenance present ruines thereof much romane coine found sometimes image c antius hath long haire roman receiued barbars citie therevnto bone diuerse men farre greater stature credible spoken day stand vpon thing hence therfore water goeth huntingdonstoueus wilton saint iues holiwell erith receiueth meane time stow néere vnto little paxton likewise ellen emmerhelenus elmerus one chanell little west huntingdon finallie maine streame spreading abroad fennes cannot tell manie branch neither manie ilets inforced although iles marshland ancarig ancarie chiefe later called crowland crowland also hight thornie cruda terra store bush saith hugo le blanc sometime growing ancartjc sundrie ancres haue liued borne great swaie therein howsoeuer case standeth certeine hath thus delited selfe ranging pleasant bottom lower ground méeteth granta whence goeth swift course vnto downeham betwéene also auon sundrie large meeres plash southwest peterborow full powts carpes whereof whittleseie méere ramseie méere whereinto riuall fallethriuelus commeth aboue broughton wiston great riuelleie said greatest riuers run streame called granta whereof whole countie old time called grantabrycshiregranta appéereth register henrie prior canturburie noble excellent describe euen place notwithstanding earst appointed vnto second booke somuch description ouze granta deliuered togither sake gaue separate sunder verie furthest head originall riuer henham large parke belonging earle sussex wherein townesmen saie foure spring run foure sundrie way maine sea leland sought course water aboue newport pond therefore commentary vpon song swan writeth thereof maner insuing although doctor iohn caius learned physician opinion riuer comming newport properlie called rhée may easilie dissent leland whose iudgement mind great deale likelie harken therefore saith head grantha granta pond newport towne east saxon going bottome beside receiueth pretie rill middest thereof dooth driue mill descendeth wickin bonhant standeth farre thence past newport goeth alongst lower ground vntill come broke walden west chipping walden saffron walden hard lord awdleis place right honorable thomas howard houshold doo soiourne sometime stood abbeie benedictine moonks generall suppression awdleie end goeth littleburie lesse greater chesterfords yealdune hincstone maner experience pretie water beginneth néere vnto gwinbach winbeche church essexgwin pant towne old yet belonging fitzwaters taking name gwin beautifull faire ba • signifieth wood without cause sith onelie hilles ech side said rillet whole paroch hath sometime abounded wood manner vtterlie decaied like commoditie euerie onelie thorough excessiue building pleasure profit contrarie ancient end building also increase pasture commoditie lord soile sale emolument whereby poore tenant inforced buie fewell yet haue rent triple maner inhanced said brooke runneth directlie thence vnto radwinter parcell lordship possession part descended chamberleins sometime chéefe owner waie also increased sundrie pretie spring pantwell chéefe whereof thinke whole brooke named pant saie truth hath manie leasing fathered certes report common fame hath béene pretie water quantitie botes haue come time past bilie abbeie beside maldon vnto moore radwinter corne haue heard also anchor found neere red willow watercourse act parlement wers surueied reformed throughout england maketh little aforesaid relation strangest lord sometime winbech surnamed great eater would breake fast whole calfe find bone therein fable goeth falling contention lord iohn radwinter could worke none iniurie stopping vp head pantwell put vse mill stood church radwinter serued brooke abundantlie certes know place mill stood lord radwinter holding parcell manour radwinter hall fitzwaters sonne hold stirrop certeine time demand shewing himselfe therefore prest time doo said seruice fitzwater readie lift leg ouer saddle putting backe foot gaue thrust fell backward brake necke wherevpon insued great trouble till matter taken vp publike authoritie seruile office conuerted pound pepper truelie paid daie leaue arme finish vp course doo voiage also coast england thus haue finished description riuers streames fall ocean according purpose although precise order manner handling might information promised accordinglie performed others would taken like hand saie done solueie west parteth england scotland side twede separateth said kingdom east go backeward contrarie course description shall find exact beside verie byriuers shall need vse anie aduise finding falles aforesaid streames hath beene helpe maister sackfords cardes conference men dare pronounce perfect exact furthermore haue also remember course streames regard much name verie towne church limit paroch therefore saie goeth towne thinke dutie discharged hit vpon anie part parcell paroch also hath little troubled meane euill writing name manie townes village haue noted one man description riuer write one towne two thrée manner way whereby inforced choose one aduenture commonlie séemed likeliest sound mine opinion iudgement finallie whereas minded set downe especiall chapter port créeks lieng ech coast english part ile prouided wise iudged conuenient came passe greater part labour taken stealth therefore discouraged meddle argument would haue giuen ouer set downe anie thing therefore much rather sée may prooue spurre vnto mischéefe thing come passe day neuerthelesse little thereof passed beginning booke set downe parcell thereof remaineth leauing supplie rest either selfe hereafter may come better performe port creek seafaringmen doo note benefit vpon coast england chap 17 maie haue former chapter omitted sundrie hauens found vpon shore england serued backe water want sound sufficient information haue written vnto recompense whereof haue thought good adde chapter port creekes whereby farre possible shall make satisfaction mine ouersights albeit cannot much abused haue béerest note behalfe bring purpose passe whole coast england round berwike solue yet let set downe much good hap remaineth ramsgate manie good créekes also sandwich douer hide reasonable port although none best sussex haue smalade créekes adioining samesussex ridon appledoure rie good hauen winchelseie nothing inferiour manie shire onelie left vnto time wherefore force must abruptlie leaue deale anie rest whose knowledge right sure would haue beene profftable hoped haue reaped great thankes hand seafaringmen haue vse hereof desunt caetera aire soile commodity iland cap 18 aire part throughout iland suchthe aire britaine reason maner continuall cloud reputed grosse nothing pleasant maine howbeit affirme thing haue onelie respect impediment hinderance sunne beames interposition cloud oft ingrossed aire experience teacheth v lesse pure wholesome commodious country caesar himselfe hereto addeth much temperate summer galles aduentured hither neither anie thing found aire region vsuallie seene amongst nation lieng beyond sea wherefore must néeds confesse situation iland benefit heauens nothing inferiour anie countrie maine euer lie vnder open firmament plutarch knew full well affirmeth part elistan field found britaine iles situate ocean soile britaine suchthe soile testimony report old new writer experience also inhabit verie fruitfull deed bringeth foorth manie commodity whereof country haue néed yet selfe fond nicenesse abolished néedlesse dailie brought place neuerthelesse inclined féeding grasing profitable tillage bearing corne reason whereof countrie woonderfullie replenished neat kind cattell store also euerie place fourth part land scarselie manured prouision maintenance graine certes fruitfulnesse vnknowne vnto briton long caesar time cause wherefore predecessor liuing day maner neglected tillage liued féeding grasing onelie grasiers themselues also dwelled mooueable village company whose custome diuide ground amongst one depart place lot laie thing much like irish criacht till eating vp countrie himcriacht inforced remooue séeke better pasture british custome learne first hath béene commonlie reported ground wale neither fruitfull england neither soile scotland bountifull wale true corne part otherwise good ground part wale england albeit best scotland scarselie comparable meane either howbeit bountie scotish dooth faile respect dooth surmount god nature hauing appointed country yéeld foorth like commodity ground good would wish haue néed sufficient helpe cherish ground withall make fruitfull beside compest carried husbandman yard ditch pond doouehouses city great townes haue v kind white marle great force cast ouer péece land thrée score year shall need anie compesting hereof also dooth plinie speakemarle lib 17 cap 6 7 8 affirmeth marle indureth vpon earth space fourescore yeares insomuch laid vpon man life whereby owner shall need trauell twise procuring commend better soile calleth marga making diuerse kind thereof finallie commendeth france aboue lieth sometime hundred foot déepe farre better scattering chalke vpon hedui pictones time day also doo practise albeit diuerse doo like better cast lime long indure haue heard reported also iland great plentie fresh riuers streamesplentie riuers haue heard alreadie throughlie fraught kind delicate fish accustomed found riuers whole ile likewise verie full hilleshilles though verie manie exceeding heigth diuerse extending themselues verie far beginning may see shooter hill rising east london farre thames runneth along south side iland westward vntill come cornewall like vnto also crowdon hils though vnder diuers name also peke doo run border scotland speake cheniot hilles reach twentie mile length blacke mounteines wale go fromhere lack tohere lack mile least length cle hilles shropshire come within foure mile ludlow diuided part worcester teme grames scotland chiltren eightéene mile least one end reach henlie oxfordshire dunstable bedfordshire verie well replenished wood corne notwithstanding part yéeld sweet short grasse profitable shéepe wherein albeit scotland doo somewhat come behind v yet outward defect inwardlie recompensed onelie plentie quarry sundrie kind marble hard stone fine alabaster also rich mine mettall shall shewed hereafter iland likewise wind commonlie strong fiercewinds anie place maine cardane also espied often séene vpon naked hilles garded trées beare kéepe grieuous inconuenience also inforceth nobilitiebuilding gentrie communaltle build house vallies leauing high ground vnto corne cattell least cold stormie blast winter bréed greater annoiance whereas region one desireth set house aloft hill onlie seene farre cast forth beames statelie curious workemanship euerie quarter countrie also hot habitation coldnesse sake aire sith heat neuer vehement hill top vallie reuerberation sunne beames either reacheth farre highest else becommeth strong reflected vpon lower soile leaue building vnto purposed place notwithstanding haue verie much increasedhusbandrie amended meane curiositie cost england wale scotland within yeares returne soile againe certeinelie euen day growne much fruitfull hath béene time past cause countriemen growne painefull skilfull carefull recompense gaine heretofore haue béene insomuch synchroni time fellow reape present great commoditie little roome whereas late yeares great compasse hath yéelded small profit onelie idle negligent occupation dailie manured occupieng might set downe example thing part iland saie manie england scotland wale two last rehearsed verie little food liuelihood woont looked beside flesh soile selfe cow gaue people meane time liuing idelie dissolutelie picking stealing one another vice part relinquished nation manureth hir owne triple commoditie time pasture iland according nature bountie soilepasture whereby place plentifull verie fine batable either fatteth cattell speed yéeldeth great abundance milke creame whereof yellowest butter finest chéese made blue claie aboundeth hardlie drinketh vp winter water long season grasse spearie rough verie apt bush occasion commeth nothing profitable vnto owner best pasture ground england wale pasture wale cardigan cheefe speake found mounteines hundred part grasse growing eaten suffered rot ground whereby soile becommeth matted diuerse bogges quicke moore made withall long continuance cattell countrie able eat downe accompted good soile man may laie wand ouer night morrow find hidden ouergrowen grasse hard find plentie thereof manie place land neuertheles fruitfulnes aforsaid countie farre surmounteth proportion whereby may compared batablenesse italie time called paradise world although reason wickednesse dwell therein may called sinke draine hell whereas woont saie v land good people euill onlie speake whereas know experience soile italie noble soile dweller therein farre anie vertue goodnesse medowesmedowes either bottomes whereof haue great store verie large bicause soile hillie else call land mead borowed best fattest pasturage first yearelie often ouerflowen rising streames passe violent falles landwaters descend hils seldome neuer ouerflowen cause wherefore grasse shorter bottomes yet farre fine wholesome batable sith haie low medowes onelie full sandie cinder breedeth sundrie disease cattell also rowtie foggie full flag therefore profitable stouer forrage higher mead difference furthermore commodity great whereas land meadowes haue often aboue one good load haie peraduenture little acre ground vse word carrucata carruca waine load remember vsed plinie lib 33 cap 11 low meadowes haue sometimes thrée commonlie two vpward experience hath oft confirmed twise mowed speake sith later math wholsome cattell first although mouth pleasant time thereby become oftentimes rotten increase fast bloud garget disease doo consume manie owner séeke remedie phlebotomie otherwise superstitious fooles suppose die garget ridden night mare therefore hang vp stone naturallie haue hole must found vnlooked stone apt cockeshot diuell run solace himselfe withall whilest cattell go scotfree molested set downe halfe toy superstition hath brought husbandman head behalfes would aske greater volume conuenient purpose wherefore shall suffice haue said thus much thing yéeld corneground also much rate folowingcorne land please make estimat thereof acre meane indifferent yeares wherein acre rie wheat well tilled dressed yeeld commonlie sixtéene twentie bushel acre barlie six thirtie bushel otes like foure fiue quarter proportion notwithstanding oft abated toward north oftentimes surmounted south mixed corne peason beanes sowen togither tare otes call bulmong rie wheat named miscelin place speake yet yéeld neuerthelesse much proportion haue often marked yet great foison comparable hoter country maine euer read increase eldred danu writeth de imperio iudaeorum aethiopia surmounteth saith field néere sabbatike riuer called old time gosan ground fertile euerie graine barleie growing dooth yéeld hundred kernel least vnto owner late yeares also haue found taken vp great trade planting hop whereof moorie hitherto vnprofitable ground doo yeeld plentie increase farmer occupier countrie haue garden hop growing owne farre better doo come flanders vnto v certes corruption vsed fleming forgerie dailie practised kind ware gaue v occasion plant home may spare send manie ouer vnto know experience one man conuersion moorie ground hopyards wherof commoditie dooth raise yearelie little twelue acre compasse two hundred markes charge borne toward maintenance familie industrie god continue though secret fréends fleming let exclaime commoditie spoile wood reason pole neuerthelesse three yeares doo also come fire spare fewell cattell breed commonlie suchcattell greatnesse bone swéetnesse flesh benefit reaped giue place vnto none may appeare first ox whose largenesse height weight tallow hide horne none anie nation doo commonlie may easilie excéed shéepe likewise good tast flesh quantitie lims finesse fléece caused hardnesse pasturage abundance increase manie place bring foorth two thrée eaning giue place vnto anie doo goates like sort doo follow order déere come behind cony haue séene fat soiles especiallie meall disnegemeall disnege grease one weighed hath peised verie néere six seuen ounce benefit first refer grace goodnesse god next vnto bountie soile hath indued notable commodious fruitfulnesse meane intreat thing largelie hereafter touch place one benefit nation wantethwine wine fault whereof soile negligence countriemen especiallie south partes doo inure commoditie reason long discontinuance become vnapt beare anie grape almost pleasure shadow much lesse plaine field seuerall vineyard aduantage commoditie yet late time haue assaied deale wine lordship also right well knowen sith liquor commeth drinking hath bin found hard brought beyond sea cost planting keeping thereof chargeable may buie far better cheape country haue giuen ouer enterprise without anie consideration thing neither ground selfe beginning successe trauell answer expectation first vntill time soile brought acquaintance commoditie prouision may made easinesse charge imploied vpon true wine dooth last indure well grow worse muse little wherefore planting vine neglected england liquor might haue growne iland heretofore first charter probus emperour gaue equallie v galles spaniard one sufficient testimonie grow ile de vignes good record appéereth bishop yearelie thrée foure tunne least giuen nomine decimae beside whatsoeuer ouersumme liquor accrue lease excheats whereof also haue seene mention wherefore conuinceth vpholders thereof euen rhenish wine time hath béene also wadwad wherwith countrie men died face caesar saith might seeme terrible enimies field also woman daughter law staine body go naked saie great number lawes doo bréed generall negligence contempt good order bicause haue manie subiect liue without transgression often alteration ordinance dooth much harme respect aristotle doth séeme idlenesse following warres requisit speake sundrie kind moold cledgie claie whereof diuerse sort red blue blacke white also red white sandie lomieearths rosellie grauellie chalkie blacke could saie manie diuerse veines britaine else anie quarter like quantitie world howbeit must néeds confesse sandie cledgie doo beare great swaie claie hath beene yet alwaies séene felt plentie dearth corne latter meane claie doo yeeld hir full increase dooth commonlie drie yeares wheat generall plentie wheras faile haue scarsitie according old rude verse set downe england vnderstood whole iland experience dooth confirme sand dooth serue claie may sing well waie claie dooth serue sand merie england might intreat famous vallies england one called vale white horsseuallies another eouesham
