mind leland also learned abbat cirnecester shewed great likelihood record thereof procéed cirnecester goeth chepingnorton couentrie leircester newarke lincolne ouerthwart watlingstreet generall consent writer except alfred beuerleie extendeth vnto cathnesse scotland said haue end watlingstréet begun said dunwallo finished guthelinewatling stréet whome directlie called gutheline stréet though corrupted watlingstréet beginneth douer kent stretcheth middest kent vnto london foorth peraduenture middest citie vnto verolaminm uerlamcester saint albons yeare grace one thousand fiue hundred thirtie one course thereof found man digged grauell wherwith mend high waie place eighteene foot broad ten foot déepe stoned bottome wise haue noted afore peraduenture also top gone rest remaine equall place leuell field yelow grauell also brought thither cart two thousand yéeres passed remained fresh strong béene digged naturall place grew manie yéeres hence goeth hard margate leauing west side little south place priorie stood long thorough fare vpon said street méetly well builded low housing side procéedeth chronicle barnwell saith caxton huntingdon forward still winding till onelie becommeth bound vnto leicestershire toward lugbie also passeth castleford stamford foorth west marton mile torkeseie waie must touch opinion traueller time noteth said stréet go another waie insomuch would haue crosse third auon betwixt newton dowbridge go binford bridge wibtoft high crosse thence atherston vpon ancre certes may fosse course countrie sort describeth watlingstréet passe atherston cannot yet persuaded neuerthelesse coniecture misliked sith vnlikelie thrée seuerall way might méet alderwaie towne vpon tame beneath salter bridge doo doubt said towne take name three way aldermarie church london thrée mary vnto hath béene dedicated watlingstréet one compasse passage wise permit thus much haue thought good note waie returne againe leland men collection next tidings heare watlingstréet goeth thorough neere parke pomfret common voice also countrie confirmeth thence passeth hastilie ouer castelford bridge aberford fiue mile thence manifest token stréet broad crest great waie togither also yorke witherbie borowbridge left hand thereof stood certeine monument pyramides stone sometimes placed ancient romanes stone saith leland stand eight mile west bowis almost west richmond little thorough fare called maiden castell situate apparantlie vpon side stréet one pyramides great round heapes three score foot compasse bottome also lesse quantity verie top ech sharpe richmond commeth borowbridge catericke eightéene mile twelue leuing six catericke eleuen mile greteie gritto fiue mile bottle eight mile burgh stanes moore foure mile applebie fiue browham said stréet commeth thorough winfoll parke ouer bridge eiemouth loder leauing perith quarter mile west side goeth carleill seuenteene mile browham hath béene notable thing hitherto appeareth euidentlie going hence scotland heare vntill come cathnesse two hundred thirtie mile thereabouts england erming stréet call lelme stretcheth easterming stréet saie southeast meneuia dauids wale vnto southampton whereby somewhat likelie indeed two way meane fosse erming méet cirnecester commeth glocester according opinion conceiued countrie waie find written therefore saie except indeuor driue awaie time alleging men say thereof whose mind doo farre disagrée one another doo truth therefore giue ouer delighting dealing ikenild rikenild began somewhere southikenild held toward cirnecester worcester wicombe brimcham lichfield darbie chesterfield crossing watlingstréet somewhere yorkeshire stretched foorth end vnto mouth tine ended maine sea men doo confesse take called ikenild passed thorough kingdome icenes albeit leland following doo séeme place icenes norffolke suffolke yet mine opinion well doone sith manifest tacitus laie néere vnto silures gesse either stafford worcester shire except coniecture doo faile author booke intituled eulogium historiarum doth call stréet lelme herein deceiued haue dealt withall faithfullie may among diuersitie opinion yet denieng much confusion name course two latter discussing whereof must leaue men better learned speake generallie common high way english part ile rest saie nothing shall vnderstand claie cledgie soile often verie déepe troublesome winter halfe wherfore authoritie parlement order taken yearelie amendment whereby sort common people doo imploie trauell six day summer vpon albeit intent statute verie profitable reparation decaied place yet rich doo cancell portion poore loiter labour six scarcelie two good day work well performed accomplished parish necessarie affaire besides haue land lieng vpon side way doo vtterlie neglect dich scowre draines watercourse better auoidance winter water except may set cut meaning statute whereby stréets doo grow much gulled thereby verie noisome trauell sometimes also verie often day work imploied vpon way lead market market ech surueior amendeth byplots lane séeme best owne commoditie easie passage vnto field pasture whereas place want stone thereby inhabitant driuen seeke farre soiles owner land wherein stone hitherto haue giuen monie haue borne awaie doo reape small commoditie raising excessiue price whereby neighbour driuen grieuous charge another cause wherefore meaning good law verie much defrauded finallie another thing likewise considered trées bush growing stréets side doo little keepe force sunne summer drieng vp lane wherefore order taken bough continuallie kept short bush suffered spread far narrow path inconuenience would also remedied manie slough proue hard ground yet déepe hollow dailie incroching couetous vpon hie way speake know experience wheras stréets within fiue twentie yeares haue béene place fift • foot broad according law whereby traueller might either escape théefe shift mier passe loaden cart without danger himselfe horsse brought vnto twelue twentie six twentie another cause also whereby way worse manie honest man encombred iourneie speake thing whereof doo thinke heare iust redresse error common benefit thereby swéet profitable manie house cotages raised vpon generall constitution body briton chap 20 bred iland men part good complexion tall stature strong bodie white colour thereto great boldnesse courage warres generall comelinesse person testimonie gregorie great time saw english capteins sold rome shall easilie confirme yet dooth differ sundrie shire soiles also proportion member may perceiue betwéene herefordshire essex men cambridge shire londoner one pokington sedberrie latter distinguished nose head commonlie greater place land concerning stomach also nation field haue alwaies beene souereigne admiration among forren prince hath béene estimation souldiers time time since isle hath béene knowne vnto roman wheresoeuer haue serued forren country cheefe brunt seruice haue beene reserued vnto conquest bloudie battels woone france germanie scotland history full haue beene ouercome victorers themselues confessed victory haue béene déerelie bought would gladlie couet ouercome often difficult maner martiall prowesse little difference betwéene englishman scot albeit scot haue beene often verie gréeuouslie ouercome force nation hath béene want manhood part mercie god shewed v iustice vpon sith alwaies haue begun quarels offered v méere iniurie great despite crueltie leland noting somewhat constitution body saith word grounding thinke vpon aristotle writeth dwell neere north courage strength bodie skilfulnesse wisdome briton white colour strong bodie full bloud people inhabiting neere north farre equinoctiall line soile fruitfull therefore people feeble whereas contrariwise dwell toward course sunne lesse stature weaker bodie nice delicate fearefull nature blacker colour blacke déed anie crow rauen thus saith howbeit bred sundrie place maine doo come behind v constitution bodie grant pregnancie wit nimblenesse limmes politike inuentions generallie exceed v notwithstanding otherwise gift doo often degenerate méere subtiltie instabilitie vnfaithfulnesse crueltie yet alexander ab alexandro opinion fertilest region dooth bring foorth dullest wit contrariwise harder soile finest head mine opinion fertile soile dooth bring foorth proudest nature may see campanians cicero also saith penis eos ipsum domicilium superbiae nether opinion iustlie take hold v yet hath pleased writer saie pleasure v dwell northward commonlie taken forren historiographer men great strength little policie much courage small shift bicause weake abode sunne v whereby braines made hot warmed pachymerus noteth lib 3 affirming people inhabiting north part white colour blockish vnciuill fierce warlike quality increase come neerer vnto pole whereas contrarie pole giueth contrarie gift blacknesse wisdome ciuilitie weakenesse cowardise thus saith ala farre probabilitie one conclusion made constitution body dwell vnder pole truth assertion holdeth onelie person inhabit néere vnto vnder equinoctiall small tariance sunne v also confuted length daiesnon vi sed virtute non armis sed ingenio vinct • n • tur •• gli wherefore reason seemeth better vphold alexander ab alexandro afore alledged prooue want wit bicause brain warmed tariance sunne thus also dooth comineus burden v sort historie bodinus thanked god wit countriemen may called wit could neuer compasse doo much britaine strength courage englishman without great wisedome forecast haue brought passe france galles time past contemned roman saith caesar bicause smalnesse stature howbeit greatnesse saith first brunt warres shew themselues féeble neither courage force stand great calamity certes accusing wisedome sort dooth mine opinion increase commendation vertue deale vprightlie singlenesse mind sincerelie plainlie without anie suspicious fetch dealing commonlie practise affaire countrimen accompted wise vertuous vice colour craftinesse subtile practises doublenesse hollow behauiour cloake policie amitie wisedome comineus countrimen reputed vicious whome prouerbe hath old time beene vsed eare marke dissimulation galli ridendo fidem frangunt c latter point take hold italie meane discusse dailie practised manie place maine accompted wise politike dissemble place iustlie determine neither would wish countrimen learne anie wisedome king france could saie qui nescit dissimulare nescit regnare viuere owne history testimony sufficient galen noble physician transferring force naturall humor bodie mind attributeth yellow colour prudence blacke constancie bloud mirth phlegme courtesie mixed lesse among themselues doo yéeld infinit varietie mean therefore commeth passe whose nature inclineth generallie phlegme cannot courteous ioined strength bodie sinceritie behauiour quality vniuersallie granted remaine well nation inhabitant north cannot see may hinderance whie rather conclude briton doo excell dwell hoter country want craft subtilties come anie whit behind vanitie also note v haue often heard common table talke barbarous bicause little regard shedding bloud rather tremble sée liquor life go v vse owne word certes barbarous eies bicause rather inflamed appalled wound obiectors flat coward iudgement sith thinke great péece manhood stand tackling vntill last drop men may spare much bicause haue much whereas hauing lesse afraid lose little haue frontinus also noteth french write owne manhood history make little accompt opinion italian writing credit papist intreating religion spaniard méekenesse scot manhood builded frenchman trusted report owne affaire wherein dooth either dissemble excéed foule vice professe deale vprightlie neither hard stranger horace wold séeme make v sith loue long abuse v make accompt far foorth despise v generallie verified vse priuileges commodity diet apparell trade gaine ample manner selues enioy lawfull v doo country stranger suffered haue worke homeborne without procéed purpose v although good men care liue long liue well doo liue hundred yéers verie manie vnto foure score thrée score taken entrance age britaine man said wax old till draw vnto thréescore time god spéed well commeth place epaminondas sometime said mirth affirming vntill thirtie yeares age welcome best salutationsalutations according age thence thréescore god kéepe thréescore best saie god spéed well time begin grow toward iournies end whereon manie one haue verie good leaue go two also noted v thing apperteining firme constitution body hath béene séene anie region manie carcass dead remaine time time without corruption britaine death slaughter otherwise remaine vnburied foure fiue day togither easie knowne discerned fréends kindred whereas tacitus complaine sundrie nation saieng body tam fluidae substantiae within certeine houres wife shall hardlie know hir husband mother hir sonne one fréend another liues ended like sort comelinesse liuing body doo continue midle age euen last gaspe speciallie mankind albeit woman bearing child doo fortie begin wrinkle apace yet commonlie wretched hard fauoured looke vpon age french woman diuerse country men also doo much participate often waiward peeuish nothing maner may content might adde somewhat also meane stature generallie woman whose beautie commonlie excéedeth fairest maine comlinesse person good proportion limmes come ouer vnto v beyond sea neuerthelesse vtterlie mislike poorer sort wealthier doo sildome offend herein themselues without gouernement carelesse education child wherein husband also blamed mean whereof verie manie neither fearing god neither regarding either maners obedience doo oftentimes come confusion anie correction discipline béene vsed toward youth might haue prooued good member commonwealth countrie good seruice industrie could make report likewise naturall vice vertues borne within iland full tractation herof craueth better head mine set foorth giue place men list take hand thus much therefore constitution body much may suffice britaine first grew diuided three portion cap 21 comming brutus iland haue read foresaid treatise yeare world 2850 1217 incarnation christ although goropius maner doo vtterlie denie historie behalfe made generall surueis whole iland side side mean view search onelie limit bound dominion also commodity new atchiued conquest might yéeld vnto people ferthermore finding last also conuenable place wherin erect citie began euen verie daie called london naming trenouanton remembrance old troie whence ancestor proceeded roman pronounced afterward trinobantum although welshman doo call still trenewith citie builded write much tenth yeare reigne liued aboue fiftéene yeares finished rest act attempted doone erection citie find certeine report reigned iland arriuall space foure twentie yeares finished day trenouanton aforesaid yoong florishing age carcase honourablie interred maner death find yet mention thereof among writer extant meane whether grew vnto defect nature force gréeuous wound receiued warres withstood time time iland therefore saie nothing matter herein onelie agree time languishing paine made disposition whole kingdome diuiding three part portion according number sonnes liuing whereof eldest excéeded eight twentie yeares age coniecturs giueth eldest thereforelocrine whose name locrine gaue greatest best region rest daie called lhoegres among britonslhoegria language england english saxon made conquest portion also included south british sea est germane ocean north humber west irish sea riuers dee sauerne whereof generall description iland haue spoken large cambercamber second sonne assigned lieth beyond sauerne deecambria toward west parcell day conteineth southwales northwales sundrie ilands adiacent whole maner cut separated england lhoegria said stream wherby séemeth also peninsula byland respect small hillie portion ground lieth indifferentlie betweene maine course branch least run fall welshman briton call ancient name still vnto day englishman terme wale denomination haue saxon time past vse word walsh sort▪ doo strange call stranger nation name walsh countrie third last part iland allotted vnto albanact yoongest sonne three ill allalbanact haue said whose portion séemed circuit large camber maner equall greatnesse dominion locrinus haue regard seuerall commodity reaped shall find much discrepant differing one another soeuer first second haue plentie corne fine grasse large cattell latter wanteth excéeding store fish rich mettall quarry stone abundance wild foule mine opinion could equall partition made brute aforesaid maner later parcell first tooke name albanactus called albania small portion onelie region vnder regiment duke reteineth said denomination rest called scotland certeine scot came ouer ireland inhabit quartersalbania diuided lhoegres also solue firth yet doo note humber albania brute left conteined north part iland found beyond aforesaid streame vnto point cathnesse conclude brute hauing diuided kingdome maner therein contenting himselfe generall title whole long yer ended life solemnelie interred new citie thrée child parted tooke possession prouinceslocrine king also scotland scotland two yeares fell againe hand locrinus chiefe lord death brother albanact slaine humber king scithians left none issue behind succéed kingdome maner souereigntie ile dooth remaine prince lhoegres king england chap 22 possible scotish nation reading former chapter take offense meaning principalitie north part ile hath alwais belonged king lhoegresthe scot alwaies desirous shake ye english subiection haue often made cruell odious attempt doo vaine whose ample satisfaction behalfe set downe discourse thereof large written diuerse finallie brought one treatise sufficient thinke satisfie reasonable although halfe enough peraduenture content wrangling mind sith leastwise hath beene nothing odious among heare king england hath ought doo scotland historiographer haue attempted shape manie coloured excuse auoid manifest title men may see read bookes indifferentlie wherevnto referre part little nothing mine herein onelie collection abridgement number fragment togither wherein chéeflie haue vsed helpe nicholas adam lawier wrote thereof set purpose king edward sixt leland like king henrie eight iohn harding vnto edward fourth beside thrée whereof first dedicated treatise henrie fourth second edward third third edward first writing yet extant doo abundantlie beare witnesse title also leland giueth booke haue written owne hand beginneth maner remembrance following found chronicle authorised remaining diuerse monastery england scotland euidentlie knowne shewed king england haue ought haue souereigntie ouer scotland homage fealtie king reigning time time c herevnto haue heard alreadie diuision brute made iland long death wherof ech child soone interred tooke seisure possession howbeit two yeares happened albanact slaine wherevpon locrinus camber raising power reuenged death finallie said locrinus made entrance vpon albania seized owne hand excheated wholie vnto himselfe without yéelding anie part thereof vnto brother camber made claime title vnto anie portion hereby saith adam euidentlie appeareth entire seigniorie ouer albania consisted locrinus according example like law among brother euer since hath continued preferring eldest brother onelie benefit collaterall ascension youngest well scotland england vnto daie ebranke lineall heire bodie locrine saie sonne mempris sonne madan sonne locrine builded albania castell maiden called edenborough called aldan somtime king scotland first named cair minid agnes 1 castell mount agnes castell virgin castell alcluith alclude called dunbriton scotish hector boetius confesseth whereby euidentlie appeareth ebranke thereof seized ebranke reigned said state ouer long time whose death albania annexed empire britaine descended onelie king briton vntill time two sister sonnes morgan conedage lineall heires said ebranke brotherlie first diuided realme betwéen morgan lhoegres conedage albania shortlie morgan elder brother pondering head loue brother affection kingdome excluded nature gaue place ambition therevpon denouncing warre death miserablie ended life reward vntruth whereby conedage obteined whole empire britaine state remained naturall life lineallie descended onelie king briton vntill reigne gorbodian issue two sonnes ferrex porrex porrex requiring like diuision land affirming former partition rather law fauor hand elder brother best loued queene mother life hoped kingdome beerea • ed wherevpon vnnaturall mother vsing hir naturall malice death hir one sonne without regard loosing miserablie slue bed mistrusting treason cloten writer well scotish next inheritour whole empire lacking power onelie meane day obteine right contented diuide among foure kinsman scater albania death cloten sonne dunwallo mulmutius made warre vpon foure king last overcame recouered whole dominion token victorie caused himselfe crowned crowne gold verie first mettall anie vse worne among king nation dunwallo erected temple wherein people assemble praier temple gaue benefit sanctuarie made law wager battell case murder felonie whereby théefe liued made art fighting purgation fight true man robbed beléeuing assuredlie god supposed manie would miracle assigne victorie none innocent partie certes priuileges law benefit latter well scotland england inioied daie cause late positiue law among v excepted wherin benefit wager battell restreined obedience lawes dooth manifestlie appéere dunwallo seized albania called scotland dunwallo reigned estate ouer manie yeares beline brenne sonnes also dunwallo father death fauourablie diuide land betweene beline lhoegres brenne albania brenne subiect without consent elder brother lord aduentured marrie daughter king denmarke beline seized albania owne hand thervpon caused notable way priuileged dunwallons lawes newlie wrought men hand length extended part cornewall vnto sea north cathnesse scotland like sort better maintenance religion day constituted minister called archflamines sundrie place iland seuerall function resembled bishop time one remained ebranke called yorke whole region caerbrantonica whereof ptolomie also speaketh without wresting name whose power extended vttermost bound albania wherby likewise appeareth within owne dominion death whole ile inioied onelie king britaine vntill time uigenius peridurus lineall heires said beline fauourablie made partition uigenius land humber south peridurus thence northward albania c uigenius died peridurus suruiued thereby obteined whole quietlie descended posteritie accordinglie inioied vntill reigne coell first name time obscure nation writer supposed scithians passed sea ireland arriued part britaine called albania whome coell assembled power entred albania expell one fergus night disguised entered tent coell bed traitorouslie slue fergus therfore reward great prowesse made king whervpon sat downe part wiues child called scotland themselues scot begining world foure thousand six hundred seauentéene yeares scotish accompt iust computation confession owne writer six hundred yeares lacking ten brutus reigned ouer whole iland land inioied posteritie comming two fiftie descent king britaine large prescription certes intrusion land manie hundred yeares inhabited manie descent king quietlie inioied best title owne writer alledge proceed fergus herevpon immediatlie diuide albania also among capteins souldiers whereby euidentlie appeareth people nation inhabiting proofe whereof partition shall follow land cathnes lieng orkneie hector boecius lib 5 betwéene dummesbeie water thane giuen vnto one cornath capteine people land betwéene water thane ne called rosse bredth cromart mouth water locht giuen lutorke another capteine people land betwéene spaie ne almane sea ireland sea called murraie land giuen one warroch people land thalia called boin ainze bogewall gariot formartine bowguhan giuen one thalis people land mar badezenoch lochquhaber giuen martach people land lorne kintier hilles mounteins thereof lieng mar ireland sea giuen capteine nanance people land athole giuen atholus another capteine people land strabraun brawdawane lieng west dunkell giuen creones epidithes two capteins land argile giuen argathelus capteine land linnox clidisdale allotted lolgona capteine land siluria called kile carrike cuningham giuen silurth another capteine land brigance called gallowaie giuen companie called brigandes best men appointed dwell next briton afterward expelled briton annandale albanie whereby confessed inhabited briton residue land called scotland saie meirnis angus steremond gowrie strahern pirth fiffe striueling callender calderwood lougthian mers teuedale rement dale sherifdome berwicke enioied nation mingled marriage britonsberouicum potiùs à berubio promontorio obedience whose capteine called beringer builded castell towne berwicke vpon twede people called picts vpon whome death coell scot oportunitie vse war whereof ceased vntill time pleased god appoint another coell king briton whose name albeit hoped like victorie first yet preuailed ceased warre vntill scot vtterlie expelled bound britaine neuer dared reenter vntill troublesome reigne sisilt king briton twelft king coell time countrie reinhabited briton scot turning ciuill discord realme betweene sisilt brother blede best aduantage arriued againe albania made one reuther king upon new arriuall new warre made vpon sisilt king briton warre reuther new king died thereus succéeded whome warre briton ceased vntill freelie submitted himselfe said sicill king briton ebranke yorke shortlie tenth yeare reigne died finnane brother iosine succeeded election kingdome scot shortlie compelled warres sicill declared himselfe subiect better assurance faith obeisance king briton deliuered sonne durstus hand sicill fantasieng child hoping owne succession alter subtiltie saie duplicitie saith adam married end agasia owne daughter durstus next kingdurstus married briton woman though indeed king daughter scot hated cause ought rather haue liked better therefore onelie traitorouslie slue declare end malice dishinherited much issue durstus agasia herevpon new warre sproong betwéene v ceased vntill contented receiue edeir king next bloud liuing descended durstus agasia thereby bloud briton part mother restored crowne albania nature whose law immutable caused bond loue hold shortlie edeir attended vpon cassibelane king briton repulse iulius caesar owne author boetius confesseth commanded subiect iulius caesar second arriuall treason androgeus preuailed briton therevpon pursued edeir scotland himselfe saith commentary subdued ile britaine though liuing scot denie dead writer confesse came beyond calender wood cast downe camelon principall citie picts token victorie farre carron builded round temple stone remained perfection vntill reigne king edward called first conquest whome subuerted monument thereof remaineth daie marius sonne aruiragusmarius king britaine time one roderike scithian great rabble néedie souldiours came water frith scotland arme sea diuiding pentland fiffe whome marius assembled power slue rodericke discomfited people westmerland remained aliue gaue countrie cathnesse scotland prooueth within owne dominion coell sonne marius issue luciuscoelus counted first christian king nation conuerted three archflamines land bishopriks ordeined bishop vnto ech first remained london power extended furthest part cornewall humber water second dwelled yorke power stretched humber furthest part scotland third aboded caerleon vpon riuer wiske glamorgan wale power extended seuerne wale write made two turned name archbishop one remaine canturburie yorke yet confesse yorke iurisdiction scotland either sufficient prooue scotland vnder dominion seuerus birth romaneseuerus bloud briton thinke lineall heire bodie androge • sonne lud nephue cassibelane shortlie emperour king briton whose time people ancester marius gaue land cathnesse scotland conspired scot receiued iles scotland herevpon seuerus came scotland méeting faith false hart togither droue maine land iles vttermost bound great britaine notwithstanding glorious victorie briton considering seruitude roman imposed treason androgeus ancestor seuerus began hate whome yet time loue defense suertie slaine scot confederats one battell thirtie thousand consideration common sort day whose malice time could diminish iust desert appease antoninus bassianus borne briton womanbassianus geta borne romane woman sonnes seuerus death father contrarie voice people contended crowne briton held bassianus fewer roman geta greater number neither end geta slaine bassianus remained emperour carautius rebelled gaue vnto scot picts scithians countrie cathnesse scotland afterward inhabited whereby seison thereof appeareth coillcoill descended bloud ancient king land shortlie king briton whose onelie daughter heire called helen married vnto constantius romane daunted rebellion part great britaine death coill right wife king thereof reigned state ouer thirtéene fouretéene yeares constantine sonne constance helenconstantine next king briton right mother passing rome receiue empire thereof deputed one octauius king wale duke gewisses expound afterward called west saxon haue gouernment dominion abusing king innocent goodnesse octauius defrauded trust tooke vpon crowne traitorie albeit vanquished leonine traheron great vncle constantine yet death traheron preuailed againe vsurped ouer britaine constantine emperor sent marimius kinsman hither processe time destroie octauius singular battell discomfited wherevpon maximius well consent great constantine election briton briton bloud made king rather vicegerent britaine maximius made warre vpon scot scithians within britaine ceassed vntill slaine eugenius king expelled driuen whole limit bound britaine finallie inhabited scotland briton man woman child scotish nation suffered remaine within hector boetius saith rebellion rebellion properlie could except béene subiects suffered picts also remaine subiects made solemne othes neuer erect anie peculiar king owne nation remaine vnder old empire onelie king britaine epistle leland exemplified saith verie ancient record beareth title helena vnto hir sonne constantine entreth manner domino semper augusto filio constantino mater helena semper augusta c repenteth exemplifie conueigh treatise whilest book thereby might haue great light estate present discourse mind haue trauelled matter neuerthelesse hereafter come againe light would wish reserued followeth also maner translated gréeke veritatem sapientis animus non recusat nec fides rectum aliquando patitur quamcunque iacturam c fiue fourtie yeares long time death maximius helpe gouan gonan helga scot newlie arriued albania created one fergus second name king bicause banished continent land crowned king aduenture argile fatall chaire marble yéere lord foure hundred two twentie themselues doo write maximian sonne leonine traheron brother king coillmaximian vncle helene lineall succession next king briton appease malice dionothus king wale also claimed kingdome maried othilia eldest daughter dionothus afterwards assembled great power briton entered albania inuading gallowaie mers annandale pentland carrike kill cuningham battell slue fergus king scot durstus king picts exiled people continent land wherevpon number scot remaining liue went argile made eugenius king maximian thus obteined quietnesse britaine departed cousine conan meridocke armorica subdued king depopulated countrie gaue conan cousine afterward inhabited briton name britaine lesse hereof realme tooke name britaine great name consent forren writer keepeth vnto daie death maximian dissention mooued betweene noble britaine scot swarmed togither againe came wall adrian realme diuided manie faction ouercame one herevpon hector boetius hen laieng one eg make great cakeling solemnlie triumphing conquest victorie alledgeth hereby briton made tributary scot yet confesseth land supposed conquest portion betwéene humber old partition annexed albania hard beléeued broken nation scot time returning banishment within foure yeares since battell loosing king great number best men thus able make conquest great britaine verie vnlikelie conquered would haue left hot sunne south part dwell cold snow scotland incredible conquered would haue deputed officer case conquest behooueth beyond beliefe great britaine countrie woon without comming anie enimie taried finallie wall adrian whereof spake need speake defense boecius scantlie trusteth owne beliefe tale saieth galfride sundrie authentike writer diuerslie varie part storie wherein owne thought accuseth conscience vntruth herein also forgetting behooueth lier mindfull assertion fourth chapter next following wholie bewraieth himselfe saieng confederat king scot picts vpon ciuill warres betwéene briton followed hoped shortlie inioie land great britaine beyond humber vnto fresh sea hope bene vaine lesse void béene owne anie conquest constantine britaine descended conan king thereof cousine brute bloud maximian neerest heire next king britaine immediatlie pursued scot war shortlie battell slue king dongard first yeare reigne whereby recouered scotland hand tooke holdes thereof owne possession uortiger shortlie obteined crowne britaine scot newlie rebelled repressing whereof mistrusting briton hate sundrie cause one auoid smoke dooth oft fall fire receiued hengest saxon great number countriemen briton entred scotland ouercame wherevpon tooke iles common refuge gaue also much scotland gallowaie pentland mers annandale sundrie land hengest people inhabit accordinglie inioie hengest processe time thirsted whole kingdome south banished yet afterward restored conspired scot aurilambrose sonne constantine iust inheritor whole dominion vntruth recompensed togithersome thinke seimors come man lineall descent suppose lesse taken prisoner eldulph de samor noble man britaine head traitorie striken commandement aurilambrose field scot vanquished octa sonne hengest receiued mercie whome people aurilambrose gaue countrie gallowaie scotland became subiects hereby appeareth scotland againe reduced hand uter called also pendragon brother aurilambrose next king briton whome sworne saxon foresworne subiects confederate scot newlie rebelled power assembled gallowaie scotland discomfited albania againe recouered vnto subiection arthur sonne uter begotten mariage lawfullie borne matrimonie succéeded next crowne great britaine whose noble act though manie vulgar fable haue rather stained commended yet scotish writer confesse subdued great britaine made tributarie ouercame saxon scattered far cathnesse scotland war seruice obeisance scot picts last setting féet guilefull path predecessor rebelled besieged citie yorke howell king lesse britaine cousine king arthur therein host came thither discomfited scot chased marsh besieged long almost famished vntill bishop abbats men religion much christened people besought take mercie grace grant portion countrie dwell vnder euerlasting subiection upon tooke grace homage fealtie sworne subiects liegeman ordeined kinsman anguisan king gouernour urian king iland murefrence king orkeneie made archbishop yorke also whose authoritie extended scotland finallie said arthur holding roiall feast cairleon king subiects vnto among angusian said king scot due seruice homage long realme scotland bare king arthur sword afore malgo shortlie succéeded whole kingdome great britaine vpon new resistance made subdued ireland iland orchads norwaie denmarke made ethelfred saxon king bernicia northumberland louthian much land scotland ethelfred sword obteined hand wilfull inhabitant continued true subiect malgo cadwan succéeded kingdome great britaine defense subiects scot made warre vpon ethelfred last agréed cadwan vpon rebellion gaue scotland vnto ethelfred therevpon subdued inioied afterward reigne cadwallo next succeeded great britaine rebelled whervpon cadwallo came scotland vpon treason reseised countrie owne hand hauing vicerois saxon inhabited subiects singular battell slue ethelfred owne hand oswald shortlie cadwallos gift made king bernicia subiect cadwallo commandement discomfited scot picts subdued scotland oswie brother oswald like gift cadwallo made next king bernicia like commandement newlie subdued scot picts held obeisance cadwallo eight twentie yeares thus cadwallo reigned whole monarchie great britaine hauing seuen king thereof well saxon others subiects albeit number saxon time time greatlie increased yet alwaies either first expelled else made tributarie onelie king briton time owne writer doo confesse cadwallader next king whole great britaine reigned twelue yeares ouer king thereof great peace tranquillitie vpon lamentable death subiects died sundrie disease innumerablie departed little britaine sonne cousine iuor iue expelled england also saxon went wale among briton posteritie remained prince upon great alteration warres whole dominion betwéene briton saxon scot thought time slip collar obedience therevpon entred league charles king france establishing wise 1 iniurie englishman doone anie people shall perpetuallie holden common 2 frenchman inuaded englishman scot shall send armie defense france supported monie vittels french 3 scot inuaded englishman frenchman shall come vpon owne expense support succour 4 none people shall take peace truce englishman without aduise c manie disputable opinion may warre without praising itnicholas adam onlie admittable inforced necessitie vsed peace sake onelie scot sought warre loue warre onelie league giueth benefit themselues either frée traffike owne commodity benefit french priuilege people discommoditie riseth loosing intercourse exchange commodity necessary aboundant france scot féele perfectlie know ruine townes destruction country slaughter people haue reason bloudie league chanced history lamentable read horrible among christian men remembred god gaue increase according séed hereby sowe dissention shortlie reape bloudie slaughter confusion alpine king possessing light mind would lost little wind hoped league shortlie subdue great britaine end onelie rebelled owne kingdome also vsurped vpon kingdome picts whervpon edwine king england made one brudeus king picts sent scotland great power battell tooke alpine king scot prisoner discomfited people alpine king found subiect rebell head striken place scotland thereof daie called pasalpine saie head alpine first effect french league osbright king england ella subiect great number briton saxon shortlie scot themselues elected new king entered scotland ceassed war vntill king people fled iles whome last vpon submission peace made wise water frith shall march betwéene scot englishman east part shall named scotish sea water cluide dunbriton shall march west part betwéene scot briton castell called alcluide dunbriton say castle briton sometimes destroied dane briton land sterling ireland sea water frith cluide cumber strength commodity thereof englishman land betwéene sterling northumberland thus cluide march betwéene scot briton one side water frith named scotish sea march betwéene englishman side sterling common march thrée people briton englishman scot howbeit king osbright castle sterling first caused coined sterling monie englishman also builded bridge stone passage ouer water frith middest whereof made crosse vnder written verse free march passenger may ken scot briton englishman manie yeares hinguar hubba two dane great number people arriued scotland slue constantine osbright made king wherevpon edulfe ethelwulfe king england assembled power hinguar hubba one battell slue people would remaine become christian suffered tarie rest banished put death c ethelwulfe granted peter penny albeit peter paule little need lesse right yet paiment thereof continued realme euer vntill late yeares scot euer since vnto daie haue yet doo paie reason grant prooueth vnder obeisance alured alfred succéeded kingdome england reigned noblie ouer whole monarchie great britaine made lawes person excommunicated disabled sue claime anie propertie law gregour whome alured made king scot obeied law well scotland england holden daie also prooueth high lord scotland alured constreined gregour king scot also breake league france generallie concluded serued warres well dane others reseruing making anie exception former league france said alured death gregour like seruice obeisance donald king scot fiue thousand horssemen one gurmond dane infested realme donald died faith obeisance alured edward first name called chifod sonne alured succéeded father next king england whome sithrtic dane scot conspired subdued constantine king brought obeisance held realme scotland also king edward dooth marian owne countrieman scot confesse beside roger houeden william malmesberie yeare lord 923 king edward president gouernour people england cumberland scot dane briton king athelstane like sort conquered scotland laie tent beside yorke whilest warres lasted king scot feined himselfe minstrell harped onelie espie ordinance people writer confesse corrupted monie sold faith false heart together dane aided king athelstane sundrie time howbeit met vntruthes broningfield west countrie mentioned ninth chapter first booke description discomfited dane slue malcolme deputie behalfe king scot battell scot confesse themselues haue lost people remembred anie age athelstane following good lucke went throughout scotland wholie subdued possession thereof gaue land lieng annandale deed copie wherof dooth follow king athelstane giues vnto paulam oddam roddam al good al faire euer mine thereto witnesse mauld wife course word onelie appeareth plaine simplicitie men dooings day also full proofe seized scotland last also receiued homage malcolme king scot could restored whole kingdome entered religion shortlie died athelstane better assurance countrie thought best haue two stringes bowe obedience therefore onelie constituted malcolme king also appointed one indulph sonne constantine third called prince scotland whome gaue much scotland malcolme homage athelstane edmund brother athelstane succéeded next king england whome indulph king scot onelie homage also serued ten thousand scot expulsion dane realme england edred eldred brother edmund succéeded next king englandsome referre edward onelie receiued homage irise king scot also homage baron scotland edgar sonne edmund brother athelstane full age next king england reigned onelie ouer whole monarchie britaine receiued homage keneth king scot kingdome scotland made malcolme prince thereof edgar gaue vnto keneth countrie louthian scotland seized hand osbright king england rebellion declared inioined keneth said king also euerie yéere certeine principall feast whereat king vse weare crowne repaire vnto england making lawes day doone noble men péeres according order france daie allowed also sundrie lodging england successours whereat lie refresh themselues iourneies whensoeuer come vp doo homage finallie péece ground lieng beside new palace westminster vpon keneth builded house posseritie inioied vntill reigne king henrie second whose time vpon rebellion william king scot resumed king england hand house decaied ground stood called scotland daie moreouerlawfull age wardship heires edgar made law man succéed patrimonie inheritance holden knight seruice vntill accomplished age one twentie yéeres intendment vnder age able person serue king countrie according tenor deed condition purchase law receiued keneth scotland well england obserued daie prooueth also scotland vnder obeisance yeere lord 974 kinald king scot malcolme king cumberland macon king man iles duuenall king southwales siferth howell king rest wale iacob iames gallowaie iukill westmerland homage king edgar chester morrow going water monasterie saint iohns seruice returning home againe said edgar sitting barge stirring vpon water dée made said king row barge saieng successor might well ioifull haue prerogatiue great honour superioritie manie mightie prince subiect vnto monarchie edward sonne edgar next king england whose time keneth king scot caused malcolme king scotland poisoned wherevpon king edward made warre ceased vntill keneth submitted himselfe offered receiue prince scotland whome king edward would appoint herevpon king edward proclamed one malcolme prince scotland immediatlie came england homage vnto king edward etheldred brother edward succéeded next ouer england whome swaine king denmarke conspired last malcolme king scot shortlie malcolme sorrowfullie submitted himselfe defense etheldred considering could amended must onelie repented benignlie receiued helpe whose seruice last etheldred recouered realme againe hand swaine reigned ouer whole monarchie eight thirtie yéeres edmund surnamed ironside sonne etheldred next king england whose time canutus dane inuaded realme much crueltie last married emme sometime wise vnto etheldred mother edmund emme arbitratrix betweene hir naturall loue one matrimoniall dutie procured amitie betwéene end edmund contented diuide realme canutus keeping himselfe england side humber gaue rest beyond humber seigniorie scotland canutus wherevpon malcolme king scot little accustomable resistance homage canutus kingdome scotland thus said canutus held ouer edmund king england like seruices long liued togither canutus memorie victorie glorie seigniorie ouer scot commanded malcolme king build church buchquhan scotland field betweene fought dedicated olauus patrone norwaie denmarke church malcolme accordinglie performed edward called confessour sonne etheldred brother edmund ironside afterward king england tooke malcolme king scot life kingdome made malcolme soone king cumberland northumberland king scot homage fealtie edward perused old lawes realme somewhat added law edgar wardship land vntill heire accomplish age one twentie yeeres addedto whome marriage ward perteineth marriage heire also belong lord land holden also euerie woman marrieng free man notwithstanding child husband enioie third part inheritance hir life manie lawes malcolme king scot obeied well scotland v england obserued day directlie prooueth whole vnder obeisance reason law malcolme sonne duncane next inheritor crowne scotland within age noble scotland deliuered ward custodie also king edward whose minoritie one makebeth scot traitorouslie vsurped crowne scotland whome said edward made warre said mackbeth ouercome slaine wherevpon said malcolme crowned king scot scone eight yeere reigne king edward aforesaid malcolme also tenor said new law wardship married vnto margaret daughter edward sonne edmund ironside agatha disposition king edward full age homage king edward confessour kingdome scotland moreoueredward confessour edward england hauing issue bodie mistrusting harald son goodwine descended daughter harald harefoot dane would vsurpe crowne leaue cousine edgar eatling within age partlie petition subiects sworne neuer receiue anie king ouer danish nation substantiall writing clergie writer affirme demise crowne great britaine vnto william bastard duke normandie heires constituting heire testamentarie also proximitie bloud betwéene emme daughter richard duke normandie wife vnto etheldred begat alured edward william son robert sonne richard brother whole bloud emme whereby appeareth william heire title conquest albeit partlie extinguish mistrust title partlie glorie victorie chalenged end name conquerour hath béene written euer since time arriuall furthermorewilliam bastard william called bastard conquerour supposed conquest perfect till likewise subdued scot wherfore bring scot iust obeisance coronation heire testamentarie edward confessour entred scotland little resistance made inhabitant said malcolme king homage abirnethie scotland kingdome scotland superiour also meane late conquest william surnamed rufuswilliam rufus sonne william called conquerour succéeded next throne england whome said malcolme king scot like homage whole kingdome scotland afterward rebelled william rufus slaine plaine field wherevpon scotishmen choose one donald dunwall king william rufus deposed created dunkane sonne malcolme king like homage finallie dunkane slaine scot dunwall restored againe william rufus deposed edgar son malcolme brother last malcolme made king like homage scotland william rufus henrie called beauelerke sonne william called conqueourhenrie 1 death brother william rufus succéeded crowne england whome edgar king scot homage scotland henrie beauclerke maried mawd daughter malcome ii scot hir issue mawd afterward empresse alexander sonne malcolme brother mawd next king scot like homage kingdome scotland henrie first edgar doone mawd called empressemawd daughter heire henrie beauclerke mawd wife receiued homage dauid brother hir alexander next king scot temporall men england kingdome scotland mawd empresse gaue vnto dauid marriage mawd daughter heire uoldosius earle huntingdon northumberland herein euasion appeareth allege king homage made earledome huntingdon dauid first king earle huntingdon since homage king recited time mariage long said alexander brother king scot homage aforesaid henrie beauclerke son aforesaid ladie whome find epitaph worthie remembred ortu magna viro maior sed maximum partu hic iacet henrici filia sponsa parens yeere lord 1136 first yeere reigne king stephan said dauid king scot required doo homage refused much doone homage mawd empresse time notwithstanding sonne said dauid homage king stephan henrie called fitz empressehenrie 2 sonne mawd empresse daughter mawd daughter malcolme king scot next king england receiued homage scotland malcolme sonne henrie sonne said dauid last king malcolme homage attended vpon king henrie warres lewis king france whereby appeareth french league neuer renewed last diuision countrie osbright king england warres finished french king malcolme againe scotland rebelled wherevpon king henrie immediatlie seized huntingdon northumberland owne hand confiscation made warres vpon scotland malcolme died without issue bodie william brother malcolme next king scot noble scotland could anie earledome homage sonne henrie second taken reseruation dutie king henrie second father also earledome huntingdon ye haue heard forfeited malcolme brother neuer restored crowne scotland william afterward attend vpon henrie second warres normandie french king notwithstanding french league licenced depart home tenth prince vpon fiftéenth februarie returned vpon sixtéenth october homage realme scotland token also perpetuall subiection crowne england offered vp cloake faddle speare high altar yorke wherevpon permitted depart home scotland immediatlie mooued cruell warre northumberland king henrie yet normandie god tooke defense king henry part deliuered william king scot hand englishman brought prisoner king henrie normandie twentith yeere reigne last sute dauid brother richard bishop saint andrew bishop lord put fine amendment trespasse wit paie ten thousand pound sterling surrender title earldome huntingdon cumberland northumberland hand king henrie thing accordinglie sealing charter thereof great seale scotland signet nobilitie yet seene wherein also comprised successours hold realme scotland king england successours euer herevpon againe homage king henrie could earledome huntingdon right whereof alreadie surrendred better assurance faith also strength berwike edenborough roxborough striueling deliuered hand king henrie england owne writer confesse hector boetius saith trespasse amended fine twentie thousand pound sterling erledome huntingdon cumberland northumberland deliuered morgage hand king henrie vntill ten thousand pound sterling paid farre truth hector liued well meaning countrie grant true yet prooueth monie paid land otherwise redéemed euer came anie scotish king hand thus appeareth earledome huntingdon neuer occasion homage scotish king king england either time doone 1175 moreouer read note hereof gathered robertus montanus montensis liued day take confessor king henrie king scot dooth homage king henrie kingdome scotland sent home againe bishop also promise doo like archbishop yorke acknowledge themselues prouince iurisdiction vertue also composition said robert saith rex angliae dabat honores episcopatus abbatias alias dignitates scotia vel saltem eius consilio dabantur king england gaue honor bishopriks abbatships dignity scotland leastwise giuen without aduise counsell time alexander bishop rome supposed haue generall iurisdiction ecclesiasticall christendome established whole cleargie scotland according old lawes vnder iurisdiction archbishop yorke yeare lord 1185 moneth august cairleill rouland talmant lord galwaie homage fealtie said king henrie held two twentith yeare reigne king henrie second gilbert sonne ferguse prince galwaie homage fealtie said king henrie left dunecan sonne hostage conseruation peace richard surnamed coeur de lion stoutnesse sonne henrie next king england whome william king scot homage canturburie whole kingdome scotland king richard taken prisoner duke ostrich whose redemption whole realme taxed great summes monie vnto william king scot subiect contributorie paied two thousand markes sterling yeare lord 1199 iohn king england sent william king scot come doo homage william came lincolne moneth december yeare homage vpon hill presence hubert archbishop canturburie people assembled therevnto tooke oth sworne vpon crosse said hubert also granted charter confirmed haue mariage alexander sonne liegeman alwaies hold king england promising moreouer said king william sonne alexander keepe hold faith allegiance henrie sonne said king iohn chiefe lord maner men might liue die also whereas william king scot put iohn bishop saint andrew bishoprike pope clement wrote henrie king england mooue induce william néed required roiall power prerogatiue ouer nation compell leaue rancor said bishop suffer haue occupie said bishoprike againe yeare lord 1216 fiue twentith reigne henrie sonne king iohn henrie quéene yorke feast christmasse solemnization marriage made feast saint stephan martyr yeare betwéene alexander king scot margaret king daughter said alexander homage henrie king england realme scotland buls diuerse pope admonition giuen king scot appeareth gregorie fift clement successor obserue trulie kéepe appointment béene made betwéene king england scotland king scotland still hold realme scotland king england vpon paine cursse interdiction death alexander king scot alexander sonne nine yeares age lawes edgar ward king henrie third noble scotland brought yorke deliuered vnto whose minoritie king henrie gouerned scotland subdue commotion realme vsed aid fiue thousand scotishmen king henrie died nonage alexander whereby receiued homage reason law respited vntill full age one twentie yeares edward first conquest sonne henrie next king england immediatlie whose coronation alexander king scot full age homage scotland westminster swearing rest maner n king scot shall true faithfull vnto lord e grace god king england noble superior lord kingdome scotland vnto make fidelitie kingdome hold claime hold shall beare faith fidelitie life lim worldlie honour men faithfullie shall knowlege shall doo seruice due vnto kingdome scotland aforesaid god helpe holie euangelies alexander king scot died leauing one onelie daughter called margaret heire maried hanigo sonne magnus king norwaie daughter also shortlie died leauing one onelie daughter hir heire age two yeares whose custodie mariage lawes king edgar edward confessor belonged edward first whervpon noble scotland commanded king edward send norwaie conueie yoong queene england whome intended haue maried sonne edward haue made perfect vnion long wished betwéene realmes herevpon noble time considering tranquillitie manie haue since refused stood vpon shift delay minoritie contempt gladlie consented therevpon sent two noble men scotland norwaie hir brought king edward died comming thither therefore required nothing inioie lawfull liberty quietlie possessed last king alexander time death margaret scot destitute anie heire crowne alexander last king time edward descended bodie mawd daughter malcolme sometime king scot greatest broile warres france minded take possession kingdome owne right contented establish balioll king thereof weake title betwéene bruse hastings humble petition realme scotland cōmitted determination king edward wherein autentike writing confessed superioritie realme remaine king edward sealed seales foure bishop seuen earles twelue baron scotland shortlie whole assent three estate scotland solemne parlement confessed enacted accordinglie euidentlie dooth appeare balioll wise made king scotland immediatlie make homage fealtie newcastell vpon saint stéeuens daie likewise lord scotland one setting hand composition writing king edward england kingdome scotland shortlie defrauding benigne goodnesse superiour rebelled verie much hurt england herevpon king edward inuaded scotland seized hand greater part countrie tooke strength thereof whervpon balioll king scot came vnto mauntrosse scotland white wand hand resigned crowne scotland right title interest hand king edward thereof made charter writing dated sealed fourth yeare reigne noble gentleman scotland also repaired berwike homage fealtie king edward becomming subiects better assurance whose oths also king edward kept strength holdes scotland owne hand herevpon lawes process iudgements gift assises others passed vnder name authoritie king edward leland touching rehearsall writeth thereof maner yeare lord 1295 iohn king scot contrarie faith allegiance rebelled king edward came england burnt siue without modestie mercie wherevpon king edward great host went newcastell vpon tine passed water twéed besieged berwike got also wan castell dunbar slaine brunt 15700 scot proceeded gat castell rokesborow castell edenborow striuelin gedworth people harried land meane season said king iohn scot considering power withstand king edward sent letter besought treatie peace prince benignlie granted sent againe come towre brechin bring thither great lord scotland king england sent thither antonie becke bishop durham roiall power conclude said treatise agreed said iohn scot vtterlie submit themselues king end submission performed accordinglie king scot laid sonne hostage pledge vnto also made letter sealed common scale scotland knowledging simplenes great offense doone lord king edward england full power frée yeelded vp land scotland people homage king went foorth sée mounteins vnderstanding quiet peace turned abbeie scone chanons regular tooke stone called regall scotland vpon king nation woont sit time coronation thronethe scot dreame stone whereon iacob slept fled mesopotamia sent abbeie westminster commanding make chaire therof priest sing masse high altar chaire made standeth yet daie séene yeare lord 1296 king held parlement berwike tooke homage singularlie diuerse lord noble scotland perpetuall memorie made letter patent sealed seales king england made william warreine earle surrie southsax lord warden scotland hugh cressingham treasuror william ormesbie iustice scotland foorthwith sent king iohn tower london iohn comin earle badenauth earle bohan lord england diuerse place side trent yeare lord 1297 feast christmas king called said iohn king scot although committed ward said would burne destroie castels townes land recompensed cost damage susteined warres king iohn ward answered nothing sith liues death good hand king vpon answer mooued pitie granted liues would doo homage make oth solemnelie high altar church abbeie westminster vpon eucharist euerie hold keepe true faith obedience allegiance said king edward heires king england euer said king scot saw king banner england displaied power draw therevnto neither anie thencefoorth beare armes king england anie bloud finallie king rewarding great gift said king iohn lord suffered depart went scotland alwaie imagining notwithstanding submission might oppresse king edward disturbe realme scot sent also king france succour helpe sent ship berwike furnished men armes king england flanders yeare lord 1298 king went scotland great host scot also assembled great number king fought fawkirke marie magdalen daie slaine thréescore thousand scot willain walleis capteine fled taken afterward hanged drawen quartered london trespass scot rebelled againe lord scotland chose robert bruse king except onelie iohn commin earle carrike would consent thereto bicause oth made king englandthis doone vpon nine twentith ianuarie 1306 wherefore robert bruse slue dumfrise crowned schone abbeie herevpon king england assembled great hoast rode scotland discomfited robert bruse slue eight thousand scot tooke part lord scotland putting temporall lord deth bicause forsworne edward borne carnaruan sonne edward next king england beginning reigne enioied scotland peaceablie dooing thing aboue said king edward father vntill toward later end reigne time robert bruse conspired helpe forsworne scot forswore himselfe king scot herevpon edward thomas earle lancaster manie lord made warre vpon feast marie magdalene said bruse partaker alreadie accurssed pope breaking truce established betwixt infortunate first warres suffered edward sonne balioll proclame himselfe king scot neuerthelesse held foorth warres bruse ending died read edward borne windsore sonne edward second next king england age fifteene yeares whose minoritie scot practised isabell mother edward roger mortimer earle march haue homage released whose good therein obteined release paie king edward thirtie thousand pound starling three yeares next following saie ten thousand pound starling yeerelie bicause nobilitie common realme would parlement consent vnto king within age release procéeded albeit scot ceased practises quéene earle thrée yeares menie bargaine taken place haue béene paied expired king edward inuaded scotland ceassed warre vntill dauid sonne robert le bruse election king scotland absolutelie submitted himselfe vntohim said dauid bruse practise quéene earle march married iane sister king edward mooued naturall zeale sister contented giue realme scotland dauid bruse heires gotten bodie said iane sauing reuersion meane homage king edward owne child wherewith dauid bruse right well contented therevpon immediatlie made homage realme scotland howbeit shortlie causelesse conceiuing cause displeasure dauid procured dissolue estate tailée therevpon onelie rebelled scotland also inuaded england whilest king edward occupied war france dauid onelie expelled england end also thinking place sufficient defense vntruth owne accord fled scotland whereby country annandale gallowaie mar teuidale twedale ethrike seized king england hand new march set betwéene england scotland cockbu • ne path sowtrie hedge dauid went recouer againe power discomfited himselfe englishman taken brought england remained prisoner eleuen yeares said apprehension time king edward enioied scotland peaceablie contemplation wearie suit sorowfull sister wife dauid contented againe restore kingdome scotland wherevpon concluded rebellion dauid paie king edward summe one hundred thousand markes starling destroie holdes fortress standing english border assure crowne scotland child king edward lacke heire owne bodie thing accordinglie better assurance obeisance also afterward deliuered hand king edward sundrie noble men scotland behalfe pledge effect historie dauid touching delings let v sée doone edward balioll wherof chronicle doo report yéere lord 1326 edward third king england crowned westminster fift yeare reigne edward balioll right heire kingdome scotland came claimed due sundrie lord gentleman also title diuerse land either themselues wiues like wherevpon said balioll went scotland sea landing kinghorns 3000 englishman discomfited 10000 scot flue 1200 went foorth dunfermeline scot assembled 40000 men feast saint laurence place called gastmore otherwise gladmore slaine fiue earl thirtéene baron hundred thrée score knight two thousand men armes manie fortie thousand staine english part thirtéene person onelie number corrupted eight yeare reigne king edward assembled great hoast came berwike vpon twéed laid siege therto also came edward balioll king scot great power strengthen aid scot came scotland foure batels well armed araied edward king england edward king scot apparrelled people either foure battels vpon halidon hill beside berwike met two hoasts discomfited scot fiue twentie thousand seauen hundred whereof slaine eight earles thousand thrée hundred knight gentleman victorie doone king returned berwike towne castell yéelded vp vnto eight yeare reigne king edward england edward balioll king scot came newcastell vpon tine homage realme scotland yeare lord 1346 dauid bruse prouocation king france rebelled came england great hoast vnto neuils crosse archbishop yorke diuerse temporall men fought said king scot taken william earle duglas morrise earle strathorne brought london manie lord slaine dauid homage edward king england thirtith yeare king reigne yeare lord 1355 scot woone towne berwicke castell herevpon king came thither great hoast anon towne yéelded vp without anie resistance edward balioll considering god manie maruellous gratious thing king edward owne gaue vp crowne realme scotland king edward england rokesborough letter patent anon king england presence lord spirituall temporall let crowne himselfe king realme scotland ordeined thing intent came ouer england richard sonne edward called blacke prince sonne king edward next king england said iane wife said king dauid scotland deceassed without issue informed scot deuised vttermost power breake limitation inheritance touching crowne scotland made foorthwith war wherein burnt edenbrough spoiled countrie tooke hold held continuallie war vntill death anno dom 1389 henrie fourth name next king england continued warres begun king richard ceassed vntill robert king scot third name resigned crowne appointment king henrie deliuered sonne iames age nine yeares hand remaine custodie wardship disposition superiour lord according old lawes king edward confessor doone anno dom 1404 within fiue yeares death king richard henrie fourth reigned estate ouer fouretéene yeares henrie fift name sonne king henrie fourth next king england made warres french king iames king scot attended vpon vpon superiour lord conuenient number scot notwithstanding league france henrie reigned nine yeares whereby homage iames king hauing fullie accomplished age one twentie yeares reason law respited finallie said iames diuerse lord attended vpon corp said henrie vnto westminster dutie apperteined henrie sixt sonne henrie fift next king england whome seigniorie scotland custodie iames right law reason descended married iames king scot iane daughter iohn earle summerset saint marie ouer ise southwarke tooke value mariage summe one hundred thousand markes starling iames king scot full age homage king henrie sixt kingdome scotland windsore moneth ianuarie since time vntill day king henrie seuenth grandfather souereigne ladie albeit realme hath béene molested diuersitie title vnmeet time neither law reason admit prescription preiudice anie right yet king edward fourth next king england preparation war scot latter end reigne sufficientlie lawes induce continuance claime superioritie ouer whose death vnto beginning reigne souereigne lord king henrie eight excéeded number seauen twentie yeares time impediment claime scot part chanced nonage iames last king continued space one twentie yeares like minoritie law reason impediment himselfe make homage like reason impediment king realme demand anie whole time intermission claime time said king henrie eight deduced vnto number thirteene yeares thus much matter wall sometime builded partition betweene england picts scot chap 23 hauing hitherto discoursed vpon title king england vnto scotish kingdome haue thought good adde vnto description two walles time past limit vnto said region therefore touched first booke generallie appertinent vnto estate whole iland lesse famous anastasius dicorus made afterward euxine vnto thracian sea conteining 420 furlong length twelue foot bredth distant constantinople 280 furlong albeit hadrian made turffe timber author therefore first wall hadrian emperourthe first beginner picts wall aelius spartianus saith erected foure score mile length twelue foot heigth eight bredth diuide barbarous briton ciuill sort generallie called name roman ouer time seuerus emperour commingthe finisher wall againe ile serued repression tumult begun death lucius amongst thing made another wall stone betwéene eightie hundred mile first thirtie two mile length reaching side also sea whome briton called murseueri gwall seueri wall seuerus seuerus dale later indureth vntill day fresh memorie reason ruines square stone oft found whose inscription declare author worke worthie noting also voiage lost 50000 men scotish side one occasion hinderance incensed determined vtterlie extinguish memorie vnder heauen doone déed life indured vntill another yeare sextus aurelius writing seuerusthe wall goeth streict line manie place addeth wall made prince conteined two thirtie mile whereby bredth iland length wall conteineth onelie manie mile may gathered word chéeflie length wall spartianus touching among thing saith seuerus followeth britanniam quod maximum eius imperij decus est muro per transuersam insulam ducto vtrin que ad finem oceani muniuit fortified britaine one chéefe act recorded time wall made ouerthwart ile reached side euen verie ocean wall stone alsothe stuffe wall ruines therof haue ministred much matter dwell néere therevnto building triall sufficient heereby like sort commeth passe soile least inhabited mention said wall wrought squared stone vntill daie maie euidentlie confirmed howbeit two walles onelie partition betwéene two kingdom sith iulius capitolinus vita antonini pij dooth write another lollius vrbicus made beyond sametwo wals turffe time said prince victory britaine also called britannicus neuerthelesse often throwne downe scot eftsoones repared againe vntill giuen ouer relinquished altogither runneth take also within wall arrow shot stone farre went yet cannot finda rampire onlie remaineth certeine walles made hadrian seuerus ditched notable ditch rampires made wise scotish aduersarie much doo enter scale assault yet read scot oftentimes pulled downe great parcel make accesse easie south part eftsoons repared againe last time amended romane soldiors came ouer verie little time uortiger season land maner left void soldiors munition betwixt thirlewall north tine also waste ground manie parcel wall seuerus yet standing whereof common people doo babble manie thing beginning therefore course thereof west seathe course wall west east find runneth bolnesse burgh foure mile likewise thence within halfe mile carleill lesse north side beneath confluence peder eden hence goeth terrebie village mile caerleill baronie linstocke gillesland north side riuer irding arding quarter mile abbeie leuercost thence thrée mile aboue leuercost aboue confluence arding pultrose becke diuideth gillesland cumberland south tindale northumberland goeth thirlwall castell wall towne next ouer riuer swensheld carraw peraduenture cairuoren tower walwtjc ouer south tine cockelie tower portgate halton sheles winchester rutchester heddon walhottle denton newcastell thought saint nicholas church standeth howbeit leland saith goeth within mile newcastell crooketh vp toward tinmouth vnto wallesend three mile mouth said riuer called bicause aforesaid wall end place thus much read pictish wall romane coine often found course thereof curious brick néere vnto caerleill beside excellent cornellines costlie stone alreadie intailed seales oftentimes taken vp quarter passe ouer incident purpose like maner would gladlie also haue set downe course offaes ditch march betwéene mercian dominion welshman time much tractation thereof referred place bicause thing generall whole iland omit speake also yet thus much note well report one saith tread followed dee kirnaburgh hill treuelach forrest est crekith cauch hill montgomerie castell new castell discoid hauing brought hitherto either lost sought testimonie another writing thereof saith stretched south side bristow along vnder mounteins wale northward ouer riuer sauerne verie mouth also dée falleth sea much thing concerne generall estate whole iland labour herein could verie well haue spared would quintus performed request cicero brother promised send ouer sound aduertisement condition britaine day appeareth second booke familiar epistle saith modò mihi date britanniam quam pingam coloribus tuis penicillo meo c sithence performed treatise demetrius argument perished value let trifle beseech reiected till man better skill shall haue drawne absolute péece workemanship wherevnto vnskilfulnesse hope shall prooue hinderance maruels england chap 24 haue written woonders countrie old time haue spoken doubt manie thing deserue credit therefore séeking thankes posteritie thier trauell behalfe haue reaped reward iust reproch stéed fame purchased vnto themselues nought else méere discredit better learned treatise like commonlie happeneth also respect lucre doo publish vnprofitable pernicious volume wherby doo consume time vaine manifold wise become preiudiciall vnto common wealth part touch anie man herein particularlie demetrius plutarch speaketh oracle bookes written thinke plutarch neuer wrote although eusebius lib 4 cap 8 dooth acknowledge demetrius left sundrie treatise behind conteining woonderfull thing collected iland sith time found false far vnmeet remember anie beléeue infernall spirit die giue vp ghost like mortall men though saxo séeme consent vnto behalfe speaking also iles saith thus beyond britaine manie desolate ilands whereof dedicated god noble hero sailed saith helpe king vnto one laie néere hand onelie see view found inhabitant yet reputed taken men great pietie holinesse time also remained vexed great storme tempest caused little doubt safe returne end demanding inhabitant cause great sudden mutation aire answered either god least hero latelie deceased candle said hurteth none whilest burneth stenderlie put annoieth manie filthie sauour god whilest liued either hurtfull verie beneficiall mankind deceassed mooue heauens aire much mischéefe dooth insue eftsoones vpon also inquisitiue state iles farre told one hard wherin saturne ouertaken dead sléepe watched briarous laie saturne also manie spirit attending vpon sundrie function office report easie conceiue vaine stuffe volume demetrius interlaced writer haue manie among said rable geruase tilberie least famous man euen sold vtter matter admiration credit world tale telleth de otio imperiali wandleburie hilles lie within sight south cambridge uandals incamped sometime entered iland spirit would custome moone shine night chalenged called therevnto run tilt turneie complet armor anie knight gentleman whomsoeuer place one osbert barnewell hearing report thereof armed himselfe well mounted rode thither alone one esquier called foorthwith appeared rich armour answered chalenge running togither verie fiercelie met rigor answerer ouerthrowne borne downe ground bickered foot long till osbert ouercame draue flight departed leauing horsse behind huge stature blacke saith colour furniture hue wherevpon seized giuing vnto page caried home kept till néere daie space seene manie daie light began shew selfe somewhat cléere beast stamped snorted foorthwith breaking raine ran awaie heard knowledge countrie meane season osbert verie faint waxing wearie sore wounded thigh either knew leastwise dissembled know caused legharnesse stéelebootes pulled fréends saw full bloud spilled voiage let list beléeue sith either fable deuised diuelish illusion anie thing doone mine owne behalfe hauing hope feare god eies purpose set downe either know selfe true crediblie informed godly men nothing deare speake truth anie thing odious discredit themselues liengfoure woonders england writing therefore woonders england find foure notable thing rarenesse amongst common sort taken foure miracle woonders land first vehement strong wind issueth hilles called peke violent strong certeine time man doo cast cote cloake caue whence issueth driueth backe againe hoising aloft open aire great force vehemencie also giraldus speaketh second miraculous standing rather hanging certeine stone vpon plaine salisburie whereof place called stonehenge saie truth may well woondered onelie manner position whereby become verie difficult numbred also greatnesse strange maner lieng one vpon another séemeth tickle hold men go vnder without feare present ruine stone brought thither yet read howbeit likelie raised briton slaughter nobilitie deadlie banket hengist saxon prouided also buried uortigerne king apprehended led awaie captiue haue heard like séene ireland true yet learne report goeth also brought thence ship sea cariage land thinke men safelie imagine third ample large hole vnder ground call carcer aeoli english chedderhole whereinto manie men haue entred walked verie farre howbeit passage large nothing • diuerse haue aduentured go could neuer yet find end waie neither sée anie thing pretie riuerets streames often crossed went place place chedderhole chedder rocke summersetshire thence said water run till méet second ax riseth owkie hole fourth lesse notable anie westward vpon certeine hilles man shall sée cloud gather togither faire weather vnto certeine thicknesse spread themselues abroad water field vpon sudden cause dispersion vtterlie vnknowne manie men coniecture great store water hilles verie néere hand néedfull sought besides foure maruelles little rockie ile aber barrie riueret falleth sauerne sea called barrie hath rift clift next first shore wherevnto man doo laie eare shall heare noise commonlie made smith forge wit clinking iron barres beating hammer blowing bellows like whereof superstitious sort doo gather manie toy gentile old time lame god uulcans pot riuer runneth chester changeth hir chanell euerie moneth cause whereof yet learne neither dooth swell force anie landfloud vehement wind oft ouerrunneth hir bank snowdonie two lake whereof one beareth moouable iland carried fro wind bloweth hath thrée kind fish eeles trowts perch herein resteth woonder haue one eie péece onelie situate right side head find confirmed also author well forrest gnaresborow whereof said forrest dooth take name water beside cold stix certeine period time knowne conuerteth wood flesh leaues trées mosse hard stone without alteration changing shape like also séene frog wormes like liuing creature fall find readie issue spring also leland writeth thus little aboue march banke nide riuer came saw well wonderfull nature called dropping well water thereof distilleth great rockes hard continuallie cold thereto nature thing soeuer falleth rock pit groweth néere thereto cast man hand turneth stone may saith sand fine ground issueth water hard rock cleauing vnto thing giueth time forme stone c neere vnto place winburne monasterie sometimes stood also farre bath faire wood▪ whereof take anie péece pitch ground thereabouts throw water within twelue moneths turne hard stone part hilles east southeast alderleie mile kingswood stone dailie found perfectlie fashioned like cockle mightie oisters dreame haue lien euer since floud clifts betwéene blacke head trewardeth baie cornwall certeine caue thing appeare like image guilded side take nothing shining bright ore coppar mettals readie hand found anie diligence vsed howbeit much maruelled rare thing doo thinke vnméet placed amongst woonders maister guise late still
