hath aught know manor glocestershire certeine okes doo grow whose rootes verie hard stone beside ground fertile saie man hew stake anie wood pitch earth grow take rooting beyond expectation siluecester towne also said conteine fourescore acre land within walles whereof corneground leland saith graine growing therein dooth come verie good perfection till readie cut downe euen time vanisheth away becommeth altogither vnprofitable woonder thinke tell sundrie cause neere browham west side riuer aimote wherein halle chamber office houshold cut hard rocke may increase number maruels verie much rehearsall also haue manie like one neere saint assaphs vpon banke elwie head uendrath uehan wale whereinto men haue often entred walked yet found nothing large roomes sandie ground vnder féet elsewhere sith thing strange let alone go forward rest parish landsarnam wale side stonie hill place wherein foure twentie seat hewen hard rockes cut end yet learned huge stone lieth pember guitherie parish notable carcasse affirmed lie vnder cause touch yet well doone haue remoued though onlie sée people haue great estimation reuerence also poole logh taw among blacke mounteins brecknockshire said head taw commeth swanseie hath propertie bréed fish anie cast die without recouerie peraduenture may grow throgh accidentall corruption water rather naturall force element selfe also lin wale one side beareth trowts red samons westerlie side verie white delicate heare also two welles far landien stand verie néere togither yet diuersitie nature one beareth sope maruellous fine water altogither contrarie quality litle mused considering saie participate one soile rise nigh one another haue notice giuen moreouer stone farre saint dauids verie great bed like thing raised vp man may stirre thumbe shoulder force whole bodie well farre stonie stratford conuerteth manie thing stone wale said double triple force anie edge toole quenched tegenia parcell wale noble well meane parish kilken maruellous nature much like another well seuill spaine although six mile sea ebbeth floweth twise one daie alwaies ebbing sea dooth vse flow flowing likewise sea dooth vse ebbe wherof doo fable well ladie mistresse ocean farre thence also medicinable spring called schinant old time wenefrides well edge whereof dooth breed verie odoriferous delectable mosse wherewith head smeller maruellouslie refreshed welles watercourse haue likewise time burst huge streames though season run verie softlie whereby people gather alteration estate hand one henleie croidon one also golden dale beside anderne picardie whereof common sort imagine manie thing greater sort also giue ouer run time wherof conceiue like opinion nature though great quantitie pit well langleie parke kent whereof good hap lucke read notable historie ancient chronicle saw late foolish people dreame hell kettle worthie rehearsall yet end lewd opinion conceiued may grow contempt saie thus much also pit certeine apoplexie sat king table taken vp carried king bedchamber day made end life thus much first broile raised cleargie practise archbishop would intreat like example tyrannie practised prelats sée lord souereignes rather write historie description iland wherefore refer report anselme becket sufficientlie penned anselme also making shewanselme bin verie vnwilling placed sée canturburie gaue answer letter fréends make request vnto take charge vpon secularia negotia nescio quia seire nolo eorum námque occupationes horreo liberum affectans animum voluntati sacrarum intendo scripturarum vos dissonantiam facitis verendúmque est nè aratrum sanctae ecclesiae quod anglia duo boues validi pari fortitudine ad bonum certantes id est rex archiepiscopus debeant trahere nunc oue vetula cum tauro indomito iugata distorqueatur à recto ego ouis vetula qui siquietus essem verbi dei lacte operimento lanae aliquibus possem fortassis non ingratus esse sed sime cum hoc tauro coniungitis videbitis pro disparilitate trahentium aratrum non rectè procedere c english thus secular affaire haue skill bicause know euen abhor trouble rise one desireth haue mind libertie applie whole indeuor rule scripture counsell onelie reseruing obedience vnto sée rome old cocke canturburie crew behalfe yoong cockerel see imitate demeanor may séene one example also king stephans time worthie remembred vnto whome bishop london would much sweare true subiect wherein also mainteined pope appeareth letter eugenius episcopus seruus seruorum dei dilecto christo filio stephano illustri regi anglorū salutē apostolic ā benedictionē adhaec superna prouidētia ecclesiapontifices ordinauit vt christianus populus ab eis pascua vitae reciperet tam principe seculares quàm inferioris conditionis homines ipsis pontificibus tanquam christi vicarijs reuerentiam exhiberent venerabilis siquidem frater noster robertus london episcopus tanquam vir sapiens honestus relligionis amator à nobilitate tua benignè tractandus est pro collata à deo prudentia propensiùs honorandus quia ergò sicut veritate comperimus cum animae suae salute ac snae ordinis periculo fidelitate quae ab eo requiritur astringi non potest volumus ex paterno tibi affectu consulimus quatenus praedictum fratrem nostrum super hoc nullatenus inquietes immò pro beati petri nostra reuerentia eum amorem gratiam tuam recipias cùm autem illud iuramentum praestare non possit sufficiat discretioni tuae vt simplici veraci verbo promittat quòd laesionem tibi velterrae tuae non inferat vale dat meldis 6 cal iulij thus sée king rule pleased pope like neither chalenge obedience subiects stood also good pleasure wrote like sort vnto quéene mawd matter making hir samson calfe better bring purpose passe appeareth letter insuing solomone attestante didicimus quòd mulier sapiens aedificat domum insipiens autem constructam destruet manibus gaudemus pro te deuotionis studium domino collaudamus quoniam sicut relligiosorum relatione accepimus timorem deiprae oculis habens operibus pietatis intēdis persona ecclesiasticas diligis honoras vt ergo de bono melius inspirante domino proficere valeas nobilitatē tuam domino rogamus rogando monemus exhortamur domino quatenus bonis initijs exitus meliores iniungas venerabilem fratrem nostrum robertum london episcopū pro illius reuerentia qui cùm olim diues esset pro nobis pauper fieri voluit attentiùs diligas honores apud virum tuum dilectum filium nostrum stephanum signem regem anglorum efficere studeas vt monitis hortatu cō silio tuo ipsum benignitatem dilectionem suam suscipiat pro beati petri nostra reuerentia propensiùs habeat commendatum et quia sicut veritate teste attendimus eum sine salute sui ordinis periculo praefato filio nostro astringi non posse volumus paterno sibi tibi affectu consulimus vt vobis sufficiat veraci simplici verbo promissionē ab eo suscipere quòd laesionem vel detrimentum ei velterrae suae nō inferat dat vt supra strange peeuish order religion deuised man breake expresse law god commandeth men honour obeie king prince whome part power god manifest laid open vnto v euen vnto end cardinall hostia also wrote canon paules maner couertlie incoraging stand election said robert willing giue ouer new bishoprike carefull offend king rather imagined waie kéepe still maugre displeasure yet sweare obedience vnto able performe vnto contrarie humilis dei gratia hostiensis episcopus londinensis ecclesiae canoniois spiritū consilij domino sicut rationi contraria prorsus est abijcienda petitio ita hijs quae iustè desyderantur effectum negare omninò non conuenit sanè nuper accepimus quòd londinensis ecclesia diuproprio destituta pastore communi voto pari assensu cleri populiforfitan naturalem venerabilem filium nostrum robertum eiusdem ecclesiae archidiaconum pastorem episcopum animarum suarum susceperit elegerit nouimus quidem eum esse personam quam sapientia desuper ei attributa honestas conuersationis morum reuerentia plurimùm commē dabilem reddidit inde est quòd fraternitati vestrae mandando consulimus vt proposito vestro bono quod vt credimus ex deo est vt ex literis domini papae cognoscetis non tepidè non lentè debitum finem imponatis ne tam nobilis ecclesia sub occasione huiusmodi spiritualium quod absit temporalium detrimentum patiatur ipsius námque industria credimus quòd antiqua relligio formadisciplinae grauitas habitus ecclesia vestra reparari si quae fuerint ipsius contentiones ex pastoris absentia dei gratia cooperante eodem praesente poterint reformari dat c hereby sée king stephan dealt withall albeit archbishop canturburie openlie touched herewith yet doubted dooer far might tend maintenance right prerogatiue holie church euen lesse vnquietnesse another prince iohn arundell fled rome feare head caused pope write ambitious contumelious letter vnto fouereigne restitution king letter yet extant beginning thus thomas proditionis non expers nostrae regiae maiestati insidias fabricauit pope vnderstood botome matter contented thomas depriued another archbishop chosen sted neither pride state archbishop bishop descended lower euen rakehelles clergie puddels vngodlinesse beside iniurie receiued superior k iohn dealt withall vile cistertians lincolne second reigne certes vpon iust occasion conceiued grudge ambitious demeanor vpon deniall paie summes moneie faine yéeld good grace insomuch meeting pacification appointed betwéene lincolne meanes present archbishop canturburie went oft betweene cistertian commissioner matter could finished end king himselfe came also vnto said commissioner sat chapiter house teares fell downe foot crauing pardon trespass heartilie requiring would thencefoorth commend realme praiers vnto protection almightie receiue fraternitie promising moreouer full satisfaction damage susteined build house order whatsoeuer place england please assigne confirmed charter bearing date seauen twentith nouember scotish king returned scotland departed king whereby like betweene iohn stratford edward third c man may easilie conceiue proud cleargiemen haue beene former time wholie presuming vpon primassie pope matter could alledge like brotles found among common historiographer howbeit seruing vnto place conuenient ceasse speake time go forward thing purpose speake first therefore like equall authoritie archbishop canturburie hath long since obteined prerogatiue aboue yorke although saie without great trouble sute bloudshed contention archbishop yorke neuerthelesse written printate england one contenting himselfe péece title least could gotten canturburie crowneth king yorke dooth like quéene whose perpetuall chapleine hath beene time time since determination controuersie writer doo report first also hath vnder iurisdiction number one twentie inferiour bishopstwentie one bishoprikes vnder ye see canturburie onelie foure see vnder archbishop yorke hath onlie foure reason church scotland remooued obedience vnto archbishop owne whereby greatnesse circuit iurisdiction yorke little diminished like sort seauen twentie sées haue cathedrall church wherein deanesdeanes calling knowne england conquest doo beare chéefe rule men especiallie chosen vocation learning godlinesse néere possible cathedrall church haue like maner dignity canonries still remaining vnto themcanonries héeretofore vnder popish regiment howbeit chosen idle vnprofitable person time past haue béene liuings either furnished stranger especiallie italie boy idiot least skill discharging function wherevnto called vertue stipend preaching teaching doo learnedlie set foorth glorie god ouerthrow antichrist vttermost power church called cathedrall bicause bishop dwell lie néere vnto bound keepe continuall residence within iurisdictions better ouersight gouernance word deriued cathedra saie chaire seat resteth part abideth first one church euerie iurisdiction wherinto man entred praie oblation toward maintenance pastor reputed infamie passe anie without visitation lesse reproch appeare emptie lord occasion also builded verie huge great otherwise capable multitude came dailie vnto heare word receiue sacrament number christian increased first monastery finallie parish church builded euerie iurisdiction whence take deanerie church haue originall called mother church incumbent archpréests rest added since conquest either lord euerie towne zealous men loth trauell farre willing haue ease building neere hand unto deanerie church also cleargie old time deanrie appointed repaire sundrie season receiue wholesome ordinance consult vpon necessarie affaire whole iurisdiction necessitie required image hereof yet seene north part number church increased repaire faithfull vnto cathedral diminish whereby become especiallie nether part rather market shop march • dize solemn place praier wherevnto first erected moreouer said cathedrall church vpon sunday festiuall daiesordinarie sermon canon doo make certeine wherevnto people doo verie reuerentlie repaire bishop themselues like sort idle calling exempt court councell one small péece felicitie although richard archbishop canturburie thought otherwise yet appeareth letter pope alexander epistola44 petri blesensis saith bicause cleargie time somewhat narrowlie looked vnto supra dorsum ecclesiae fabricant peccatores c applie mind setting foorth wordthe bishop preach diligentlie whose predecessor heretofore haue beene occupied temporall affair verie doo euerie sundaie offener resort place within iurisdictions expound scripture much grauitie skill yet without great mistaking contempt hate word manifold translation one sée another saie nothing doone benefit flocke preferment partie fauoured aduantage vnto prince matter time past much doubted wit whether bishop pastor might translated one sée another left vndecided till prescription roiall authoritie made good among prince thing doone well doone doone oftentimes though warrant found therefore haue vnder also archdeaconsarchdecons one diuerse two manie foure mo circuit quantitie archdeacon termed law bishop eies beside ordinarie court holden within manie seuerall deanries themselues official moneth least doo kéepe yearelie two visitation synod bishop dooth euerie third yeare wherein confirmeth child though care litle ceremonie make diligent inquisition search well doctrine behauiour minister orderlie dealing parishioner resorting parish church conformitie vnto religion punish also great seueritie trespasser either person pursse permutation penance thought gréeuous themselues among hearer onelie come knowledge presence herein also part two yoonger sort minister doo expound ech péece scripture ordinarilie appointed vnto course wherein orderlie go one euangelists epistle pleaseth whole assemblie choose first euerie conference haue spent houre little betwéene commeth one better learned sort graduat part knowne preacher sufficientlie authorised sound iudgement supplieth roome moderator making first breefe rehearsall discourse adding thinketh good owne knowledge wherby two houres thus commonlie spent profitable méeting doone first speaker haue shewed anie peece diligence commended trauell incouraged go forward haue béene found slacke sound deliuerie doctrine negligence error openlie reprooued brother go aside purpose laitie exercise ended iudge matter elsewhere twise yeare notable spurre vnto minister thereby applie bookes otherwise time past would giue themselues hawking hunting table card dice tipling alehouse shooting match like vanity nothing parlement first sort saie called ministerie without respect whether married bishop deanes archdeacon haue higher place hierarchie church elected also rest first comming vnto anie spirituall promotion doo yéeld vnto prince entire taxe liuing one whole yeare amount value vnto ten pound vpwards vnder name title first fruit v also permitted sufficient man may dispensation prince hold two liuings distant either aboue thirtie mile whereby commeth passe hir maiestie dooth reape commoditie facultie vnition two one man dooth bring oftentimes benefit one moneth meane doctrine haue peraduenture manie yeares manie exclame faculty mo good preacher want maintenance liuings mainteine déed liuing void manie sutors man would thinke report true certeine commeth triall sufficient staied men conuersation iudgement learning great number shall hardlie find one two ought yet none earnest make sute promise largelie beare better shew find fault state thing neuerthelesse doo thinke exclamation wiselie handled altogither grounded vpon rumor ambitious mind respect state thing selfe necessitie growing want able men furnish cure england vniuersities neuer able performe obserue number preacher pound c liuings hitherto hath béene vsuallie granted consent synod wherein thing decided according equitie poorer sort considered equallie burdened paie also tenth liuings prince yearelie according valuation ech hath beene latelie made neuerthelesse time past annuall voluntarie paid request king pope herevpon also hangeth pleasant storie though doone late yeares wit 1452 time cleargie séeing continuall loss king england susteined france vpon motion reléefe made granted open conuocation giue two tenth toward recouerie burdeaux grace verie thankefullie receiued fortuned also time uincentius alderman set themselues make finall end sametwelue men according vnto iustice purpose likewise euerie hundred twelue men chosen good age wisedome sworne giue sentence without respect person manner gather thing handeled day waie word wapentake came vse yet cannot tell howbeit signification declareth conceiue chiefe towne soldier serue hundred méet fetch weapon go togither thence field place seruice ordinarie custome generallie knowen amongst supposed also word rape commeth rapiendo catching snatching bicause tenant hundred wapentakes met vpon one sundrie day made quicke dispatch lord haruest great hast whether true imagination yet vncerteine therefore lieth determine anie thing thereof wherefore shall suffice haue touched maner time found england fourtie shiresfortie shire england thirtéene wale likewise thirtéene wale latter erected late yeares king henrie eight made briton welshman equall respect vnto english brought passe nation indifferentlie gouerned one law time past ordred diuerse far discrepant disagreing one another seuerall view yet easie discerned name shire england whereof first ten lie betwéene british sea thames polydor also dooth set downe kent sussex surreie hampshire barkeshire wilshire dorsetshire summerset deuon cornewall moreouer northside thames betwéene riuer trent passeth middest england polydor saith sixtéene shire whereof six lie toward east rest toward west mddest countrie essex somtime forrest saue one hundred middlesex hartfordshire suffolke norffolke cambridgeshire 12 hundred bedford huntington wher foure hundred buckingham thirtie two shire lie south trent beyond riuer haue like sort eight darbie yorke lancaster cumberland westmerland richemond wherein fiue wapentaxes accompted parcell yorkeshire taken reputed whole commots glamorgan monmouth breckenocke radnor northwales likewise six saie angleseie carnaruon merioneth denbigh flint montgomerie added england yéeld fiftie thrée shire county vnder quéenes maiestie manie county whereby easilie discerned hir power farre excéedeth offa old time highlie honored much britaine vnder subiection afterward conteined thirtie nine shire diuision made whereof spake moreouer noted diuision shiresod parcel shire alwaies counted laid togither one parcell whereof haue great maruell sith occasiō hath growen take either priuiledge like occasion better briefelie set downe part lie spend time séeking iust cause od diuision first therefore note part buckinghamshire betweene amondesham beconsfield peece hartfordshire found inuironed round countie buckingham yet directlie ouer luffeld towne buckkinghamshire find parcell oxfordshire passing two mile compasse oxfordshire diuerse doo participate much péece glocestershire lieth halfe warwikeshire halfe thereofapparell moreouer touching wearing aforesaid apparell custome weare enter chappell george chapter house order finallie doo go anie thing apperteining companie like sort weare also mantel vpon euen george go souereigne deputie maner procession king great chamber vnto chappell vnto college likewise backe againe vnto aforsaid place putting vntill supper ended auoid doone next daie resort vnto chappell also like order thence vnto diner wearing afterward said apparell vnto euening praier likewise supper time vntill auoid finished solemnitie likewise feast thirtéene chanons six twentie poore knight haue mantel order whereof chanons murreie roundell armes george red scutcheon onelie said armes anie knight order absent solemnitie vpon euen daie georgesicke absent inforced present either bodilie sickenesse absence land dooth church chappell chamber remaining prouide honorable stall king maiestie right hand place cloth estat cushion scutchion garter therein armes order also owne stall side soeuer distant king emperours owne place appointed nigh maner situation stall windsore remaine first euening praier euen george thrée clocke likewise next daie time diuine seruice vntill morning praier rest seruice ended weare meane time mantell onelie george lace without either whood collar surcete sicke doo kéepe bed dooth vse haue habit laid vpon time diuine seruice aforesaid seruice time also vpon morrow georgeoffering two chiefe knight sauing deputie souereigne himselfe absent shall offer king banner armes two sword hilt forward doone first two shall returne againe offer helme crest hauing time two herald armes going according statute lord deputie lieutenant vnto king grace time alone assisted one chiefe lord dooth deliuer offering péece gold hauing king armes herald going procéedeth offering hath thus offered prince returneth like solemnitie vnto stall next goeth againe one herald offer himselfe whose oblation made euerie knight according stals herald procéedeth offering solemnitie vsed buriall anie knight garterburiall vaine declare wherefore shew generallie doone disgrading one knight anie grieuous offense separated companie whereas otherwise signe order neuer taken vntill death doo end finish vp day therfore anie thing doone promulgation made therof maner insuing knowne vnto men n n knight noble order garter found giltie abhominable detestable crime high treasondisgrading hath traitorouslie conspired high mightie prince souereigne said order contrarie right dutie faithfull oth hath sworne taken cause therefore hath deserued deposed noble order fellowship garter may suffered traitor disloiall member remaine among faithfull knight renowned stomach bountifull prowes armes mingled noble chiualrie wherefore excellent prince supreme honorable order aduise counsell collegues willeth commandeth armes time hath deserued shall hencefoorth taken awaie throwne downe himselfe cleane cut socieitie renowmed order neuer daie reputed anie member example may hereafter beware commit like trespasse fall notorious infamie rebuke notice giuen resorteth vnto partie disgraded certeine officer diuerse late fellowes appointed take george inuestiture solemne maner hitherto honorable order hoping man offended vttering thus much sith noble order toison dor golden fléese ceremony apperteining vnto creation inuestiture six thirtie knight thereof likewise saint michaell one thirtie knight discoursed vpon large historiographer owne country without reprehension checke especiallie vincentius lupan lib 1 de mag franc cap de equitibus ordinis calleth cheualliers sans reproche thereto addeth chaine commonlie two hundred crownes least honour thereof great lawfull sell giue laie morgage would god might brooke name sans reproche generall deling time men suffer best owne country haue opinion trust haue giuen anie cause displeasure briefelie set foorth thing apperteine vnto renowmed order garter whose compasse written commonliesome think answer quéene king asked men would thinke hir losing garter maner honi soit qui mal pense much saie euill come euill thinketh verie sharpe imprecation yet contrarie word promiseth like measure meter dooth mete others yet order knight england called knight banneretsbannerets made field ceremonie cutting awaie point penant armes making banner bacheler knight higher degree allowed displaie higher degree gentleman whose ancestor knowen come william duke normandie saxon race yet remaining make none accompt much lesse british issue doo take beginning england maner time soeuer studieth seruice manie gaie thing therevnto made good cheape called master title men giue esquiers gentleman reputed gentleman euer much lesse disalowed prince dooth loose nothing gentleman much subiect tax publike paiments yeoman husbandman likewise dooth beare gladlier sauing reputation called also warres gouernment commonwealth medleth litle soeuer cost arraie arme himselfe accordinglie shew manly courage token person representeth man hath hurt himselfe peraduenture go wider buskens leg beare prouerbe saith beare bigger saile boat able susteine certes making new gentleman bred great strife sometimes amongst roman meane noui homines allowed vertues newlie séene shewed old smell ancient race latelie defaced cowardise euill life nephues defendant could make enuie hath affinitie iustice equitie forceth language malicious doo giue exalted wisdomes neuerthelesse generallie reprehended estate gentilitie short time turne great ruine countrie vsuall sending nobleman meane gentleman sonnes italie whence bring home nothing meere atheisme infidelitie vicious conuersation amibitious proud behauiour wherby commeth passe returne far worsse men went gentleman present newlie come italie went thither earnest protestant comming home could saie maner faith truth kept losse hinderance purpose susteined holding forgiuenesse onelie shewed full reuenge made another lesse forward returne thence could ad thus much foole maketh accompt religion foole loose anie part wealth come trouble constant leaning anie yéeld loose life possession stark mad worthie taken foole rest gaie bootie gate gentleman going italie hereby man may see fruit afterward looked blossom doo appéere care saith third talke god may haue prince lawes realme side men last easilie knowen haue learned italie go vp downe also england page héeles finelie apparelled whose face countenance shall sheweth master blind choise least offend much passe ouer saie anie italionates demeanor ala open manifest world yet prodigalitie error men hauing wherewith owne mainteine excess doo search high way budget cofers male stable way supplie want diuerse also coueting beare high saile doo insinuate themselues yoong gentleman noble men newlie come land case much apparant whereby good nature party onelie little impaired also liuelihoods reuenues wasted consumed yet manie yeares shall able recouer themselues verie good therefore superfluous heapes part diminished sith necessitie inforceth haue yet let wisdome moderate number shall master rid vnnecessarie charge common wealth manie théeues nation cherisheth store doo england hope maintenance manie giue themselues idlenesse otherwise would brought labour liue order like subiects whoredomes speake anie thing swearing yet found doo make first cheefe piller building consuming onlie good also health welfare manie honest gentleman citizen wealthie yeoman c vnlawfull dealing farre haue waded point farre may saile large sea therefore staie speake anie kind men returning therefore matter furthermore among thing haue saie husbandman artificer neuer excellent trade present workemanship later sort neuer fine curious eie neuer lesse strong substantiall continuance benefit buiers neither anie thing hurteth common sort artificer hast barbarous slauish desire turne penie ridding worke make spéedie vtterance ware inforceth bungle vp dispatch manie thing kept coldnesse aire time time speciallie winter dooth enuiron body maruell therefore table oftentimes plentifullie garnished nation trade hath continued v euen since verie beginning roman found knew waie vnto countrie predecessor fed largelie vpon flesh milke whereof great aboundance ile bicause applied chéefe study vnto pasturage féeding maner also welsh briton order themselues diet long liued themselues became vnited made equall english framed appetite liue maner daie verie little difference betwéene v diet scotland likewise haue giuen themselues late yeares speake vnto verie ample large diet wherein respect nature dooth make equall v otherwise far excéed v ouer much distemperate gormandize ingrosse body diuerse doo oft become vnapt anie purpose spend time large tabling bellie chéere generallie prouided vertue act lawfull anie eat vnder degrée gentleman onelie high festiuall day ala soone forgotten old time north briton giue themselues vniuersallie great abstinence time warres souldiers would often féed twise two thrée day especiallie held themselues secret could haue issue bogges mari presence enimie distresse vsed eat certeine kind confection whereof much beane would qualifie hunger aboue common expectation wood moreouer liued hearbes rootes shift serued thorough want prouision hand vsed créepe water said moorish plot vp vnto chin remaine long time onelie qualifie heat stomach violence otherwise would haue wrought béene readie oppresse hunger want sustinance day likewise taken great offense ouer eat either goose hare henne bicause certeine superstitious opinion conceiued three creature howbeit roman saie found entrance iland long yer open shipwracke made religious obseruation processe time well north south briton roman gaue ouer make difference meat doone thencefoorth also vnto day euen season wherein liue restreint anie meat either religion sake publike order england lawfull euerie man féed vpon soeuer able purchase except vpon day whereon eating flesh especiallie forbidden lawes realme order taken onelie end number cattell may better increased aboundance fish sea yeeldeth generallie receiued beside great consideration making law preseruation nauie maintenance conuenient number sea faring men would otherwise greatlie decaie meanes found whereby might increased soeuer case standeth white meat milke butter cheese neuer deere time woont accounted one chiefe stay throughout iland reputed food appertinent onelie inferiour sort whilest wealthie doo féed vpon flesh kind cattell accustomed eaten sort fish taken vpon coast fresh riuers diuersitie wild tame foules either bred iland brought ouer vnto v country maine number dish change meat nobilitie england whose cooke part musicall headed frenchman stranger doo exceed sith daie maner passeth ouer head wherein haue onelie béefe mutton veale lambe kid porke conie capon pig manie season yeeldeth also portion red fallow déere beside great varietie fish wild foule thereto sundrie delicates wherein swéet hand seafaring portingale wanting man dine one tast euerie dish standeth vse doo ech one feedeth vpon meat best liketh time beginning euerie dish notwithstanding reserued vnto greatest personage sitteth table whome drawen vp still waiter order requireth whome descendeth againe euen lower end whereby one may tast thereof rather yéeld vnto conspiracie great deale meat spéedie suppression naturall health vse necessarie meane satisfie himselfe competent repast susteine bodie withall large feeding séene gests owne person sith haue dailie much resort vnto table manie time vnlooked thereto reteine great number seruants verie requisit expedient somewhat plentifull behalfe chiefe part likewise dailie prouision brought commonlie siluer vessell degrée baron bishop vpwards colour mould whereof manie garnished siluer leastwise pewter notwithstanding seldome set table one necessitie vrgeth calleth cup drinke listeth haue hath tasted deliuered cup againe one stander making cleane pouring drinke remaineth restoreth cupbord whence fetched deuise thing brought vp first mnesteus athens conseruation honour orestes yet made expiation death adulterous parent egistus difficult atteined estimation stuffe manie become rich onelie new trade vnto murana towne néere uenice situat adriatike sea whence verie best dailie beautie doo well néere match christall ancient murrhina vas whereof man hath knowledge séene gentilitie wealthie communaltie like desire glasse neglected whereby gaine gotten purchase yet much increased benefit merchant poorest also haue glasse may sith uenecian somewhat déere content themselues made home ferne burned stone fine go one waie shard last great expense glass beside bréed much strife toward haue charge worst bestowed mine opinion bicause péeces doo turne vnto profit philosopher stone found one part hereof mixed fortie molten glasse would induce mettallicall toughnesse therevntoro bacon fall nothing hurt maner yet might peraduenture bunch batter neuerthelesse inconuenience quickelie redressed hammer whither slipped gentleman merchant keepe much one rate contenteth himselfe foure fiue six dish haue small resort generallie venison lambe especiall dish whereon merchant man himselfe liketh feed cold peraduenture sundrie cause incident féeder better warme hot short time merchant doo make ordinarie voluntarie feast world see great prouision made maner delicat meat euerie quarter countrie wherein beside often comparable herein nobilitie land seldome regard anie thing butcher vsuallie killeth reiect worthie come place case also geliffes colour mixed varietie representation sundrie floures herb tree formes beast fish foules fruit therevnto marchpaine wrought small curiositie tart diuerse hewes sundrie remember potato venerous root brought spaine portingale • y furnish vp bankets speake wherin mures lesse force crosbie rauenswath begin haue place among kind meat obteined difficultie cost commonlie taken delicat therevpon guest soonest desire feed estats doo excéed herin meane strangenesse number costlie dish forget vse like excesse wine somuch kind neither anie store sort england although haue none growing v yearelie proportion 20000 30000 tun vpwards notwithstanding dailie restreincts brought ouer vnto v wherof great méetings store neither doo meane small wine onlie claret white red french c amount fiftie six sort according number region whence come also thirtie kind italian grecian spanish canarian c whereof ueruage cate pument raspis muscadell romnie bastard tire oseie caprike clareie malmeseie least accompted bicause strength valure haue said meat stronger wine desired mean wherof old time best called theologicum bicause cleargie religious men vnto whose house manie laitie would often send bottels filled sure would neither drinke serued worst anie way mingled brued vintener naie merchant would haue thought soule haue gone streightwaie diuell haue serued best furthermore haue course nature yéeldeth fundrie sort artificiall stuffe ypocras wormewood wine must like maner succéed turnes beside stale ale strong béere neuerthelesse beare greatest brunt drinking manie sort age pleaseth bruer make béere vsed noble men table fixed standing housesbéere commonlie yeare old peraduenture two yeares tunning generall also brued march therefore called march béere household vsuallie vnder moneths age ech one coueting haue stale may sowre bread new possible hot artificerartificer husbandman make greatest accompt meat may soonest come haue quickliest readie except london company euery trade doo meet quarter day time nothing inferiour nobilitie food also consisteth principallie béefe meat butcher selleth saie mutton veale lambe porke c whereof findeth great store market adioining beside souse brawne bacon fruit pie fruit foules sundrie sort cheese butter egs c wanteth home owne prouision best hand commonlie least charge feasting also latter sort meane husbandman doo excéed maner especiallie bridales purification woman od méetings incredible tell meat consumed spent ech one bringing dish manie wife doo consult vpon alwaies consideration léefer fréend shall haue better prouision also commonlie séene bankets good man house charged thing sauing bread drink sauce houseroome fire artificer city good townes doo deale far otherwise albeit doo suffer iawes go oft clawes diuerse making good cheere doo hinder themselues men yet wiser sort handle matter well inough iunkettings therfore frugalitie deserueth commendation conclude artificer husbandman sufficientlie liberall verie fréendlie table méet merie without malice plaine without inward italian french craft subtiltie would doo man good companie among herein onelie inferiour sort somewhat blamed thus assembled talke sauoureth scurrilitie ribaldrie thing naturallie incident carter clownes thinke themselues merie welcome foolish veines behalfe neuer little restreined moreouer added méetings happen stumble vpon péece venison cup wine verie strong beere ale latter commonlie prouide appointed day thinke chéere great themselues haue fared well lord maiori haue dined well lord maior london whome belly full often sticke make comparison subiect publike officer anie citie europe may compare port countenance time office might talke somewhat great silence vsed table honorable wiser sort generallie ouer realme albeit much deserueth cōmendation belongeth gests neither muti loquaces likewise moderate eating drinking dailie séene finallie regard one hath keepe himselfe note surffetting dronkennesse cause salt meat except béefe bacon porke anie whit esteemed yet thrée may much powdered rehearsall thereof commend noble man merchant frugall artificer could cleare meaner sort husbandman countrie inhabitant verie much babbling except od yeoman whome thought meriest talketh ribaldrie wisest man speaketh fasteth among surffetting dronkennesse rather fall want héed taking wilfullie following delighting errours set mind purpose may diuers liuing home hard pinching diet small drinke hauing scarse inough soonest ouertaken come vnto bankets howbeit take generallie small disgrace happen cupshotten greefe vnto though sans remedie sith thing doone past freends also wealthier sort come house farre commonlie welcome till depart vpon first daie comming wheras good townes city london c men oftentimes complaine little roome reward fat capon plentie béefe mutton largelie bestowed vpon countrie cup wine béere napkin wipe lip hartelie welcome thought begreat interteinement therefore old countrie clearkes haue framed saieng behalfe meane vpon interteinment townesmens londoner day aboad maner primus incundus tollerabilis est que secundus tertius est vanus sed fetet quatriduanus bread land made suchbread graine soile yéeldeth neuerthelesse gentilitie commonlie prouide themselues sufficientlie wheat owne table whilest household poore neighbour shire inforced content themselues rie barl • ie yea time dearth manie bread made either bean peason otes altogither acornes among scourge poorest doo soonest tast sith least able prouide themselues better saie extremitie oft well seene time plentie dearth could easilie bring triall albeit much ground eared almost euerie place hath beene late yeares yet price corne continueth towne market without iust cause except landlord doo get licence carie corne land onelie kéepe vp peeces owne priuate gaines ruine commonwealth artificer poore laboring man able reach vnto driuen content himselfe horssecornea famine hand first séene horsse manger poore doo fall horssecorne meane beanes peason otes tare lintel theerfore true prouerbe neuer well verified hunger setteth first foot horsse manger world last rate wheate rie graine poore men feed catterpillers saie much alreadie bread made wheat haue sundrie sort dailie brought table whereof first excellent mainchet commonlie call white bread latine primarius panis primarius panis wherof budeus also speaketh first booke de asse good workemen deliuer commonlie proportion flower one bushell another make fortie cast manchet euerie lofe weigheth eight ounce ouen six ounce haue béene informed second cheat wheaton breadcheat bread named bicause colour therof resembleth graie yellowish wheat cleane well dressed coursest bran vsuallie called gurgeons pollard taken raueled kind cheat bread alsorauelled bread reteineth grosse lesse pure substance wheat sleightlie wrought vp vsed halle nobilitie gentrie oneliethe size bread verie ill kept looked vnto countrie townes market whereas either baked city good townes appointed size according price corne dooth beare statute prouided king iohn behalfe raueled cheat therfore generallie made one bushell meale two twentie pound bran sisted taken wherevnto ad gurgeons rise manchet make thirtie cast euerie lofe weighing eightéene ounce ouen sixteene ounce beside handle matter euerie bushell meale ad onelie two twentie thrée twentie pound water washing also house corne go mill whereby manchet bread excellent colour pleasing eie otherwise would next sort named browne bread colourbrowne bread haue two sort one baked vp cōmeth mill neither bran floure anie whit diminished celsus called autopirus panis lib 2 putteth second place nourishment hath little floure left therein howbeit callech panem cibarium panis cibarius onlie woorst weakest sort also appointed old time seruants slaues inferiour kind people féed vpon herevnto likewise bicause drie brickle working hardlie made vp handsomelie loaues adde portion rie meale time whereby rough drinesse drie roughnes therof somwhat qualified named miscelin bread made mingled corne albeit diuerse doo sow mingle wheat rie set purpose mill come sell market vnder aforesaid name champeigne country much rie barleie bread eatensummer wheat win • er bar • eie verie rare england especiallie wheat scant geson difference betwéene summer winter wheat husbandman know sith neither acquainted summer wheat winter barleie yet find sort speciallie north kendall call march wheat also summer rie small quantity dare pronounce greatlie common among v drinkedrinke whose force continuance partlie touched alreadie made barleie water hop sodden mingled togither industrie bruers certeine exact proportion barleie doo come vnto hand susteineth great alteration conuerted malt making whereof set downe order skill therein may extend vnto scarse good malster chiefelie forreine writer haue attempted describe samemalt making beere wherein haue shot farre wide quantitie ground betwéene themselues marke meane time beare gentle reader beséech thée lead thee description plentifull diet countrie vnto fond report seruile trade rather table delicatelie furnished mustie malthouse thy hap wherfore praie thée contented malt made yeare long great townes gentleman yeoman housesmaking malt commonlie make sufficient owne expense onelie winter halfe thought méet commoditie howbeit malt made willow dooth bud commonlie worst neuerthelesse one indeuoureth make best barleie steeped cesterne greater lesse quantitie space thrée day three night vntill throughlie soked doone water drained little little till quite gone afterward take laieng vpon cleane floore round heape resteth vntill readie shoote root end maltster call comming beginneth therefore shoot maner saie come foorthwith spread abroad first thicke afterward thinner thinner vpon said floore commeth lieth turning euerie daie foure fiue time space one twentie day least workeman suffering anie wise take anie heat whereby bud end spire bringeth foorth blade ouersight hurt stuffe selfe malt would spoiled turne small commoditie bruer hath gone béene turned long vpon floore carie kill couered haire cloth giue gentle heat haue spread verie thin abroad till drie meane turne often may vniformelie dried dried yet must doone soft fire swéeter better malt longer continue whereas dried downe call slackelie handled bréed kind worme called wiuell groweth floure corne processe time eat selfe nothing shall remaine graine euen verie rind huske best malt tried hardnesse colour looke fresh yellow hew thereto write like péece chalke haue bitten kirnell sunder middest may assure selfe dried downe •••• place dried leisure wood alone strawe alone wood strawe togither strawe dried excellent wood dried malt brued beside drinke higher colour dooth hurt annoie head vsed thereto bicause smoake also vse indifferentlie doo barke cleaue drie wood ouen thereby remooue moisture shuld procure fume malt second place likewise made dried firze broome c whereas also occupied gréene maner preiudiciall corne moist wood thus much malt bruing whereof grinde somewhat groselie séething well liquor shall put vnto adde euerie nine quarter mault one headcorne consisteth sundrie graine wheate otes groond haue doo matter rather great quantitie wherewith acquainted neuerthelesse sith haue taken occasion speake bruing exemplifie proportion best skilled bicause vsuall rate mine owne familie moneth practised wife hir maid seruants procéed withall maner hath informed hauing therefore groond eight bushel goodbruing beere malt vpon querne toll saued addeth vnto halfe bushell wheat meale much otes small groond tempereth mixeth malt cannot easilie discerne one otherwise later would clunter fall lump thereby become vnprofitable first liquor full eightie gallon according proportion furnace maketh boiling hot powreth softlie malt resteth without stirring vntill hir second liquor almost readie boile doone letteth hir mash run till malt left without liquor leastwise greatest part moisture perceiueth staie soft issue thereof time hir second liquor furnace ready séeth put also malt first woorst also againe furnace wherevnto addeth two pound best english hop letteth seeth togither space two houres summer houre halfe winter whereby getteth excellent colour continuance without impeachment anie superfluous tartnessecharwoore putteth hir first woort furnace mingleth hop taketh vessell full eight nine gallon shutteth vp close suffereth aire come till become yellow reserueth selfe vnto vse shall appeare hereafter calling brackwoort charwoort saith addeth also colour drinke whereby yeeldeth vnto amber fine gold hew vnto eie time also hir second woort let runne first taken furnace placed coole returneth middle woort vnto furnace striken ouer whence taken againe beginneth boile mashed second time whilest third liquor heat thrée liquor last put furnace second mashed againe hath mashed also last liquor set second coole first letteth runne séetheth againe pound halfe new hop peraduenture two pound séeth cause goodnesse basenesse hop hath sodden summer two houres winter houre halfe striketh also reserueth vnto mixture rest time dooth serue therefore finallie setteth hir drinke togither addeth hir brackwoort charwoort halfe ounce arras halfe quarterne ounce baiberries finelie powdered putting hir woort handfull wheat flowre procéedeth vsuall order common bruing requireth stéed arras bay adde much long pepper onelie hir opinion liking good first hereof make thrée hoggesheads good beere meane méet poore men liue withall whose small maintenance great thing fortie pound yeare computatis computandis able performe may indure déeper cut charge whereof groweth manner value malt ten shilling wood foure shilling buie hop twentie penny spice two penny seruants wage two shilling six penny meat drinke wearing vessell twentie penny twentie shilling haue ten score gallon béere notwithstanding losse seething loth forgo doo obserue time therefore spéed thereafter successe worthilie continuance drinke alwaie determined quantitie hop well hopped lasteth longer féedeth vpon hop holdeth long force continueth extinguished drinke must spent else dieth becommeth value trade also bruers obserue verie diligentlie nature water dailie occupie soile passeth water like goodnesse sith fattest standing water alwaies best although water run chalke cledgie soiles good next vnto thames water excellent yet water standeth either best v dwell countrie whereon sunne lieth longest fattest fish bred • ennie morish worst cléerest spring water next vnto busines therfore skilfull workeman dooth redeeme iniquitie element changing proportion trouble ale sometime onelie taken manie old sickmens drinke neuer séene heard howbeit beere well sodden bruing stale cleere well coloured muscadell malueseie rather yellow gold noble potknights call ale verie little sodden without hop thicke fulsome continuance thrée notable thing considered liquor certes know aleknights much addicted therevnto ceasse morow vntill euen visit clensing house house till defile themselues either fall woman locke manie time cut aboue vnder eares round woodden dish neither meddle varietie beardsbeards shauen chin like turk cut short like beard marque otto made round like rubbing brush pique de vant fine fashion suffered grow long barber growen cunning behalfe tailor therefore man haue leane streight face marquesse ottons cut make broad large platter like long slender beard make séeme narrower wesell becked much heare left chéekes make owner looke big like bowdled hen grim goose cornelis chelmeresford saie true manie old men doo weare beard lustie courtier also gentleman courage doo weare nation round v wherein like polypus chameleon therevnto bestow cost vpon arses much vpon rest body woman doo likewise vpon head shouldersexcesse woman woman also lamented doo farre excéed lightnesse men neuerthelesse transformed cap euen verie shoo staring attire time past supposed méet none light housewiues onelie become habit chast sober matrones saie doublet pendant codpéeses brest full iags trulles london disguised hath passed skill discerne whether men woman thus come passe woman become men men transformed monster good gift almightie god hath giuen vnto v reléeue necessity withall entrance presentation house wherein declareth good liking king hath conceiued choise vnto office function admitted maketh fiue request vnto honorable assembliepetitions speaker first house may time past inioy hir former liberty priuileges secondlie congregates may frankelie shew mind vpon matter come question thirdlie anie lower house doo giue anie cause offense continuance assemblie may inflict resolued fiftlie last craueth pardon himselfe going fro betweene house forget mistake anie thing requiring may returne better informed thing faile without offense vnto petition lord chancellor dooth answer apperteineth doone first daie peraduenture second could conuenientlie performed first beside lord chancellor another vpper house called clerke parlementclerke parlement whose office read billes euerie thing commeth consultation either house first put writing paper read listeth riseth vp speaketh either one another long shall thinke good doone go another third c instrument still wholie part raced reformed cause moueth amendment substance reputed necessarie vpper house lord chancellor demandeth haue ingrossed saie put parchment doone read third time debating matter fro part doo conclude withall vpon vtterance word ye contended enacted clerke writeth vnderneath baille aux common sée time send billes approued common sit wooll sackes comming house demanding licence speake doo vse kind word like speaker sir thomas smith dooth deliuer set downe whose onelie direction vse almost word word chapter requiting like borowage hath vsed toward discourse sundrie degrées estate commonwealth england hope shall discredit trauell master speaker lord vpper house haue passed amongst thinke good enacted parlement act act reading title sort receiued praie therefore consider shew aduise vpon doone go waie doore shut speaker declareth message sent vnto void consultation vpon anie bill presentlie demandeth pleasure first one another c solemnelie read content bréeflie shewed debated vpon among speaker sitteth chair erected somewhat higher restof nether house may see séene men lower seat sitteth clerke readeth bils first propounded lower house sent downe lord point house hath equall authoritie propound thinke méet either abrogation old making new lawes bils thrise diuerse day read disputed vpon come question whether shall enacted discourse vpon verie good order vsed lower house wherein speake giueth notice thereof standing vp bare headed manie stand vp happeneth speaketh first first seene moue place telleth tale vnto speaker without rehersall name whose speches meaneth confute perpetuall oration altercation discourse continued partie confuted may replie daie one man speake twise one bill one daie though would change opinion next may speake againe yet afore vile seditious vnreuerent biting word vsed assemblie yet anie happen escape vttered partie punished according censure assemblie custome behalfe afternoone sit except vpon vrgent occasion neither hath speaker anie voice house wherewith moue dissuade furtherance staie anie bill office vpon reading thereof breeflie declare content anie bill passe commeth vnto lord thus subscribed le common ont assentus lord agree vpon anie bill sent vnto common subscribed maner le seigniours ont assentus agreed thrise reading conference required betwéene vpper nether house certeine appointed purpose vpon point question wherevpon finall agréement part obteined bill dashed reiected saieng cleane cast doores none nether house giue voice proxie owne person bill twise read ingrossed third time read againe discoursed vpon speaker asketh go question whervnto agree holdeth vp bill saith manie haue bill go forward saie yea hervpon manie allow thing crie yea crie lesse either side bill staie else go forward mundum vt ab eo lumine accendamur igne claritatis tuae et sicut igne illuminasti mosen ita nunc illumina corda nostra sensus nostros vt ad vitam aeternam mereamur peruenire per christum c lord god brightnesse thou diddest lighten moses illuminate heart sens may deserue come euerlasting life christ c ended let say pater noster c word saluum fac seruum c mitte ei auxilium deus c de sion tuere eum priest go masse doo order requireth hath receiued host shall call man purged written hereafter first adiuring permitting communicate according maner office masse iustus e domine c lord thou art iust c praier absolue quaesumus domine delicta famulus tui vt à peccatorum suorum nexibus quae pro sua fragilitate contraxit tua benignitate liberetur hoc iudicio quoad meruit iustitia tua praeueniente ad veritatis censuram peruenire mereatur per christum dominum c pardon beséech thée lord sinnes thy seruant deliuered burden offense wherewith intangled may cleared thy benignitie triall far hath deserued thy mercie preuenting may come knowledge truth christ lord c gospell mar 10 illo tempore cùm egressus esset iesus via procurrens quidam genuflexo ante eum rogabat eum dicens magister bone quid faciam vt vitam aeternam percipiam iesus autem dixit ei quid dicis bonum c day iesus went foorth toward iourneie one méeting waie running knéeling vnto asked saieng good master shall doo may possesse eternall life iesus said vnto whie callest thou good c followeth secret foorth rest masse partie dooth communicate priest shall vse word vnto adiuro te per patrem filium spiritum sanctum per veram christianitatem quam suscepisti per sanctas relliquias quae ista ecclesia sunt per baptismum quo te sacerdos regenerauit vt non praesumas vllo modo communicare ne que accedere ad altare si hoc fecisti aut consensisti c adiure thée father sonne holie ghost true christendome thou hast receiued holie relikes church baptisme wherewith priest hath regenerated thée thou presume maner mean communicate come altar thou hast doone consented vnto whereof thou art accnsed c let priest suffer communicate saieng corpus hoc sanguis domini nostri iesu christi sit tibi ad probationem hodie bodie bloud lord iesus christthe cup yet vse vnto thee triall daie praier perceptis domine deus noster sacris muneribus supplices deprecamur vt huius participatio sacramenti à proprijs no reatibus expediat conspectum mosis minimè comburi permisisti deus qui de incendio fornacis chaldaicis plerísque succensis tres pueros tuos illaesos eduxisti deus qui incendio ignis populum sodomae inuoluens loth noticiam nulla vnquam secreta effugiunt fidei nostrae tua bonitate responde praesta vt quisquis purgandi se gratia hoc ignitum tulerit ferrum vel absoluatur vt innocens vel noxius detegatur c english yeares law made power wax feeble discord fell amongst themselues able mainteine warres roman raise anie iust armie riuer runing one streame swift plentifull water drained drawne manie branch land good vttered excessiue taking monie abide small gaine extend treatise farre greater volume conuenient purpose wherfore shall suffice haue set downe much demeanour much euen enough cause looke somewhat poorest men commonlie contentiouspoore men contentious refuse haue cause heard néere home indeuoureth rather vtter vndooing trauell vp london thinking soonest preuaile aduersarie though case neuer doubtfull toie welshman doo excéed euer heard shall haue one od poore dauid giuen much contention strife without respect charge vp london though go bare legged waie carie hosen necke saue foot wearing bicause hath change commeth also make importunate begging countrimen hard shift otherwise sometimes carie downe six seuen writ pursse wherewith molest neighbor though greatest quarrell scarselie worth withall number poore men dailie abused vtterlie vndoone sundrie varlet go countrie promoter broker betwéene pettie foggers lawe common people onelie kindle espie coales contention whereby one side may reape commoditie spend put trauell euer knew essex denis mainford excelled till iohn ludlow aliàs mason came place vnto whome comparison two child last lesse thrée foure yeares bring one man among manie elsewhere place almost extreame miserie beggerie vttermost shauing beard valued two hundred pound speake least finallie feeling sufficient wherwith susteine himselfe familie also satisfie greedie rauenour still called vpon new fées went bed within foure day made end wofull life euen care pensiuenesse death also handled sonne neuer shéepe shorne maie néere clipped fléece present manie come compelled let awaie land bicause cattell stocke consumed longer able occupie ground hereof let suffice stéed enormity table shall follow termes conteining beginning ending haue borrowed fréend iohn stow whose studie onelie store house antiquity time worthie therefore reputation honour man would imagine time execution lawesthe time termes hinderance iustice little aboue one quarter fullie third part yeare appointment holden one place onelie wit neere london westminster finallie great expense emploied vpon small cause staie hinderance administration iustice land falleth prooue great occasion staie much contention reason soone conceiued broken sleeue dooth hold elbow backe paine trauell cause manie sit home quiet shortnesse time feare delaie dooth driue oftentimes like peace otherwise would liue strife quickelie od men desirous gaines would haue termes yet made shorter delaie might ingender longer sute would haue house made larger office erected wherein minister lawes time tearmes rather short long one returne péece smaller roomes fowler way vnto would inforce manie make paw rashlie enter plée sith purpose make ample discourse thing shall suffice deliuer time holding termes insueth manner perfect rule know beginning ending euerie terme returnes hilarie terme beginneth three twentieth daie ianuarie sundaie otherwise next daie finished twelfe februarie hath foure returnes octabis hilarij quind hilarij crastino purific octabis purific ¶easter terme beginneth seuentéene day easter endeth foure day ascension daie hath fiue returnes quind pasch tres paschae mense paschae quinque paschae crast ascention ¶trinitie terme beginneth fridaie trinitie sundaie endeth wednesdaie fortnight time hath foure returnes crast trinitatis octabis trinitatis quind trinitatis tres trinitatis ¶michaelmasse terme beginneth ninth october sundaie ending eight twentith nouember hath eight returnes octabis michael quind michael tres michael mense michael crast anima crast martini octa martini quind martini note also escheker fiscus aerarum publicum principis openeth eight day anie terme begin except trinitie terme openeth foure day thus much vsuall termes kept feast blase shall euerie court day obserued order may kept conuenientlie marke although ashwednesdaie put seuenth order yet hath certeine place changed course easter causeth easter terme fiftéenth doo find much diligent inquirie saxon prince ordeined lawe howbeit generallie gather thereof deuised traine inhabiters land loue learning contemned letter good knowledge men onelie giuing themselues husbandrie warres like whereof read haue beene amongst gothes uandals time would suffer euen prince lerned weakening courage anie learned men remaine counsell house open proclamation would command auoid whensoeuer anie thing touching state land consulted vponpirats pirats robber sea condemned court admeraltie hanged shore lowe water marke left till three tide haue ouer washed finallie hauing wals bank néere vnto sea doo suffer decaie conuenient admonition whereby water entereth drowneth vp countrie certeine ancient custome apprehended condemned staked breach remaine euer parcell foundation new wall made vpon haue heard reported thus much part administration instice vsed countrie wherein notwithstanding doo often heare horrible merciles wilfull murthers meane asiare sildome gentleman oftentimes doo beare port able mainteine secondlie seruingmen whose wage cannot suffice much find bréeches wherefore constreined either kéepe high way breake wealthie men house first sort else walke vp downe gentleman rich farmer pasture sée view horsses féed best whereby manie time get something although hard aduenture hath béene knowne confession gallowes one chapman hath fortie fiftie sixtie stolne horsses pasture abroad countrie time haue sold faires market farre themselues meane season taken home honest yeoman verie wealthie drouers till dealing haue bewrated long since one companie apprehended time reputed verie honest wealthie townesman vttered also horsses anie trade sold reasonable peniworth faire spoken man custome likewise saie anie man hucked hard price gelding god helpe gentleman sir either cost much else iesus stole talke plaine inough yet estimation beleeued first part tale made account later truer indeed third annoiers commonwealth roges doo verie great mischeefe place become wheras rich onelie suffer iniurie fir • two spare neither rich poore whether great gaine small fish commeth net yet saie rest trussed vp apace one yeare commonlie wherein three hundred foure 〈◊〉 deuoured eaten vp gallowes one place appeareth cardane writeth vpon report bishop lexouia geniture king edward sixt henrie eight executing law verie seuerelie idle person meane great theeues pettie théeues roges hang vp thréescore twelue thousand time seemed greatlie haue terrified rest since death number increased yea although haue warres great occasion breed custome idle sort hauing serued séene side sea vnder colour seruice shake hand labour euer thinking disgrace himselfe returne vnto former trade except better order taken lawes alreadie made better executed dwell vplandish townes little village shall liue small safetie rest better apprehension also theeues mankillers old law england verie well prouided whereby ordered robbed man complaine giue next constable one constable serch made aduertise another parish parish till come offendor harbored found also prouided anie parish businesse doo hir dutie suffereth théefe auoiding trouble sake carrieng gaile apprehended letting worke escape parish onlie make fine king also whole hundred wherein standeth repaie partie robbed damage leaue estate harmlesse certes good law howbeit haue knowne mine owne experience fellons taken haue escaped stock rescued want watch gard théeues haue beene let passe bicause couetous greedie parishoners would neither take paine charge carrie prison far hue crie haue béene made euen face constable haue said god restore losse haue businesse time meanes meaning manie good law left vnexecuted malefactor imboldened manie poore man turned hath swet taken thin diet princelike habitation palace like sort euerie countrie house thus apparelled side inwardlie diuided sundrie roomes aboue beneath plentie wood couer tile otherwise straw sedge réed except quarrie • ate néere hand whence haue monie much may suffice claie wherewith house impanelled either white red blue first dooth participat verie much nature chalke second called lome third eftsoones changeth colour soone wrought notwithstanding looke blue throwne pit chalke also haue excellent asbestos white lime made place wherewith quenched strike ouer claie workes stone wals city good townes rich farmer gentleman house otherwise steed chalke wanteth scant place sold pound compelled burne certeine kind red stone wale else stone shels oisters like fish found vpon sea coast conuerted lime doth naturallie abhorre eschew water whereby dissolued neuerthelesse desire oile wherewith easilie mixed haue seene experience within doores also • bilit • doo oft make floores parget fine alabaster burned call plaster paris whereof place haue great plentie verie profitable rage fire plastering likewise fairest house ouer head vse laie first laine two white morter tempered haire vpon lath nailed one another sometimes vpon reed wicker dangerous fire made fast saplaths falling downe finallie couer aforesaid plaster beside delectable whitenesse stuffe selfe laied euen smoothlie nothing iudgment doone exactnesse wals house inner side like sort either hanged tapisterie arras worke painted cloth wherin either diuerse history hearbes beast knot like stained else seeled oke owne wainescot brought hither east country whereby roomes little commended made warme much close otherwise would stooues haue hitherto vsed greatlie yet doo begin made diuerse house gentrie wealthie citizen build worke feed germanie else sweat occasion néed shall require also hath béene common england contrarie customes nation yet séene example stréets london many greatest house haue outwardlie béene verie simple plaine sight inwardlie haue beene able receiue duke whole traine lodge ease hereby moreouer come passe front stréets haue béene vniforme orderlie builded forrei • e city saie truth vtterside mansion dwelling haue oft cost bestowed vpon rest house often verie simple vneasie within experience dooth confirme old time countrie house steed glasse vse much lattise made either wicker fine rift oke chekerwise read also better sort time saxon notwithstanding vsed glasse also since time benedict biscop moonke brought feat glasing first land make panel horne stéed glasse fix woodden calmes horne window quite laid downe euerie place lattises also growne lesse vse bicause glasse come plentifull within verie little good cheape better find obscure mention specular stone also haue béene found applied vse england doubtfull sort dare affirme certeine neuerthelesse certeine antiquitie vsed glasse knowen vnder name selenites glasse first found care greatlie remember euen present although directlie beside purposed matter syria phenices bordereth vpon iurie néere foot mount carmell moore marri wherout riseth brooke called somtime belus falleth sea néere ptolemais riuer fondlie ascribed vnto baall also honored vnder name infidel long time anie king israell came passe also certeine merchant sailed waie loden nitrum passenger went land repose themselues take store fresh water vessell also shore kindled fire made prouision dinner bicause wanted treuets slones whereon set kettels ran chance ship brought great péeces nitrum serued turne present short said substance hot beginning melt mixed chance grauell laie vnder brought foorth shining substance called glasse time semiramis companie saw made small accompt successe foorthwith began practise like mixture whereby great varietie said stuffe also insue certes time historie may well true read glasse iob rest refer common opinion conceiued writer turne againe windowes heretofore also house prince noble men often glased berill example whereof yet séene sudleie castell diuerse place fine christall especiallie time roman wherof also fragment haue béene taken vp old ruines vse onelie clearest glasse estéemed haue diuerse sort brought burgundie normandie much flanders beside made england would good best diligent carefull bestow cost vpon yet one may haue building moreouer mansion house countrie townes village champaine ground stand altogither stréets ioining one woodland soiles dispersed one vpon seuerall ground owner builded sort generallie haue neither dairie stable bruehouse annexed vnto vnder roofe manie place beyond sea north part countrie separate first one another yet farre distant sunder goodman lieng bed may lightlie heare doone ease call quicklie vnto meinie anie danger attach ancient manours house gentleman yet part strong timber framing whereof carpenter haue beene worthilie preferred like science among nation howbeit latelie builded cōmonlie either bricke hard stone roomes large comelie house office distant lodging nobilitie likewise wrought bricke hard stone prouision may best made magnificent statelie basest house baron dooth often match day honour prince old time euer curious building florish england yeares wherin workemen excell maner comparable skill old vitruuius leo baptista serlo neuerthelesse estimation gréedie seruile couetousnesse ioined lingering humour causeth often reiected stranger preferred greater bargaines reasonable taking lesse waster time great deale owne furniture house also exceedeth growne maner euen passing delicacie herein doo speake nobilitie gentrie onelie likewise lowest sort place south countrie haue anie thing take certes noble men house rare sée abundance arras rich haugings tapistrie siluer vessell much plate may furnish sundrie cupbords summe oftentimes thousand two thousand pound least whereby value rest stuffe dooth grow almost inestimable likewise house knight gentleman merchantman wealthie citizen geson behold generallie great prouision tapistrie turkie worke pewter brasse fine linen thereto costlie cupbords plate worth fiue six hundred thousand pound deemed estimation herein sort doo far excéed elder predecessor neatnesse curiositie merchant time past costlie furniture staied whereas descended yet lower euen vnto inferiour artificer manie farmer vertue old new lease haue part learned also garnish cupbords plate ioined bed tapistrie silke hanging table carpet fine naperie whereby wealth countrie god praised therefore giue v grace imploie well dooth infinitelie appeare neither doo speake reproch anie man god iudge shew reioise rather sée god hath blessed v good gift whilest behold time wherein thing growne excessiue price commoditie euer dailie plucked communaltie looke euerie trade doo yet find mean obtein atchiue furniture heretofore hath beene vnpossible old men yet dwelling village remainethree thing greatlie amended england haue noted three thing maruellouslie altred england within sound remembrance three thing much increased one ischimnies multitude chimnies latelie exected wheras yoong day two thrée manie vplandish townes realme religious house manour place lord alwaies excepted peraduenture great personage ech one made fire reredosse hall dined dressed meat second great although generall amendment lodging said father yea selues also haue lien full oft vpon straw palletshard lodging rough mat couered onelie shéet vnder couerlets made dagswain hopharlots vse owne termes good round log vnder head steed bolster pillow father good man house within seuen yeares mariage purchased matteres flockebed thereto sacke chaffe rest head vpon thought himselfe well lodged lord towne peraduenture laie seldome bed downe whole fethers well contented base kind furniture also verie much amended yet part bedfordshire elsewhere southerne part pillowes said thought méet onelie woman childbed seruants anie shéet aboue well seldome anie vnder body kéepe pricking straw ran oft canuas pallet rased hardened hide third thing tell offurniture household exchange vessell treene platter pewter woodden spoones siluer tin common sort tréene stuffe old time man hardlie find foure péeces pewter one peraduenture salt good farmer house yet frugalitie may iustly called scarse able liue paie rent day without selling cowthis time generall idlenesse horsse although paid foure pound vttermost yeare also pouertie one od farmer husbandman béene alehouse thing greatlie vsed day amongst six seuen neighbour brauerie shew store cast downe pursse therein noble six shilling siluer vnto men cared gold bicause readie paiment oft inforced giue penie exchange angell verie likelie rest could laie downe much whereas time although peraduenture foure pound old rent improued fortie fiftie hundred pound yet farmer another palme date trée thinke gaines verie small toward end terme haue six seuen yeares rent lieng therewith purchase new lease beside faire garnish pewter cupbord much od vessell going house thrée foure featherbed manie couerlids carpet tapistrie siluer salt bowle wine whole neast dozzen spoones furnish vp sute also taketh owne cléere stocke monie soeuer gathereth laieth vp yeares often séene landlord take order renueth lease commonlie eight six yeares old expired sith growen almost custome come lord long another shall step reuersion defeat right shall neuer trouble haire beard barber hath washed shauen chin commend beside decaie housekéeping whereby poore haue beene relieued speake also thrée thing growen verie grieuous vnto wit inhansing rent latelie mentioned dailie oppression copiholders whose lord séeke bring poore tenant almost plaine seruitude miserie dailie deuising new meanes séeking vp old cut shorter shorter doubling trebling seuen time increasing fine driuing also euerie trifle loose forfeit tenure whome greatest part realme dooth stand mainteined end may fléece yet lamentable hering third thing talke vsurie trade brought iewes perfectlie practised almost euerie christian commonlie accompted foole dooth lend monie nothing time past sors pro sorte principall onelie principall beside aboue principall properlie called vsura chalenge foenus commoditie soile fruit earth ground selfe time past also one hundred much thence rose vnto two called latine vsura ex sextante thrée wit ex quadrante foure wit ex triente fiue ex quincunce six called ex semisse c accompt assis ariseth comming last vnto vsura ex asse amounteth twelue hundred therefore latines call centesima hundred moneth doubleth principall elsewhere see cicero verres demosthenes aphobus athenaeus lib 13 fine thou hast read well helpe praie thée lawfull maner hang vp take centū pro cento yeare better worthie doo iudge conscience forget also landlord vse value lease secret estimation giuen wealth credit taker whereby séeme cat vp deale bondman leassée thought worth hundred pound shall paie lesse new terme else another enter hard doubtfull couenants sorie report much gréeued vnderstand practise sorowfull vnderstand men great port countenance farre suffering farmer haue anie gaine themselues become grasiers butcher tanner shéepmasters woodman denique quid non thereby inrich themselues bring wealth countrie owne hand leauing communaltie weake idoll broken féeble armes may time peace haue plausible shew necessitie shall inforce haue heauie bitter sequele city townes england cap 13 old time read thatsix twentie city england eight twentie flamen archflamines south part ile manie great city vnder iurisdiction day one two fewer also vnder ecclesiasticall regiment one bishop archbishop spirituall case haue charge ouersight manie city therefore england wale bishopriks archbishopriks notwithstanding lichfield couentrie bath welles doo séeme extend aforesaid number vnto nine twentie yet neither couple accounted one entier citie sée bishop sith one bishoprike haue relation vnto one sée said see situate one place bishop dooth take name appeareth old ancient history city southerlie portion haue beene excéeding greatnesse beautie whereof builded time samotheans time quite decaied place stood worne remembrance also part yet remaine maruellouslie altered insomuch whereas first large ample come either vnto verie house appeare much greater comparison poore simple village antoninus diligent writer thorough fare britaine noteth among ancient townes following sitomagus sitomagus nouiomagus neomagus niomagus placeth waie norwich leland supposeth wherin went colchester london nouiomagus lieth betwéene carleill canturburie within ten mile east london likewise neomagus niomagus take name first founder magus sonne samothes second king celtes reigned iland profunditate onelie bodinus affirmeth plinie townes ended magus stand hole low ground disprooued diuerse city maine also v moreouer sir thomas eliot supposeth neomagus haue stood somewhere chester george lillie booke name ancient place iudgeth niomagus verie doo call buckingham lieth farre shore sundrie perished tooke denomination prince diuerse causessalisburie sarron mooue coniecture salisburie dooth rather take first name sarron sonne said magus caesar caradoc seuerus writer doo imagine else least wise salisburge maine whence saxon came inhabit land later vnlikelie sith comming saxon king suessionenses great part iland subiection caesar saith another place belgie stale ouer hither maine builded called diuerse city name whence came meane stood vpon coast himselfe dooth witnesse sith coniectures veritiessarronium sarrous burg mine opinion one man iudgement stand vpon proofe matter least séeme take great paine adding new coniectures vnto old wise deteine head reader trifle otherwise peraduenture would farre better occupied matter importance procéed refore
