walles verolamlum small knowledge ruines beautie citie selfe shall partlie vnderstand followeth hand haue told better intelligence municipium romanorum great difference betweene colonia romanorum sith colonia alio traducitur ciuitate rom municipes aliundè ciuitatem veniunt suis que iuribus legibus viuuni moreouer soile changed nature romane liue stedfast fréendship protection roman somtime ceretes first people euer obteined priuilege british verolamians therefore hauing noble seruice warres deserued great commendation hand roman gaue vnto whole fréedome roman whereby made municipes became frée truth colony could conclude therefore municipium citie franchised indued romane priuileges without anie alteration hir former inhabitant priuileges whereas colonie companie sent rome anie region prouince possesse either citie newlie builded replenish whence hir former citizen haue beene expelled driuen proceed time king edgar fell one eldred abbat desirous inlarge house came mind search ruines verolamium ouerthrowne furie saxon dane sée might come anie curious peeces worke wherewith garnish building taken hand short sooner begun dig among rubbis found excéeding number pillers péeces antike worke threshold doore frame sundrie peeces fine masonrie windowes like verie conuenient purpose also porphyrite stone diuerse kind marble touch alabaster beside manie curious deuises hard mettall finding whereof thought himselfe happie man successe greatlie guided albane besides also found sundrie pillers brasse socket latton alabaster touch laid aside great heap determining end saie laie foundation new abbaie god preuented determination death tooke awaie building begun succéeded one eadmeerus followed dooings eldred vttermost therefore onlie perused left great diligence also caused pioners search yet within old walles verolamium onelie found infinite péeces excellent workemanship came last certeine vault vnder ground stood diuers idol altar verie superstitiouslie religiouslie adorned pagan left belike time necessitie image sundrie mettals pure gold altar likewise richlie couered ornament edmerus tooke awaie onelie conuerted vse building also destroied innumerable sort idol whose estimation consisted formes substance could doo seruice tooke vp also sundrie curious pot iugs crus stone wood artificiallie wrought carued quantitie besides infinite store fine houshold stuffe whole furniture citie beene brought thither purpose hidden vault proceeding tooke vp diuerse pot gold siluer brasse glasse earth whereof filled ash bone gentils mouth turned brake péeces melting mettall reserued like sort garnishing church found likewise stone wall two old bookes whereof one conteined rite gentils sacrifice god saie martyrdome saint albanethis soundeth like lie written old brittish letter either bicause man liuing could read woorth keeping consumed ash sauing note first taken later concerning death albane thus much haue thought good note former beautie verolamium whereof infinite token haue beene found since time diuerse within memorie man passing workemanship like whereof hath whers else béene séene anie ruines within compasse ile either cost quantitie stuffe furthermore whereas manie afraid saie thames came sometimes citie indeed nothing uerlume afterward called uere mure dooth still whatsoeuer gildas talketh hereof whose book may corrupted behalfe yet euident proofe confirmed experience albeit riuer growne verie small reason ground higher old time yet kéepeth maner old course runneth betwéene old citie new towne standing holmehirst crag beheld late place also medow beneath abbaie sometimes great lake mere poole said riuer ran read verie swift violent course wheras present verie slow deapth ancient time hath beene heare mine author saith aforsaid workemen digged ruines happened oftentimes vpon lempet shels péeces rustie anchor kéeles great vessel wherevpon gathered either thames arme sea beat vpon towne vnderstanding thing might aswell happen great lake mere wherof one adioining north side citie laie men thinke vnwalled also false vpon occasion summer passed saw remnant old wals standing place appeared haue béene verie substantiallie builded ruines likewise greater part séene running along old chappell hard maner banke whereby euident new towne standeth cleane without limit old bridge whereof historie albane speaketh nether end 〈◊〉 halliwell stréet view place doth inforce coniecture mere latine copie description britaine written late humfrey lhoid countrie man calleth corruptlie stagnum enaximum stagnum maximum first belonged king thereby offa time reape small commoditie continued also vntill time alfrijc seuenth abbat house bought outright king liuing excessiue charge drained narrowlie within left drie sauing reserued chanell riuer haue hir vsuall course held vp high bankes bicause alwaies contention betwéene moonks king seruants fished water vnto king behoofe day therefore remaineth maner mention poole onelie one stréet yet called fishpoole stréet wherof may suffice resolution men séeke rather yéeld inconuenience gildas seeme mistake riuer hauing thus digressed giue remembrance old estate verolamium time returne againe vnto former purpose certes would gladlie set downe name number city townes village england wale true longitude latitude yet cannot come order would howbeit tale city soone found bishoprikes sith euerie sée hath prerogatiue giuen vnto beare name citie vse regaleius within hir owne limit priuilege also granted sundrie ancient number throughlie scanned certes misfortune hath onelie happened vnto ile nation vnto famous country world heretofore gréedie desire would liue alone onelie themselues hereof may take example candie old time called creta homer writeth called hetacompolis bicause conteined hundred city vnfurnished may hardlie called tripoli diodorus siculus saith aegypt 18000 city decaied processe time ptolomeus lagus reigned aboue 3000 day asia aegypt lesser number shall verie readilie found time past lincolne fame goeth haue beene two fiftie parish church good record appeareth eight thirtie foure twentie inconuenience hath growen altogither church appropriation made vnto monastery religious house terrible canker enimie religion leaue lamentable discourse notable gréeuous inconuenience growing said incroching ioining house house laieng land land whereby inhabitant manie place countrie deuoured eaten vp house either altogither pulled downe suffered decaie litle litle although sometime poore man peraduenture dooth dwell one able repare suffereth fall downe thereto thinketh himselfe verie friendlie dealt withall may haue acre ground assigned vnto whereon kéepe cow wherein set cabbage radish parsneps carrets melon pompon like stuffe poore household liueth principall food sith doo better wheaten bread eat reach vnto price contenting themselues meane time bread made otes barleie poore estate god wot howbeit care great incrochers diuers place rich men dwelled sometime good tenement house hopyards sheads pole peraduenture garden may sée castell hedingham diuerse place procéed soile diuided champaine ground woodland house first lie vniformelie builded euerie towne togither stréets lane wheras woodland country except great market townes stand scattered abroad one dwelling midst owne occupieng manie great market townes commonlie thrée hundred foure hundred family mansion two thousand communicant peraduenture whether woodland champaine find often aboue fortie fiftie thrée score household two thrée hundred communicant whereof greatest part neuerthelesse verie poore folkes offentimes without maner occupieng sith ground pa • ish gotten vp men hand yea sometimes tenure one two thrée whereby rest compelled either hired seruants vnto else beg bread miserie doore doore saith leland fauourable haue gotten land let house remaine vpon vse poore compound lord soile pull downe altogither saieng let stand toll beggers towne therby surcharge rest parish laie burden vpon ala pitifull men sée themselues hereby doo laie greatest log vpon neighbor neck sith prince dooth commonlie loose nothing duty accustomable paid rest parishioner remaine must answer beare plead charge way saieng charged alreadie light horsse answer sort maner yet altogither knowledge king seuen pound thirteene shilling taske gathered fiftie wealthie householder parish england gentleman hauing three part towne owne hand foure housholds doo beare aforesaid paiment else leland deceiued commentary lib 13 latelie come hand thing especiallie noted trauell ouer ile common plague enormitie hart land likewise vpon coast certes great number complaine increase pouertie laieng cause vpon god though fault sending increase people want war consume affirming land neuer full c men doo sée verie root whence dooth procéed yet roman found florished therefore prescribed limit euerie man tenure occupieng homer commendeth achilles ouerthrowing fiue twentie city mine opinion ganges much better preferred suidas building thrée score inde plant himselfe could néed required set downe place number religious house great wickednesse made endwares little better brodelhouses especiallio nunries farre else safe accesse vnto doo spend time rehearsall filthiness would god memorie might perish malefactor purpose also eight booke excellent treatise haue deale whether profitable sith purpose rather shew plentie haue performe far shall néedfull haue béene time past great store castels place defense within realme england builded briton manie roman saxon dane baron realme time king stephan licenced build manie listed vpon owne demeasnes hoping thereby would haue imploied vse aduantage commoditie finallie saw rather fortified himselfe end vsed defense repented late inconsiderate dealing sith remedie force subdue decease king henrie second came sooner crowne called mind inconuenience predecessour suffered himselfe might time sustaine fortification therefore one first thing attempt race deface part hold certes thought better hazard méeting enimie plaine field liue perpetuall feare house rebellion lord vpon euerie light occasion conceiued full strong strong made readier withstand gainesaie manie procéedings successours time time intended herevpon therefore caused eleuen hundred said castels raced ouerthrowne whereby power nobilitie little restreined since time also remained haue decaied partlie commandement henrie third partlie themselues conuersion dwelling house noble men martiall front remooued present verie castels mainteined within england sauing onelie vpon coast march countrie better kéeping backe forren enimie soeuer shall attempt enter annoie v prouident prince euer reigned land fortification thereof outward enimies late prince famous memorie king henrie eight beside repared alreadie standing builded sundrie ground hauing shaken seruile yoke popish tyrannie espieng emperour offended diuorce quéene catharine aunt thereto vnderstanding french king coupled dolphin sonne pope neece maried daughter king scot whereby cause iustlie suspect safelie trust ani one lambert saith determined stand vpon owne defense therefore small spéed like charge builded sundrie blockehouses castels platformes vpon diuerse frontier realme chieflie east southeast part england whereby doubt verie much qualifie conceiued grudge aduersaries vtterlie put hastie purpose inuasion would god cast eie toward harwich coast norffolke suffolke nothing yet doone albeit none fit likelie place enimie enter vpon part full sea may touch vpon shore come land without resistance thus much brieflie purpose present néed make anie long discourse castels sith nature good englishman regard caged vp coope hedged stone wals rather meet enimie plaine field handstrokes may trauaise ground choose plot vse benefit sunne shine wind weather best aduantage commoditie isocrates also saith towres wallesthe best keeper kingdomes bulworkes soldier plentie armour best kéepers kingdomes freends loue subiects obedience vnto martiall discipline want shew themselues either cruell couetous toward people tale go beston castell shall saue england daie likewise brag rebellious baron old time named hugh bigot said contempt king henrie third fiftith yeare reigne castell bungeie vpon water waueneie wold set button king cockneie repute toy first méere vaine second fondlie vttered anie thing said manie word haue béene spoken like hold wallingford c growen memorie small losse heard among common sort certes castell bungeie ouerthrowen aforesaid prince yeare ouerthrew walles castell leircester also castels treske malesar apperteining roger mowbraie fremlingham belonging likewise hugh bigot wherof chronologie following may read large might like sort take occasion speake sundrie strong place camp men haue lien haue great plentie england plaine field passe ouer talke néedlesse discoursesthe wandles time past called windles neuerthelesse concerning two omitted wit one néere vnto cambridge gogmagogs hill called windleburie time read late old pamphlet saie truth haue often heard named winterburie hilles difference may easilie grow corruption former word place likewise verie large strong second séene edge shropshire two mile colme betwéene two riuers clun colunus tewie otherwise named themis wherevnto accesse one place welshman call cair carador opinion caractatus king sillures ouercome ostorius time fled cartimanda quéene brigants succour betraied roman may sée tacitus palace belonging prince chap 15 lieth set exactlie number name palace belonging prince make anie description hir grace court sith calling hath béene haue scarselie presumed peepe hir gate much lesse haue aduentured search know estate house magnificent behauiour séene within yet thus much saie generallie house honour perteining hir maiestie builded either square stone bricke else thervnto although capacitie hugenesse needlesse discourse resoluing selfe euen also rest excéeding mercie louing kindnesse god dooth wonderfullie appéere towards v hath largelie indued v ample benefit great prince court beyond sea euen cause likened vnto hell diuerse learned writer haue spent great part time henricus cornelius agrippa one example epistle ad aulicum dam saith thus non inferno e amice qui e aula vbi daemonum habitatio est qui illic suis artibus humana licèt effigie regnant atque vbi scelerum schola est animatum iactura ingens ac quicquid vspiam est perfidiae ac doli quicquid crudelitatis inclemētiae quicquid effraenatae superbiae rapacis auariciae quicquid obscenae libidinis faedissimae impudicitiae quicquid nefandae impietatis morum pessimorum totum illic aceruatur cumulatissimè vbi stupra raptus incestus adulteria principum nobilium ludi sunt vbi fastus tumor ira liuor faedáque cupido cum socijs suis imperauit vbi criminum omnium procellae virtutúmque omniū ínenarrabile naufragium c great history chronicle lieng therein exercise come whereby stranger entereth court england vpon sudden shall rather imagine himselfe come publike schoole vniuersities manie giue eare one readeth prince palace conferre nation would god honorable personage would take example hir grace godlie dealing behalfe shew conformitie vnto hir good beginning would manie grieuous offense wherewith god highlie displeased cut restreined doo reigne excéedinglie noble gentleman house wherof sée paterne within hir grace gate might speake great traines troopes seruing men alsotraines attendant attend vpon nobilitie england seuerall liueries difference cognisance sléeues whereby knowen whome apperteine could also set downe goodlie sight sée muster court filled dooth yéeld contemplation noble varietie vnto beholder much like shew pecocks taile full beautie medow garnished infinit kind diuersitie pleasant floures passe ouer rehearsall hereof men delite vaine amplification séeke curious point professe discipline firme peace also mainteined within certeine compasse prince palace nothing inferiour sée dailie practised best gouerned hold fortress seuere punishment strike within limit great beetle staple cord wherewith fasten hand offendor vnto said blocke vntill whole circumstance execution performed yeoman scullarie likewise time dooth prouide great fire coales hard blocke right hand seruice king warres willinglie yeelded forgo left end king pardoned small benefit offendor publication bountifull nature remained prince like priuilege almost giuen church churchyard smite staffe dagger anie maner weapon sufficientlie found verdict twelue men arrainement beside excommunication sure loose one eares without hope release one hath beene twise condemned executed bargaine sale maketh auaileable law neither act whatsoeuer pleadable wherby liueth outlaw man altogither prince protection although lawfull kill anie man otherwise outlawed without danger fellonie twentie yéeres old go without dagger least backe side although aged burgess magistrate anie citie appeerance exempt brabling contention nobilitie weare commonlie sword rapier dagger dooth euerie common seruing man also followeth lord master desperate cutter haue like sort carrie two dagger two rapier sheath alwaies wherewith euerie dronken fraie knowen worke much mischiefe sword dagger also great length longer like vsed anie countrie whereby ech one pretendeth haue aduantage enimie manie order haue béene taken intollerable length weapon sée yet small redresse cause thereof doth rest sooth part wote might speake excessiue staues diuerse trauell waie doo carrie vpon shoulder whereof twelue thirtéene foote long beside pike twelue inch commonlie suspected honest men theeues robber occasion either suspect historie thinke time come verie farre behind thing haue ship growing stub sailing sea within space fiue fiftie day yet nauie séene first war carthage led thither duellius romane warres also hieron two hundred twentie tall ship bare leafe saile within fiue fortie day second warre carthage nauie went scipio felled wood séeme saile sea fullie furnished sixe weekes vnto ignorant thing doth séeme false vnpossible like maner multitude find polybius one skirmish sea roman lost seauen hundred vessel bare ech fiue rowes ore side carthaginenses fiue hundred albeit formes apparell vessel altogither correspondent ship gallies made day yet capacitie onelie match farrre excéed one biremes onlie conteined much burden ship six hundred tun shall thinke seauen rowes ore walking side least séeme speake forren thing course historie doth permit without licence digresse giue leaue séech thee gentle reader wade yet little report ancient formes kind vessel albeit discourse hereof maketh little description present nauie england yet shall report thereof vnprofitable vnpleasant shall reade among writing capacity mould shall amisse therefore begin nauie xerxes ech meane manie certes prince europe hath beautifull gallant sort ship quéenes maiestie england present generallie exceeding force two well appointed furnished ought let encounter thrée foure country either quietnesse passage elsewhere faires market chap 18 take great townes england haue wéekelie market one granted prince maner prouision houshold bought sold ease benefit countrie round wherby cōmeth passe buier shall make anie great iourneie purueiance necessity occupier shall haue occasion trauell far commodity except séeke highest price commonlie néere vnto great city round spéediest vtterance alwaies haue béene time past erected benefit realme many place much abused reliefe ease buier much intended benefit seller neither magistrats part men loth displease neighbour one yeares dignitie carefull office right dutie bée market neither assises bread order goodnesse swéetnesse graine commodity brought thither sold anie whit looked vnto ech one suffered sell set vp himselfe listeth one euident cause dearth scarsitie time great abundance could would exemplifie manie touch one particularlie sith rare sée anie countrie towne said assise bread well kept according statute yet anie countrie baker happen come among market daie bread better quantitie find fault one thing another stuffe whereby honest poore man whome law nation doo commend indeuoureth liue anie lawfull meanes driuen awaie come vpon round penaltie vertue priuileges howbeit though nice proportion bread yet lieu headie ale béere mightinesse thereof among séeke commonlie called huffecap mad dog father whoresonne angel food dragon milke go wall stride wide list leg c noted one late fell god prouidence troubled cōscience considered well reachlesse life dangerous estate another thinking belike change colour mind caried straightwaie strongest ale next physician incredible saie maltbugs lug liquor euen pig lie row lugging dame teat till lie still againe able wag neither romulus remus sucke shee woolfe shéepheards wife lupa eger sharpe deuotion men hale hufcap till red cockes litle wiser comb fallen market alehouse returning therefore vnto purpose find corne great abuse dailie suffered great preiudice towne countrie especiallie poore artificer householder tilleth land laboring wéeke buie bushell two graine market daie haue none monie bicause bodgers loders common carrier corne doo onlie buie vp giue aboue price serued great quantity shall go anie well saie yet little somewhat mine owne experience michaelmasse time poore men must make monie graine may paie rent long poore man hath sell rich men bring none rather buie vp poore bring vnder pretense seed corne alteration graine although bring none owne bicause one wheat often sowen without change séed soone decaie conuerted darnell cause therefore must need buie market though twentie mile knowne promising happen espied god wot verie seldome send much next market performed wot shift serue neither dooth fox vse alwaies one tracke feare snare compound one towne market holder pot hufcap merie go downe let buie owne name else wage one poore man othersuborned bodgers become bodger thereto get licence vpon forged surmise doone féed monie buie till hath filled loft doo good himselfe giue somewhat paine time reserue • eare manie like prouiders stumble vponbodgers licenced blind créekes sea coast wote well haue doone yet doo vnder men wing case plaine dare find fault haue licence yea though serue meane gentleman house corne hath cast vp tillage bicause boasteth buie graine market better cheape sow land rich grasier often dooth also vpon like deuise bicause grasing requireth smaller household lesse attendance charge anie man come buie bushell two expense vnto market crosse answer made forsooth one euen bad monie hope haue saie truth bodgers faire chapman word let see shall giue knit vp haue go carie chamber bring twentie seme weeke daie inne sollar laie corne haue giue penny euerie bushell six wéekes day paiment thus bodgers beare awaie poore artificer labourer cannot make prouision market sith hardlie adaies sell bushell breake measure much rather buier looke sai • much ouer measure bushell bodger doo quarter naie poore man cannot get anie farmer home bicause prouideth altogither serue bodger hath hope grounded vpon greedie insatiable desire gaine sale better market must giue two penny groate bushell house last market craued else go without sléepe hungrie bellie common carriage corne ouer vnto part beyond sea speake leastwise could touch alone néeds must ioine prouision withall whereby onelie fréends abroad also manie aduersaries countriemen papist abundantlie relieued report goeth sith sée trust mine eares write truth returne market againe time poore occupier hath sold crop néed monie readie peraduenture buie againe yer long whole sale corne great occupier hand hitherto haue threshed little none owne bought vp men much could come hencefoorth also begin sell quarter load first marring market bushell two horsseload therby séene keepe crosse either shew make men eger buie may haue monie regard paie thus corne waxeth doere déerer next market daie possible also mislike price beginning whole yeare insuing men supposing corne litle worth better price next yeare haue certeine superstitious obseruations giue gesse sale corne yeare following countriemen doo vse commonlie barleie dwell iudge price baldocke vpon matthewes daie wheat sold séed time take like sort experiment sight first flockes crane flée southward winter age moone beginning ianuarie apish toy laieng twelue cornes vpon hot hearth twelue moneths c whereby shew themselues scant good christian care may come monie herevpon also thresh thrée part old corne toward latter end summer new commeth apace hand cast fourth vnthreshed shall lie vntill next spring peraduenture till must putrifie certes • intie sée mustie corne manie great market england great occupier bring foorth kéepe longer inforced offentimes vpon one occasion somwhat abate price plague seldome ingendred thereby among poorer sort necessitie must buie wherby manie thousand degree consumed whose death mine opinion farmer vnguiltie proceed laie vp graine wheat maner haue yet another policie whereby séeme haue small store left barnes else gird sheues band stacke vp new lesse roome end may onlie séeme lesse quantitie also giue place corne yet come barne growing field happen plentie market anie market daie cannot sell price set vp fréends house third daie bring foorth till like sale sell anie home beside harder measure shall déerer poore man bieth two penny groat bushell may sell market thing worthie redresse wish god would open eies deale thus sée owne errours yet little care manie poore men suffer extremitie may fill purse carie awaie gaine world also sée place realme pestered purueiours take vp egs butter chéese pig capon hen chicken hog bakon c one market vnder pretense commission suffer wiues sell another pulters london chapman absent two thrée market day may perfectlie sée ware reasonablie sold therevnto cross sufficientlie furnished thing like sort since number bu • termen haue much increased since trauell wife come men house butter faster make almost incredible see price butter augmented whereas owner inforced bring market townes fewer butter buiers stirring butter scarslie woorth eighteene penny gallon worth thrée shilling foure penny perhaps fiue shilling wherby also gather maintenance superfluous number dealer trade • illage alwaies excepted one greatest cause price thing become excessiue one doo cōmonlie vse bid another whilest countrie commodity commonlie bought sold priuate house neuer looke see enormitie redressed market well furnished could saie euen inough peraduenture shall well thanked yet true though thinke trespasse moreouer lamented one generall measure vse throughout england euerie market towne hath maner seuerall bushell lesser seller draweth resort vnto also couetousnesse manie clearkes market taking view measure alwaie prouide one bushell shall either big little next comming yet depart without fee first mending one time empairing another countrie greatlie charged iust measure anie stéed oft found likewise diuerse vnconscionable dealer haue one measure sell another buie withall like also weight yet sealed bronded wherefore verie good two reduced vnto one standard one bushell one pound one quarter one hundred one tale one number thing time fall better order fewer cause contention mooued land complaint poore tenant paie rent corne vnto landlord speake often dealt withall hardlie beside measuring ten quarter part lose one iniquitie bushell gréedinesse appointed receiuers thereof fault found also goodnesse cleannesse graine wherby péece monie must néeds passe vnto purse stop mouth withall else lord like corne thou art worthie loose thy lease c cheaper market rate allowed rent must paie monie corne small extremitie thereby may see one v indeuoureth fléece eat vp another another thing market worthie looked vnto recariage graine lost sollars gaue intimation wherefore ordered euerie seller make market houre else bailie clearke said market make sale therof according discretion without libertie farmer fet vp corne house chamber persuaded price graine would soone abated againe enacted one kéepe next market graine run six eight ten fouretéene twentie mile home sell corne dooth find highest price therby leaueth neighbour vnfurnished doo thinke market would farre better serued present finallie men barn might indifferentlie viewed immediatlie haruest note gethered estimat kept appointed trustie person purpose haue much plentie corne towne cross yet commonlie seene bicause one hideth hoordeth may vpon purpose either déerer shall haue priuie veine bodgers doo accustomablie deale sea dooth load awaie small part thereof country enimies great hinderance commonwealth home likelie yet except remedie found doo talke thing desire suppression bodgers minister certes may speake right well séeling harme buier neuerthelesse speake generallie ech conclude therefore market thing sold necessarie man vse prouision made commonlie wéeke insuing therefore great townes without one weekelie market least verie haue one two faires within compasse yeare assigned vnto prince albeit much better lowse faire common kirkemesses shire england great plentie parkes whereof wit welnere number two hundred hir daily prouision flesh apperteine prince rest nobilitie gentleman haue land patrimony lieng néere vnto would gladlie haue set downe iust number inclosure found euerie countie sith cannot doo shall suffice saie kent essex onelie number hundred twentie bishoprike durham wherein great plentie fallow deere cherished kept warren cony iudge almost innumerable dailie like incerase reason blacke skin beast thought counteruaile price naked carcase onelie cause whie graie lesse esteemed neere vnto london quickest merchandize yong rabbet wherfore older cony brought speedie vtterance rabbet suckling season great losse skin sith suffered growe vp full greatnesse owner parkes gene •• llie inclosed strong pale made oke kind wood great store cherished woodland country time time ech onelie maintenance said defense safekeeping fallow déere ranging countrie howbeit time past diuerse haue fensed stone walles especiallie time roman first brought fallow déere land coniecture albeit inclosure ouerthrowne againe saxon dane cauisham towner woodstocke beside west countrie one also bolton among thing also seene towne one fairest clockes europe wood also inclosed pile state therto douted manie whether bucke doe reckoned wild tame beast plinie deemeth wild martial also opinion saith imbelles damae quid nisi praeda sumus time past like controuersie bées lawiers call feras tit de acquirendo rerum dominio lib 2 instit plinie attempting decide quarell calleth medias interferas placidas aues whither suddenlie digressed returning therefore vnto park find also circuit inclosure like manner conteine often time walke foure fiue mile sometimes lesse wherby séene store ground emploied vpon vaine commoditie bringeth manner gaine profit owner sith commonlie giue awaie flesh neuer taking penie except ordinarie fée part déere giuen vnto kéeper custome beside three shilling foure penny fiue shilling monie hath skin head vmbles chine shoulder whereby hath warrant whole bucke hath end little halfe iudgement scarselie equall dealing venison england neither bought sold country mainteined onelie pleasure owner friend albeit heard late one ancient ladie maketh great gaine selling yeerelie hir husband venison cooke another lesse name sticke ride market sée hir butter sold performed without infinite scoffes mockes euen poorest pezzants countrie thinke odious matter lady woman countenance sell venison butter earle feele ox sheepe lamb whether readie butcher sell wooll vnto clothier kéepe tanhouse deale like affaire belong men honor rather farmer grasiers anie may well noted vniustlie degenerate true nobilitie betake themselues husbandrie euen enormitie tooke place sometime among roman entred farre verie senate whome one two thrée ship going vpon sea pretending prouision house truth following trade merchandize till law made inhibit restraine liuie also telleth another law passed likewise senator claudius tribune helpe onelie c flaminius senator beene father anie senator possesse anie ship vessell aboue capacitie thrée hundred amphora supposed sufficient cariage recariage necessity apperteine vnto house sith trading merchandizes commodity dooth delcare base couetous mind altogither void enuie anie man liue anie gaine onelie would haue himselfe wonderfull dealing must néeds proue time confusion countrie wherein enormity exercised time part manie large wealthie occupier dwelling within compasse one parke thereby great plentie corne cattell séenetillage mankind diminished parkes among beside copious procreation humane issue whereby realme alwaies better furnished able men serue prince affaire almost nothing kept sort wild sauage beast cherished pleasure delight yet owner still desirous inlarge ground either bréed feeding cattell doo let dailie take sparing verie common whervpon manie towneships doo liue affirming haue alreadie great store people england youth marrieng soone doo nothing profit countrie fill full beggar hurt vtter vndooing saie common wealth certes one curse lord haue countrie conuerted sort furniture mankindthe decaie people destruction kingdome walk shrowds wild beast know anie manie family also great small game kéepers call haue eaten vp likelie hereafter deuoure men may coniecture manie lament sith hope restraint looked behalfe corruption generall man may presentlie giue ghesse vniuersalitie euill contemplation circumstance shall saie last twentith part realme imploied vpon déere cony alreadie séemeth verie much dulie considered king henrie eight one noblest prince euer reigned land lamented oft constreined hire forren aid want competent store souldiors home perceiuing indeed supply oftentimes hurtfull profitable vnto interteine may chéeflie seene ualens emperor uortiger small number others would oft maruell priuate talke seauen eight prince ruled one could lead thirtie fortie thousand men field another two 100000 third taken onelie owne dominion found want saw cause decaie grew beside occasion mentioned also laieng house house land land whereby manie men occupiengs conuerted one bréed people little thereby diminished auarice landlord increasing rent fine also wearie people readie rebell would arise supposing short end warres better long miserable life peace priuileges faculty also another great cause ruine common wealth diminution mankind whereas law nature dooth permit men liue best maner whatsoeuer trade exercised commeth priuiledge waie cutteth trade wherby must néeds shift soile séeke vnto country also greatest commodity brought hand imbase corrupt yet raise price thing owne pleasure example last giue also bookes first impression anie one booke part verie negligentlie handled whereas another might print well first would men striue doo best falleth trade easie matter prooue england neuer lesse furnished people present old record euerie manour sought search made find tenement fallen either downe lord hand brought vnited togither men soone appéere one manour seuentéen eightéene twentie house shrunke know saie mine owne experience notwithstanding one cotage erected late little purpose city townes either vtterlie decaied quarter halfe diminished though one little increased townes pulled downe sheepewalks lordship standing beside william rufus pulled downe time could saie somewhat swarue yet purpose wherevnto returne wée parkes left england comming norman added calamitie also seruitude nation making men best sort furthermore become kéepers game whilest liued meane time vpon spoile reuenues dailie ouerthrew townes village infinit sort family maintenance venerie neither anie parke supposed time statelie enough conteined least eight ten hidelands manie hundred acre family haue béene alwaies called place realme carrucats cartwares one sufficient old time mainteine honest yeoman king iohn trauelling time northward wit 1209 warre vpon king scot married daughter earle bullen without consent returne ouerthrew great number parkes warren belonged baron greatest part abbats prelats cleargie hearing trauelled complaint countrie inclosure chéefe decaie men tillage land sware oth would suffer wild beast féed vpon fat soile sée people perish want abilitie procure buie food defend realme howbeit act ill taken religious adherent inuerted intent herein another end affirming slanderouslie rather purpose spoile corne grasse common catholikes held estate impouerish bring north part realme destruction refused go scotland said prince aliue day wherein andrew boord saith park england europe ouer trauelled owne person saw much ground consume thinke would either double othes laie open tillage might better looked vnto hope shall néed time owner great fort begin smell parcel might emploied gaine therefore doo grow disparked next haue franke chase taketh something parke forrest giuen either king grant prescription certes differeth much parke nay maner selfe thing parke sauing parke inuironed pale wall like chase alwaie open nothing inclosed see enuéeld maluerne chase cause seisure franchise parke kéepe inclosed like chase anie time imparked trespasse law also anie man haue make chase parke frée warren without good warrantie king charter perfect title prescription lawfull anie subiect either carnilate build stone house imbattell haue querke sea kéepe assise bread ale wine set vp furels tumbrell thew pillorie inclose anie ground aforesaid purpose within owne soile without warrant grant beast chase commonlie bucke roe fox marterne venerie old time hart hare bore woolfe held time canutus stéed woolfe beare crept beast cō monlie hunted east country fed vpon excellent venison although v know anie féed thereon care certes seeme forrests franke chase haue alwaies béene religiouslie preserued iland solace prince recreation nobilitie howbeit read euer inclosed present otherwise fensed vsuall note limitation whereby bound remembred time time better preseruation venerie vert sort nourished neither anie ancient law prescribed maintenance day canutus sith time hath dealt perished lost canutus therefore seeing dailie spoile made almost place game last make sundrie sanction decrées whereby thenceforth red fallow déere better looked throughout whole dominion haue day diuerse forrests england wale belong king subiects waltham forrest windlesor pickering fecknam delamore gillingham kingswood wencedale clun rath bredon weire charlie leircester lée rokingham selwood new forrest wichwood hatfeeld sauernake westbirie blacamore pcke deane penrise manie cleane remembrance although far greater circuit manie parkes warren yet time lesse deuourers people latter sith beside much tillage manie townes ar found wheras park warren haue nothing else either keeper wareners lodge least manor place chéef lord owner soile find also good record essex hath time past wholie béene forrest ground except one cantred hundred long since lost said denomination good sooth doo read neuerth • lesse remaineth yet memorie towne walden essex slan • ing limit aforesaid countie doth take hir name thereof c • ltike toong w • erewith saxon scithian spéech dooth little participate huge wood forrests called walds likewise druides named walie waldie bicause frequented wood made sacrifice among okes thicket coniecture behalfe anie thing aforesaid towne taketh denomination wald end say end wooddie soile parish champaine hand may called wald dene haue read written old euidences waldaene diphthong saie truth dene old saxon word vale lowe bottome dune hill hillie soile certes walden taketh hir name woodie vale sometime stood first deriuation liketh better highest part towne called also chipping walden saxon word gipping signifieth leaning hanginggipping going vp anie place may verie well applied therevnto sith whole towne hangeth vpon side two hils wherof lesser runneth quite middest might confirmation thing bring mention wald kent may suffice vse word wald differeth much wold signifieth woodie soile betokeneth soile without wood plaine champaine countrie without anie store trées may seene cotswold porkewold c beside could saie forrests aforesaid inclosure also therein prooue booke forrest law whole countie lancaster hath likewise beene forrest heretofore also william bastard made law whosoeuer take anie wild beast within king forrest lose eare henrie first punish either life lim ordinance confirmed henrie second péeres woodstocke wherevpon great trouble insued vnder king iohn henrie third appeareth chronicle shall suffice haue said much set downe alreadie howbeit may restore one antiquitie light hath hitherto lien raked vp ember obliuion giue law canutus made forrest whereby manie thing shall disclosed concerning wherof peraduenture lawiers haue knowlege diuerse note gathered touching ancient estate realme found deale great charter may perceiue manie place vnperfect reason corruption want also congruitie crept length time restored another breefe law made first yeare reigne winchester afterward inserted later constitution canon 32 beginneth thus owne saxon tong ic elc one c grant tha ech one shall worthie venerie hunting take either plaines wood within owne fée dominion ech man shall abstaine venerie euerie place beast shall haue firme peace quietnesse vpon paine forfet much man may forfet hitherto statute made aforesaid canutus afterward confirmed king edward surnamed confessor ratified bastard fourth yeare reigne followeth great charter selfe rude order latine find word word would gladlie haue turned english might haue sounded anie benefit vnskilfull vnlearned incipiunt constitutiones canuti regis de foresta hae sunt sanctiones de foresta quas ego canutus rex cum consilio primariorum hominum meorum condo facio vt cunctis regni nostri angliae ecclesijs pax iustitia fiat vt omnis delinquens secundum modum delicti delinquentis fortunam patiatur 1 sint iam deinceps quatuor ex liberalioribus hominibuspegened qui habent saluas suas debitas consuetudines quos angli pegened appellant qualibet regni mei prouincia constituti ad iustitiam distribuedam vna cum poena merita materijs fornestae cuncto populo meo tam anglis quàm danis per totum regnum meum angliae quos quatuor primarios forestae appellandos censemus 2 sint sub quolibet horum quatuor ex mediocribus hominibus quos angli lespegend lespegend nunc sortè tringald nuncupant dani verò yoong men vocant locati qui • uram onus tum viridis tum veneris suscipiant 3 administranda autem iustitia nullatenus volo vt tale se intromittant mediocrés que tale post ferarum curam susceptam pro liberalibus semper hadbeanturealdermen quos dani ealdermen appellant 4 sub horum iterum quolibet sint duo minutorum hominumtineman quos tineman angli dicunt hi nocturnam curam veneris viridis tum seruilia opera subibunt 5 si talis minutus seruus fuerit tam citò quàm inforesta nostra locabitur liber esto omnés que ho ex sumptibus nostris manutenebimus 6 habeat ettam quilibet primariorum quolibet anno de nostra warda quam michni angli appellantmichni duo equos vnum cum sella alterum sine sella vnum gladium quinque lanceas vnum cuspidem vnum scutum ducentos solidos argenti 7 mediocrium quilibet vnum equum vnam lanceam vnum scutum 60 solidos argenti 8 minutorum quilibet vnum lanceam vnam arcubalistam 15 solidos argenti 9 sint omnes tam primarij quàm mediocres minuti immune liberi quieti ab omnibus prouincialibus summonitionibus popularibus placitis quae hundred laghe hundred law angli dicunt ab omnibus armorum oneribus quod warscot angli dicuntwarscot forincesis querelis 10 sint mediocrium minutorum causae carum correctiones tam criminalium quàm ciuilium per prouidam sapientiam rationem primariorum iudicatae decisae primariorum verò enormia si quae fuerint ne scelus aliquod remaneat inultum nosmet ira nostra regali puniemus 11 habeant hi quatuor vnam regalem potestatem salue semper nobis nostra praesentia quatér que anno generales forestae demonstrationes viridis veneris forisfactionesmuchehunt quas muchehunt dicunt vbi teneant omnes calumniam de materia aliqua tangente forestam eántque ad triplex iudicium ofgangfordell purgatio ignis triplex ordali • quod angli ofgangfordell dicunt ita autem acquiratur illued triplex iudicium accipiat secura quinque sit ipse sextus sic iurando acquirat triplex iudicium aut triplex iuramentum sed purgatio ignis nullatenus admittatur nisi vbi nuda veritas nequit aliter inuestigari 12 liberalis autem homopegen 1 pegen modo crimen suum non sit inter maiora habeat fidelem hominem qui possit pro eo iurare iur amentumforathe 1 forathe si autem non habet ipsemet iuret nec pardonetur ei aliquod iuramentum 13 si aduena vel peregrinus qui de longinquo venerit sit calumniatus de foresta talis est sua inopia vt possit habere plegium ad primam calumniam qualem nullus anglus iudicare potest tunc subeat captionem regis ibi expectet quousque vadat ad iudicium ferri aqua attamen si quis extraneo aut peregrino de longè venienti sibi ipsi nocet si aliquod iudicium iudicauerint 14 quicún que coram primarios homines meos forestae falso testimonio steterit victus fuerit non sit dignus imposterum stare aut portare testimonium quia legalitatem suam perdidit pro culpa soluat regi decem solidos quos dani vocant halfehang aliàshelfehang halsehang 15 si quis vim aliquam primarijs forestae meae intulerit si liberalis sit amittat libertatem omnia sua si villanus abscindatur dextra 16 si alteruter iterum peccauerit reus sit mortis 17 si quis autem contra primarium pugnauerit plito emendet secundum pretium sui ipsius quod angli pere pite dicuntpere pite dicunt soluat primario quadraginta solidos 18 si pacem quis fregerit ante mediocres forestae quod dicunt gethbrech gethbrech emendet regi decem solidis 19 si quis mediocrium aliquem cum ira percusserit emendetur prout interfectio ferae regalis mihi emendari solet 20 si quis delinquens foresta nostra capietur poenas luet secundum modum genus delicti 21 poena forisfactio non vna eadém que erit liberalis quem dani ealderman ealderman vocant illiberalis domini serui noti ignoti nec vna eadém que erit causarum tum ciuilium tum criminalium ferarum forestae ferarum regalium viridis veneris tractatio nam crimen veneris ab antiquo inter maiora non immeritò numerabatur viridis verò fractione chaceae nostrae regalis excepta ita pusillum exiguum est quòd vix earespicit nostra constitutio qui hoc tamen deliquerit sit criminis forestae reus 22 si liber aliquis feram forestae ad cursum impulerit siue casu siue praehabita voluntate ita vt cursu celeri cogatur fera anhelare decem solidis regi emendet si illiberalis dupliciter emendet si seruus careat corio 23 si vero harum aliquot interfecerit soluat dupliciter persoluat sitque pretij sui reus contra regem 24 sed si regalem feramstaggon stagge quam angli staggon appellant alteruter coegerit anhelare alter per vnum annum alter per duo careat libertate naturali si verò seruus pro vtlegato habeatur quem angli frendlesman vocantfrendlesman 25 si verò occiderit amittat liber scutum libertatis si sit illiberalis careat libertate si seruus vita 26 episcopi abbates barones mei non calumniabuntur pro venatione si non regales feras occiderint siregales restabunt rei regi pro libito suo sine certa emendatione 27 sunt aliae praeter feras forestae bestlae quae dum inter septum sepes forestae continentur emendationi fubiacent quales sunt capreoli lepores cuniculi sunt alia quàm plurima animalia quae quāquam infra septum forestae viuunt oneri curae mediocrium subiacent forestae tamen nequaquā censeri possuntbubali olim anglia qualia sunt bubali vaccae similia vulpes lupi nec forestae nec veneris habentur proinde eorum interfectio nulli emendationi subiacet si tamen infra limites occiduntur fractio sit regalis chaceae mitiùs emendetur aper verò quanquam forestae sit nullatenus tamen animal veneris haberi est assuetus 28 bosco nec subbosco nostro sine licentia primariorum forestae nemo manum apponat quòd si quis fecerit reus sit fractionis regalis chaceae 29 si quis verò ilicem aut arborē aliquam quae victum feris suppeditat scideritilices aliquando britānia nisi intelligatur de quercu praeter fractionem regalis chaceae emendet regi viginti solidis 30 volo vt monis liber homo pro libito suo habeat venerem siue viridem planis suis super terras suas sine chacea tamen deuitent omnes meam vbicún que eam habere voluero 31 nullus mediocris habebit nec custodiet canesgreihounds quos angli greihounds appellant liberali verò dum genuiscissio eorum facta fuerit coram primario forestae licebit aut sine genuiscissione dune remoti sunt à limitibus forestae per decem miliaria quando verò propiùs venerint emendet quodlibet miliare vno solido siverò infra septum forestae reperiatur dominus canis forisfaciet decem solidos regi 32 velteres verò quos langeran appellant quia manifestè constat ijs nihil esse periculiuelter langeran cuilibet licebit sine genuiscissione eos custodire idem de canibus quos ramhundt vocantramhundt 33 quòdsi casu inauspicato huiusmodi cane rabidi fiant vbi que vagātur negligentia dominorum redduntur illicitipretium hominis mediocris emendetur regi pro illicitis c quòdsi intra septum forestae reperiantur talis exquiratur herus emendet secundum pretium hominis mediocris quòd secundum legem werinorum 1 churingorum est ducentorum solidorum 34 si canis rabidus momorderit feram tunc emendet secundum pretiū hominis liberalis quod est duodecies solidis centumpretium liberi hominis si verò fera regalis morsa fuerit reus sit maximi criminis constitution canutus concerning forrest verie barbarouslie translated tooke hand howbeit find set downe without anie alteration copie anie iot tittle garden orchard chap 19 time cali woone french countriemen learned trade diuerse country wherby grew rich began wax idle also therevpon onlie left former painfulnesse frugalitie like sort gaue themselues liue excesse vanitie whereby manie goodlie commodity failed short time amongst v stranger also dwelled v perceiuing sluggishnesse espieng idlenesse might redound great profit foorthwith imploied endeuours bring supplie thing lacked continuallie forren country yet augmented idlenes hauing thing reasonable price supposed mean thought méere madnesse spend either time cost home thus became enimies owne welfare men day reposed felicitie following war wherewith often exercised home place besides naturall desire mankind hath estéeme thing farre sought bicause rare costlie irkesome contempt thing néere hand common plentifull hath borne small swaie also behalfe amongst v hereby haue neglected owne good gift god growing home vile valure euerie trifle toie admiration brought hither far country ascribing wot great force solemne estimation vnto vntill also haue waxen old haue béene little regarded despised amongst v owne example hereof could set downe manie manie thing sith purpose deale time garden orchard shall suffice touch onelie shew inconstancie farre shall séeme conuenient turne comprehend therefore vnder word garden ground wrought spade man hand case requireth wine haue written alreadie elsewhere sufficientlie commoditie haue learned since penning booke hath beene verie plentifull iland onlie time roman also since conquest haue séene record yet present haue none else verie little speake growing iland impute vnto soile negligence countrimen herbes fruit root also grow yéerelie ground seed haue béene verie plentifull land time first edward day processe time grew also neglected henrie fourth till latter end henrie seuenth beginning henrie eight litle vse england remained either vnknowne supposed food meet hog sauage beast feed vpon mankind whereas time vse onelie resumed among poore common meane melon pompions gourd cucumber radish skirets parsneps carrets cabbage nauewes turneps kind salad herbes also fed vpon deintie dish table delicate merchant gentleman nobilitie make prouision yearelie new séeds strange country whence haue aboundantlie neither doo staie fruit wholesome kind aduenture vpon verie dangerous hurtfull verangenes mushroms c nature ordeined bellie thing eaten whose mischiefous operation lord measure hath giuen prouided remedie hop time past plentifull land afterwards also maintenance cease reuiued anie better found anie greater commoditie raised onelie pole accounted greatest charge sith men haue learned late sow ashen key ashyards themselues inconuenience short time redressed madder hath growne abundantlie iland long time neglected little reuiued offereth selfe prooue small benefit vnto countrie manie thing else fetched v time gaue selues idlenesse glad haue looke garden annexed house woonderfullie beautie increased onelie floures colmella calleth terrena sydera saieng pingit varios terrestria sydera flores varietie curious costlie workmanship also rare medicinable hearbes curious cunning gardener day presume doo maner list nature moderate hir course thing hir superiours world also sée manie strange hearbs plant annuall fruit dailie brought vnto v indie american taprobane canarie iles part world albeit respect constitution body doo grow v bicause god hath bestowed sufficient commodity vpon euerie countrie hir owne necessitie yet delectation sake vnto eie odoriferous sauours vnto nose cherished god glorified also bicause good gift created doo man helpe seruice almost one noble man gentleman merchant hath great store floures also doo begin wax well acquainted soiles may almost accompt parcell owne commodity haue lesse regard like sort cherish medicinable hearbs fetched region néerer hand insomuch haue séene one garden number three hundred foure hundred halfe whose name within fortie yéeres passed maner knowledge herein find cause iust complaint extoll v farre fall contempt owne truth beneficiall apt v grow elsewhere sith said euerie region hath abundantlie within hir owne limit whatsoeuer needfull conuenient dwell therein doo men extoll vse tabacco time whereas truth whether cause repugnancie constitution vnto operation thereof ground dooth alter hir force cannot tell found great efficacie write beside common germander thistle benet found knowne bée wholesome great power medicine anie hearbe vsed accordinglie could exemplifie like maner sundrie salsa parilla mochoacan c forbeare doo couet bréefe trulie estimation credit yéeld giue vnto compound medicine made forren drug one great cause wherefore full knowledge vse owne simple hath bene long raked vp imbers may verified one sound conclusion greater number simple go vnto anie compound medicine greater confusion found therein quality operation verie particular throughlie knowne euen continuall desire strange drug whereby physician apothecarie onelie hath benefit small cause vse simple home dooth go losse tread herbes vnder féet whose force knew could applie necessity wold honor haue reuerence case behooueth ala haue doo arabian grecian stuffe dailie brought party lie another clime therefore body dwell another constitution home certes grow v arabian grecian albeit maie skill applied vnto benefit yet skilfull owne follie vse forren ware owne maie serue turne follie despise owne magnifie abou • measure vse sought brought farre follie sauoureth ignorance leastwise negligence therefore woorthie reproch among indian haue present cure euerie disease owne nation small regard compound medicins lesse forren drug neither know vse worke woonders euen owne simple also difference clime dooth shew hir full effect whereas heale one another short time application one simple c spaniard englishman stand need helpe driuen haue longer space cure also vse addition two thrée simple whose force vnto throughlie knowne exercise onelie owne men neuer sought heard vertue came country euen marcus cato learned roman indeuor deale cure sundrie disease wherein onelie vsed simple owne countrie also examined learned force wherewith dealt diligentlie life time could atteine exact knowledge thereto wrote learnedlie would easilie séene bookes extant space also 600 yéeres colewort onelie medicine rome disease vertues thoroughlie knowne part pliny time like affection forren drug rage among roman whereby owne grow contempt crieng therefore extreame follie lib 22 cap 24 speaketh maner non placent remedia tam longè nascentia non enim nobis gignuntur immò ne illis quidem alioquin non venderent siplacet etiam superstitionis gratiâ emantur quoniam supplicamus c salutem quidem sine posse constare vel obid probabimus vt tanto magi sui tandem pudeat part doubt vse outlandish drug blinded physician england time passed vertues simple home would haue béene far better knowne well vnto v india practisioners partes therevnto found profitable v forren either maie also ad euen common reason plentie vile bicause abundance without vniuersall especiall efficacie knowne benefit sith god nature hath disposed creature néedfull plentifull seruing generall disease constitution commonlie affected withall great thanks therefore giuen vnto physician age countrie onelie indeuour search vse simple soile dooth yéeld bring foorth also procure grow elsewhere vpō purpose acquaint clime time alteration receiued nature earth maie likewise turne benefit commoditie vsed owne chiefe workeman maie call founder deuise carolus clusius noble herbarist whose industrie hath woonderfullie stirred vp vnto good act albeit matthiolus rembert i▪ obell haue trauelled verie farre behalfe yet none hath come néere clusius much lesse gone finding true description herbes late brought light doubt man england one seuen yéeres would reueale number herbes growing v whereof neither physician apothecary yet haue anie knowledge euen like thankes giuen vnto nobilitie gentleman others continuall nutriture cherishing homeborne forren simple garden hereby shall onlie hand preserued also formes made familiar discerned force better knowne hitherto haue béene euen fareth garden dooth orchard neuer furnished good fruit varietie present beside haue delicate apple plummes peares walnut filberds c sundrie sort planted within fortie yéeres passed comparison old trées nothing woorth haue lesse store strange fruit abricotes almond peach figges cornetrees noble men orchard haue seene caper orenges lemmon heard wild oliues growing beside strange tree brought far whose name know england commodity neuer better furnished neither anie nation vnder clime plentifullie indued blessing high god grant v grace withall vse honour glorie instrument prouocations vnto excesse vanitie wherewith displeasure may kindled least benefit doo turne vnto thornes brier vnto v annoiance punishment hath bestowed vpon v consolation comfort haue like sort workemen onelie excellent graffing naturall fruit also artificiall mixture whereby one trée bringeth foorth sundrie fruit one fruit diuers colour tasts dallieng nature hir course hir whole trade perfectlie knowne vnto hard fruit make tender sowre sweet sweet yet delicate béereuing also kernel core finallie induing sauour muske ambre swéet spice pleasure diuerse also haue written large seuerall practises conuert kernel peach almond small fruit make farre greater remooue ad superfluous necessarie moisture trées thing belonging preseruation lesse diligence physician doo commonlie shew vpon owne diseased body dooth seeme right strange euen doo gardener herbes whereby strengthened noisome blast preserued putrifaction hinderance whereby annuall made perpetuall almost anie one riuers hath od rare quality diuers manie said indued withall vitruuius writeth well paphlagonia whose water séemeth mixed wine addeth thereto diuerse become drunke superfluous taking like force found amne licesio riuer thracia vpon whose bankes man shall hardlie misse find traueller sléeping drunkennesse drinking liquor néere also vnto ephesus certeine welles taste like sharpe vineger therefore much esteemed sicke euill ease part hieropolis spring force strabo saith water thereof mixed certaine herbes choise dooth colour wooll glosse die thereof contendeth skarlet murreie purple oft ouercommeth cydims tarsus cilicia vertue batheth himselfe therein shall find great case gowt runneth ouer ioints one fortunate iles saith pomponius cosmographer two spring one bringeth immoderate laughter drinketh thereof sadnesse restraint effect whereby last taken souereigne medicine great admiration haue beholden susis persia spring maketh drinketh downe anie water cast téeth onlie wash mouth withall maketh fast mouth verie healthfull riuer among gadarens wherof beast drinke foorthwith casteth hoofe haire horne haue anie also lake assyria neere vnto kind glewie matter found holdeth bird hap doo light thereon fast birdlime mean wherof verie manie doo perish taken light vpon howbeit anie portion hereof happen set fire casualtie otherwise neuer quenched casting dust caieranus dooth report another halicarnassus called salmacis noted make men effeminate drinke water certes maie saith strabo water aire region maie qualifie courage men none make effeminate anie thing benefit people neuertheles none found without hir fish know experience diuerse turne ash elme oken stake pole lie throwne hard stone long continuance time strangest thing learne present wherevpon rest owner sufficient defense kéepe house safetie assurance timber double doores locke bolt must defend man robbing haue manie chimnies yet tenderlings complaine rheumes catarhs pose none reredos head heards swine time plentie mast red fallow déere let participat thereof hog nete yea common pultrie also may come vnto abundance dooth prooue verie pernicious vnto first egs latter doo bring foorth beside blackenesse color bitternesse tast haue seldome beene found bréed diuerse disease vnto person haue eaten samethe like haue séene hen doo féed vpon tender blade garlike might ad like sort profit insuing barke wood whereof tanner haue great vse dressing leather buie yearelie maie fadame haue oft séene shall néed time enter anie discourse onlie wi •• • ur sole vpper leathering may haue due time redresse enormitie cōmeth passe execution penall statute gaines gotten giuen one two hungrie vnthriftie person make shew great reformation first litle till • hey find following sute law offendors somwhat chargeable tedious therefore perceiued giue ouer law fall admission gift reward winke thing past haue gone ouer ground kind tillage doo tender licence offer large dispensation vnto shall aske thereby doo listeth trade yearelie pension whereby bribour groweth certeine reuenues tanner great libertie lether much worse mockerie lawes manifest illusion good subiect thus pill poll oke growing england parke oke softest far spalt brickle hedge oke essex growing bardfield parke finest ioiners craft oftentimes haue seene workes made oke fine faire wainescot brought hither danske wainescot made england yet diuerse haue assaied deale without okes end good successe haue hoped bicause ab iuice soone remoued cleane drawne attribute want time salt water neuerthelesse building well hedge parke oke go one waie neuer much hath beene spent hundred year ten yeare time euerie man almost builder hath bought small parcell ground neuer little quiet till haue pulled downe old house anie standing set vp new owne deuise wherevnto curiositie come elme haue great store euerie high waie elsewhere yet haue séene thereof anie togither wood forrests haue béene first planted suffered spread owne willes yet haue knowen great wood béech hasell manie place especiallie barkeshire oxfordshire buckinghamshire greatlie cherished conuerted sundrie v dwell elm euer saw south side douer court essex néere harwich notable grow meane crooked maner almost apt nothing else nauie timber great ordinance béetels thereto naturall qualitie vsed said behalfe continue longer long anie like trées whatsoeuer parcell else land without cuphar shaking cleauing find ash commeth vp euerie selfe euerie kind wood haue verie great plentie lesse vse husbandrie without plane vgh sorfe chestnut line blacke cherrie like although inioy great plentie place time past afore remembred yet haue sufficient necessarie turnes v especiallie vgh may séene betwixt rotheram sheffield stéeds kent also haue béene informed firre frankincense pine doo altogither want especiallie firre whereof haue store chatleie moore darbishire shropshire andernesse mosse néere manchester far leircesters house although time past onelie lancastershire great part coast betwéene chester solme well stored frankincense pine haue béene planted onelie college cloister cleargie religious heretofore wherefore mine opinion may rather saie want altogither except grew naturallie force sée cause whie accounted parcell commodity haue also aspe whereof fletcher make arrowes seuerall kind poplar turner haue great vse bolles trey trough dish c also alder whose barke vnprofitable die blacke withall therfore much vsed countrie wiues colouring knit hosen might take occasion speake great sale yéerelie made wood whereby infinit quantitie hath bin destroied within yéers giue ouer trauell behalfe howbeit thus much dare affirme wood go fast decaie next hundred yeere grace haue doone like doo sometimes increase sheepwalk maintenance prodigalitie pompe haue knowne well burnished gentleman gentleman caught heate sore loade faine go rome physicke yet could saue life hée must néeds die homewards hath borne threescore one paire galigascons shew strength brauerie feared fennie bote broome turffe gall heath firze brake whinnes ling dy hassacks flag straw sedge réed rush also seacole good merchandize euen citie london wherevnto euen haue gotten readie passage taken vp innes greatest merchant parlour man would thinke law able inough make sufficient prouision redresse error enormitie likelie insue nature countriemen manie law made kéepe none vrged make answer rather séeke crooked construction increase priuat gaine yéeld themselues guided common wealth profit countrie end whatsoeuer law saith haue willes whereby wholesome ordinance prince contemned trauell nobilitie councellors derided common wealth impouerished onelie inriched peruerse dealing thus manie thousand person doo suffer hinderance lewd behauior hereby wholesome law prince oft defrauded good meaning magistrate consultation common wealth vtterlie neglected would wish might liue longer sée foure thing land reformed want discipline church couetous dealing merchant preferment commodity country hinderance owne holding faires market vpon sundaie abolished referred wednesday euerie man whatsoeuer part champaine soile enioieth fortie acre land vpwards rate either frée deed copie hold fee farme might plant one acre word sowe oke mast hasell béech sufficient prouision made may cherished kept feare liue long long either wearie world world yet thing may easilie brought passe certes euerie small occasion time enough cut downe great wood euerie trifle sufficeth laie infinit acre corne ground vnto pasture taking downe house small fine beare great manie would god might take example roman restreint superfluous grasing made exact limitation manie head cattell ech estate might kéepe number acre suffice purpose neither wood euer better cherished mansion house mainteined lawes statute also care maintenance nauigation great part charge consul yéerelie view looke vnto hilles whereon great timber grow least vnnecessarie fault satisfaction priuat owner couetous mind might prooue preiudice vnto common wealth hinderance sufficient stuffe furniture nauie certes like hereof yet obserued uenice read also praie suetonius writeth consulship bibulus cesar wood ancus martius dedicated toward maintenance common nauie passe ouer hauing elsewhere remembred vnto another end doo meane speake sith purpose onlie talke owne wood well take finall conclusion wood beside country alreadie driuen sell wood pound heauie report within fortie yéeres shall haue little great timber growing aboue fortie yéeres old commonlie seene yoong staddle leaue standing one twentie yéeres fall vsuallie next sale cut downe without danger statute serue fire bote please owner burne mari fennie bogges haue many englandmarises tennes though many old roman writer doo specifie wale haue respect vnto seuerall quantity country howbeit verie profitable summer halfe yeere number lie lowe néere great riuers small commoditie winter part common experience dooth teach yet find manie moore time past haue béene harder ground sundrie well replenished great wood void bush example hereof may sée triall beside root dailie found déeps monmouth turfe digged also wale aburgauennie merioneth sundrie part lancashire great store firre hath growen time past said people go vnto daie fen mari long spit dash vp verie cronge ground practise thing commonlie doone winter happen smite vpon anie firre trées lie whole length block note place haruest time ground driest come againe get vp afterward carieng home applie v like doo shropshire like hath beene felled old time within 7 mile salop foolishlie suppose haue lien since noies floud fond rest imagine grow euen place find without consideration time pat part lhoegres cambria generallie replenished wood felled ouerthrowne vpon sundrie occasion left lieng place still ground processe time became quite ouergrowne earth mould mould wanting due sadnesse turned moorie plot wherby commeth passe also great plentie water commeth betwéene new loose swart old hard earth drawen awaie ditching dreanes thing soone doone countriemen painfull behalfe might soone leaue drie soile great lucre aduantage owner find history lincolne somtime builded lud brother cassibelan called cair ludcoit great store wood inuironed commoditie vtterlie decaied lud aliue againe would call citie wood rather towne plaines wood heare wasted altogither hilles called peke like sort named mennith orcoit wooddie hilles forrests much wood séene place let hath béene testifie list heare store hath béene time past trauell waie thus much wood mari far deale bath hot welles chap 23 almightie god hath plentifull maner bestowed infinit verie notable benefit vpon ile britaine whereby little inriched hot naturall bath whereof haue diuerse sundrie place manifestlie appéereth hath forgotten england sundrie bath therefore found realme first called saint uinconts second halliewell place opinion obscure two yet seldome sought vnto stand need albeit fame force generallie spread yet case thought nothing inferior diuerse haue often affirmed owne experience triall third place wherein hot bath found néere vnto buxston towne darbishire situat high peke passing sixtéene mile manchester markechesterford twentie darbie eight nine seuerall welles séene thrée counted excellent gratest hotest void corruption compared iones saith summersetshire cold indéed quart boiling water would made fiue quartes running water added therevnto whereas side bath likened vnto haue appropriated vnto gallon hot water hath quart cold mixed herevpon effect bath worketh temperatlie pleasantlie writeth albeit maketh great spéed cure resort vnto helpe yet dealeth effectuallie commodiouslie summersetshire infer withall lesse greeuous accident restreining naturall issue strengthening affeebled member assisting liuelie force dispersing annoious oppilations qualifieng sundrie griefes experience hath oft confirmed like vertues haue two measure therefore operation speedilie perceiued fourth place bath king newnam within certeine mile couentrie water wherof thought procéedeth rocke allume vnderstand diuerse glouers haue béene also mine owne experience hath tast much like allume liquor yet nothing vnplesant vnsauorie drinking thrée welles chiefest best riseth hill runneth toward south thence infinit plentie water without notable diminution spring dailie caried sundrie party realme droonke haue néed occupie two one reserued comelie personage void lothsome disease left common tag rag clensed dailie whereby becommeth wholesomer manie disease also cured palsie dimnesse sight dulnesse hearing especiallie collike stone old sore gréene wound suppose neuer anie compound medicine greater spéedie force behalfes vse simple liquor doo frequent said water hath naturall propertie also following rare leafe sticke ash oke c doo fall within short space store fine sand comming doubt earth water congeale gather forme reserued inner part lightlie altered seeme become hard stone much like vnto ingendred kidneis man haue séene experience first entrance verie cold season warmeth goer casting indifferent heat furthermore remembred man hath yet susteined anie manner impeachment coldnesse vertue thereof found 1579 whitsuntide man wounded himselfe comming water thought onelie wash blood hand therewith go home séeke helpe surgerie finallie finding paine well asswaged wound faire clensed departed misliking vsuall medicins eftsoones came againe often indéed vnto said water till hand healed outright without anie practise meanes also became counsellor hurt paine trie vertue spring finding ease also gaue commendation said water present fame fullie equall resort vnto nothing inferior old bath beside cure disease force extend vnto much speedie may haue one commoditie also smallie considered fift place bath medicinable welles hamlet called newton little saint neots pronounce saint need ten twelue mile cambridge two spring knowne one verie sweet fresh brackish salt good scab leaperie said dimnesse sight uerie manie also doo make repaire vnto sundrie disease returning whole nothing amended bicause cure without working water neuer went people fast church either vnto faire market go wels neere rugbie place discouered 1579 grace heare another well found also ratcliffe néere london euen season sith rumor spred almost euerie spring vaine tale flie maner euerie water surcease speake anie till experience doo trie whether medicinable yet doubt alredie mentioned haue heretofore bin knowne remembred also though confusedlie writer old time yet processe time either neglected forgotten meanes sundrie trouble turmoiles made realme dane outward enimies whereby manifold benefit hath woonderfullie béene missed last place bath citie summersetshire taketh name hot water séene vsed first called cair bledud cair bledune would haue old name ancient castell malmesburie saxon named yngleburne ptolomie afterward called thermae aqua solis scamannia acmancester hight generallie bath english vnder name likelie continue citie selfe verie ancient thing doubt may yet appeare diuerse notable antiquity ingraued stone séene wals thereof first betweene south gate west betwixt west gate north first antike head man made flat great lock haire much like coine haue seene antius romane second betweene south north gate image take hercules held hand serpent dooth thirdlie standeth man foot sword one hand buckler stretched also branch lieth folded wreathed circle like wreath alcimedon moreouer two naked image whereof one bath participate anie allume could neuer till dieng daie indured beléeue might thought necessarie intreat notable situation citie standeth pleasant bottome inuironed euerie side great hils come manie mint england commonlie kept abbaies religious house conquest true dealing commonlie supposed dwell ramseie edmundsburie canturburie glassenburie peterborow like sundrie exemplificats grant whereof yet seene writing especiallie peterborow vnder confirmation pope eugenius wherevnto appeereth charter king edgar haue either held another stanford norman gotten kingdome finger trusted themselues best ouersight mint therefore erected diuerse owne although afterward permitted small péeces siluer vnto sundrie house aforesaid time diuerse mint suppressed southwarke bristow c coinage brought one place saie tower london continuallie holden perused without great gaine deale withall also coinage tin holden yearelie two seuerall time saie midsummer michaelmas west countrie first hearing supposed haue béene monie said mettall granted priuilege prince vnto town hailestone trurie lostwithiell howbeit vpon examination matter find nothing office onlie erected prince wherin allowed ordinarie customes
