prooued ease ox commonlie large bone horsses decent pleasant pase kine commodious pale shéepe profitable wooll swine wholesome flesh goates gainefull kéepers v england speke peculiarlie suppose kine abundant yéeld milke wherof make butter chéese like anie else apt plough diuerse place either horsses ox albeit twin yet herein séeme come short commoditle looked country wit bring foorth commonlie one calfe gaines also gotten cow charge borne hath beene valued twentie shilling yearelie land inhanced proportion gaine much abated likelie decaie ground arise yet déerer god forbid pleasure heard late cow warwikshire belonging thomas bruer studleie six yéeres sixtéene calfes foure three caluings twise twin vnto manie may séeme thing incredibleoxen like maner ox like found anie countrie europe greatnesse bodie swéetnesse flesh else would romane writer haue preferred liguria place grasiers growen cunning doo sée ox bullocke come féeling giue ghesse weight manie score stone flesh tallow beareth butcher may liue sale may haue skin tallow point skill commonlie practised heretofore grasiers also reported ride veluet coat chaines gold absence wiues let supplie turnes lesse skill husband hard worke poore butcher sith mean seldome rich wealthie trade like sort flesh ox kine sold hand weight buier yoong ware rather weight especiallie stéere heighfer sith finer béefe lightest wheras flesh buls old kine sadder substance therefore much heauier lieth scale horne also knowne faire large england anie place except séene among paeones quantitie albeit giuen bréed generallie nature yet helped also artathenaeus lib 10 cap 8 verie yoong manie grasiers oftentimes annoint budding horne tender tip honie mollifieth naturall hardnesse substance thereby maketh grow vnto notable greatnesse certes strange england sée ox whose horne haue length yard thrée foot betweene tip themselues thereto tall heigth man meane indifferent stature scarse equall vnto neuerthelesse much lamented generall bréed catell better looked vnto greatest occupier weane least store bicause buie saie far better cheape raise bring vp time cow hath risen foure noble foure mark mean notwithstanding great price yearelie bring foorth one calfe péece heare doo country horsses moreouer highhorsses although commonlie huge greatnesse place maine yet respect easinesse pase hard saie like land dooth yéeld ass therefore want generation also mule somers therefore part cariage made remaining stoned either reserued cart appointed beare burden conuenient cart plough horsses vse indifferentlie commonlie strong fiue six draw thrée thousand weight greatest tale ease long iourneie although load common vsage consisteth onelie two thousand fiftie foot timber fortie bushel white salt six thirtie baie fiue quarter wheat experience dailie teacheth haue elsewhere remembred kept also burden carie foure hundred weight commonlie without anie hurt hinderance furthermore noted prince nobilitie haue cariage commonlie made cart wherby commeth passe quéenes maiestie dooth remooue anie one place another vsuallie 400 carewares amount summe 2400 horsses appointed country adioining whereby hir cariage conueied safelie vnto appointed place hereby also ancient vse somers sumpter horsses maner vtterlie relinquished causeth traines prince progress shew far lesse king nation serue saddle commonlie geldedgeldings growne verie déere among v especiallie well coloured iustlie limmed haue thereto easie ambling pase countriemen séeking ease euerie corner delight verie much quality chieflie excellent pas besides maner peculiar vnto horsses soile hurtfull rider owner sitting backes moreouer verie pleasant delectable eares noise well proportioned pase dooth yéeld comfortable sound trauelleth waie yet greater deceipt vsed anie among horssekeepers horssecorsers hostelers subtill knauerie great sort without exception anie spoken deale priuat gaine honest meaning man shall haue verie good lucke among deceiued false tricke certeine notable market wherein great plentie horsses colt bought sold wherevnto haue néed resort yearelie buie make necessarie prouision rippon newport pond wolfpit harborow diuerse drouers verie diligent bring great store vnto place manie lewd abusing buie haue custome make looke faire eie come within two day iourneie market driue till sweat space eight twelue houres doone turne ouer back water stand season go forward place appointed make sale infected ware meanes doo fall manie disease malady outlandish horsses dailie brought ouer vnto v speake genet spaine courser naples hobbie ireland flemish roile scotish nag bicause spéech commeth within compasse treatise whose breed maintenance especiallie greatest sort king henrie eight erected noble studderie time verie good successe till officer waxing wearie procured mixed brood bastard race whereby good purpose came little effect sir nicholas arnold late hath bred best horsses england written maner production would god compasse ground like pella syria wherin king nation vsuallie studderie 30000 mare 300 stallion strabo dooth remember lib 16 leaue let v sée may said sheepe shéepe verie excellentshéepe sith sweetnesse flesh passe much woolles preferred milesia place iason knowne value bred britaine would neuer haue gone colchis looke anie dionysius alexandrinus saith de situ orbis may spinning made comparable spider web fooles countrimen séeke bereue themselues commoditie practising dailie transfer nation carieng ouer ram ewe breed increase among first example hereof giuen vnder edward fourth vnderstanding botome sute sundrie traitorous merchant sought present gaine perpetuall hinderance countrie licenced carie ouer certeine number spaine hauing licence shipped veris manie thing commonlie practised commodity also whereby prince hir land seldome time defrauded nature blind déed sée inconuenience féele present gaine regard damage may insue posteritie hereto man would ad also desire haue benefit country impech owne sure god liueth euerie trifle commeth beyond sea though woorth thrée penny estéemed continuall commoditie home v far excéedeth value time past vse commoditie consisted part cloth woolsteds meanes stranger succoured domesticall persecution hath béene imploied vnto sundrie v mockados bay vellures grograines c whereby maker haue reaped small commoditie furthermore noted low country belgie know dailie experience notwithstanding sharpenesse lawes contrarie dooth yet confirme although ram weather doo go thither v neuer well headed according kindshéepe without horne yet haue remained cast head thencefoorth remaine polled without horne certes kind cattell cherished england standeth well commoditie common prosperitie diuerse townes whereof wholie conuerted féeding yet profitable sweetnesse fléece necessitie flesh great benefit manuring barren soile doong pisse superfluous number better borne withall neuer husbandman speake great shéepemasters one man hath 20000 hath lesse cattell séeding fallowes short ground yéeld siner fléece virgil following varro well espied georg 3 saith si tibi lanicium curae primùm aspera sylua lappaequae tribulique absint fuge pabula laeta neuerthelesse sheepe countrie often troubled rot swine measels though neuer generallie manie men great loser calamitie ouer recouer kéepe new stock sound seauen yeares togither former losse easilie recompensed double commoditie cardan writeth water hurtfull shéepe howbeit coniecture know shéepe infected going water take sure certeine token rot hath gotten hold liuers light alredie distempered excessiue heat inforceth rather séeke vnto water certes parcell maine wherin man shall generallie find fine wholesome water england therfore impossible shéepe decaie tasting wherfore hinderance rot rather ascribed vnseasonablenes moisture weather summer also licking mildewes gossamire rowtie fog ranke grasse full superfluous iuice speciallie saie ouer moist wether whereby continuall raine pearsing hollow felles soketh foorthwith flesh bringeth baines also infected first shew sickenesse desire drinke water vnto causa aegritudinis signum morbi euer cardan doo mainteine contrarie peraduenture small babe growne good husband make account euerie ten kine cléerelie woorth twentie pound cōmon indifferent yeares milke fiue shéepe dailie added wote true surmise bicause part trade sure hereof housewiues doo ad dailie lesse proportion ewe milke vnto chéese manie kine whereby cheese dooth longer abide moist eateth brickle mellow otherwise would goat haue p • ntiegoats sundrie colour west part england especiallie towards wale amongst rockie hilles whome owner doo reape small aduantage also cherished elsewhere diuerse stéeds benefit diseased sundrie malady vnto heare milke chéese body yoong kid iudged verie profitable therefore inquired manie farre néere certes find among writer milke goat next estimation woman helpeth stomach remooueth oppilations stopping liuer looseth bellie place also next vnto milke ew thirdlie cow hereof shew reason onelie know ewe milke fulsome sweet tast except vsed vnto man gladlie yéeld liue féed withall swine place hath greater storeswine wholesome eating england neuerthelesse doo neuer anie good till come table eat greene porke dried vp bakon haue continuance lard make though verie little chargeable neither haue vse thereof séene france country sith doo either bake meat swéet suet beefe mutton bast meat sweet salt butter suffer fattest bast selfe leisure champaine country kept herd hogherd appointed attend wait vpon commonlie gathereth togither noise crie leadeth foorth féed abroad field place also woman doo scowre wet cloth doong doo hemlock netles sauor cloth touched withall cannot abide weare bodie scowred reffuse sope mine opinion none vnkindlie fauor tame bore make brawnebores kind meat vsuallie knowne stranger take otherwise would swart rutters french cooke losse cali found great store prouision almost euerie house haue attempted ridiculous successe rost bake broile frie master till better informed haue heard moreouer noble man england long since send ouer hogshead brawne readie sowsed catholike gentleman france supposing fish reserued till lent time eat thereof verie great frugalitie thereto well liked prouision selfe wrote ouer verie earnestlie offer great recompense fish yeare insuing whereas knowne haue beene flesh would haue touched dare saie thousand crownes without pope dispensation fréend mine also dwelling sometime spaine hauing certeine iewes table set brawne whereof eat verie earnestlie supposing kind fish common party goodman house brought head pastime among shew eaten rose table hied home hast ech procuring himselfe vomit oile meanes till supposed clensed stomach prohibited food v accounted great péece seruice table nouember vntill februarie ended chéeflie christmasse time also begin dinner ech daie somewhat hard digestion draught malueseie bastard muscadell vsuallie droonke either conuenientlie otherwise meaner fort content themselues owne drinke season generallie verie strong stronger indéed yeare beside made commonlie fore part tame bore set vp purpose space whole yere twobrawne bore especiallie gentleman house husbandman farmer neuer franke owne vse aboue thrée foure moneths halfe yéere time dieted otes peason lodged bare plank vneasie coat till fat hardened sufficientlie purpose afterward killed scalded cut former part brawne madebaked hog rest nothing fat therefore beareth name sowse onelie commonlie reserued seruing man hind except please owner haue anie part therof baked handled custome manner hinder part cut first drawne lard sodden sodden sowsed claret wine vineger certeine space afterward baked pasty eaten manie stéed wild bore trulie verie good meat pestle may hanged vp drie drawne lard thereby prooue better hereof inough therefore come againe vnto brawne necke peeces cut round called collar brawne shoulder named shilds onelie rib reteine former denomination aforesaid péeces deserue name brawne bowel beast commonlie cast awaie ranknesse likewise stone till foolish fantasie got hold late amongst delicate dame haue found meanes dresse also great cost deintie dish bring boord seruice among like sort though without note desire prouocation fleshlie lust fond curiositie little reuealed bore thus cut ech peece wrapped vp either bulrush ozier péeles tape inkle like sodden lead caldron togither till tender man may thrust brused rush soft straw cleane fat doone take vp laie abroad coole afterward putting close vessel powre either good small ale béere mingled veriuice salt thereto till couered let lie altering changing sowsing drinke least wax sowre till occasion serue spend waie vse make brawne great barrow hog séeth sowse whole doo bore iudgement better easie digestion brawne thus much much may seeme sufficient wild tame foules chap 2 order requireth speake somewhat foules also england may easilie diuide wild tame ala small skill foules say truth neither recite number well distinguish one kind another yet haue generall knowledge nation vnder sunne hath alreadie time yere plentie wild foule manie kind iland dooth bring foorth much would haue higher soile might spared one yeare two greedie engins couetous foulers set onlie pot purse certes enormitie bred great trouble k iohns day insomuch going progresse tenth reigne found little game wherewith solace exercise falcon wherfore bristow christmas insuing restreined maner hawking taking wildfoule throughout england season whereby land within yeares throughlie replenished againe stand vpon impertinent discourse therefore bred land haue crane bitter wild tame swan bustard herron curlew snite wildgoose wind doterell brant larke plouer sort lapwing teele wigeon mallard sheldrake shoueler pewet seamew barnacle quaile onelie man subiect falling sickenesse notte oliet olife dunbird woodcocke partrich feasant besides diuerse whose name vtterlie vnknowne much taste flesh wherewith neuer acquainted serue season seuerall turnes plentie wanting whereby table nobilitie gentrie séeme anie time furnisht production none maruellous mind barnacle whose place generation haue sought oft time farre orchades whereas peraduenture might haue found neerer home onelie vpon coast ireland euen owne riuers say either foule much vnlike vnto haue bred late time place generation perpetuall opportunitie serueth circumstance doo minister occasion thames mouth doo thinke manie beleeue yet thing hath béene seene kind foule beginning vpon short tender shrub standing néere vnto shore whence time came fell downe either salt water liued vpon drie land perished pena french herbarian hath also noted verie end herball mine owne part haue séene experience haue alreadie touched chapter ilands time spent vaine repeat againe looke therefore description man manaw barnacle also eleuenth chapter description scotland doo doubt shall respect iude pigeon hurtfull foule reason multitude number house dailie erected increase bowres countrie call scorne almes house den theeues like wherof great plentie euerie farmer yard kept also sold either quarter hen make great repast cock combe doo country occasion serue whole carcass manie capon hen pigeon like doo oft go wracke beside béefe mutton veale lambe euerie feast taken necessarie dish amongest communaltie england golding cock whereby capon made ancient practise brought old time roman dwelt land gelding turkies indish peacock newer deuise certeinlie vsed amisse sith rankenesse bird verie much abated thereby strong taste flesh sundrie wise amended say gander grow also gelded suppose laugh scorne neither haue tasted anie time foule serued yet haue heard vsed countrie géese driuen field like heards cattell gooseheard toie also lesse maruelled rare heare gelded gander strange sée heare géese led field like shéepe yet gooseheard carieth rattle paper parchment goeth morning gather gostings togither noise whereof commeth sooner eares fall gagling hasten go happen gate yet open none house stirring ridiculous sée peepe vnder doores neuer leaue creaking gagling till let vnto ouertake fellowes v dwell kept sort manie place neither kept much body feather hold furthermore opinion ouer ranke soiles doong dooth qualifie batablenesse soile cattell thereby kept garget sundrie disease although come end licking vp feather might make mention foules producted industrie man betwéene fesant cocke doonghill hen betwéene fesant ringdooue peacocke turkie hen partrich pigeon sith catch vp woormes bréed soiles polydor supposeth sith vplandish townes haue haue net owne store catch withall sundrie act parlement likewise made vtter destruction also spoile rauenous foul hurtfull pultrie cony lamb kid whose valuation reward killeth head deuise brought goth like ordinance destruction white crowes tale made becke killed lamb pig like order taken v vermines also rootage wild maintenance idle person would spend whole time vpon bankes coueting labour hand follow anie good trade none preiudiciall neighbour dwell water pike éele commonlie deuoure fish frie spawne may get come rauenous foules chap 5 make yet anie iust report manie sort hawkes bred within relame howbeit vsuallie among v disclosed land thinke easie losse difficult set downe first therefore haue egle common experience dooth euidentlie confirme diuerse rockes whereon bréed speach serue could well declare excellent aierie much chester castell called dinas bren sometime builded brennus writer doo remember certes castell great thing yet pile sometime verie strong inaccessible enimies though ruinous manie standeth vpon hard rocke side whereof eagle bréedeth euerie yeare also notable ouerthrow hir nest thing oft attempted goeth thither must sure two large basket prouide let downe thereto may sit one couered otherwise eagle would kill teare flesh bone hir sharpe talon though apparell neuer good common people call foule erne ignorant whither word eagle erne doo shew anie difference sexe meane betwéene male female haue great store néere place bréed common complaine great harme doone thier field able beare yoong lambe kid vnto neasts therwith féed yoong come againe opinion diuersitie kind betwéene eagle erne till perceiued nation vsed word erne place eagle haue also lanner lanneret tersell gosehawke musket sparhawke tacke hobbie finallie though verie marlions hawkes doo heare yet bred within iland howbeit wanting v verie plentifull wherefore delite hawking doo make chiefe purueiance prouision danske germanie eastcountries whence haue great abundance excessiue price whereas home bred sold almost right naught vsuallie brought market chickins pullet pigeon v bought vp eaten doo aforesaid foules almost euerie man said sparhawke preieth vpon foule morning taketh ouer euen loth haue double benefit one seelie foule dooth let go make shift selfe hereof stand doubt find among writer worthie noting sparhawke enimie yoong child also ape pecocke maruellouslie afraid appalled courage stomach time taken hir vpon sight thereof proceed rest rauenous bird haue also verie great plentie bussard kite ringtaile dunkite often annoie countrie dame spoiling yoong bréeds chicken duckes gosling wherevnto verie rauens crowes haue learned also waie much rauens giuen kind spoile idle curious head set purpose haue manned reclaimed vsed stéed hawkes could doo imagine rauen vulture almost persuaded time past beleeue finding late description vulture better agreeth forme second kind eagle fréelie surcease longer opinion hath sort shape colour quantitie eagle leg foot hairie rough side vnder wing better couered thicke downe wherewith also gorge part brest vnder throtes armed fethers like part eagle vnto portraiture member rauen also verie blacke colour haue anie resemblance haue none england knowledge haue go generallie vnder name eagle erne neither haue pygargus gripe wherefore haue occasion intreat haue séene carren crowes cunning also owne industrie late haue vsed soare ouer great riuers thames example suddenlie comming downe haue caught small fish féet gone awaie withall without wetting wing euen present aforesaid riuer without thing opinion little wondered haue also ospraies bréed v park wood wherby kéepers doo reape bréeding time small commoditie soone almost yoong hatched tie end ground end sundrie tree old one finding doo neuer cease bring fish vnto keeper take eat commonlie well fed worst sort hath béene hap hitherto see anie foules partlie mine owne negligence heare hath one foot like hawke catch hold withall another resembling goose wherewith swim whether refer search triall thereof vnto neuertheles certeine aliue dead yea euen hir verie oile deadlie terrour fish come within wind cause wherefore describe cormorant amongst hawkes blacke manie pied chiefelie ile elie taken night rauen except call water hawke sith dealing conuenient let v sée may said venemous wormes manie kind haue within realme countrie venemous beast chap 6 go make anie long discourse venemous beast wormes bred england attempt occasion selfe would readilie offer sith haue verie worm beast thought naturall quality either venemous hurtfull first therefore haue adder old saxon toong called atter men doo rashlie take viper certes viper author death hirgalenus de theriaca ad pisonem parent history affirme thereto encelius late writer de metallica lib 3 cap 38plin lib 10 cap 62 maketh mention adder saw sala whose wombe saith eaten like fashion hir yoong one lieng hir sunne shine béene earth worm neuerthelesse nameth vipera calleth male echis female echidna concluding end echis serpent countrimen daie call ein atter haue also noted saxon dictionarie part persuaded slaughter parent either true alwaies although doubt nature hath right well prouided inhibit superfluous increase meanes much rather led herevnto gather nicander venemous worm viper onelie bringeth hir yoong aliue therefore called latine vipera quasi viuipara hir owne death dooth remembrance saie thing testified also word like sense echis id est vipera sola exserpentibus non ouased animalia parit may well remember haue read philostratus de vita appollonij adder viper saw viper licking hir yoong see adder selfe laie thought sléeping moulehill whose mouth came eleuen yoong adder twelue thirtéene inch length péece plaied fro grasse one another till espied sée aristotle animalium lib 5 cap vltimo theophrast lib 7 cap 13 soone therefore saw face ran againe mouth dam whome killed found shrowded distinct cell pannicle hir bellie much like vnto soft white iellie maketh opinion adder viper indéed colour skin part like rustie iron iron graie verie old resemble ruddie blew yeare wit aprill beginning maie cast old skin whereby thought age reneweth stinging bringeth death without present remedie hand wounded neuer ceasing swell neither venem worke till skin one breake ascend vpward hart finisheth naturall effect except iuico dragon latine called dracunculus minor spéedilie ministred dronke strong ale else medicine taken like force may counteruaile ouercome venem length commonlie two foot somwhat seldome dooth extend vnto two foot six inch except rare monsterous onesnakes whereas snake much longer séene sometimes surmount yard thrée foot although poison nothing grieuous deadlie others adder lie winter vnder stone aristotle also saith viper lib 8 cap 15 hole earth rotten stub tree amongst dead leaues heat summer come abroad lie either round beapes length von hillocke elsewhere grasse found onelie woodland country highest ground sometimes though seldome speckled stone called echites dutch ein atter stein gotten dried carcase diuers report good poison snake latine properlie named angues sol cap 40 commonlie seene mooresplin lib 37 cap 11 fen lomie wals low bottom haue great store todes adder commonlie foundtodes doo frog abound snake doo kéepe residencefrogs haue also slowormesloworme blacke graieth colour somewhat shorter adder killing one perceiued called anie want nimble motion rather contrarie neuerthelesse haue blind worme found vnder log wood timber hath lien long place also doo call vpon better ground name flow worm knowen easilie lesse varietie striped colour drawen long way head whole body little excéeding foot length yet venem deadlie also omitted fennie country kind serpent found greater quantitie either adder snake ordinarie oft séene meane intreat among common annoiances neither haue scorpion plague god sent long since italie whose poison apollodorus saith white neither tarantula neopolitane spider whose poison bringeth death except musike hand wherfore suppose countrie happie meane part void two grieuous annoiances wherewith nation plagued haue also eft land waterefts likewise noisome swiftsswifts whereof saie anie losse time sith well knowne region knowledge found void manie themflies fly sith shall amisse little touch also haue none doo hurt hinderance naturallie vnto anie whether cut wastedcutwasted▪ whole bodied whole bodiedhornets void poison venemous inclinationwaspes cut girt wasted english word insecta hornet waspes bées like whereof haue great store opinion conceiued first doo bréed corruption dead horsses second peares apple corrupted last kine ox may true especiallie first latter part beast whole substance also second sith haue neuer waspes fruit beginneth wax ripe déed virgil others speake generation bées killing smoothering brused bullocke calfe laieng bowles flesh wrapped vp hide close house certeine season true hitherto haue tried yet sure one liuing creature corrupteth without production another may see selues whose flesh dooth alter louse also shéepe excessiue number flesh fly suffered lie vnburi •• vneaten dog swine often happilie preuent néedlesse generation concerning bées thinke good remember wheras ancient writer affirme commoditie wanting iland found nothing old time peraduenture none déed day plentie maner euerie vplandish townes▪ one hundred two hundred hiues although said hiues huge east countrie far lesse able conteine aboue one bushell corne fiue peck plinie man set purpose deliteth write woonders speaking honie noteth north region hiues time quantitie one combe conteined eight foot length yet séeme speketh greatest podolia subiect king poland hiues great combes abundant huge bore ouerturning falling drowned honie recouer find meanes come honie also taken reputed besthonie bicause harder better wrought clenlier vesselled vp commeth beyond sea stampe streine comb bées yoong blowing altogither stuffe haue béene informed vse also medicine physician apothecary eschew forren especiallie spaine ponthus reason venemous qualitie naturallie planted write choose home made onelie reason soile hath lesse plentie wild thime growing therein sicilia athens makth best stuffe also bréedeth gotten haruest time lesse choler oftentimes haue séene experience white sugar corned salt hiues made commonlie rie straw wadled bramble quarter make wicker cast ouer claie wée cherish none trées set hiues somewhere warmest side house prouiding may stand drie without danger mouse moth furthermore noted wheras vessel oile néerest top counted finest wine middest honie best heauiest moistes alwaies next bottome euermore casteth driueth dreg vpward toward verie top contrarie nature liquid substance whose groonds léeze doo generallie settle downewards thus much waie bées english honie whole bodied cantharides venemous creature kind abundantlie found country heare yet haue béetles horsefly turdbugs dorres called latine scarabei locust grashoppers doo séeme one thing anon declare like whereof let intreat make exercise catching fly far greater sport offering spider domitian sometime prince yet liuing delited much sée iollie combat betwixt stout flie old spider diuerse men haue great reward giuen painfull prouision fly made onelie purpose parasite also time aforesaid emperour disposed laugh follie yet would seeme appearance gratifie fantasticall head shew dutifull demenour could deuise set lord worke letting flesh flie priuilie chamber foorthwith would egerlie haue hunted businesse set apart neuer ceased till caught hir finger wherevpon arose prouerbe ne musca quidem vttered first vibius priscus asked whether anie bodie domitian answered nemusca quidem wherby noted follie cockescombs england learning abroad men transregionate make account also pastime notable matter telling fight séene betwene either lustie couragious kind one also hath made booke spider flie wherein dealeth profoundlie beyond measure skill neither himselfe made neither anie one readeth reach vnto meaning therof iollie fellow stéed straw thrust fly tale great iniurie doubt noble champion would bestow cost set fooles cap vpon owne head might securitie lesse reprehension behold notable battels concerning locust led diuerse countrie say either germanie italie pannonia 1542 nation greatly annoied kind flie affirme verie constantlie saw none creature grashopper time annoiance said come meotides translation also bible word locusta englished grashopper therevnto leuit 11 reputed among cleane food otherwise iohn baptist would neuer haue liued wildernesse barbarie numidia sée diodorus siculus sundrie place affrica haue beene eaten daie powdred barels therefore people part called acedophagi neuertheles shorten life eater production last irkesome filthie disease india thrée foot long ethiopia much shorter england seldome aboue inch cricket called latin cicada hath likelihood verie great grashopper therefore brought vmpier case finallie matthiolus manie describe locust doo set downe none forme grashopper maketh much rest vpon former imagination locust grashopper one english dog quality chap 7 countrie maie take compare number excellencie diuersitie dog therefore polycrates samia aliue would send epyro merchandize cost prouide britaine ornament countrie péece husbandrie common wealth furnished set purpose molossian lacaonian dog also shéepe attica miletum gotes scyro naxus swine sicilia artificer place howbeit learned doctor caius latine treatise vnto gesner de canibus anglicis bringeth thrée sort gentle kind seruing game homelie kind apt sundrie v currish kind méet many toy part say hath doone alredie wherefore set downe onelie summe hath written name nature addition example two latelie experience whereby courage mastiffes shall yet largelie appeare country haue deale neither care report plinie dog sometime killed sacrifice sometime whelp eaten delicate dish lib 29 cap 4 wherefore anie man disposed read let resort plinie lib 8 cap 40 among woonders telleth armie two hundred dog fetched king garamantes captiuitie mawgre resistance aduersaries also cardan lib 10 de animalibus aristotle c write maruels none credit cardan afraid compare greatnesse ox also smalnesse vnto little field mouse neither doo find anie far writer great antiquitie maketh mention dog starbo excepted saith galles somtime buy vp mastiffes serue forewards battle wherein resembled colophonians castabalenses calicute phenicia plinie also speaketh v first sort therefore diuideth either rowse beast continue chase springeth bird bewraieth hir flight pursute commonlie called spaniel named hound whereof maketh eight sort formost excelleth perfect smelling second quicke espieng third swiftnesse quickenesse fourth smelling nimblenesse c last subtiltie deceitfulnesse saith strabo apt game called sagaces generall name onelie bicause skill hunting also know owne name fellowes exactlie hunter see anie one follow skilfullie likelihood good successe biddeth rest harke follow dog estsoones obeie soone heare name first kind also commonlie called hariers whose game fox hare woolfe anie hart bucke badger otter polcat lopstart wesell conie c second hight terrer hunteth badger graie onelie third bloudhound whose office follow fierce pursue théefe beast drie foot fourth hight gasehound hunteth eie fift greihound cherished strength swiftnes stature commended bratius de venatione vnremembred hercules stroza like treatise aboue britaine saith — magna spectandi mole britanni also nemesianus libro cynegeticôn saith diuisa britannia mittit veloces nostrí que orbis venatibus aptos sort also smooth sundrie colour shake haired sixt liemer excelleth smelling swift running seuenth tumbler eight théefe whose office meane latter two incline onelie deceit wherein oft skilfull men would thinke mischiefous wit remaine sillie creaturs hauing made enumeration dog apt chase hunting commeth next serue falcon time whereof maketh also two sort one findeth game land putteth vp foule keepeth water commonlie vsuall net traine hawke dooth shew large first saith haue peculiar name assigned seuerallie called bird naturall appointment allotted hunt serue consideration named dog feasant falcon partrich howbeit common name spaniell saith therevpon alludeth kind dog bin brought hither spaine like sort haue water spaniel kind third sort dog gentle kind spaniell gentle comforter common terme fistinghound called melitei iland malta whence brought hither little prettie proper fine sought far néere satisfie nice delicacie daintie dame wanton woman willes instrument follie plaie dallie withall trifling away treasure time withdraw mind commendable exercise content corrupt concupiscence vaine disport sillie poore shift shun irkesome idlenes sybariticall puppy smaller thereto haue hole forepart head better accepted pleasure also prouoke méet plaiefellowes minsing mistress beare bosom keepe companie withall chamber succour sléepe bed nourish meat boord lie lap licke lip lie like yoong dianaes wagon coches good reason coursenesse finenesse hath fellowship featnesse neatnesse hath neighbourhead inough plausible prouerbe therefore verefied sometime vpon tyrant namelie loued sow better sonne may well applied kind people delight dog depriued possibilitie reason doo child capable wisedome iudgement yea oft féed best poore man child doores hardlie come woorst former abuse peraduenture reigneth hath bene long want issue else barrennesse best blossome beautie finallie poore men child want owne issue readie thought verie wholesome weake stomach beare dog bosome hath palsie féele dailie smell fauour truelie affirmed let learned iudge onelie shall suffice doctor caius haue said thus much spaniel dog gentle kind dog homelie kindhomelie kind dog either shepheards cur mastiffes first common néedeth speake vse also well knowne keeping heard togither either grase go sheepheard vaine spend anie▪ time wherefore leaue curre vnto owne kindtie dog go hand mastiffe tie dog banddog called bicause manie tied vp chaines strong bond daie time dooing hurt abroad huge dog stubborne ouglie eager burthenous bodie therefore little swiftnesse terrible fearfull behold oftentimes fierce fell anie archadian corsican cur englishman intent dog may cruell fierce assist nature art vse custome although kind dog capable courage violent valiant stout bold yet increase stomach teaching bait beare bull lion like cruell bloudie beast either brought ouer kept vp home purpose without anie collar defend throat oftentimes thereto traine vp fighting wrestling man hauing safegard life either pike staffe club sword priuie coate wherby become fierce cruell vnto stranger caspian made much account sometime great dog euerie able man would nourish sundrie house set purpose end deuoure carcase death thinking dog belly honourable sepulcher common people also followed rate therfore tie dog kept vp publike ordinance deuoure death mean whereof beast became eger great difficultie restreined falling vpon liuing whither digressed returning therefore owne saie mastiffes barke onelie fierce open mouth bitesome 〈…〉 doo barke bite cruellest doo either barke bite barke therefore feared anie othersome bite barke take also name word mase théefe master théefe bicause often stound put person shift townes village principall cause apprehension taking force surmounteth beleefe fast hold take téeth excéedeth credit thrée beare foure lion sufficient trie mastries king henrie seauenth report goeth commanded curres hanged bicause durst presume fight lion king souereigne like excellent falcon saie bicause feared hand hand match eagle willing falconer owne presence pluck head taken downe saieng méet anie subiect offer wrong vnto lord superiour wherein meaning king henrie seauenth liued time would haue doone one english mastiffe alone without anie helpe pulled downe first huge beare pard last lion french king one daie lord buckhurst ambassador vnto whereof write circumstance tooke aduantage let lose vnto finallie draue excéeding feare glad run awaie taken take much paine yet reape small credit wherefore shall suffice haue said thus much thereof mastiffes rage onelie night tied vp daie night also suffered go lose house yard gentle daie time child may ride back plaie pleasure diuerse likewise gelousie ouer maister whosoeuer houshold stranger doo imbrace touch anie fall fiercelie vpon vnto extreame mischéefe furie preuented one dog nichomedes king sometime bithinia séeing consigne quéene imbrace kisse hir husband walked togither garden teare hir peeces mauger resistance present aid attended moreouer suffer stranger come walke house yard listeth without giuing ouer follow put foorth hand touch anie thing flie vpon kill may one selfe would suffer anie man bring weapon gate neither house touched presence beaten anie child would gentlie haue assaied catch rod teeth take hand else pluck downe clothes saue stripe opinion vnworthie noted thus much mastiffes creature lesse faith loue towards maisters horsses may appeare euen confidence masinissa reposed much mistrusting houshold seruants made gard dog manie time deliuered treason conspiracy euen thier barking biting lesse force molossian race brought epiro country poet feigne haue originall brasen dog uulcan made gaue iupiter also deliuered europa procris procris cephalus iulius pollux noteth lib 5 cap 5 neither vnequall carefulnesse mastiffe alexander phereus onelie courage attendance kept maister long time slaughter till last remooued policie tyrant killed sléeping storie goeth thus • e wife said phereus hir three brother conspired death hir husband fearing dog onelie found mean allure chamber doore faire mean vnto another house hard whilest execute purpose neuerthelesse came bed laie sléeping waxed faint harted till put choise either dispatch else hir selfe would wake hir husband giue warning enimies least wise bring dog vpon feared therefore quicklie dispatched last sort dog consisteth currish kind méet manie toy whappet prickeard curre one men call warner bicause good nothing else barke giue warning anie bodie dooth stirre lie wait house night season certes vnpossible describe cur anie order bicause haue anie one kind proper vnto themselues confused companie mixt rest second sort called turne spit whose office vnknowne anie onelie reserued purpose manie place mastiffes beside vse tinker haue carieng heauie budget made draw water great whéeles déepe wels going much like vnto framed turne spit séene roiston feat often practised besides also haue sholts cur dailie brought iseland much made among v bicause sawcinesse quarrelling moreouer bite verie sore loue candle excéedinglie doo men woman countrie may saie bicause bred v yet make report waie pastime sake great man part came late one ship went thither fish see forme fashion wife apparrelled fine fable abiding decke whilest hir husband vnder hatch mariner espied pound two candle hanging mast loth stand idle alone fell eat vp euerie one supposing hir selfe haue béene iollie banket shewing verie plesant gesture hir husband came vp againe vnto hir last kind toiesh cur named bansers mongrell sort also taught exercised danse measure musicall sound instrument iust stroke drum sweet accent citharne pleasant harmonie harpe shewing manie trickes gesture body stand bolt vpright lie flat vpon ground turne round ring holding tailes teeth saw beg meat take man cap head sundrie property learne idle rogish master whose instrument gather gaine old ape clothed motleie coloured short wasted iackets like vagabunds séeke better liuing may get fond pastime idlenesse might intreat dog bred betwéene bitch woolfe called lycisca thing verie often séene france saith franciscus patricius common wealth procured set purpose learned thinke indian tie fault bitch often wood might loined tiger also betweene bitch fox beare mastiffe vtterlie want first sort except brought vnto v happeneth sometime two ingendered seene home amongst v rest heretofore remembred chapter none ouglie odious sight cruell fierce déed vntractable hand begotten betwéene beare bandog whatsoeuer catcheth hold taketh fast man may sooner teare rend bodie sunder get open mouth separate chap certes regardeth neither woolfe beare lion therfore may well compared two dog sent alexander india procreated thought betwéene mastiffe male tiger also hircania bred archadia copulation oft seene betweene lion bitch like france said betwéene shée woolfes dog whereof let suffice sith tractation dooth concerne purpose confutation cardans talke de subt lib 10 saith manie generation dog doo become woolfes contrariwise true could england without manie woolfes nature hath set difference betwéene onelie outward forme also inward disposition bone wherefore vnpossible assertion sound saffron dressing thereof chap 8 saffron england platina reckneth among spice excellent giueth place neither cilicia whereof solinus speaketh neither anie commeth cilicia groweth vpon mount taurus tmolus italie aetolia sicilia licia swéetnesse tincture continuance amongst v grows saffron walden somtime called waldenburg edge essex first planted time edward third glocester shire westerlie part thinke better walden surmounteth rest therefore beareth worthilie higher price six penny twelue penny commonlie pound root herbe beareth commoditie round much like vnto indifferent chestnut yet cloued lillie flaked scallion hath sad substance inter bulbosa orchis hyacinthus orientalis statyrion colour rind much differing innermost shell chestnut although altogither brickle pill onion long leafe florisheth root litle small grasse withered head increaseth multiplieth fillet also small root die time dooth come take vp haue root continue vntill september doo grow againe chiue grounded smallest head also estéemed whether great small sheepe neat may come heape lie field deuoure haie stuble also wroot verie eger maner leafe rather blade thereof long narrow grasse come vp alwaies october floures gathered gone pointed little tuft much like vnto siues sometimes cattell féed vpon neuerthelesse bitten whilest gréene head dieth therefore crokers carefull kéepe annoiance vntill begin wither also cattell soonest tast thereof vntill time iuice thereof bitter euerie floure find commonlie thrée chiues three yellowes double number leaues twisted floures speake yet found two floures grow togither bring foorth fiue chiues alwaies od chiue od yellow though thrée foure floures come one root whole herbe named gréeke crocos dioscorides saith castor cynomorphos hercules blood yet arabian spéech whence borow name giue thervnto find called zahafaran occasion name rembert dooth beare witnesse cause wherefore called crocus poet feigne speciallie whome galen hath borowed historie noteth ninth booke de medicamentis secundum loca writeth maner although take crocus first vsed cō moditie certeine yong gentleman called crocus went plaie coits field mercurie héedlesse himselfe mercury coit happened mishap hit head whereby receiued wound yer long killed altogither great discomfort freends finallie place bled saffron found grow wherevpon people seeing colour chiue stood although doubt grew long adiudged come blood crocus therefore gaue name thus farre rembert galen c differ much ouids metamorphos 4 writeth also thereof indéed chiue remaineth whole vnbrused resembleth darke red broken conuerted vse yéeldeth yellow tincture haue doo fable head saffron raised iulie either plough raising tined hooke scowred rosse filth seuered head ingendred since last setting interred againe iulie august rank rowes couered mould rest earth cast forth litle fillet small root like vnto scallion vntill september beginning moneth ground pared wéeds grasse groweth vpon remoouedpaung intent nothing may annoie floure time dooth come rise thing thus ordered latter end aforesaid moneth septembergathering floure beginneth appeere whitish blew fesse skie colour end shewing selfe owne kindsée 〈◊〉 resembleth almost leucotion theophrast sauing longer hath middest thereof thrée chiues verie red pleasant behold floures gathered morning rising sunné otherwise would cause welke flitter chiues picked floures throwne doonghill dried vpon little kelles couered streined canuasses vpon soft fire wherby weight laied vpon dried pressed cake bagged vp benefit owner good yeeres gather foure score hundred pound wet saffron acre dried dooth yeeld twentie pound drie whereby sith price saffron commonlie twentie shilling monie little easie sée benefit reaped acre commoditie towards charge setter indeed great yet great shall thereby looser anie thing diligent admit triple tillage acre dooth cost 13 shilling foure penny saffron set clodding sixtéene penny taking euerie load stone foure penny raising euerie quarter head six penny much clensing besides rent ten shilling euerie acre thirtie load doong woorth six penny load laid first yéere setting three twentie shilling foure penny paring fiue shilling six penny picking pound wet c yea though hire readie set paie ten pound yet shall susteine damage warme weather open season doo happen gathering also noted euerie acre asketh twentie quarter head placed rank two inch one long bed conteine eight ten foot breadth thrée yeeres ground serue well without compest barleie space eightéene twentie yéeres togither experience dooth confirme head also euerie acre raising store acre halfe new ground great aduantage floure eight ten day togither best saffron gathered first time foure pound wet saffron go verie neere make one drie middest fiue pound one make one chiue waxeth smaller six last doo yéeld one dried reason chiue verie leane hungrie twentie yeeres also ground may set saffron againe lieu conclusion take perpetuall rule head comming good ground prosper best lighter soile contrariwise one note crokers doo carefullie obserue head raised euerie third yeare v witraising midsummer rosse commeth drie head commonlie first yéere set yéeld verie little increase yet commeth counted finest greatest chiue best medicine called saffron du hort next crop much greater third exceedeth raise againe walden cambridge shire period time also head said child yéeld part diuerse headlets whereby hath béene séene one head hath béene increased though owne detriment three foure fiue six augmentation onlie cause whereby sold good cheape remembrance haue knowne foure bushel coome valued much aboue two shilling eight penny except od yéeres arise eight ten shilling quarter ouer great store winter water hath rotted stood within ground heat summer parched burnt vp norffolke suffolke raise seuen yéeres saffron fine cambridge shire walden cake ting hold colour withall wherein lieth great part value stuffe craftie iackes vse mix scraped brazell floure sonchus commeth somewhat neere indeed hue good saffron late gathered soone bewraied depth colour hardnesse also plentie saffron twentie yeeres passed townesmen walden gaue one halfe floures picking sent ten twelue mile abroad countrie whilest rest thankfull abundance god blessing bestowed vpon wishing rather scarsitie thereof kéeping vp price contemptuous maner murmured saieng shite saffron therewith choake market shewed themselues lesse ingrat infidel behalfe lord considered vnthankfulnesse gaue euer since scarsitie greatest murmurer haue least store either worne occupieng remaine scarse able mainteine ground without helpe men certes hath generallie decaied safton walden since said time vntill late within two yeares men began againe plant renew great commoditie procéed head raised taken vp remaine sixteene twentie day earth yea peraduenture full moneth howbeit commonlie earth againe saint iames tide verie shortlie taken vp midsummer beginning iulie head shirnke like rosted warden august wax drie become vnfruitfull decaie know experience haue carried london notwithstanding haue remained vnset space fortie dais yet haue brought foorth two thrée floures peece floures thrée fiue chiues greeat admiration haue gathered béene acquainted nature countrie grew crokers saffron men doo vse obseruation litle comming vp floure sometime taking vp midsummer tide opening head iudge plentie scarsitie commoditie come sée many small hairie veines saffron middest bulbe pronounce fruitfull yeare saie truth cleauing ech head man shall discerne saffron colour sée abouts chiue issue root warme darke night swéet dew fat ground chéeflie chalkie mistie morning verie good saffron frost cold doo kill keepe backe floure else shrinke vp chiue thus much haue thought good speake english saffron hot second drie first degrée plentifull crokers hold yéere wherein ewe twin make warrantize hereof otherwise sure deceit vsed anie trade saffron making grease paper kell little candle grease make woorst saffron haue good colour best afterwards also sprinkle butter thereon make weight better bewraied either quantitie thereof holden ouer fire siluer spoone softnesse thereof betwéene fore finger thumbe thirdlie colour thereof age laie farre worse saffron country colour bewraie forgerie swartnesse chiue otherwise would excell therevnto sound remaine crispe brickle drie finallie holden néere face strike certeine biting heat vpon skin eies whereby adiudged good merchant ware indéed among skilfull crokers please heare anie vertues thereof note insuing request one required touch whatsoeuer breuitie listed therefore saffron beside manifold vse hath kitchin pastrie also cake bridal thanksgiuings woman verie profitably mingled medicins take disease breast lung liuer bladder good also stomach take meat comforteth maketh good digestion sodden also wine onelie kéepeth man droonkennesse incorageth also vnto procreation issue drinke sweet wine inlargeth breath good troubled tisike shortnesse wind mingled milke woman laied vpon eies staieth humor descend taketh awaie red wheales pearles oft grow killeth moth sowed paper bag verie thin laid vp press amongst tapistrie apparell also verie profitablie laid vnto inflammation painefull aposthumes shingle dooth small ease vnto deafnes mingled medicins beneficiall vnto eares great vse also ripening botch swelling procéeding raw humor shall please drinke root thereof maluesie maruellouslie prouoke vrine dissolue expell grauell yéeld small ease make water dropmeales finallie thrée dram thereof taken weight one shilling nine penny halfepenie deadlie poison dioscorides dooth affirme droonke wine saith platina lib 3 cap 13 de honesta voluptate dooth hast droonkennesse verie true haue knowne eating onelie bread custome streined saffron haue become like droonken men yet otherwise well known competent drinker confirmation also man doo open ransake bag one hundred two hundred weight merchant doo buie crokers strike aire head deale withall time shall giddie sicke meane two three houres space nose eies like sort yéeld plentie rheumatike water shall better long especiallie eiesight woonderfullie clarified meanes howbeit merchant liking physike muffle themselues woman doo ride put spectacle set leather dooth measure altogither put force thereof groweth saffron manie place almaine also uienna austria later taken best springeth quarter steed doo vse carthamus called amongst v bastard saffron neither anie value wise comparable vnto whereof let suffice commoditie brought iland time edward 3 commonlie planted till richard 2 reigne would grow verie well take chiltern hils vale white horsse well walden cambridgeshire carefull heare also cherished alreadie glocestershire certeine place westward finenesse tincture chiue heare yet anie triall would god countriemen béene heretofore carefull commoditie would doubt haue prooued beneficiall iland cloth wooll ala idle heretofore much giuen ease reason smalnesse rent men regard search best commodity landlord hold raise rent farm begin inforce tenant looke better vnto gain scratch rent vnder euerie clod may turned aside greatest mart saffron aquila abruzo haue especiall weight ten pound lesse hundred florens luke agréeth shall appéere hereafter quarry stone building chap 9 quarry v pit mine dig stone build withall haue great plentie england diuerse sort verie profitable sundrie necessarie v time past vse stone maner dedicated building church religious house princely palace bishop manours hold onlie scrupulous obseruation altogither infringed building stone commonlie taken vp amongst noble men gentleman timber frame supposed much better paper worke little continuance least continuance farre passeth cunning set downe manie sort stone building found england much call proper name howbeit curiositie countrimen notwithstanding almightie god hath blessed realme plentifull maner manie quarry apt meet pile longest continuance yet lothsome abundance liking plentie doo commonlie leaue naturall gift mould cinder ground take vp artificiall bricke burning whereof great part wood land dailie consumed spent small decaie commoditie hinderance poore perish oft cold elder haue time time following naturall vice misliking owne commodity home desiring country abroad estéemed cane stone brought hither normandie manie euen day following veine doo couet work almost vse none howbeit experience one side skilfull mason whose iudgement nothing inferiour country doo affirme north south part england certeine place quarry hardnesse beautie equall outlandish greet maie also confirmed king chappell cambridge greatest part square stone wherof brought thither north commend veine white frée stone slate méere stone betwéene pentowen blacke head cornewall verie fine stuffe doo speake much quarry hamden nine mile milberie pauing stone burbecke toph stone allow quarrie dresleie diuerse mislike veines hard stone oxford burford one praiseth free stone manchester prestburie glocestershire another quarry like richmont third liketh well hard stone clee hill shropshire fourth thorowbridge welden terrinton whereby appeareth haue quarry inow good inough england sufficient v build withall péeuish contempt owne commodity delectation inrich country catch foolish hold vpon v also verified anie waie nation haue rather néed england eugland anie thinke may suffice substance work haue regard ornature manie mine sundrie kind course fine marble england chieflie one staffordshire neere peke 〈…〉 lord chaindois fift eglestone • blacke marble spotted graie white spot sixt farre durham white marble also haue store faire marpesian paris ile meane go recite excellent sith haue named alredie altogither best scarselie anie value comparison whose place growth vtterlie vnknowne vnto whereof blacke marble spotted greene none vilest sort maie appeare parcell pauement lower part quire paules london also westminster péeces thereof yet séene marked anie looke marble serue haue finest alabaster maie elsewhere bée saint dauids wale also neere beau manour foure fiue mile leicester taken best although diuerse quarry hereof beyond trent yorkeshire c fullie good whose name time remembrance talke plaister axholme dig earth sundrie place lincolne darbishires wherewith blanch house stead lime speake certes fine kind alabaster sith sold commonlie twelue penny load iudge vile course part cannot skill stone yet opinion without great vse plaister paris mine stone thereof lie flake vpon like plankes table vnder excéeding hard stone verie profitable building hath often time béene prooued also marked plaister white graie contented god quarrie dooth send yéeld foorth haue deuised cast mould windowes pillers forme fashion list euen alabaster selfe stuffe sundrie house yorkshire furnished late continuance deuise like proue time come shall easilie bewraie meane time sir rafe burcher knight hath put deuise practise affirmeth six men six moneths shall trauell trade sée greater profit owner twelue men six yeares could tricke inuented neither alabaster marble dooth suffice haue touchstone called latine lydius lapis shining glasse either match socket pillers alabaster contrariwise please workeman ioine pillers alabaster touch socket brasse pewter copper want also mettals think nation haue excellent greater diuersitie stuffe building maie haue england selues could like ala nature men delite v desire noueltie oft exchange finest cloth corne tin woolles halfe penie cockhorsses child dog wax chéese two pennie tabers leaden sword painted feather gewgaw fooles dogtricks disards hawkeswhoods like thrée ship beyond sea woorth v right good iewell easie home haue also cast teach v neglect owne thing see begin make anie account commodity haue also like owne country suddenlie abase low price gaine woorthie trauell commoditie lesse cost readie home country though causeth v giue ouer indeuours forget matter whereabout went obteine hand onelie cause wherefore commodity oft little estéemed saie without anie teacher buie case fox englishman groat make afterward giue twelue penny taile would god might wax wiser one indeuor commonwealth england may flourish againe hir old rate commodity may fullie wrought home cloth example caried shorne dressed abroad clothworkers doo starue beg bread lacke dailie practise vtterlie neglect skilfull science purpose haue england great plentie quicke siluer antimonie sulphur blacke lead orpiment red yellow haue also finest alume wherein diligence one greatest fauourers commonwealth england subiect hath béene late egregiouslie abusedthe lord mountioy euen almost barbarous inciuilitie lesse force fire vsed parietings lipara onlie vse somtime amongst asian roman wherof sylla triall meant haue burned tower wood erected archelaus lieutenant mithridates could meanes set fire long time bicause washed ouer alume also gate temple ierusalem like effect perceiued titus commanded fire put vnto beside haue also naturall cinnabarum vermilion appéere yet good record whereas great distance betweene syllan iles point land end late yeares speke scarselie brooke draine one fadam water betwéene much euidences appeereth yet séene hand lord chiefe owner iles procéed colemines haue plentie north westerne part iland may suffice realme england must doo hereafter deed wood better cherished present saie truth notwithstanding verie manie caried country maine yet greatest trade beginneth grow forge kitchin hall may appéere alreadie city townes lie coast haue little fewell except turffe hassocke maruell little trade sussex southhampton siluer daughter noble child g • ld hir brother among mettall worthilie called cheefe contrariwise substance aforesaid parent mixed without proportion lesse digested fixed entrailes earth whereby radicall moisture becommeth combustible force indure heat hammer dooth either turne tin lead copper iron first mettals knowne time past vnto antiquitie although day diuerse whereof neither alchumists euer anie knowledge therfore reputed among third sort england haue part call mind intreat breuitie may serue turne yet altogither omit saie somewhat gold siluer also bicause find good experience said old time without great reasongold siluer country haue need britaine britaine selfe none truelie man regard necessity nature onelie requireth nation vnder sunne saie much sith doo want none conuenient v wherefore benefit haue anie gold void neither likewise siluer whatsoeuer cicero affirmeth contrarie lib 4 ad atticum epi 16 whose time found britannici belli exitus saith expectatur constat enim aditus insulae esse munitos mirificis molibus etiam illud iam cognitum est neque argenti scrupulum esse vllum illa insula neque vllam spem praedae nisiex mancipijs ex quibus nullos puto te litteris aut musicis eruditos expectare albeit haue abundance country doo yéeld yet haue rich countrimen store inough pursses time past woont haue least bicause garnishing church tabernacle image shrine apparell preests consumed greatest part experience hath confirmed late countriemen haue found wot voiage west indie whence haue brought gold whereby countrie inriched euer aduentured part none haue sped better sir francis drake whose successe 1582 hath far passed euen owne expectation one iohn frobisher like maner attempting séeke shorter cut northerlie region peaceable sea kingdome cathaie happened 1577 vpon certeine ilands waie wherein great plentie much gold appeared much letted giue certeintie salomon gold thence wherewith builded temple golden shew made desirous also like successe left former voiage returned home bring news thing seene another voiage found drosse gaue ouer enterprise keepeth home without anie desire séeke farre country truth plentie ore séene holden perfect might haue furnished world abundance mettall iorneie also short performed foure fiue moneths notable incouragement proceed tin lead mettals strabo noteth time carried vnto marsilis hencetin lead dooth make stuffe brickle brasse better pewter profitable vnto dooth buie purchase proceed place beyond sea garnish good flat english pewter ordinarie making saie flat bicause dish platter time begin made déepe like basons indéed conuenient sawce broth kéeping meat warme estéemed almost pretious like number vessel made fine siluer maner lesse desired amongst great estate whose workman nothing skilfull trade neither mettall good plentie great haue england roman made excellent looking glass english tin howbeit workemen equisite feat brundusiens wherefore wrought mettall carried ouer vnto waie merchandize verie highlie glass estéemed till siluer came generallie place end brought tin contempt manner euerie dishwasher refused looke siluer glass attiring hir head howbeit making siluer glass béene vse britaine knowne vnto roman read one praxiteles deuised yoong time pompeie comming caesar iland mine lead sometimes also wale indured long till people consumed wood melting also comeristwith six mile stradfluer suppose pliny time abundance lead whereof speaketh found part seauentéenth thirtie fourth booke also affirmeth laie verie swart earth dailie gotten plentie roman made restraint cariage thereof rome limiting much yearelie wrought transported ouer sea waie worthie noted crow miner tin dwelling néere comeristwith leland saith made tame would dailie flie follow worke place soeuer happened trauell labourer working time bottome vallie first mine knowne laie pursse girdle men commonlie doo addresse themselues applie businesse earnestlie himselfe also vsed time time crow likewise verie busie flittering much molested waxed angrie bird furie threatened wring necke might get hand short end crow hastilie caught vp girdle pursse made awaie withall far hir wing could carrie hir héerevpon pore man falling great agonie feared vse peraduenture monie threw downe mattocke aduenture ran bird curssing menacing lose life euer got againe fell crow mean whereby life saued béene long mine yer fell downe killed fellowes take vpon discourse search cause thus dealing bird large peraduenture set selfe brier well find waie come againe yet persuaded crow god instrument herein whereby life poore labourer preserued doone also order read another tame crow kept vp shoomaker dutch land shop stoue séeing sit vpon pearch among shoone verie heauilie drousie said vnto bird aileth iacke whie art thou sad pensiue crow hearing maister speake sort vnto answered else diuell within psalter cogitaui dy antiquos aeternos mente habui whither digressed lead vnto crowes crowes vnto yéeldeth making claricord wire place realme neuerthelesse better cheape v stranger onelie brought hither qualitie get anie commoditie vse extremitie towards owne nation haue found meanes shut forreners bringing like breedeth like manner great expense waste wood dooth making pot table vessell glasse wherein much losse sith quicklie broken yet thinke easie made tougher alchumists could find true birth production red man whose mixture would induce metallicall toughnesse vnto whereby abide hammer copper latelie foundcopper rather restored againe light haue read copper haue béene heretofore gotten iland howbeit stranger haue commonly gouernance mine hither make small gain hand north part informed profit dooth verie hardlie counteruaile charge whereat wise men doo litle maruel considering abundance mine dooth séeme offer hand leland countrieman noteth sundrie great likelihood naturall copper mine eastward betwéene dudman trewa •• thher place wherea • sundrie pla • e booke alreadie therefore shall b • vaine repeat againe • hat gotten marchasite speake sith incident purpose dorsetshire also copper mine latelie found brought good perfection stéelestéele good edgetooles colaine yet one often sold like tale vsed saie thirtie gad sheffe twelue sheffes burden alchumie artificiall thereof spoones salt commonlie made preferred pewter albeit truth much subiect corruption putrifaction heauie foule handle pewter yet ignorant person affirme mettall naturall verie encelius calleth plumbum cinereum german wisemute mithan counterfeie adding groweth siluer farre neuerthelesse knowne mixture brasse lead tin latter occupieth one halfe another proportion vsed pewter ala persuaded neither old arabian new alchumists time euer heare albeit name thereof doo séeme come forge common sort indeed doo call alchumie vnwholsome mettall god wot woorthie banished driuen land thus conclude discourse hauing saie mettals countrie except talke brasse bell mettall brought ouer merchandize country preferred geat britaine like stone bred luke country wheresoeuer marbodeus gallus also writing among estimation saith thus nascitur lycialapis propè gemma gagates sed genus eximium faecunda britannia awaie serpent onelie perfume thereof charles fourth emperour name glased church withall standeth fall tangra cannot imagine light enter therby writer also diuide stone fiue kind one colour like vnto lion tawnie another straked white veines third yellow line fourth garled diuerse colour among like drop bloud come inde fift shining blacke anie rauens feather moreouer geat one first stone ile whereof anie forren account made pearles also match renowme much onelie desire caused caesar aduenture hither séene quantity heard plentie abode france whereof made taberd offered vp rome uenus hoong diamond adamant although verie faire sight yet much softer found bred toward north brought hither country haue also vpon coast white corall nothing inferiour found beyond sea albe néere fall tangra red blacke whereof dioscorides intreateth lib 5 cap 8 haue like sort sundrie stone dailie found cliffes rock beside load stone oftentimes taken vp mine iron whereof find haue either knowledge else doo make small account seduced outlandith lapidary whereof part discourage v searching séeking owne commodity end maie haue frée vtterance naturall artificiall ware whereby get great gaines amongst haue skill haue heard best triall stone laie naile thombetriall stone go abroad cleare light colour hold place like stone thought naturall good alter especiallie toward naile sound rather taken artificiall péece practise true experiment woorthie noting cardan also hath de subtilitate notlib 7 haue read lie one example cato saieth cup iuie hold wine haue made vessel wood refuse kind liquor therefore suppose antipathia betweene wine iuie reading philosopher without maner practise seeme infer amongst v yet denie iuie gréece italie may haue propertie iuie france somewhat participat withall like effect groweth hotter soile baptista porta saith holdeth also french iuie wherefore beléeue hath anie qualitie cato ascribeth vnto say stone trulie tell sith haue said may alreadie peraduenture thinke necessarie causeth passe ouer taken oisters todes muskels snailes adder likewise found vpon sundrie hils glocestershire haue naturallie sundrie proportion formes colour passe humane possibilitie imitate workeman neuer skilfull cunning also found head perch carp much desired haue stone yet themselues stone rather shels gristle time consume nothing yet ad found muskels vtterlie ignorant generation pearl good pearle déed haue sundrie time gathered ounce diuerse haue hole alreadie entered nature much inferiour great peason quantitie thereto sundrie colour happeneth amongst brought esterlie coast saffron walden lent want flesh stale stinking fish welked muskels thought good meat fish déere amongst v law dooth bind v vse sée generation pearl description scotland shall informed boetius behalfe called orient cléerenesse resembleth colour cléere aire rising sun also sought later end august little time swéetnesse dew conuenient kind fish dooth ingender conceiue whose forme flat much like vnto lempet north also found brighter colour substance better valure lapidary doo giue salt made england chap 13 england certein welles salt made whereof leland hath written abundantlie cōmentaries britaine whose word onlie set downe english wrote bicause seemeth haue diligent consideration without adding anie thing mine owne except necessitie dooth inforce méere aid reader vnderstanding mind directing therefore iournie worcester peregrination laborious trauell ouer england saith thus worcester road wich inclosed soile hauing meetlie good corne ground sufficient wood good pasture six mile wich standeth somewhat vallie low ground betwixt two small hils left ripe calleth banke euerie brooke english treatise pretie riuer far beneath wich called salope brooke beautie towne maner standeth one stréet yet manie lane towne besides also meane church maine stréet wéeke indifferent round market towne selfe somewhat foule durtie anie raine falleth reason much cariage stréets verie ill paued rather paued great aduancement also hereof making salt though commoditie thereof singular great yet burgess poore generallie bicause gentleman haue part gotten great gaine hand whilest poore burgess yeeld vnto laboura common plague thing anie great commoditie one beateth bush another catcheth bird may see batfowling present time thrée hundred salter thrée salt spring towne wich whereof principall within butshoot right ripe banke riuer commeth downe spring double profitable yeelding salt liquor saie rather fable salt spring faile time richard de la wich bishop chichester afterwards intercession restored profit old course superstition people remembrance whereof peraduenture zeale wich men salter beare vnto richard de la wich countriman vsed late time daie commeth yeare hang salt spring well tapistrie haue sundrie game drinking foolish reuels procéed great number salt cote well wherein salt water sodden lead brought perfection pure white salt two salt spring left side riuer pretie waie lower first found verie end towne also diuerse fornaces make salt profit plentie two nothing comparable gaine riseth greatest asked salter manie fornaces three spring numbred eightéene score thrée hundred sixtie saieng euerie one paied yearelie six shilling eight penny king truth old liberty giuen vnto thrée hundred fornaces therevpon giue fee farme vectigal one hundred pound yearelie certes pension number fornaces increased foure hundred late search made another salt spring abouts meanes one newport gentleman dwelling wich place appéereth dooth also wood timber set kéepe vp earth falling pit since occupied whether lacke plentie salt spring letting hindering profit three thinke wood sale salt would serue might dig find salt spring wich thrée somewhat else wind heard late yeares salt spring found quarter worcestershirepriuileges doo somtimes harme grew without anie vse sith wich men haue priuilege alone quarter shall haue making salt pit set gutter salt water easilie turned euerie man house mantwich verie manie trough go ouer riuer commoditie dwell side séeth also salt water fornaces lead lade salt case wicker water draineth salt remaineth also two thrée verie little salt spring dertwitch low bottome salt sometime made late also mile cumbremere abbaie peece hill sinke pit rose spring salt water abbat began make salt men citie compounded abbat couent none made whereby pit suffered go losse although yéelded salt water still selfe yet spoiled last filled vp filth wich men vse cōmoditie salt spring drawing decocting water onlie six moneths yeare midsummer christmas gesse mainteine price salt sauing wood thinke principall reason making salt great notable destruction wood shall greater hereafter except prouision made better increase firing lacke wood also alreadie perceiued place néere wich whereas vsed buie take wood neere vnto occupiengs woonted spring decaied inforced seeke wood far worcester towne part brenisgraue alchirch alcester asked salter much wood supposed yearelie spent fornaces answered estimation consumed six thousand load round pole wood easie cleft handsomelie riuen péeces people fornace verie ill coloured iust rate euerie fornace make foure load salt yearelie euerie load goeth fiue six quarter make account fornace men make one fornace foure load said imploied owne auaile thus much hath leland left memorie white salt booke hand hath touched making also baie salt part countrie sith booke deliuered againe owner tractation baie salt framed anie order bicause memorie serue shew true maner place shall suffice therfore haue giuen notice end reader may know aswell baie white wrought made england white also vpon west coast toward scotland essex else salt water betwéene wire cokermouth commonlie like price wheat finallie hauing thus intermedled artificiall salt mineral let v giue ouer go hand mettals growing england accompt time hir part chap 14 libra assis roman weight foot standard measure accompt part time take daie consisting foure twentie houres greatest least least greatest whereby keepe reckoning houre saie truth ancient roman greek hebrues anie vse sith reckoned watch whereof also censorinus cap 19 sheweth reason wherefore neglected part doo sée anie great difference vsed obseruation time hir part betwéene owne forren nation wherfore shall néed stand long matter howbeit end exact order herein shall appéere vnto men set downe short rehearsall thereof briefe manner vnto possible astronomicall practises meane meddle sith course vniformelie obserued ouer common order therefore begin minut conteineth part houre smallest part time knowne vnto people notwithstanding place descend lower halfe quarter quarter houre whence proceed vnto houre wit foure twentith part call common naturall daie dooth begin midnight obserued continuallie clockes dialles astronomicall instrument sort artificiall varietie kind ware great england place else mine opinion comparable therein ile speake cost bestowed vpon perle stone neither valure mettall whereof haue béene made gold siluer c almost abbeie religious house without onelie shall suffice note waie antiquitie hath delighted thing time pompe excesse spendeth nothing regarded bringeth bread vnequall temporall houres day nation hath regard therefore shew quantity difference diuisions greater lesser whereof later conteineth one vnequall houre rising halfe signe whole signe two houres space wherof marke seemeth speake cap 15 c 25 rest euangelists yea also ibid vers 33 doo matth 27 e 45 luke 23 e 44 iohn 19 b 14 vaine like sort wheras elder aegyptians italian bohemian latter atheniens iews begin daie sun set ouer night persian babylonian grecian noribergians sun rising ech accompting day night vnequall houres also elder atheniens arabian dutchman umber hetrurians astronomer high noone reckon noone noone hipparchus latter aegyptians speake properlie imitating roman maner vsed church long time choose verie point midnight whence accompt twelue equall houres vnto middaie insuing twelue againe vnto aforesaid point according verse manè diem graeca gen incipit astrasequentes medio lucis iudaeis vespere sanctum inchoat ecclesia medium sua tempora nocte generall order naturall daie artificiall make farre accompt reckon daie sun vp night sun leaueth horizon otherwise also diuide two part saie fore noone noone regarding ruddie shining burning warming season thrée vnequall houres péece others séeme diuide spring time summer autumne winter like curious manner whereof read verse solis equi lucis dicuntur quatuor horae haec rubet haec splendet haec calet illa tepet indéed physician haue another partition daie men lesse learning doubt best forren country could conceiue herein concurre also nation distinction regiment humor diuide artificiall daie night wise verse doo import indéed generall rule ech doth follow tres lucis prima noctis tres sanguinis imas vi cholerae medias lucis sex vendicat horas dátque melam prima noctis tres lucis imas centrales ponas sex noctis phlegmatis horas thus tansteter hath giuen foorth prelections nona noctis donec sit terita lucis est dominus sanguis sex inde sequentibus horis est dominans cholera dum lucis nona sit hora post niger humid inest donec sit tertia noctis posthaec phlegma venit donec sit nona quietis english thus effect three houres yer sun doo rise manie blud nine three noone hot choler beares swaie euen nine night swart choler hath rule phlegme thence three morne six houres ech one saie like sort night haue none part twilightnight darkenight midnight cock crowing wheras latin diuide 7 part vesper vesper vesperugo plautus calleth virgil vseth word hesper euening immediatlie setting sun crepusculum crepusculum twilight call prima fax men begin light candle betwéene daie night light darkenesse properlie neither daie night concubium concubium still night ech one laid rest intempestum intempestum dull dead night midnight men first dead sléepe gallicinium gallicinium cock crowing conticinium conticinium cock haue left crowing matutinum matutinum breach daie diluculum diluculum siue aurora ruddie orenge golden shining colour séene immediatlie rising sun opposite euening matutinum twilight doo reckon watch diuiding night sun setting foure equall partswatches first beginneth euening called first watch continueth thrée vnequall houres foorth vntill end ninth houre whereat fourth watch entreth called morning watch bicause concurreth partlie darke night partlie morning breach daie rising sun originall word houre verie ancienthoure yet old watch wherof shall read abundantlie scripture deuised first among souldiors better safegard change watchman camp like whereof almost vsed among seafaring men call clearing glasse performed time time great héed solemnitie vnto word hora among grecian signified well foure quarter yéere foure twentith part daie limit anie forme stand vpon thing let purpose staie procéed therefore naturall day wéeke compactedweeke consisteth seauen fridaie commonlie called among vulgar sort either king worling bicause either fairest foulest seauen albeit cannot ghesse anie reason whie imagine first entreth mondaie whereby commeth passe rest vpon sundaie seauenth number almightie god hath commanded word iews begin wéeke vpon saturdaie setting sun turk day saturdaie whereby commeth passe iews make last daie first wéeke turk make iewish sabaoth beginning hebdoma bicause mahomet prophet saie borne dead vpon fridaie indéed except alcharon deceiue iews doo reckon day distance sabaoth first daie wéeke first daie sabaoth foorth vnto sixt latin aegyptians accompted day seauen planet choosing denominator daie entreth regiment first vnequall houre sun risen howbeit order wholie reteined v vse yet altogither abolished may appéere sunday mondaie saturdaie rest changed saxon remembrance theut sometime prince called second day wéek theutsdach third woden othin othon edon
