rebellion rose assembled themselues togither make warre roman hundred twentie thousand got togither one armie vnder leading said uoadicia bunduica name hir therefore encourage hir people enimies mounted vp high place raised vp turfes sod made nonce made long verie pithie oration hir mightie tall personage comelie shape seuere countenance sharpe voice hir long yellow tress heare reaching downe hir thighes hir braue gorgeous apparell also caused people haue hir great reuerence ware chaine gold great verie massie clad lose kirtle sundrie colour aloft therevpon thicke irish mantell hereto hir hand hir custome bare speare shew hirselfe dreadfull oration queene voadicia full prudence spirit britain encouragement roman wherein rippeth vp vile seruitude shamefull wrong enimies inflicted vpon matter verie motiue concerning themselues enimies hir supplication praier victorie eleuenth chapter uoadicia prepared heare set foorth maiestie greatlie incouraged britain vnto whome better animating emboldening vttered gallant oration manner forme following doo suppose louers friend man dooth well vnderstand muchthe oration uoadicia libertie fréedome preferred thraldome bondage haue bene anie deceiued romane persuasion ye time see difference betwéene iudged whether desired hope hauing tried vnder ye reforme iudgement harmes alreadie taken acknowledge ouersight forsake former error againe number haue rashlie preferred externall souereigntie customes lawes owne countrie doo time doubt perfectlie vnderstand much free pouertie prefered great rich wherevnto seruitude annexed much wealth respect captiuitie vnder forren magistrats wherevpon slauerie attendeth thing beséech vile grieuous vnto nature man hath happened vnto v sithens time roman haue bene acquainted iland manner bereaued rich possession doo beside thing giue land till onelie profit paie kind tributs ye • owne carcase much better alost fortunate deed vnder forged false title libertie continuallie paie redemption fréedome much commendable lose liues defense countrie carie much head toll free dailie oppressed laden innumerable exaction end doo remember speake thing since suffer death become frée much paie dead one dooth well vnderstand among nation brought seruitude alwaies death discharged bondage onelie roman dead doo still liue increase commoditie gaine anie v without monie know well way come anie left naked spoiled remaineth house selues men left desolate dead shall looke better dealing hand hereafter beginning deale vncourteousie v since man taketh much wild beast first cherish gentlenesse win familiaritie selues saie trueth author owne mischiefe suffered first set foot within iland driue backe cesar slue sword yet farre aduenturing hither dangerous sometime augustus caligula therefore inhabit iland quantitie thereof maie well called maine although inuironed ocean sea diuiding v nation séeme liue vpon earth vnder seuerall heauen euen saie whose name hath béene long kept hid wisest contemned troden vnder foot studie nothing else become lord haue rule men wherefore welbeloued citizen friendes kinsfolkes thinke kin since borne dwell ile haue one name common v let v euen saie haue doone heretofore whilest remembrance ancient libertie remaineth sticke togither performe thing dooth perteine valiant hardie courage end maie inioie onelie name libertie also fréedome selfe thereby leaue force valiant act example posteritie haue béene liberallie honest maner brought vp vtterlie forget pristinate felicitie may hope shall sucéed v like brought vp miserie thraldome doo make rehearsall thing vnto end would prouoke mislike present estate thing well know abhorre sufficientlie alreadie neither put feare thing likelie fall hereafter doo feare sée verie well hand end maie giue heartie thankes woorthie commendation owne accord meanes determine well prouide thing necessarie thereby helpe selues willing mind men nothing doubt romane puissance consider number enimies greater regard strength stronger dooth easilie appéere bassinet habergeon greiues wherewith armed also wall ditch trench haue made defense kéepe excursion rather fight v farre cope deale v hand stroke custome warres martiall discipline dooth require wherefore doo farre exceed force mine opinion armie strong stone wall one target woorth armour doo beare vpon meanes whereof victorie shall soone make captiues lose field shall easilie escape danger furthermore flight shall indeuour méet anie haue marishes héere beneath hide v hils round kéepe meanes shall haue purpose v whereas ouercharged heauie armour shall neither able follow flée escape danger put flight happen breake anie time desirous make rode returne appointed place maie take bird alreadie cage thing farre inferior v indure hunger thirst cold heat sunneshine doo house also tent make much account baked meates wine oile abroad shadow anie doo faile either die foorthwith else time languish consume whereas v euerie hearbe root meat euerie iuice oile water pleasant wine euerie trée house beside place land vnknowne v neither yet vnfriendlie succour v néed whereas roman part vnknowne altogither dangerous stand néed ease swim ouer euerie riuer naked clad great ship scarse able performe wherefore hope good lucke let v set vpon couragiouslie teach vnderstand since better hare fox attempt wrong match indeuour subdue grehounds woolues togither againe procéeded forward hir praier made holding vp hir hand manner giue thée thanks adraste call vpon shee thou woman woman reignest ouer burthenbearing aegyptians nitocris neither ouer merchant dooth semiramis trifle haue learned latelie roman neither ouer people rome litle héeretofore messalina agrippina nero called name man déed verie woman dooth appéere voice harpe woman attire call vpon thee goddesse gouernest britain haue learned till field handicraft men lead liues warres best manner also haue thing haue likewise wiues child common whereby woman haue like audacitie men lesse boldnesse warres therefore sithens haue obteined kingdome among mightie people beséech thée grant victorie health libertie contentious wicked vnsatiable men maie called men vse warme bathing delicate fare hot wine swéet oiles soft bed fine musicke vnkindlie lust altogither giuen couetousnesse crueltie dooings doo declare let beséech thée neronian domitian tyrannie anie preuaile vpon saie truth vpon thée let rather serue thée whose heauie oppression thou hast borne withall long season thou wilt still helper onlie defender fauourer furtherer noble ladie hartilie beséech thee queene voadicia marcheth roman giueth shamefull bloudie ouerthrow without anie motion mercie dredfull example britain crueltie indifferentlie executed without exception age sex twelfe chapter uoadicia made decianus procurator emperours agent treasurer receiuer citie although inhabited roman great garrison able men wherevpon procurator sent aid thought might well spare past two hundred men sufficientlie furnished either weapon armour citie compassed anie rampire ditch defense happilie priuie conspiracie hauing put head roman fortification néeded neither aged men woman sent awaie whereby yoong able personage might without trouble better attend defense citie euen béene suertie peace frée suspicion anie warre suddenlie beset huge armie britain went spoile fire could found without inclosure temple romane souldiers striken sudden feare sudden comming enimies thronged themselues assieged britain within space two day place woonne found within slaine euerie mother sonne britain incouraged victorie went méet petus cerealis lieutenant legion surnamed ninth boldlie incountering legion gaue roman ouerthrow slue footman cerealis much adoo escaped horssemen got backe campe saued himselfe within trench catus procurator put feare ouerthrow perceiuing hatred britain bare towards hauing couetousnesse thus brought warre vpon head roman got ouer gallia suetonius aduertised dooings came backe anglesey maruellous constancie marched middest enimies london greatlie peopled roman though colonie full merchant well prouided vittels great doubt comming thither whether might best staie place conuenient rather séeke easie defended length considering small number men warre remembring cerealis sped much rashnesse thought better losing one towne saue whole put danger irrecouerable losse therewith nothing mooued praier teares besought aid succour departed would go receiued armie taried behind oppressed enimies like destruction happened uerolanium towne day great fame situat néere place towne saint albons standeth britain leauing castels fortress vnassaulted followed gaine spoiling place easie get great plentie rich found vsing victorie crueltie slue report went number 70 thousand romans80000 saith dion tooke part said place britain thus woon conquered nothing britain slaughter fire gallowes like earnestlie set reuenge spared neither age sex woman great nobilitie woorthie fame tooke hanged vp naked cutting pap sowed mouthes might séeme sucked fed body stretched length thrust sharpe stake thing great despite whilest sacrificed temple made feast namelie wood vttermost side field uoadicia boudicia find hir written copiescorn tacit li 15 bonuica also dion hauing hir daughter afore hirdion cassius mounted charret passed souldiers ech sundrie countrie told thing accustomed among britain go warres vnder leading woman come foorth one borne noble ancestor descended fight hir kingdome rich one meaner sort rather defend hir lost libertie reuenge hir selfe enimie crueltie shewed scourging hir like vagabond shamefull deflouring hir daughter licentious lust roman farre spred increased spared neither body old yoong readie shame fullie abuse hauing whipped hir naked aged woman forced hir daughter satisfie filthie concupiscence saith god hand readie take iust reuenge legion presumed incounter v slaine beaten downe residue kéepe close within hold else séeke way flée countrie shall able much abide noise clamor manie thousand héere assembled much lesse force great puissance dreadfull hand ye therefore said would wey consider selues huge number men warre cause ye haue mooued warre ye would surelie determine either battell die honour else vanquish enimie plaine force quoth woman fullie resolued men ye maie ye list liue brought bondage neither suetonius ceasse exhort people though trusted manhood yet diuided armie three battels make vnto ech seuerall oration willing feare shrill vaine menacing threat britain sith among woman men hauing skill warrelike discipline heereto naked without furniture armour would foorthwith giue place féele sharpe point roman weapon force often béene put flight manie legion saith number small win battell glorie therefore small number win fame due whole armie would thronging togither bestow weapon fréelie swoords target preasse forward vpon enimies continuing slaughter without regard spoile might assure themselues victorie atchiued haue pleasure forwardnesse souldiers followed vpon exhortation couragious generall euerie one prepared himselfe readilie doo dutie shew skill experience suetonius hir bloodthirstie enimies died roman part notable battell 400 like number grieuouslie hurt pitifullie wounded penius posthumus maister campe second legionpenius posthumus sleteth himselfe emperour caused supplie sent germanie 2000 legionarie souldi er 8 band aid 1000 horssemen whose comming band ninth legion supplied legionarie souldiers band wing horssemen appointed place might winter people britain either enimies else stood doubt whether friend enimies déed persecuted fire sword nothing afflicted famine whilest euerie man gaue himselfe warre purposed haue liued vpon prouision roman enimies applied themselues tillage anie husbanding groundiulius cassictanus procurator long yer fierce kind people fell embrace peace reason iulius cassicianus sent britaine successor catus fell square suetonius priuat grudge hindered prosperous successe publike affaire sticked write rome except sent succéed roome suetonius beare would end warres herevpon one polycletus sometime béene bondman sent britaine commissioner surueie state countrie reconcile legat procurator also pacifie trouble within ile port polycletus bare great furnished small traine attended vpon presence seemed verie dreadfull roman britain yet pacified thought great scorne see honorable capteins men warre roman submit themselues order one béene bondslaue state iland stood while aruiragus reigned dissolute loose gouernement petronius turpilianus trebellius maximus victius volanus three lieutenant britaine romane emperours iulius frontinus vanquished silures xiiij chapter place suetoniuspetronius turpilianus lieutenant petronius turpilianus latelie béene consull appointed haue gouernance armie britaine neither troubling enimie enimie anie wise troubled prouoked colour slouthfull rest honest name peace quietnesse sat still without exploiting anie notable enterprise turpilianustrebellius maximus lieutenant trebellius maximus made lieutenant britaine likewise courteous demeanous sought kéepe britain rest rather force compell began people ile beare pleasant fault flattering vice ciuill warres chanced day death emperour nero home might easilie excuse slouthfulnesse romane lieutenant moreouer rose dissention amongest men warre vsed lie abroad field could agrée idle life trebellius maximus glad hide himselfe sight souldiers vprore till length humbling himselfe vnto became estate gouerned waie intreatie rather courtesie commotion staied without bloudshed armie hauing couenant obteined liue licentiouslie capteine suertie liue without danger murthered neither uictius uolanus succéeded maximus whilest time ciuill warres yet enduredvictius volanus lieutenāt trouble britain vsing slacknesse slouth lieutenant vsed permitted like licence presumptuous souldiers yet uolanus innocent touching himselfe hated anie notable crime vice purchased fauour although authoritie wanted emperour uespasianus subdued aduersaries atteined imperiall gouernment well ouer britaine ouer part worldcor tacitus sent hither right noble capteins diuers notable band souldiers petilius cerialis appointed lieutenant put britain great feare inuading brigants mightiest nation whole iland fighting manie battels right bloudie people subdued great part countrie last succéeded lieutenant britaine one iulius frontinusiulius frontinus lieutenāt vanquished brought romane subiection force armes people called silures striuing onelie stout resistance men also hardnesse combersome trouble place ¶thus may perceiue state ile stood time aruiragus reigned supposed best history old britain may thought gouerned rather part land whole bare name king roman hauing reduced countrie forme prouince britain bare rule diuerse part thereof permission roman neuerthelesse lieutenant procuratours bare greatest rule vnder aforesaid emperours state iland vnder marius sonne aruiragus comming picts roderike king death field picts scot enter mutuall aliance monument marius victorie ouer picts death interrement xv chapter decease aruiragusmarius sonne marius succeeded estatehector bo • tiu saith marius romane 73 began reigne yeare lord 73 old english chronicle fondlie called westmer verie wise man gouerning britain great prosperitie honour wealth time man reigne people called picts inuaded landof maie reade pag 9 iudged descended nation scithians neare knismen goth countrie maners cruell kind men much giuen warres people ringleader roderikematth west name londorike entering ocean sea maner rouers arriued coast ireland required scot new seat inhabit scot thinke also descended scithians inhabit ireland doubting profit receiue warlike nation ile feining friendship excusing matter narrownesse countrie declared picts ile britaine farre thence large countrie plentifull greatly inhabited wherefore counselled go thither promising vnto aid might picts desirous spoile rule gouernment without delaie returned sea sailed towards britaine arriued first inuaded north part thereof finding inhabiters began wast forrey countrie whereof king marius aduertised speed assembled people made towards enimies giuing battell obteined victorieroderike king picts slaine roderike slaine field people vanquished unto escaped life marius granted licence might inhabit north part scotland called catnesse countrie maner desolate without habitation wherevpon withdrew thither setled themselues party bicause britain disdained grant vnto daughter mariage sent vnto scot ireland requiring haue wiues nation scot agréed request condition wanted lawfull issue king linage succéed kingdome picts name one woman side king ordinance receiued obserued euer amongst picts long kingdome endured thus picts next roman first anie stranger came land inhabit writer affirme although scotish chronicle auouch picts therefore spéed hasted foorth come succour people sending first light horssemen certeine light armed footman assaile enimies back shortlie approched whole puissance romane standard beginning appéere sight light daie began spring britain sore discouraged roman renewing force fiercelie preassed vpon euen entrie campe sore conflict till length britain put flight chased mareshes wood saued pursute roman beene end made whole warre euen one day worke britain escaping well might reputing victorie haue chanced valiancie romane soldier occasion prudent policie capteine nothing abashed present losse enimie narrownesse front battels haue bemmed ech side done hauing conceiued good hope victorie alighted foot putting horsse stood standard one caring anie danger might happen first bestowed shot dart fréelie side britain aswell constant manhood skilfull practise broad sword little round buckler auoided beat arrowes dart came enimies therewithall paid home againe shot dart roman néere hand followed hollandershollanders beat downe britain might approch manie ouerrun left halfe dead touched anie weapon likewise ouerpressed hast roman made follow vpon britain whilest british horssemen fled charets ioined themselues footman restoring battell put roman feare sudden stay charets troubled prease enimies vnéeuennesse ground could worke feat anie purpose neither fight anie resemblance battell horssemen ech one encumbred roome stirre themselues charets oftentimes wanting guiders caried awaie horsses put feare noise stur ran hither thither bearing downe one another whomsoeuer else met withall britain kept top hils yet fought despising small number roman began come downewards cast might set vpon back enimies hope make end battell win victorie agricola doubting lesse thing would come passe aforehand foreséene danger hauing reserued foure wing horssemen sudden chance sent foorth britain horssemen full randon charging vpon rashlie came forward quicklie disordered put flight purposed deuise policie britain turned owne hinderance horssemen capteins appointment trauersing ouerthwart front fought set vpon battell britain found open plaine place greeuous heauie sight behold pursued wounded tooke enimies aduised slea taken end might ouertake nothing fléeing taking chasing slaughter spilling bloud scattering weapon grunting groning men horsses lay ground gasping breath readie die day yet affirme lucius died glocester yéere lord 156gal mon matth west say died yere 201 208 truth historie brought doubt discord writer concerning time circumstance although agrée king day christian faith first publike consent openlie receiued professed land affirmepolydor chance twelfe yéere reigne yéere lord 177 iudge came passe eight yeere regiment yéere lord 188 said alledge yéere lord 179 nauclerus saith happened yeare lord 156nauclerus hen herf henricus de herfordea supposeth yéere lord 169 nintéenth yéere emperor marcus anfonius uerus sixt yéere emperor commodus conclude king lucius died without issue reason whereof deceasse britain fell variance continued space fiftéene yéeres fabian thinkethfabian howbeit old english chronicle affirmeth contention betwixt remained fiftie yéerescaxton iohn hard though harding affirmeth foure yéeres thus much britain king coilus lucius resteth speake somewhat roman gouerned meane agricola called backe rome britain namelie inhabited beyond tweed partlie weakned former strength partlie consideration pledge deliuered roman remained peace certeine yéeres britain deceasse lucius died without issue rebell roman emperor adrian comming owne person britaine appeaseth broile go recouer libertie roman suppressed lollius romane lieutenant vigilantnesse wakefulnesie marcellus policie keepe souldiers waking britain ruled certaine meane gentleman perhennis appointing doo falselie accuse emperor commodus mangled murthered souldiers xx chapter meane time romane lieutenant cneus trebellius succéeded iulius agricolacneus trebellius lieutenant could foresee thing preciselie souldiers waxing vnrulie reason long rest fell variance among themselues would end obey lieutenant disquieted britain beyond measure wherefore britain perceiuing themselues sore oppressed intollerable bondage dailie incresed conspired togither vpon hope recouer libertie defend countrie meanes possible herewith tooke weapon hand roman boldlie assailed yet warilie might flie vnto wood bog refuge vpon necessitie according maner countrie herevpon diuers slaughter commited party countrie readie rebell whereof emperour adrian aduertised trebellius lieutenant conuenient speed passed ouer britaine quieted ile vsing great humanitie towards inhabitant making small account part scot inhabit either bicause barrennesse thereof reason nature countrie thought would hard kept vnder subiection deuised diuide residue britainethe wall adrian built spartianus caused wall made mouth tine vnto water eske wall conteined length 30 mile britain bearing malicious hatred towards romane souldiers repining kept vnder bond seruitude eftsoones went recouer libertie againe whereof aduertisement giuenlollius urbicus lieutenant emperour pius antoninus sent ouer lollius urbicus lieutenant britaine sundrie battels striken constreined britain remaine quiet causing inhabited north part remooue confines romane prouince iulius capitol another wall built caised another wall beyond emperor adrian made supposed suertie romane subiects inuasion enimies yet lollius make end warrs britain shortlie attempted afreshcalphurnius agricola either reduce state libertie bring danger wherevpon marcus antonius succéeded piusof doings calphurnius britaine ye may read scotish chronicle sent calphurnius agricola succéed lollius gouernement britaine easilie ouercame subdued enimies chanced trouble day emperour commodus son marcus antonius successor empire britans dwelled northward beyond adrian wall brake spoiled great part countrie romane lieutenant time come foorthdion cassius gaue battell romane souldiers beaten downe slaine newes commodus sore amazed sent britain one ulpius marcellusulpius marcellus lieutenant man great diligence temperance therewith rough nothing gentle vsed kind diet common souldiers vse captaine much watchfull one contented verie little sléepe desirous haue souldiers also vigilant carefull kéepe sure watch night season euerie euening would write twelue table vsed make lind trée deliuering one seruants appointed beare seuerall houres night sundrie souldiers whereby supposing generall still watching gone bed might doubt sléepe although nature could well absteine sléepe yet better able forbeare vsed maruellous spare kind diet end would fill himselfe much bread would eat none brought rome necessitie compelled could eat reason stalenesse tooke awaie pleasant tast thereof lesse prouoked appetite maruellous contemner monie bribe might mooue doo otherwise dutie required marcellus disposition sore afflicted britain put oftentimes great loss fame wherof cōmodus enuieng renowme mind make away yet spared purpose suffered depart remooued gouernment britaineperhennis capteine emperours gard one perhennis capteine emperor gard pretorian souldiers called bearing rule vnder emperor commodus appointed certeine gentleman meane calling gouerne armie britaine fond substituting petie officer ouersée ouerrule people occasion hartgrudge meanes finall mischeefe likelie might haue auoided béene prouident deputation souldiers armie grudging repining gouerned men base degréeaelius l ••• pridius respect borne rule ouer honorable personage senator consular dignitie fell square among themselues fiftéene hundred departed towards rome exhibit complaint perhennis soeuer amisse blame still laid passed foorth without impeachment comming rome emperour himselfe came foorth vnderstand meant comming sort place appointed serue answer come informe treason perhennis deuised destruction might make son emperor accusation commodus lightlie gaue eare beléeued true namelie setting one cleander hated perhennis brideled dooing diuerse vnlawfull act went vpon wilfull mind without reason modestie practise matter handled end perhennis deliuered souldiers cruellie mangled presentlie put pitifull death pertinax sent lieutenant britaine danger slaine souldiers riddeth himselfe perilous office albinus armie britain fighteth seuerus power neere lion seuerus slaine conflict picts geta bassianus two brother make mutuall warre regiment land one slaine ruleth xxj chapter saie somewhat tumult britainepertinax lieutenant britaine thought néedfull send sufficient capteine autoritie thither therefore one pertinax béene consull ruler ouer foure seuerall consular prouinces appointed commodus go lieutenant ile thought man méet charge also satisfie credit béene discharged perhennis bearing anie rule sent home liguria borne appointed remaine pertinax comming britaine pacified armie without danger haue béene slaine mutinic raised one legion stricken downethe lieutenant danger left dead among staine carcass woorthilie reuenged himselfe iniurie length hauing chastised rebel brought ile méetelie good quiet sued obteined discharged roome alledged souldiers could brooke kept dutifull obedience correcting offended lawes armes clodius albinus appointed haue rule romane armie britaineclodius albinus lieutenāt whose destruction seuerus emperour sought albinus perceiued quicklie therefore choosing foorth great power britain passed ouer france encounter seuerus come thither towards néere citie lion ioined battell fought right sore much seuerus point haue receiued ouerthrow high prowesse manhood britain yet end albinus lost field slaine heraclitus lieutenant began gouerne britaine writeth spartianus sent thither seuerus purpose state ile yeare lord 195 season king lucius dead left issue succéed britain ye haue heard variance amongst themselues continued till comming seuerus whome british chronographers affirme reigne king ile right succession bloud descended androgeus britaine went rome iulius cesar ye haue heard seuerus emperour romeseuerus began rule ile author affirme yeare lord 207 gouerned 4 yeares od moneths length hearing one fulgentius leader picts entred border countrie side durham raised host britain roman marched towards enimies méeting said fulgentius place néere vnto yorke end sore fight seuerus slaine ruled land space almost fiue yeares said buried yorke leauing behind two sonnes one named geta bassianus bassianus borne british woman succéeded father gouernement britaine yeare incarnation lord 211 roman would haue geta created king britaine bearing fauour romane ladie mother britain moued like respect held bassianus thervpon warre raised betwixt two brother comming trie quarrell battell geta slaine bassianus aid britain remained victor continued king till length slaine one carausius britaine borne low birth howbeit right valiant armes therefore well estéemed somuch obteining senat rome kéeping coast britaine might defend malice stranger picts others drew great number souldiers speciallie britain whome promised would make king would waste forrey countrie whereby insued diuerse conflict skirmish betwixt roman inhabitant victorie still remaining roman side enimies easilie escaped without anie great losse vnto wood mountain bog place refuge knew hand whither roman durst follow approch feare intrapped inclosed britain readie returne assaile enimies vpon euerie occasion aduantage might offered maner dealing sore troubled roman hindered procéedings spéedie end could made warredion cassius britain would oftentimes purpose laie cattell ox kine shéepe like place conuenient stale roman roman make fetch awaie distant residue armie good space would fall vpon distresse beside roman much annoied vnwholesomnesse water forced drinke chanced straie abroad snapped vp ambush caledonians laid féeble could want strength kéepe pace flame euen largelie ocean sea stretch mediterrane gulf doo reach neither ignorant although feare infection fester within bowel britaine onelie proceeded furie would haue aduanced selfe else might haue britain receiue maximian great ioy humblenesse came foorth offered themselues presence thier wiues child reuerencing onlie selfe set eies one descended downe heauen also euen sailes tackling ship brought diuine presence vnto coast set foot land readie lie downe foot might march ouer desirous neither anie maruell shewed selues ioifull sith miserable captiuitie manie yeeres contiuued long abusing wiues filthie bondage child length yet restored libertie length made roman length refreshed true light imperiall rule gouernement beside fame clemencie pitie set forth report nation child yea child vowed posteritie race ofspring trulie perpetuall parent anddioclesian maximian lord mankind require immortall god earnest supplication heartie praier child child shall come euer hereafter may dedicated vnto bring vp shall bring vp hereafter better hap wish shall succeed v enioiers felicitie selues enioy romane common wealth dooth comprehend one coniunction peace whatsoeuer sundrie time haue belonged roman huge power great burden shroonke downe riuen sunder brought ioine againe assured ioints imperiall gouernment part earth region vnder heauen either remaineth quiet feare subdued force army lestwise bound clemencie anie thing else part reason mooue men thereto might obteined beyond ocean britaine recouered nation nere adioinign bound ilenations néere britaine obeie emperours obedient commandements occasion may mooue passe except end ocean sea nature forbiddeth sought inuincible prince accounted woorthie thereof commeth may equallie prouide euerie one sith haue whole maiesties hand therefore heretofore excellent emperour dioclesian commandement asia supplie desert place thracia inhabitant transported thither afterward excellent emperour maximian appointment frankeners length brought pleasant subiection admitted liue vnder lawes hath peopled manured vacant field neruiansthe printed booke hath 〈◊〉 take h thrust n citie trier victory inuincible enterprise rigging sundrie place tooke order thier setting forward aduantage easie atchiuing enterprise appointed passe himselfe coast flanders time capteines fleet part likewise make saile towards britaine meanes alectus vsurped title dignitie king rather emperour ouer britain knew take héed yet vnderstanding nauie made readie mouth saine ment maie coniectured intercept fléet come foorth make saile forward purpose laie great number ship ile wight whether asclepiodotus came ouer nauie rigged coast flanders presume affirme either déed mamertinus maketh expresse mention either alectus asclepiodotus notwithstanding euident conteined oration maximian capteins gouerned armie slue alectus maie suppose asclepiodotus chiefteine ouer number ship directed maximian appointment passe ouer ile alectus maie mamertinus writeth agrée truth doo find eutropius eutropius héere remembred maximian thus recouered britaine hand vsurped rule thereof roman séeme onelie great number artificer people conueied ouer gallia inhabit furnish city run decaie also power warlike youth transported thither defend countrie inuasion barbarous nation find day maximian britain expelling neruians citie mon name rome holding neither maners lawes according name rather casting sendeth foorth branch hir bitter planting wit maximus accompanied great number warrior gard apparelled imperiall robe neuer ware sea scot west picts north men thus quite dismaidscotorum à circio pictorum ab aquilone lament miserable case knowing else doo space manie yéeres togither reason whose gréeuous inuasion cruell oppression wherewith miserablie disquieted sendeth hir ambassador vnto rome making lamentable sute euen teares haue power men warre sent defend hir enimies promising true subiects faithfulnes mind writeth maximus rather constantine great first peopled armorica yet agréeth maximus also constantinus vsurper whome ye shall heare led great number britain land maximus maximianus constantinus afterwards slaine one theodosius honorius britain followeth warres part killed residue escaping flight withdrew vnto britain constantine great first placed armorica tyrant left none countrie rude people anie townes giuen slouth gluttonie britaine void aid hir valiant youth became prey hir next neighbour scot picts héere yet considered price souldiers british nation day whose onelie puissance maximus durst take vpon go force whole romane empire prospered dangerous aduenture expressed sufficientlie romane history whose report appéereth onlie conquer hither part france germanie namelie side rhine also found meanes intrap emperour gratian kind policiew h paulus diaco lib 12 alijs faithfull friend called andragatius admirall sea perteining empire therefore agréed betwixt andragatius chosen companie armie carried secret wise coch toward lion béene constantia posthumia empressetripart hist lib 9 cap 21 wife emperour gratian bruting abroad therewithall said empresse comming forward hir waie lion méet hir husband vpon occasion verie desirous commune certeine earnest businesse gratian heard héereof one mistrusting dissimulation made hast meete wife comming length without anie great gard one doubt anie treason approched coch supposing find wife found streightwaies murthered dispatched quite life said andragatius leapt foorth coch woorke feate within danger thus emperour gratian finish life 29 yéere age 25 august yéere christ 383 died maximus succéeded making sonne flauius uictor nobilissimus assistant empire383 flauius uictor begat wife helen daughter eudes h lhoyd reigning fiue yéeres two day beginning reigne ualentinian yoonger made great suit haue father bodie would granted afterwards also maximus earnestlie requested come enteruiew ualentinian promised onelie safe conduct also manie beneficiall good turnes beside howbeit maximus durst put himselfe anie hazard rather ment pursue ualentinian vsurper length chased slauonie driuen streight theodosius come releeue maximus driuen thence alsoualentinian put danger maximus else slaughter rid waie maximus thought himselfe assured established empire doubted peril liued carelesse owne safegard therfore dismissed british souldiers retiring northwest part gallia placed themselues among countriemen brought ouer emperour constantius whilest maximus passing residue time delight pleasure surprised end slaine theodosius néere vnto aquilia 27 august yéere grace 388eutropius 388 beginning sixt yéere reigne rather vsurpation rightlie maie tearmed sonne flauius uictor surnamed nobilissimus also dispatched brought end farre place father slaine practise one arbogastes gotharbogastes flauius uictor said maximus made regent frankeners partaker said empire ile britaine remained meetlie good quiet space twentie yéeres till one marcus legat maie call lord lieutenant deputie britaine roman souldiers héere proclaimed emperour honorius marcus soone killed tumult raised among people within day vsurpation began one gratianus britaine borne succéeded placegratianus britaine reigned foure yéeres shal beléeue british historie also slaine fourth moneth taken vpon imperiall ornament souldiers yet heerewith pacified procéeded election emperour rather vsurper pronounced noble gentleman called constantine borne also britaine emperour tooke honour vpon 409 yéere birth sauiour409 continuing reigne space two yeeres od moneths romane history make mention report constantine great towardlie disposition woorthie gouerne empire souldiers chose rather name sake bicause would haue another constantine anie vertues sufficient quality found person commend manhood wisedome wherein speake truth deserued singular commendation one note vsurpation imperiall dignitie stained noble quality heerein manie would haue doone neither yet inuesture somuch looked hand constantine placed imperiall throne gathered armie possible indeuour purposing hand go ouer therwith france thinking thereby win possession countrie hand honorius least worke haue souldiers people missed ioine league suabeiners alanes uandales sought performe end neither deuises could take place sent ouer sonne constans whome absence aduersaries shorne moonke making partaker empire caused bring ouer another armie vnder conduct constans sent spaine bring countrie vnder obeisance constans therefore comming vnder passage lead ouer pyrenine mountain dindimus uerianianus two brother vnto whome keeping passage committed defend uandals enimies empirehis souldiers picts placed among men warre serued vnder ensignes empire named honorius honoriciani blondus readie resist seruants countriemen inhabited therabouts giuing verie sharpe incounter first putting great danger ouerthrow yet length valiant prowes british souldiers constans put aduersaries flight killed two capteins diuers men name partaker necessarie defense countrie enimies constans thus repelled resisted custodie passage pyrenine mounteins committed vnto band picts fable woorkes whereas might haue deposed matter truth xxxij chapter emperour honorius perceiuing réeling state empire determined foorthwith recouer fell altogither ruine therefore sent one constantius earle driue constantine gallia accordinglie performed certeine bickering slue said constantine arles although without great bloudshed pursued also residue britain driuing verie sea coast shrowded themselues among britain setled countrie ancientlie called said armorica region lieng sea coast ar british toong signifieth vpon moure perteining sea constantine father slaine constantius constans seabeda polychron stretching penuelton vnto citie aclud whereby enimies might staid entring land wall made turf sod rather stone departure roman easilie ouerthrowne scot picts eutsoones returned another legion souldiers one gallio rauenna leadinggallio rauenna sent brittaine go succour arriuing britaine set enimies giuing ouerthrow slue great number chased residue countrie roman thus hauing obteined victorie declared britain thencefoorth would take vpon euerie light occasion painefull iournie alledging reason romane ensignes number men warre put trauell far sea land repelling beating backe sort scattering rouers pilfring théeues wherfore aduised britain looke dueties like men indeuour themselues defend countrie owne force enimies inuasions iudged might helpe britain set hand build wall yet againe ouerthward ile place emperour seuerusa wall built ouerthwart iland beda caused trench rampire cast wall roman built helpe britain 8 foot bredth 12 length trauersing land east west made stone wall finishedgyldas beda roman exhorted britain plaie men shewed way make armor weapon besides coast east sea ship lay rode douted enimies would land caused tower erected space betwixt sea might discouered thing ordered roman bad britain farewell minding returne thither againegyldas roman gon land scot picts knowing thereof came againe sea emboldened bicause deniall made roman come succor britain tooke possession north vttermost bound ile euen vnto foresaid wall therein remaine inhabitansthis chanced yere 43 w saith wheras britain got wall defend enimies passe countrie end beaten diuers slaine scot picts entred vpon pursued cruell maner britain chased city townes dwelling house constreined flie desert place remaine liue maner sauage people end began rob spoile one another auoid danger staruing lacke food thus last countrie destroied wasted shift left aliue liue except onelie hunting taking wild beast foules augment miserie common imputing fault rest lord hector boet rebellion gouernors arose armes vanquished easilie put fight two seuerall time beaten downe slaine lacke skill number especiallie latter time residue escaped withdrew craggie mounteins within bush caues kept themselues close sometimes comming downe fetching away heards beast flock shéepe belonged noble gentleman countrie great booty relieue withall length oppressed extreme famine neither part could long remaine state néeding one anothers helpe necessitie made peace betwixt lord common land iniuries pardoned cléerelie forgiuen ciuill warre decaied force britainsciuill warre decaied force britain mischiefe follow ciuill warres little lesse tyrannicall practises maximus auoiding common thus house ground laie vntilled whereof insued famine space thrée yéeres togither woonderfull number people died want sustenance thus britain brought generallie extreame miserie thought good trie might purchase aid noble man actiusactius time remained france yet called gallia gouerning lieutenant vnder emperor honorius herevpon taking counsell togither wrote letter tenor whereof insueth actius thrise consull lamentable request v britain beseeching aid bee ministred vnto prouince romane empire vnto countrie vnto wiues child present stand extreame perill barbarous people driue v sea sea driueth v backe vnto againe hereof rise two kind death either slaine drowned euils haue remedie helpe therefore respct clemencie succor owne instantlie require c notwithstanding britain thus sought aid actius hand emperours lieutenantthe britain could get aid frō roman yet could get none either actius would passed litle thing went bicause bare displeasure mind ualentinian emperor else could otherwise constreined imploie force place barbarous nation inuaded romane empire mean britaine lost tribute britain accustomed pay roman ceassed iust fiue hundred yéeres iulius cesar first entred ile britain thus put shift manie hungerstarued constrained yéeld themselues griping hand enimies whereas yet kéeping within mounteins wood caues brake occasion serued vpon aduersaries first saith gyldas britain putting trust man god according saieng philo man helpe faileth needfull god helpe present make inhabitant departed naughtie dooings readie put backe common enimies exercise ciuill warre discord among themselues wicked irish people departed home make returne againe within picts settled considered people wherein word gyldas well weighed considered maie lead v thinke scot habitation britaine onelie ireland till season present time picts inhabited within iles orkenie placed themselues bring thing frame orderlupicinus sent britaine lupicinus time master armorie warlike person skilfull point chiualrie proud highminded beyond measure one doubted long whether couetous cruell herevpon said lupicinus setting forward light armed men heruli bataui 〈…〉 diuers company also people mesia called bulgarie winter well entred come came himselfe bulleine prouiding ship imbarking men wind gumobarius succeed roome anie thing knowen party doubted least lupicinus vnderstood much whilest yet britaine would haue attempted new trouble man stout loftie mind called backe thence withall sent notarie vnto bulleine watch none passe sea ouer britaine till lupicinus returned returning ouer thence yer anie knowledge doone emperour could make sturre hauing assistant gallia thought might haue appointed go thithertheodosius sent britaine man approoued skill warlike affaire calling togither hardie youthfull number legion cohort men warre went foorth small hope conceiued good spéed fame wherof spred went afore litle marcellinus adding people troubled britain wise saith thus shall suffice saidpicts diuided two nation attacotti season picts diuided two nation dicalidones victuriones like maner attacotti right warlike nation scot wandering made fowle woorke place came confines france disquieted frankeners saxon borderer vnto euerie one could breaking foorth dooing great harme cruell spoile fire taking prisoner withstand dooings good fortune would giue leauetheodosius passeth ouer britaine able capteine going vnto vttermost bound earth came coast bullen seuered contrarie coast side sea narrow streight sometime water goeth verie high rough shortlie becommeth calme pleasant without hurt passe transporting ouer leasure arriued sandwich rather richburrow quiet road vessel lie anchorbataui hollander wherevpon bataui heruli souldiers legion called iouij victores company trusted well owne strength marched foorth drew towards london ancient citie late hath bin called augustalondon called augusta herewith diuiding armie sundrie part set vpon troop enimies abroad forrey countrie pestered burden spoiles pillage spéedilie putting flight leading away prisoner taken booty cattell bereft preie poore britain tributary lost briefe restoring whole except small portion bestowed amongst wearie souldiers entred citie opprest trouble suddenlie refreshed bicause hope reliefe assured preseruation theodosius comforted prosperous successe attempt thing greater importance searching way good aduise woorke suerlie whilest remained doubtfull would insue learned well confession prisoner taken also information fled enimies scattered people sundrie nation practise great crueltie become fierce vndanted could subdued policie secretlie practised sudden inuasions length therefore setting foorth proclamation promising pardon gone awaie capteins charge called backe againe serue also licence departed laie scattered place abroad meanes manie returned one side earnestlie prouoked holden backe thoughtfull care required haue one ciuilis name sent haue rule prouinces britaine steed gouernourstheodosius requireth haue ciuilis sent man sharpe wit earnest mainteiner iustice likewise required one dulcitius capteine renowmed knowledge warlike affaire might sent ouer better assistancedulcitius thing doone britaine againe eight twentith booke marcellinus reciting theodosius atchiued britaine hath effect word thedosius verelie capteine woorthie fame taking valiant courage departing augustalondon called augusta men old time called london souldiers assembled great diligence succour reléeue greatlie decaied troubled state britain preuenting euerie conuenient place barbarous people might lie wait doo mischiefe nothing commanded meane souldiers doo whereof chéerefull mind would first take hand shew example meanes accomplishing roome valiant souldier fulfilling charge noble capteine discomfited put flight sundrie nation whome presumption nourished securitie emboldened like haue burst foorth gréeuous danger setting thing broile béene staied euen beginning first attempt one ualentinus borne party ualeria adioining pannoniaualentinus ualeria stiermarke called stiermarke man proud loftie stomach brother wife maximinus ualentinus notable offense béene banished britaine naughtie man could rest quiet deuised commotion might destroy theodosius saw onelie able resist wicked purpose going manie thing priuilie apertlie force vnmeasurable desire mischiefe still increasing sought procure aswell semblable wise banished men inclined mischiefe like selfe also diuers souldiers alluring time serued large promise great wealth would ioine enterprise euen verie nicke shuld haue gone hand vngratious exploit theodosius warned intent boldlie aduanced himselfe sée due punishment executed offendors foorthwith taken knowne guiltie conspiracie theodosius committed ualentine trustie complices vnto capteine dulcitiusdulcitius appointed put ualentinus death somewhat haue spoken act emperour constance little little fallen vice remooued place abiding openlie conuicted allured bribe faire promise oftentimes bewraied vnto barbarous nation doone among romans▪ first great britaine repelled emperour ualentinianus firstseuerus conduct guiding seuerus yéere saith emperours third time consul brake forth multitude saxon passing sea entred stronglie romane confines nation fed oftentimes slaughter people brunt whose first inuasion earle nonneus susteinednonneus co •• e one appointed defend party approoued capteine continuall trauell warres verie expert incountring desperate forlorne people perceiued souldiers ouerthrowne beaten downe himselfe wounded able abide often assault enimies obteined informing emperour necessarie ought dooneseuerus coronell footman insomuch seuerus maister maie call coronell footman sent helpe reléeue thing stood danger bringing sufficient power state businesse came place diuiding armie part put saxon feare trouble fought much take weapon hand make resistance amazed sight glittering ensignes eagle figured romane standard streight made sute peace length matter debated sundrie wise iudged profitable romane commonwealth truce granted vnto manie yoong men able seruice warres deliuered roman according couenants concluded saxon permitted depart without impeachment returne whence came feare preparing go way diuers band footman sent lie priuilie certeine hid vallie ambushed might easilie breake foorth vpon enimies passed chanced far otherwise supposed certeine footman stirred noise comming brake foorth time suddenlie discouered whilest hasted vnite knit themselues togither hideous crie shout saxon put flight yet closing togither againe staied extremitie chance ministring force though sufficient driuen fight beaten downe great slaughter died euerie mother sonne troope horssemen armed point like maner placed side entring waie assaile enimies passe aduertised dolefull noise fought spéedilie come succour fellowes ran togither cruellie roman bending themselues towards enimies compassed side drawne sword slue downe right one left returne home natiue countrie bring newes sped one suffered liue anothers death either reuenge ruine lement losse thus limit romane empire preserued time britaine séeme yéere lord 399399 ¶thus roman commonlie martiall affaire incounter verie fortunate happie issue conflict faling side strange consider marke people celestiall kind influence begotten borne prowesse renowme course dealing field aptlie answering name suppose roman called gréeke word 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 solinus adr iun signifieng power mightinesse old time called ualentians valendo preuailing maruell though victorious subduer forren people sithens nature created appointed conqueror thereof denomination poet claudianus saith state britaine decaie romane empire scot picts cruellie vexing britain afflicted inuasion barbarous nation practise saxon scot first comming iland whence scotish chronographers noted curiositie vanitie xxxv chapter thishonorius 〈◊〉 emperour time emperour honorius scot picts saxon eftsoones inuade frontier romane prouince britaine appéereth poet claudianus writeth attributing honour preseruing frontier vnto said emperour booke intituled panegerycus tertij consulatus fell yéere 396 thus ille leues mauros nec falso nomine pictos edomuit scotúm que vago mucrone secutus396 claudia ••• fregit hyperboreas remis audacibus vndas et gemini fulgens vtró que sub axe tropheis tethyos alternae refluas calcauit arena nimble more picts right cald hath subdude wandring swoord likewise scot hath pursude brake bold couragious oare hyperborean waue shining vnder pole double trophy braue marcht vpon bubling sand either swelling sea caladianus vpon fourth consulship honorius saith tetrastichon followeth quid rigor aeternus caeli quid frigora prosunt ignotúm que fretum maduerunt saxon fuso orcades incaluit pictonum sanguine thule sootorum cumulos fleuit glacialis hyberne lasting cold frostlie climats gaine sea vnknowne moisted bloud saxon slaine orknies bloud picts hath thule waxed warmethule take take iseland scotland ysie ireland hath bewaild heap scotish harme praise giueth stilico sonne law honorius maketh mention legion souldiers sent britaine periphrasis circumlocution gotish bloudie warres venit extremis legio praetenta britannis quae scoto dat fraena truci ferró que notatas perleget exanimes picto moriente figuras legion eke came farthest britain bent brideled hath scot sterne mark iron brent vpon liuelesse lims doth read while picts liues relent rehearseth like second panegerycus stilico ample pithie manner insuing inde calidonio velata britannia monstro ferro picta genas cuius vestigia verrit caerulus oceaní que aestum mentitur amictus quo que vicinis pereuntem gentibus inquit muniuit stilico totam quum scotus hybernam mouit infesto spumauit remige thetis illius effectum curis ne bella timerem scotica ne pictum tremerem ne littore toto prospicerem dubijs venturum saxona ventis britaine monster calidone surround whose cheekes pearst scorching steele whose garment swept ground resembling much marble hew ocean sea boile said neighbour nation conspire bring spoile hath stilico munited strong raisd scot entice ireland enimies ore salt sea fome slice care hath causd feare scotish broiles haue horsus catigerne 6 year martianus 455 christpolydor howbeit polydor virgil saith uortimer succéeded father father deceasse english saxon whome great number ile comming ouer dailie like swarmes bées hauing possession onelie kent also north part realme towards scotland togither great part west countrie thought fit time attempt fortune warre first therefore concluding league scot picts vpon sudden turned weapon point britain cruellie pursued though receiued great iniurie hand benefit britain maruelouslie abashed herewith perceiuing haue doo hengist capteine high renowme also ancient enimies scot picts thus one time remedie either must fight else become slaues wherefore length dread bondage stirred vp manhood assembled togither boldlie began resist enimies ech side weakethe britain discomfited scot easilie discomfited put flight hope defense force armes vtterlie taken awaie men despaire preuaile enimies fled shéepe scattered abroad following one capteine another getting desart place wood maresh ground moreouer left townes fortress notable strength preie vnto enimies thus saith polydor virgil first breaking warres betwixt saxon britain chanced appeare writeth thereof till death uortigerne howbeit denieth hengist first comming got seates people within countie kent began inhabit ought forgotten king uortimer sigebertus hath writtensigebertus restored christian religion vanquished saxon place decaied enimies inuasion whose drift onelie ouerrun land violence also erect owne law liberty regard clemencie vortigerne restored regiment place abode time sonnes reigne hengist saxon reenter land saxon britain appointed meet salisburie plaine priuie treason hengist power whereby britain slaine like sheepe manhood edol earle glocester vortigerne • taken prisoner hengist possession three prouinces land description kent fift chapter bloudie broiles tempestuous tumult endedmatth west saith 461 uortigerne restored set againe kingdome britaine yeare lord 471471 time sonnes reigne remained party called wale write meane time builded strong castle called generon guaneren west side wale nere riuer guana vpon mounteine called cloaricus referre builded second returne wale shall shewed hereafter much likelie old chronicle fabian sight affirmeth uortigerne kept vnder rule certeine gouernors appointed towne caerlegion behaued himselfe commendable sort towards sonnecaerleon arwiske aiding counsell otherwise meane season whilest sonne reigned britain reason thereof began fauour death uortimer made king againe shortlie uortigerne restored rule kingdom matth west saith 4000 might easi • ie returne except deceiued neuer driuen set foot within ile hengist aduertised therof returned land mightie armie saxon whereof uortigerne admonished assembled britain woolues britain weapon defend themselues except anie strength manhood got knife enimie amongst britainsran cestren fabian one edol earle glocester say chester got slake hedge else defended himselfe laid himgal saith 70 matth west ran cestren slue 17 towne ambrie called salisburie saued owne life uortiger taken kept prisoner hengist till constreined deliuer vnto hengist thrée prouinces country realme say kent essex write part south saxon inhabit sussex third countrie estangles planted themselues norfolke suffolke hengist possession thrée prouinces suffered uortigerne depart libertie ¶william malmesburie writeth somewhat otherwise taking uortigernewil malm whose reigne deceasse sonne uortimer nothing attempted saxon meane time hengist colorable craft procured sonne law uortigerne come banket house three hundred britain made well warme often quaffing emptieng cup purpose touched euerie one bitter tawnt first fell multiplieng malicious word blowes britain slaine euerie mother brother uter pendragon lay wale yet fullie recouered sore sicknesse wherewith late béene much vexed yet lord britaine buriall aurelius ambrosius came vnto crowned king though able go saxon reason aurelius ambrosius death verie busie earnest pursuing warre yet armie prepared sent foorth conuenient spéed vnder leading one nathaliod man neither anie great ancient house yet skill warlike affaire noble men nothing pleased herewith misliking altogither lacke discretion new king doubted sore least time come would haue delight aduance men base degrée descended noble parentage yet would put state common wealth danger anie mutinie agréed go foorth iournie occa aduertisement giuen certeine letter sent close friend amongest britain whole matter therefore hope better spéed hasted foorth incounter hill next battell led leauing britain danger séeing began flée died great number britain except killed fight occa mistrusting gothlois meant withdrawing aside would suffer saxon follow chase night following gothlois got awaie rested till danger occa perceiuing himslefe haue vpper hand sent herald vnto king uter certeine message threatning destruction people refused doo appoint uter perceiuing disloialtie rested hart owne subiects agréed matter might committed eight graue wise courrestors foure britain foure saxon might haue full power make end controuersies variance depending betwixt two nation occa likewise contented therewith wherevpon named either part foure person wisedome knowledge experience thought meetest ordering weightie matter arbitrement award doome eight person authorised whome afterwards maried begot hir noble knight arthur daughter named amie anna occa osca escaping also prison assembled eftsoones poer saxon made warre britain whereof uter hauing aduertisement prepared resist finallie went himselfe person saint albans write gaue battellharding slue field polydor virgil writeth séeme germane bishop auxerre came britaine day uter whose presence britain victorie saxon ye haue heard victorie rested troubling either time saxon astonied present miracle britain following good successe shortlie fell discord amongst themselues finallie brought vtter decaie shall appeare saxon desirous spoile britain whole possession part ile held whereas accounted city townes small strength defended got high mounteine called badon hill polydor supposeth blackamore lieth néere water theisebadon hill diuideth bishoprike durham yorkeshire hauing mouth thereof hauen méet receiue ship come germanie whence saxon looked aid hauing alreadie sent thither britain thereof aduertised made hast towards place besieged euerie side also laie sea coast full souldiers kéepe enimies landing come germanie saxon kept themselues certeine space aloft vpon high ground end constreined want vittels came downe armie order battell next plaines offering fight battell anon begun continued morning till far day slaughter earth euerie side flowed bloud saxon susteined greater losse capteins occa osca slaine britain might séeme quite deliuered danger enimies fatall destinie could auoided hereafter may appeare thus slaughter made saxon badon hill whereof gyldas maketh constreined withdraw refuge one london winchester constantine pursuing first came winchester force entered citie slue one brother fled thither within church saint amphibalus comming london entered citie also finding brother within church slue like maner doone hauing dispatched aduersaries thought haue purchased himselfe safetie shortlie owne kinsman one aurelius conanus arrered warre himaurelius conanus constantine slaine ioining battell slue field reigned foure yéeres bodie conueied stonheng buried beside ancestour uter pendragon constantine seemeth ment gyldas writeth booke intituled de excidio britanniae gyldas inueieng ruler britain time writeth thus britaine hath king tyrant iudges hath wicked oftentines péeling harming innocent people reuenging defending gu • ltie person robber hauing manie wiues yet breaking wedlocke oftentimes swearing yet swearing themselues vowing part lieng warring mainteining ciuill vniust warres pursuing indéed théeues abroad countrie yet onelie cherishing sit euen table also highlie rewarding giuing almesse largelie part heaping vp mightie mount sinnes sitting seat sentence seldome séeking rule righteous iudgement despising innocent humble person exalting farre lieth euen vp heauens bloudie proud murtherers théeues adulterer yea verie professed enimies god would permit kéeping manie prison whome oppresse loding iron craft rather serue owne purpose anie gilt person imprisoned taking solemne oths altar shortlie despising altar vile filthie stone hainous wicked offense constantine tyrannicall whelpe lionesse deuonshire ignorant yeare receiuing dreadfull oth whereby bound himselfe wise hurt subiects god first oth companie saint mother present notwithstanding reuerent lap two mother church carnall mother vnder coule holie abbat deuoure sword speare stead téeth tender side yea entrailes two child noble kinglie race likewise two gouernours yea said amongest sacred altar armes person slaine stretched foorth defend themselues weapon day handled valiantlie stretched foorth saie god altar day iudgement shall set vp reuerent ensignes patience faith gate citie christ haue couered seat celestiall sacrifice red mantle cluttered bloud thing anie good déeds doone deseruing praise manie yeares ouercome often changeable filth adulterie forsaking lawfull wife contrarie lawes god c brought foorth crime quelling owne kinsman violating church neither loosed snare former euils increaseth new old ¶thus effect hath gyldas written constantine turning tale reproueth fault counselleth repent aurelius reigned 30 yeares right haue béene king kept prison satisfied slue tyrannous maner two son said vncle god would suffer long inioy rule land vniust dealing died reigned space two yeares left sonne behind called uortiporus succéeded kingdome author doo record aurelius conanus gyldas writeth calling vnto made end predecessor constantine saieng wise thou lion whelpe saith prophet aurelius conanus doost thou art thou swallowed vp filthie mire murthering thy kinsman committing fornication adultery like mentioned deadlie waues surge drenching sea ouerwhelming thée hir vnmercifull rage dooest thou hating peace thy countrie deadlie serpent thirsting ciuill war spoiles oftentimes vniustlie gotten shut vp thy soule gate celestiall peace refreshment thou left alone withering trée middle field call remembrance praie thée vaine youthfull fantasie ouertimelie death thy father thy brother shalt thou set apart chosen foorth thy linage thy godlie desert reserued liue hundred yeares remaine earth till thou old methusalem reprehension threatnings god vengeance exhorted amendment life proceedeth talke uortiporus whome nameth king rather tyrant southwales shall rehearsed beginning kingdome brenitia whetting toong beginneth thus standest thou one starke amazed thou say uortiporus tyrant southwales like panther maner wickednesse diuerslie spotted manie color thy hoarie head thy throne full deceit craft wile defiled euen lowest part thy bodie crowne thy head diuers sundrie murthers committed thine owne kin filthie adultery thus proouing naughtie sonne good king manasses ezechias chanceth violent streames sinnes thou swallowest vp like pleasant wine rather art deuoured end thy life little little drawing néere yet satisfie meanest thou fornication euils full heape thine owne wife put away thou hir honest death dooest oppresse thy soule certeine burthen auoided thine vnshamefast daughter consume pray thée residue thy day offense god c like woords vttered exhorting repentance wipha succeeded deceasse ethelric one edelbertor edelfride surnamed wild succeeded gouernement northumbers returne purpose ethelbert king kent discouraged euill chance happened beginning rather luidhard appointed come remaine hir land hir better instruction lawes lord two french nation came ouer remaining court vsing serue god praiers otherwise according custome christian religion began comelie shape lims bodie turned eies maner citizen beholding fortuned gregorie also came amongst behold considered well viewed faire skinsvita gregorii magni swéet visage beautifull bush bright yeallow heares demanded region land came vnto whome answere made brought britaine inhabitant countrie like beautifull aspect asked whether men countrie christian yet intangled blind heathenish error person 〈◊〉 though himselfe yet augustine fellowes sent said way passing iour ••• sudden feare entred heartsm fox write returned others write augustine sent backe gregorie sue might released voiage dangerous vncerteine amongst barbarous people whose language neither knew whose rudenesse able resist gregorie pithie perswasions confirming comforting sent againe letter vnto bishop arles willing helpe aid said austine companie euer néede required also letter directed foresaid austine vnto fellowes exhorting go forward boldlie lord woorke tenor said epistle following may appeare gregorie seruant god seruants seruants lord much better take good thing hand begun thinke reuolt backe againe therefore may cannot dere child feruent studie labour must need go forward good businesse thorough helpe god haue well begun neither let wearisomnesse iournie slanderous toongs men appall instance feruencie ye proceed accomplish thing lord hath ordeined take hand knowing great trauell shall recompensed reward greater glorie hereafter come therefore send austine againe whome also haue ordeined gouernour doo humblie obey thing knowing shall profitable soules soeuer admonition ye shall doo almightie god grace defend grant see eternall countrie fruit labour though heere cannot labour fellowship togither lord god keepe safe deere welbeloued child dated tenth kalends august reigne souereigne lord mauricius vertuous emperor fourtenth empire thus emboldned comforted good woords wholesome exhortation gregorie set forward againe spéeding foorth iournie first arriued ile thanet kent moneth iulie number fortie person diuerse interpretors whome brought france sent vnto king ethelbert signifieng occasion comming hearing messenger within day went ile abroad anie house sat downe caused augustine fellowes come would come vnder anie roofe sore doubting bewitched persuaded practised nigromancie comming power diuell said might power almightie god bearing steed banner crosse siluer image lord sauiour painted tablethe seuenfold letanies gregorie yet deuised thereto singing letanies made intercession vnto lord euerlasting preseruation themselues whome whome came set downe commandement king preached woord life came thither made answer woords promise good much new vncerteine béen brought vp contrarie doctrine could rashlie assent admonition leaue beléefe english nation long time obserued kept said ye haue trauelled farre intent make v partaker thing ye beléeue true perfect thus much graunt vnto ye shall receiued countrie haue harbrough thing sufficient found vnto maintenance sustentation neither hinder ye may preaching associat ioine manie subiects vnto law beléefe therefore assigned vnto place lodge within citie canturburie head citie dominion said approched citie according maner crosse borne image lord iesus christ followed singing letanie deprecamur te domine omni misericordia tua vt auferatur furor tuus ira tua à ciuitate ista de domo sanctum tua quoniam peccauimus alleluia say beseech thee ò lord thy mercie thy furie wrath may taken citie thy holie house haue sinned praise thee ô lord receiued canturburiebeda matth west began follow trade life apostle vsed primitiue church say exercising themselues continuall praier watching preaching manie could despising worldlie thing belonging receiuing onelie whome taught thing necessarie sustenance life liuing point according doctrine set forth hauing mind readie suffer patience aduersities euer yea death selfe confirming preachedthe christian faith receiued english men herevpon manie english people beléeued baptised hauing great reuerence simplicitie men swéetenesse heauenlie doctrine church néeree citie east part thereof dedicated honor saint martine builded old time whilest roman yet inhabited britaine quéene haue said christian vsed make hir praiers church austine fellowes first comming accustomed resort sing praie saie masse preach baptise till length king conuerted granted licence preach euerie place build restore church thought good king persuaded doctrine good example giuing diuers miracle shewed baptised people great number began giue eare vnto preaching gospell renouncing heathenish beléefe became christianslib 7 cap 26 much gregorie remembreth baptised ten thousand person one day feast natiuitie sauiour 597 first indiction ¶some write chance toward latter end augustine daiespolychron admitted preach gospell amongst inhabited yorke write affirme said number ten thousand baptised riuer suale w harison saith cannot verified indiction death gregorie procéed religion inforced perswaded preached augustine made archbishop england gregorie informeth augustine certeine ordinance made obserued new english church reuenewes church diuided foure part liturgie mariage ecclesiasticall discipline ordeining bishop trifling question obiected augustine gregorie fellow helper sent ouer assist augustine ministerie receiueth pall reformation must doone little little glorie miracle effect gregory letter k ethelbert conuersion christianitie xx chapter king ethelbert reioised conuersion peoplebeda lib 1 cap 26 27 howbeit would force anie man baptised british king departed life deceasse britain welshman whether shall call chose cadwan gouerne foresaid yéere 609 7 yéere emperour phoca 21 second lotharius king france 13 yéere kilwoolfe king westsaxons cadwan established king shortlie assembled power britain went foresaid ethelfred king northumberland thereof aduertised associate part saxon prince came foorth armie méet cadwan field herevpon readie haue tried matter battell certeine friend trauelled betwixt peace end brought agréement ethelfred kéepe quiet possession country beyond riuer humber cadwan hold ofgal mon right belonged britain south side riuer couenant touching agréement confirmed oths solemnelie taken pledge therewith deliuered afterwards continued good quiet peace without vexing one chanced afterward ethelfred ye haue heard rehersed soundeth like truth followeth british booke omit make rehersall passing forward dooings fell meane season whilest cadwan gouernement britain reigning king ouer tearme 22 say 13 yéeresiohn hard finallie slaine northumbers hath béene also shall shewed 8 yéere cadwan began reigne ethelbert king kent departed life 21 yéere comming augustine fellowes preach faith christ realme ethelbert reigned ouer prouince kent tearme 56 yéeres beda saith haue noted thrée yéeres lesse departed world aboue signified yeere lord 617wil malm beda li 2 cap 5 24 day februarie buried ile saint martine within church apostle peter paule without citie canturburie wife quéene bartha also buried foresaid archbishop augustine first conuerted faith amongst thing king ethelbert aduise councell ordeined diuers lawes statute according decrées iudgements passe decrées caused written english toong remained force vnto day beda declareth first expressed lawes amends make stole anie thing belonged church bishop anie ecclesiasticall person willing mean defend whose doctrine receiued deceasse ethelbert sonne eadbaldeadbald succéeded gouernment kingdome kent great hinderer increase new church amongst englishman party onelie refuse baptised himselfe also vsed kind fornication hath béene heard apostle saith amongst gentile tooke wife mother law béene wife father two euill example manie tooke occasion returne heathenish religion whilest father reignedthe prince example occasion euill either prince pleasure feare offend professe christian faith eadbald escaped woorthie punishment sent liuing god euill desert insomuch vexed certeine kind madnesse taken vncleane spirit foresaid storme vnquiet troubling christian congregation afterwards greatlie increased also death sabert sebert king eastsaxons conuerted faith christ baptized melitus bishop london mentioned departing life go better blissefull kingdome heauen left behind thrée sonnes true successours estate earthlie kingdome sonnes likewise refused baptised name serred seward sigebert ran cest beda li 2 cap 5 serred seward segebert sonnes sabert men ill mind whome vertue remained feare god anie respect religion speciallie hating professours christian faith father dead began fall old idolatrie life time séemed haue giuen ouer insomuch openlie worshipped idol gaue libertie subiects like bishop melitus solemnizing masse church distributed eucharisticall bread vnto people asked said wherfore deliuer bright white bread vnto also well béene accustomed doo father saba vsed call unto whome bishop made answer washed wholesome fountaine wherein father washed ye may partaker holie bread whereof partaker despise washpoole life ye may meanes tast bread saluation offended herewith replied wise enter fountaine know haue néed thereof yet neuerthelesse refreshed bread beene earnestlie manie time told vnlesse would baptised might partaker sacred oblation length great displeasure told would consent vnto small matter place within bound dominion constrained depart wherevpon expelled resorted kent take aduise fellowbishops laurence iustus doone weightie matter finallie resolued vpon point better returne countrie frée mind might serue almightie god rather remaine amongest people rebelled faith without hope doo good amongest wherefore melitus iustus depart first went ouer france minding abide till might sée end would shortlie brother king essex expelled bishop maner aboue said suffered woorthilie wicked dooings going forth battell westsaxons ouerthrowen slaine altogither armiethe sonne king sebert slaine two king kinigils quichelme neuerthelesse albeit author mischiefe thus taken awaie yet people countrie would reduced againe diuelish woorshipping false god eftsoones fallen thereto season incouragement perilous example ruler wherefore archbishop laurence mind also follow fellowes melitus iustus minded set forward warned dreame cruellie scourged hath beene reported apostle saint peter reprooued would vncharitablie sake flocke leaue danger without shepherd kéepe woolfe fold archbishop imboldned vision also repenting determination came king eadbald shewed stripe maner dreame king herewith put great feare renounced heathenish worshipping idol baptised much laie thenceforth succoured congregation christian aduanced church power sent also france called home bishop melitus iustus iustus restored sée rochester eastsaxons would receiue melitus sée london continued wicked mawmetrie obeieng bishop pagan law erected purpose neither king eadbald authoritie power party father whereby might constreine receiue lawfull bishop suerlie said king eadbald people conuerted againe gaue himselfe wholie obeie lawes god amongst déeds godlie zeale builded church ladie canturburiebeda lib 2 within monasterie saint peter afterwards called saint agnes church consecrated melitus death laurence succéeded gouernance archbishop sée canturburie melitus departed life yeare lord 624 iustus
