northumbers great power reputation marriage betweene ethelburga sister king eadbald vpon religious couenants traitorous attempt murtherous eumerus wife ethelburga deliuered daughter assalteth westsaxons discomfiteth boniface fift writeth desist idolatrie ladie persist true christianitie vision edwin banished man court redwald king eastangles whereby informed great exaltation conuersion christian religion xxv chapter ye haue heard edelfred king northumberland slaine battell neere water idel redwald king eastangles fauour edwin said edelfred confined dominion 24 yéeres foresaid redwald therefore hauing obteined victorie found meanes place edwin gouernement kingdome northumbers hauing title thereto sonne alla elle sometime king northumberland edwin prooued right valiant prince edwin beda lib 2 ca 5 grew power anie king day english nation onelie ruling ouer great part country inhabited english men also britain inhabited onelie wale part chesshire lancashire cumberland alongst west seacoast galloway foorth euen vnto dumbritaine scotland haue thought good note may appeare country cadwall • bare rule whome often mention made part historie concerning edwin reputation onelie english men w malm taketh meuania anglesey britain scot also iles orknie man others west iles ancient time called meuaniae reuerence feared mightie power durst attempt anie exploit offend chanced shortlie king redwald aduanced kingdom northumberland wit 6 yeares redwald deceassed made greatlie augmentation edwin power people eastangles whilest edwin remained amongst banished man conceiued good opinion approoued valiancie noble courage offered themselues wholie commandementcarpwaldus edwin suffering carpwald erpwald sonne redwald inioie bare title name king countrie ruled thing owne pleasure neither anie prouince within britaine obeie readie doo seruice kingdome kent onelie excepted suffered kentishmen liue quiet began haue liking sister king eadbald namelie ladie ethelburga otherwise called tate tace made request therefore sending ambassadours hir brotherbeda lib 2 cap 9 haue said ladie marriage length obteined hir condition christian woman might onelie vse christian religion also whether men woman priest minister came hir might haue licence doo without trouble impeachment anie maner person herevpon sent vnto appointed go hir besides manie one pauline consecrated bishop archbishop iustus 21 iuliematth west beda lib 2 cap 9 yeare lord 625625 comming northumberland thus companie ethelburga trauelled earnestlie office preserue hir christian faith christ appointed giue attendance hir least chance fall also sought win pagan possible vnto faith though first little profited matter yeare following came murtherer vnto court king edwin soiourning palace stood vpon side riuer dorwent sent quichelme king westsaxons intent murther edwin late sore damnified country westsaxons murtherer called eumerus caried vnder coate short double edged woodknife inuenomed purposeother say axe matth west king little hurt therewith die wound yet escape danger poison eumerus easter mondaie came kingeumerus making foorth béene haue declared message maister espied time drew weapon offered strike king one king seruants named lilla perceiuing slept betwixt king blow howbeit murtherer set stripe forward force knife running bodie lilla wounded also king little murtherer could beaten downe slue another king seruants knight attended vpon called fordher night ethelburga deliuered daughter named eanfledeanfled borne king edwin gaue thanks vnto god presence bishop pauline bishop admonish rather giue thanks vnto true onelie god whose goodnesse came passe queene safelie without danger deliuered king giuing good eare vnto bishop wholesome admonition promised present become christian might reuenge iniuries receiued hand westsaxons assure pauline promise take place gaue vnto new borne daughter made holie lord say baptised bishop receiuing hir whitsundaie next following baptised hir twelue king houshold first english northumbers washed founteine regeneration meane time k edwin recouered hurt assembled armie went westsaxons whome incountring battell either slue brought subiection conspired death returned conquerour countrie yet delaied time performance promise become christian howbeit left dooing sacrifice idol euer since made promise baptised sage prince would alter religion politikelie thought good heare matter touching old religion christian religion throughlie examined whilest thus hoong doubt vnto whether part incline came letter pope boniface fift namebeda lib 2 cap 10 exhorting sundrie kind gentle perswasions turne worshipping true liuing god renounce worshipping mawmets idol pope wrote also quéene ethelburga praieng hir continue hir good purpose meanes possible doo might doone conuerting hir husband vnto faith christ thing mooued kingbeda lib 2 cap 11 visiona vision sometime remained banished man court redwald king eastangles thus king ethelfred informed foresaid redwald receiued edwinbeda cap 12 ceased ambassadours moue redwald either deliuer edwin hand make awaie length often sending promise made large summes monie mixed threatnings obteined grant sute determined edwin either murthered else deliuered enimies hand one edwin friend hauing intelligence hereof night season came edwin chamber leading abroad told whole practise purposed offering helpe countrie would aduenture escape edwin woonderouslie amazed thanked friendthe honorable consideration edwin refused depart countrie sith iust cause outwardlie giuen play slipper part choosing rather ieopard life honour giue men cause thinke first broken promise prince redwald whome giuen faith herevpon friend departing left sitting without doores reuolued manie thing mind thought long vpon matter length perceiued one come towards vnknowne strange apparell séeming euerie point stranger sight could imagine edwin much afraid man comming saluted asked made time night rest edwin part asked doo therewith whether vsed lie abroad night within house answering said thinke edwin ignorant thy heauinesse thy watching thy solitarie sitting without doores know thou art wherefore thou art thus pensiue euils thou fearest towards thée hand tell wouldest thou giue could deliuer thée heauinesse perswade redwald neither doo thée hurt deliuer thée thine enimies edwin said would gladlie giue might lie one reward said wouldst thou giue promise good sooth thine enimies destroied thou shouldest king thou shouldest passe power king haue reigned english nation thy time edwin better come himselfe demandes sticke promise would requite friendship woorthie thanks replied word said shall prophesie thée good hap come shall also able informe thee counsell thy health life neuer anie thy forefather kinsfolke yet haue heard wouldest thou obey also consent receiue wholesome aduertisement wherevnto without deliberation edwin promised would point follow instruction deliuer manie great calamity bring rule kingdome answere got person thus talked laid hand vpon head saieng therefore shall chance thée forgetfull time communication thing thou dooest promise sée thou performe therewith vanished awaie edwin might well perceiue man vision thus appeared vnto ¶this vnaccustomed course pleased god vse conuersion king whose example doubt people inferiour sort would generallie conformed otherwise continued paganisme blind ignorance god truth true christianitie maie king predecessor settled perswasion gentilish error neither admonition preaching though procéeded mouth one allotted ministrie reuoked infidelitie misbeléefe wherein nuzzeled trained vp nature men addicted obseruation rite customes haue béene established left force progenitor sooner stand vnto desire earnest purpose adding somewhat elder corrupt constitution irreligious course conuersation inclinable anie article point tending innouatition inflexible posteritie swarue tradition antiquitie stand vpon neuer grosse palpable absurdity edwin still reioising foresaid comfortable talke thoughtfull mind whence came talked sort behold friend returned first brought receiue christian faith somuch pauline vpon daie came vnto sat musing best doo laid hand vpon head asking knew signe whereat king would haue fallen downe féet lifted vp familiar wise thus said vnto behold assistance god fauour thou hast escaped hand thine enimies whome thou stoodst feare behold bountious liberalitie thou hast obteined kingdome thou diddest desire remember thou delaie time performe third thing thou diddest promise receiuing faith kéeping commandements deliuering thée worldlie aduersities hath thus aduanced thée honor king henceforth thou wilt obey mouth hée setteth preacheth thée others deliuer thée euerlasting torment make thée partaker celestiall kingdome thought vision king time past receiued spirit reuealed vnto pauline wherevpon without delaie time put remembrance maner aboue mentioned king hauing heard word answered would ought receiue faith taught first would conferre noble would agrée doo like would baptised altogither one time pauline satisfied herewith edwin promised calling togither wisest men realme asked question thought diuinitieedwin consulteth noble preached vnto pauline vnto whome chiefe bishop named coifi incontinentlie made answerthe answere heathen bishop suerlie religion hicherto followed nothing worth saith none thy people hath reuerentlie woorshipped god haue doone yet manie haue receiued far greater benefit thy hand haue doone therefore god anie power would rather helpe high honor dignitie others therefore maie found new religion better auailable old let v spéed imbrace finallie king councell men high authoritie gaue consent doctrine pauline taught ought receiued therein appeered certeintie saluation could found length king gaue licence pauline openlie preach gospellpauline licenced preach gospell renouncing worshipping false god professed christian faith demanded bishop coifi first deface altar idol tabernacle wherewith compassed answered himselfe would doo méet saith thorough foolishnesse haue worshipped example sake destroie thorough wisedome giuen true liuing god streightwaies throwing awaie superstition vanitie required armour weapon king stoned horsse vpon mounted rode foorth destroie countrie cadwallo taking aduice matter length persuasion nephue brian denied grant vnto edwin request wherewith edwin tooke displeasure sent woord vnto cadwallo would crowned without leaue licence sith would willinglie grant wherto cadwallo answered would cut head vnder diademe presumed weare anie within confines britaine hereof discord arising betwixt two prince began make fierce cruell warre desirous restore christian faith whole kingdome sore lamenting decay thereof within therefore euen beginning reigne sent vnto donwald scotish king whome béene brought vp time banishment space 18 yéeres requiring haue learned scotishman sent vnto skilfull preaching word life godly sermon wholesome instruction might conuert people northumberland vnto true liuing god promising interteine prouision apperteined instance sent vnto one corman clerke singularlie well learnedcorman great grauitie behauiour wanted facilitie plaine vtterance waie gentle persuading requisite shall instruct simple onelie setting foorth sermon high mystery matter profound knowledge verie learned might scarselie perceiue perfect sense meaning talke trauell came small effect yéeres remaining returned countrie declaring amongst brother cleargie people northumberland froward stubborne stiffeharted generation whose mind could frame anie good meanes persuasion receiue christian faith iudged lost labour spend time amongst vnthankfull intractable people good might doone vnto amongst learned vertuous prelats scot chanced one present time called aidanaidan man perfect life beda writeth taught otherwise liued hauing regard care world whatsoeuer giuen king men wealth rich fréelie bestowed vpon poore exhorting doo like aidan hearing cormans woords perceiued anon fault much people teacher therefore declared thought although people northumberland gaue attentiue eare vnto preaching reuerend prelate corman godlie expectation haue doone yet might vttering ouer manie mysticall article amongst farre aboue capacitie vnderstanding simple men cause lightlie regarded diuine instruction whereas according counsell saint paule first ministred vnto tender vnderstandings onelie milkes paules counsell without harder nourishment might happilie haue woone farre greater number vnto receiuing faith haue framed little little haue digested stronger food therefore thought necessarie discharge duty towards god satisfie earnest zeale king oswald one amongst might appointed go againe northumberland trie procéeding maner afore alledged profit would thereof insue bishop hearing opinion aidan therewith knowing cormans maner preaching iudged matter aidan declared therevpon onelie allowed woords also willed take iournie vpon sith knew none able effect accomplish wished desire behalfe aidanaidan commeth england preach gospell would seeme refuse take hand himselfe motioned contented satisfie request set forward towards northumberland comming thither ioifullie receiued king oswald appointed ile lindesfarne wherein place see new bishoprike aidan one point varied vse new begun church englandbeda li 3 ca 3 hector boet say touching time obseruing feast easter like maner bishop scot picts inhabiting within britaine day following therein tooke doctrine holie praisewoorthie father anatholius scot inhabited south part ireland alreadie agréed obserue feast according rule church rome howbeit aidan thus come northumberland applied himselfe earnestlie praier preaching people within short woonderfull estimation chiefelie tempered preaching swéet pleasant matter men great desire heare insomuch sometime glad preach abroad churchyard bicause audience could haue roome church one thing great hinderance perfect knowledge saxon toong oswald himselfe great helpe matter desirous nothing haue hard scotland time banishment readie scotish saxon toong people seeing king earnest desire furthering doctrine set foorth aidan inclined heare maruellous matter note number people dailie offred named adrian take office vpon adrian excused himselfe sufficient roomeadrian required pope appoint one andrew moonke also wherevnto pope consented andrew preuented death eftsoones adrian haue béene made archbishop named one theodore moonke abode rome borne citie tharsus cilicia verie well learned gréeke latine reuerend yeares 76 theodore presentment adrian appointed ordeined archbishop canturburie condition adrian neuerthelesse attend vpon england béene twise time france knew coast againe might assist thing looke well matter theodore bring church england anie rite custome gréekes contrarie vse romane church theodore first ordeined subdeacon tarried foure moneths till heare growen might haue crowne shauen maner peter rounded shauen maner east church persuaded themselues according vse saint paule apostletheodore ordeined archbishop canturburie length theodore ordeined archbishop canturburie pope uitalianus yeare lord 668668 sixt kalends iune adrian sent britaine retinue came france come thither shortlie king egbert knowledge thereof wherevpon conuenient spéed sent ouer one noble named redfrid bring archbishop england adrian staied time suspected haue commission emperour haue practised englishman disquieting realme france howbeit perceiued suspicion grounded truth also suffered follow archbishop comming vnto canturburie made abbat monasterie saint augustine archbishop theodore came thus vnto church canturburie second yeare consecration second kalends iune sundaie gouerned church also 21 yeares 16 day first archbishop whome church england acknowledge obeisance accompanied foresaid adrian visited part land ordeined bishop minister church thought conuenient reformed church séemed néedfull well thing misliked also causing obserue feast easterran cest matth west according rite vsage church rome ceadda bishop yorke lawfullie ordeinedbeda himselfe confessed remoued sée yorke wilfrid therevnto restored ceadda though disgraded degrée performance vow offered vnto bishop wilfride chanced present taken ile much therof conteined 300 housholds family whole consisted 1200 housholds wilfrid receiuing thankefullie gift deliuered vnto one seuen moneths thought disquieted continuall warres trouble finallie brought end naturall course time punishment wicked consent giuen putting death cousin ethelbert ethelbrit appeared reported martyrswil malm knowen died innocentlie mocked made iest although brother acknowledging fault capgraue faith sister repented thereof gaue recompense mother part ile thanet building monasterie foresaid edrikeedricke lother dead got dominion kent ruled king thereof without ciuill warre insomuch reigned full terme two yeares slaine warre ceadwalla king westsaxons thereof aduertised supposing time come would serue purpose one still coueting worke kentishmen displeasure could entred armie theri covntrie began waste spoile ech side till finallie kentishmen assembled themselues togither gaue battell enimies put flight mollo brother ceadwalla driuen companie constrained take house refuge enimies pursued set fire thereon burned hosue mollo within ash yet ceadwalla herewith deaprt countriemollo brother king ceadwalla burnt death wreake wrath reuenge griefe tooke death brother wasted destroied great part kent yer returned home left occasion successor also pursue quarell reuenging wherein sée cankerd nature man speciallie case wrong displeasure far tollerating forgiuing tooth naile permitted take vengeance heart breake full conceit wrath law nature teacheth v otherwise affected namelie —per te nulli vnquam iniuria fiat sed verbis alijsque modis fuge laedere quenquam quod tibi nolles alijs fecisse caueto quódque tibi velles alijs praestare studeto haec est naturae lex optimum quam nisiad vnguem seruabis non ipse deo mihi crede placebis póstque obitum infoelix non aurea sydera adibis lesson taught nature commanded god men followed minded nothing lesse fier furie would haue béene content competent reuenge outragious maner fier sword haue afflicted one another tigerlike crueltie haue ministred occasion posterity reuenge wrong giuen taken ancestor let passe without discourse meaning hereafter due place declare processe kentishmen destitute king diuers coueted place sought atteine thereto well force otherwise great disquieting prouince space 6 yeares togither length 7 yeare edricks death withred sonnes king egbertwithdredis made king • kent hauing diligent trauell ouercome enuie home monie redéemed peace abroad great hope conceiued worthinesse made king kent 11 nobuember 205 death hengist reigned 33 yeares deceiuing subiects good conceiued opinion ouercomming aduersaries readie leuie ciuill warre also purchased peace inas king westsaxons ment haue made warre till monie made friend little withdred confirmed kingdome kent hen hunt beda lib 5 suebhard nidred king vsurpation succe • sion •• hunt writeth reigned two king countrie suebhard nidred rather withred printed copie beda booke intituled ecclesiastica historia gentis anglorum haue name corrupted sheweth archbishop theodorus age 88 yeares departed life yeare lord 690 next chapter declareth yeare 692 first daie iulie brightwald chosen succéed archbishop sée canturburie withredus suebhardus reigning kent whether withredus gouerned suebhardus named nidred forceth certeine agréement othere writer till withdred obteined whole rule great strife contention moued gouernement diuers wre sought fought itbrightwald first archbishop english nation ought noted forenamed brightwald eight archbishop till none august yeare following birth sauiour 759 man prooued right valiant gouernement subiects slue battell earle countrie named oswin arrearing warre fought pitcht field eadwines cliue receiued worthie reward rebellion chanced third yeare reigne shortlie aftersimon dun 764 say yeare lord 764 fell maruellous great snow therwith extreame frost like béene heard continuing beginning wintes almost till middest spring rigour whereof tree fruit withered awaie lost liuelie shape growth onelie feathered foules also beast land fish sea died great number yeare died cedlwulf king northumberland vnto whome beda dedicate booke history english nation become moonke monasterie lindesfernemoonks licenced drinke wine moonks house licence drinke wine ale whereas might drinke anie thing milke water great towardnesse vertuouslie brought vp father circumspect care diligence vtterlie abhorred vice delighted onelie vertue commendable exercise better atteining knowledge vnderstanding good science remaine manie sundrie saiengs dooings manifestlie bearing witnesse could man honorable thankefullthe saieng king ethelbert courteous gentle amongest saieng oftentimes mouth greater men humble ought beare themselues lord putteth proud mightie men seates exalteth humble méeke moreouer onelie shew himselfe wise word desired also excell staiednesse maners continencie life whereby wan heart people perceiuing nothing delighted companie woman therefore minded mariage singular loue fauour towards required anie wise yet take wife might haue issue succéed length matter referred councell persuaded thing lastlie la •• one night asléepe thought saw dreame roofe owne palace fall downe ground though thing brought great feare yet kept iourniethe innocent mistrustfull euill mistrusted deceit acknowledge supreme gouernoursimon dun yeare bernulfe king mercia slaine eastanglesthese men cornish men supposed sore battell foughten gauelford betwixt deuonshire britain manie thousand died part king egbert hauing conquered english people inhabiting south side humber led foorth armie northumberland northumbers onelie vexed ciuill sedition also often inuasion dane perceiued able resist power king egbertking egbert inuadeth northumberland northumbers mit themselues king egbert therefore vpon good aduisement taken matter resolued submit themselues therevpon sent ambassador offer submission committing themselues wholie vnto protection king egbert gladlie receiued promised defend forren enimies thus kingdome northumberland brought vnder subiection king westsaxons state béen sore weakened contention ciuill discord continued amongst noble countrie space manie yeeres beside inuasion made outward enimies gréeuous damage people king egbert finished businesse northumberland turned power towards countrie northwales subdued citie chester till day 〈◊〉 northwales citie chester conquered egbert britain welshman kept possession king egbert obteined victory made conquest mentioned people héere land caused councell assembled winchester aduise high estate crowned king • ouereigne gouernour supreame lord whole land also recorded caused commission directed foorth part realme giue commandement thence forward people inhabiting within land called english men saxon likewise land called england one generall namethe name 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 changed though appéere mentioned called shortlie first time angle saxon got possession thereof king egbert setled good quiet dominion reduced trouble warre suddenlie newes camethe dane dane nauie 35 ship arriued english coast began make sore warre land k egbert thereof aduertised conuenient spéed got togither armie went foorth giue battell enimies heerevpon incountring sore foughten field betwixt continued great slaughter side till night came chance warre englishman point haue gone awaie victorie vanquished put flightthe englishman discomfited dane simon dun h hunt matth west 834 yet king egbert couert night escaped enimies hand two chiefe trouble misery •• ed persecuted dane speciallie persecution dane made sore greeuous war sundrie part landmatt westm destroieng cruell wise moneth made kingthe dane obteine victorie gaue battell dane vnto london lay winter season second yeare alured reigne 〈◊〉 danish king halden led armie london lindseie lodged winter torkseierep • yeare following halden inuaded mercia wintered ripindonburthred king mercia come thrée leader dane writer name king godrun esketell ammond power greatlie increased burthred king mercia gouerned countrie space 22 yéeres able withstand puissance enimies wherevpon part thereof went northumberland lay winter season néere riuer tine hee diuided countrie amongest men remained space two yeares oftentimes fetched thither booty prey countrie ofthe picts part danish armie thrée foresaid king leader came vnto cambridgethe dane cambridge remained whole yeare yeare king alured fought sea 7 ship danes876 tooke one chased residue yeare next insuingthe dane tooke oth hen hunt dane came countrie westsaxons king alured tooke truce againe sware vsed doo anie afore time would depart countrie armie sea sailing warham toward excester susteined great losse tempest perished 120 ship swanewicke moreouer armie dane land went excester breach trucethe dane went excester king alured followed could ouertake till came excester approched wise glad deliuer pledge performance couenants accorded betwixt themhent hunt departed countrie drew mercia shortlie whole gouernment land thames northward thought good suffer king alured continue rest residue country beyond thames therefore thrée foresaid ruler dane godrun esketell ammond inuading countrie westsaxons came chipnam distant 17 mile bristow877 pitched tent king alured aduertised hereofpolydor hasted thither lodging armie néere enimies prouoked battell dane perceiuing either must fight liues die shame boldlie came foorth gaue battell englishman rashlie incountered though ouermatched number yet violence gaue onset enimies first abashed hardie assault perceiued slender rank able resist thicke leghers enimies began shrinke looke backe one vpon force constreined retire therewithall cast themselues ring though séemed best way could deuised safetie yet great force number enimies side assailing thronged togither heap roome stir weapon disaduantage notwithstanding • lue great number daneshubba slaine amongest hubba brother agner manie danish capteins length englishman hauing valiantlie foughten long time enimies compassed last brake got campethe victorie doubtfull briefe battell foughten equall fortune man knew whether part victorie ought ascribed seuered tooke care cure hurt men burie dead body namelie dane interred bodie capteine hubba great funerall pompe solemnitie doone held iournie till came abingtonabington whither english armie shortlie came also incamped fast enimies meane rumor spread abroad king alured béene discomfited dane bicause last battell withdrew campe turned greatlie aduantage thereby great number englishman hasted come succourthe dane englishman fight néer abington morrow comming abington brought armie readie fight field neither enimies slacke part receiue battell two army ioined fought verie sore side séemed englishman doo dane béene diuerse time discomfited put flight rather new people fresh lustie neither one part minded giue ouer much horssemen alighting foot putting horsses entered battell amongst footman thus continued equall aduantage till night came parted affraie one sorest foughten field beene heard day whether partie man welshman great glorie high commendation beginning reigne disquieted brother adelwold tooke towne winborne besides bath maried nun whome deflouredwinborne attempted manie thing brother wherevpon king came bath though adelwold shewed countenance would haue abidden chance warre within winborne hen hunt adelwold fleeth dane yet stole awaie night fled northumberland ioifullie receiued dane king tooke wife left behind restored hir house whence takenwil malm ¶some haue written adelwold ethelwold brother vnto king edward vncles sonne king edward prouiding suertie subiects forraies dane vsed make fortified diuers city townes stuffed great garrison souldiers defend inhabitant expell enimiesthe english nation practised war go commonlie awaie victorie suerlie englishman invred warres day people aduertised inuasion enimies anie part countrie would assemble oftentimes without knowledge king capteine setting vpon enimies went commonlie awaie victorie reason ouermatched number practise enimies despised english souldiers laughed scorne king foolish attemptshen hunt yet third yeare king edward reigne adelwold brother came nauie dane party eastanglesessex yéeldes adelwold euen first essex men yeelded themselues vnto yéere following inuaded countrie mercia great armieran higd wasting spoiling vnto crikelade passing ouer thames rode foorth till came basingstokebrittenden bookes haue brittenden harieng countrie side returned backe vnto eastangles great ioy triumph king edward awakened héerewithhen hun • assembled people followed enimies wasting country betwixt riuer ouse saint edmunds ditch returne gaue commandement man staie behind come backe togither doubt forelaid enimiesthe kentishmen disobeiing king commandement surprised enimies adelwold king edward brother kentishmen notwithstanding ordinance commandement remained behind although king sent seuen messenger dane awaiting aduantage came togither fiercelie fought kentishmen long time valiantlie defended themselues end dane obteined victorie although lost people kentishmen amongst slaine foresaid adelwold diuerse chiefe capteins amongst dane likewise english side died two duke siwolfe singlem sigbelme sundrie men name temporall also spirituall lord abbats fift yéere reigne king edward concluded truce dane eastangle northumberland itingford yéere following sent armie northumberlandfortie day saith simon dun slue manie dane tooke great booty people cattell remaining countrie space fiue weekes yéere next insuing dane great armie entered mercia rob spoile countrie whome king edward sent mightie host assembled togither westsaxons mercia set vpon dane returning homeward slue huge multitude togither chiefe capteins leader king halden king eolwils earle uter earle scurfahen hunt diuerse yéere 912 simon dunel saith 908 duke mercia edred etheldred departed life king edward seized hand city london oxford part mercia held afterwards suffered sister elfleda inioy part thereof except said city london oxford still reteined owne hand elfleda wife said duke edred etheldred haue heard whose woorthie act shall said heereafter ninth yéere reigne king edward built castell hertfordwightham likewise apostle 26 maie yeare came fell tuesday set table espied common robber placed neere vnto whome sometime banished land returned without licence presumed come king presence wherewith king moued high disdaine suddenlie arose table flew vpon theefe catching heare head threw vnder féet wherewithas haue said finallie prince king théefe hauing fast hold king brought downe vpon also knife stroke bellie wise king bowel fell chest presentlie died theefe hewen péeces king seruants yet slue hurt diuers could dispatch chance lamentable namelie english people ouertimelie death king whome appeared manie euident token great excellencie lost hope conceiued great wealth increase prudent princelie gouernement bodie buried glastenburie dunstane abbat write death king edmund signified aforehand dunstane time attending vpon king remooued one place othercapgraue chanced accompanie himselfe noble mana vaine tale one duke elstane rode togither behold suddenlietokens great excellencie lost hope dunstane saw waie king musician rode diuell running leaping amongst musician reioising maner whome beheld good said duke possible may see sée duke answered saw nothing otherwise ought sée said dunstane blesse eies signe crossecrossing bringeth sight diuels crossing driueth away trie whether see sée doone dunstane appointed saw also féend likenesse little short euill fauoured aethiopian dansing leaping whereby gathered euill hap towards companie crossed blessed foule spirit vanished sight talked visiondunstane interpretor dreames made end talke touching duke required dunstane interpret dreame late night worke saith honor woman hath tasted pleasure king bodie anie suffer seruitude vnder rule appointment sharpe rough mistresse king mooued spirit laughed matter though heart tooke great indignation vttered edgar great reproch wiselie dissembled matter time although kept remembrance thereof inclosed within breast vpon occasion length feigned go hunting taking king scot forth hauing caused one seruants conuey two sword place within forrest appointed secret wise purpose withdrew residue companie accompanied onelie scotish king came place sword laid taking one deliuered scotish kingthe noble courage king edgar willing assaie strength might shew proofe whether ought subiect start trie saith shame king full brag bankets readie fight triall made abroad scotish king herewith astonied maruellouslie abashed fell downe féet much humilitie confessed fault desired pardon vpon humble submission king edward easilie granted noble prince two wiues egelfrida elfrida surnamed white daughter dunstane kingston vpon thames great griefe mother law alfred hir friendswil malm ¶about beginning reigne blasing starre seene signifieng thought miserable hap followed first insued barrennesse ground thereby famine amongest people morraine cattell also duke alfer elfer merciaalfer elfer duke mercia noble men destroied abbies king edgar bishop adelwold builded within limit mercia priest canon beene expelled edgar time prebend benefice began complaine wrong doone beene put possession liuings alleging great offense miserable case stranger come remoue old inhabitant maner dooing could please god yet allowed anie good man ought reason doubt least hap might sée haue béene man vndooing matter hard hold manie temporall lordsiohn cap • namelie alfer iudged priest wrongwil malm much remoued moonks placesran higd brought monastery secular priest wiuesmatt west edelwin duke eastangles alfred brothersimon dun brightnoth brighnode earle essex withstood dooing gathering armie great valiancie mainteined moonks house within countrie eastangles herevpon councels holdensimon dun winchester kirthling eastangle calne winchesterpolydor matter brought passe priest like haue purpose image rood stood refectorie sat councell vttered certeine woords wise god forbid god forbid ye iudged well ye may change well againea pretie shift moonks disappoint priest though saith polydorpolydor virgil moonks right berest men possession priest required restitution owne saith bicause image christ hanging crosse thought speake word credit giuen thereto béene oracle priest sute dashed trouble ceassed moonks held possession howsoeuer came helpe god rather saith polydor helpe man euen diuers thought rather oracle phebus god say published god power fraud craftie deceit men matter therefore quieted vpon new trouble councell manour house belonging kingwil malm called calne appointed haue hearing matter sat vpper lost king reason yoong yéeres spared came héere busied arguing matter either part sonne law hir owne sonne might inioy garland wherefore required alight wise would yéeld vnto said stolne companie onelie come see hir brother drinke therefore would returne forrest againe sée sport queene perceiuing would alight caused drinke fetched cup mouththe shameful murther k edward hir appointment one hir seruants stroke bodie knife wherevpon féeling himselfe wounded set sprres horsse thinking gallop awaie get companie hurt death fell horsse one féet fastened stirrup reason whereof horsse drew foorth wood launds bloud gushed wound shewed token death followed waie place horsse left condition euen necessitie required ouercome resteth onelie god kind agreement hath beene made deed destruction sith enimies haue sticked breake wicked king people neither regard god man contrarie france sixt yéere malcolme second king scot king edmund receiued crowne citie london hand archbishop yorke assembled togither power could make marched foorth towards west part made countrie subiect meane time cnute proclaimed ordeined king southampton bishop abbatsran higd diuerse lord also temporaltie togither assembled vnto whome sware good faithfull souereigne would sée iustice trulie vprightlie ministred ended businesse southamptonhen hunt simon dun drew people towards london comming thither besieged citie water land causing great trench cast man might either get come foorth manie great assalts caused giuen vnto citielondon besieged londoner others within valiantlie defended wals gate enimies got small aduantage length constreined depart losse cnute perceiuing might haue purpose withdrew westwardcnute galingham dorsetshire put flight besides gillingham dorsetshire incountred k edmund rogation weeke sore sharpe battell put woorse constreined forsake field high prowesse manhood said edmund king cnute night army seuered departed towards winchesterpolydor get himselfe danger shortlie king edmund hearing armie dane besieged salisburiesalisburie besieged marched thither succour within immediatlie cnute followed place worcestershire called scorastansimon dun matt west wit malm battell equall fortune foure twentith iune incountred togither fought verie cruell battell length night parted equall fortune likewise next day buckled togither againe fought like successe doone day beforean battell like successe towards euening gaue ouer well wearied knowing whome victorie ought ascribed writer haue reportededrike de streona treason simon dun second day duke edrike perceiued englishman point haue got vpper hand withdrew aside hauing chance slaine common souldier called osmear visage much resembled king edmund whose head cut held vp shaking swoord bloudie slaughter cried englishman flee ye wretch flee get awaie king dead behold heere head hold hand héerewith englishman fled immediatlie king edmund aduised stratagem quicklie got high ground men might sée aliue lustie héerewith also traitor edrike escaped hardlie danger death englishman shot egerlie length said night parting sunder withdrew one armie béene consent third day remained armor yet absteining battell sate still taking meate drinke relieue wearied body gathered heapes dead car case béene slaine former fighttwentie thousand dead body number either partie reckoned rose point twentie thousand aboue night followingthe army dislodged cnuse remooued campe secret wise marched towards london citie maner remained besieged nauie dane king edmund morning light discouered departure enimies followed tract comming london small adoo remooued siege dane ouercome brentford wil malm hen hunt fabian caxton polydor entered citie like conqueror shortlie fought dane brentford gaue great ouerthrow meane queene emma widow king egelred doubting fortune warre sent hir two sonnes alfred edward ouer normandie vnto hir brother duke richard rather fled thither hirselfe write moreouer earle edrike perceiuing great manhood king edmund began feare least end subdue vanquish dane wherefore sought meanes conclude peace take order might stand contentations yer long brought doone shall heare consent cnute writehent hunt intent edrike put trust king edmund might easilie deuise way betraie cnute disappointed purpose london fetching great bootie preie country next adioining repared ship sée order amongst little withdrawen riuer passeth rochester called medwaiethe riuer medwaie héere cnute remained certeine day assemble greater power also hearken learne enimies ment doo easilie vnderstood king edmundking edmunds diligence hated nothing woorse linger businesse assembled people marching forward toward enimies approched néere vnto pitcht downe tent farre enimies campe exhorting people remember passed victory doo good willes length one battell ouerthrow might make end warre dispatch cleerelie realme like woords incourage souldiers disdaining thus haue enimies dailie prouoke put trouble eger mind fierce courage offered battell dane cnute prepared receiue whensoeuer englishman approched heerewith bringing men araie came foorth méet enimies battell begun great earnestnesse sidesthe battell begun continued foure houres till length dane began somewhat shrinke cnute perceiued commanded horssemen come forward forepart dawnted host whilest one part dane gaue backe fearethe dane put flight came slowlie forward arraie whole armie broken without respect shame fled amaine died following oration capteine audience english danish armie haue woorthie capteins fought long inough one another hath beene much bloud shed betweene nation valiancie souldiers side sufficientlie seene triall either manhood likewise yet beare neither good euill fortune one win battell pursueth ouercome chance vanquished resteth till haue recouered new strength fight eftsoones victor meane inuincible came home write grow greatlie pride insomuch néere thames rather writehe caused chaire set matth west saith hen hunt vpon sea strand néere southhampton perceiuing water rise reason tide east gowne wrapping round togither threw sand verie neere increasing water sat downe vpon speaking like word sea thou art saith within compasse dominion ground whereon sit mine thou knowest wight dare disoboie commandements therefore doo command thée rise vpon ground presume wet anie part thy souereigne lord gouernour sea kéeping hir course rose still higher higher ouerflowed onelie king féet also flashed vp vnto leg knee wherewith king started suddenlie vp withdrew saieng withall noble himthe saieng king cnute behold noble men call king much staie commandement small portion water know ye certeine king father onelie lord iesus christ whome reigneth whose becke thing gouerned let v therefore honor let v confesse professe ruler heauenzealouslie inough bm according true knowledge earth sea besides none predecessor partlie tempered according owne liking thought expedient among diuerse concerne cause well ecclesiasticall temporall whereby maister fox hath noted maie gathered gouernment spirituall matter depend vpon bishop rome rather apperteined vnto lawfull authoritie temporall prince lesse matter cause temporall lawes statute enacted king cnute ye may read ye find set foorth remembred booke wise rebellious act canturburie vnder iurisdiction earle man bold courage quicke wit perceiue matter made great deale woorse first beginning likelihood would prooue end thought reason therefore first answere kentishmen heard anie sentence giuen héerevpon although king commanded foorthwith go armie kent punish canturburie rigorous maner yet would hastie refused execute king commandementearle goodwine offended king fauouring stranger bare péece grudge mind king fauour stranger highlie againe bicause héereby séeme doo pleasure countriemen taking vpon defend cause rough accusation accused wherefore declared king conuenient haue supposed offendors first called afore able excuse themselues suffered depart without vexation found faultie put fine well satisfieng king whose peace broken also earle damaged earle goodwine departed thus king leauing great furiea councel called glocester siward earle northumberland leofrike earle chester rafe earle hereford malmes howbeit passed litle thereof supposing would long continue king called great assemblie lord togither glocester matter might déepelie considered siward earle northumberland leofrike earle chester rafe earle hereford king nephue sister goda noble men realme onlie earle goodwine sonnes ment come except might bring great power armed men remained beuerstane band leauied vnder colour resist welshman whome bruted abroad readie inuade march hereford welshman preuenting slander signified king matter ment party earle goodwine sonnes complices went mooue commotion héerevpon rumor raised court king power shortlie march foorth assaile earle goodwine place lodged wherevpon earle prepared himselfe sent friend willing sticke quarrell king go force withstand rather yéeld suffer themselues troden vnder foot strangersearle goodwine meaneth defend selfe king swaine ran higd matth west simon dun harold goodwine meane time got togither great power country kent southerie west part swaine like wise assembled much people country barkeshire orfordshire summersetshire herefordshire glocestershire harold also come great multitude leuied essex norffolke sufforld cambridgeshire huntingtonshire part earles kingsimon dun leofrike siward rafe raised power might make approching glocester king thought himselfe suertie much whereas earle goodwine lay armie langton farre glocestershire sent vnto king requiring earle bullongne frenchman also norman held castell douer might deliuered vnto king though first stood great doubt doo yet hearing armie friend comming made answere messingers goodwine sent would deliuer man whome goodwine required héerewith said messenger departed king armie entered glocester readie good wils appéered fight aduersaries king would haue permitted would foorth haue gone giuen battell enimies thus matter point haue put realme hazard onelie field vtter ruine might thereof haue insued one part assembled chiefest lord able personage land wisedome good aduise earle leofrike others matter pacified time order taken come parlement communication london vpon pledge giuen receiued well one part king mightie armie northumbers mercia came vnto london earle goodwine sonnes great power westsaxons came southwarke perceiuing manie companie stale awaie slipt durst abide anie longer enter talke king couenanted night next insuing fled awaie spéed possible write wil malm swaine eldest sonne goodwine banished order prescribed swanus eldest sonne goodwine depart land banished man qualifie king wrath goodwine one son say harold come assemblie holden london accompanied 12 seruants onelie resigne force knight gentleman souldiers vnto king guiding gouernment last article pleased nothing earle goodwine perceiued force began decline able match king power fled realme likewise sonnesearle goodwine fled realme himselfe sonnes swanus tostie girth sailed flanders harold brother leofwine gat ship bristow passed ireland githa wife goodwine iudith wife tostie daughter baldwine earle flanders went ouer also husband goodwine sonnes proclaimed outlawes land giuen king edward putteth awaie queene wife earle goodwines daughter cleareth hir selfe houre hir death suspicion incontinencie lewdnesse life king edward forbare haue fleshlie pleasure hir earle goodwine sonnes take prey coast kent sussex griffin king wale destroieth great part herefordshire giueth incounterers ouerthrow harold leofwine two brother inuade dorset summerset shire resisted yet preuaile coast point cornwall ioine father goodwine king edward maketh threescore armed ship thicke mist separateth side readie graple fight pacification betweene king earle goodwine restored land libertie well friended counterpledges agreement interchangablie deliuered swanus eldest sonne goodwine notable rebell pirat troubled conscience wicked life wretched death third chapter king hauing perfect knowledge earle goodwine refused come court order prescribed departed realme sonnes proclaimed outlawes gaue land detionshire summersetshire moreouer time king put wife quéene editha himthe king put awaie wife editha appointed hir streict keeping abbeie warwell editha noble gentlewoman well learned expert science yet hir good name stained somewhat though liued continentlie wished hir husband life time deceasse yet houre hir death chanced day william conqueror cleared hir selfe taking vpon charge hir soule euer liued perfect chastitie king edward mentioned neuer touched hir anie actuall maner streict dealing quéene daughter earle goodwine time hir father exile hath séemed manie king edward forbare deale hir carnall wise hatred hir kin anie respect proceed second yéere goodwines banishment1052 hen hunt sonnes hauing prouided themselues ship men warre conuenient purpose came vpon coast england maner rouers wight king edward withstand malice rigged furnished foorth sixtie ship warresimon dun himselfe went water sticking lie aboord season although appointed capteines admerals two earles coosins odo rafe charge whole armie rafe nephue soone sister goda hir first husband gualter de maunt although knowne sufficient men ordering businesse yet thought necessitie person could presentlie spared therefore diligent foreséeing thing good aduise although age would giue leaue execute owne hand force bodie nauies part readie haue ioined seuered reason thicke mist rose wherby furious rage restreined time immediatlie therevpon goodwine complices forced contrarie wind returne place whence came shortlie mediation friend peace made earle goodwine restored home obteined againe king sauour former liuings eloquent wise man clered purged himselfe crime accusation anie sort béene laid thus haue written concerning agréement betwixt king edward erle goodwine make somewhat larger report thereof thus time two sonnes erle goodwine harold leofwine came foorth ireland inuaded west countrie king edward rigged foorth fortie ship throughlie furnished men munition vittels sent vnto sandwich commanding stigand infamed simonie kept winchester canturburie hand one instant stigand greatlie infamed couetous practises sale possession apperteining church nothing learned want common fault amongest bishop age openlie spoken day méet onelie bishop could vse pompe world voluptuous pleasureswhat maner men méet bishop day rich rament set himselfe foorth iollie retinue gentleman seruants horssebacke therein stood countenance bishop world went studie haue people fed word life sauing soules king edward twelfth yeare reignepolydor hauing brought state realme quite trouble warre sea land began foresée well welth subiects himselfe naturallie inclined wish well men therefore considered manifold lawes beene made britaines englishman dane within land occasion ministred manie measured thing respect owne priuate gaine profit peruert iustice vse wrongfull dealing stead right clouding vnder branch lawe naughtilie misconstrued wherevpon auoid mischiefe picked summe huge vnmesurable masse heape lawes thought indifferent necessarie therewith ordeined wholesome thenceforth vsed according whose prescript men might liue due forme rightfull order ciuill lifethe lawes edward instituted lawes afterwards called common lawes also saint edward lawes much esteemed englishman conquest norman oftentimes went abrogate chanced small mutiny rebellion reteining lawes heere noted although called saint edward lawes part made king edgar king edward restored bin abrogated time dane time1053 1054 hector boet polydor malmes matth west earle goodwine died suddenlie haue recorded sat table king vpon talke ministred death alfred king brother excuse himselfe tooke peece bread eate saieng god let neuer swallow bread downe chest may presentlie choked therewith euer weetting consenting vnto alfred death immediatlie therewith fell downe starke dead sayran higd ex mariano ended life winchester suddenlie surprised sicknesse simon dun likeliest tale sat table king vpon easter monday yet liued till thursday following died earledome giuen vnto sonne harold harolds earledome oxford giuen vnto algar sonne leofrike goodwine man great power wise hardie politike ambitious desirous beare rule loth anie person passe authoritie yet whether true writer report malicious practises bring himselfe sonnes chiefe seat gouernement kingdome hatred slander raised may perhaps doubted day king edward soft gentle prince bare great rule authoritie might procure himselfe euill report euerie thing chanced amisse oftentimes commeth passe case haue great dooings gouernement common wealth commonlie euill spoken earledome fift chapter thirteenth yeare king edward reigne writematth west 1054 hector boet rather nineteéenth twentith yeare appeare scotish writer siward noble earle northumberland great power horssemen went scotland battell put flight mackbeth vsurped crowne scotland doone placed malcolme surnamed camoir sonne duncane sometime king scotland gouernement realmesimon dun west afterward slue said mackbeth reigned quiet english writer say malcolme king cumberland report sonne king cumberland héere noted mackbeth reigned till yeare 1061 slaine malcolme earle siward battell writer doo testifie died yeare 1055 yeare next writer affirme vanquished mackbeth fight slue manie thousand scot norman ye haue heard withdrawen scotland driuen england recorded also foresaid battell earle siward vanquished scot one siwards sonnes chanced slaine whereof although father good cause sorowfull yet heard died wound receiued fighting stoutlie forepart bodie face towards enimie greatlie reioised thereat heare died manfullie noted little henrie hunt saith earle siward went scotland himselfe person sent sonne armie conquere land whose hap slaine father heard newes demanded whether receiued wound whereof died forepart bodie hinder part told receiued forepart reioise saith euen heart would wish either sonne selfe kind death shortlie aldred bishop worcester sent vnto emperour whereof harold aduertised left part armie northwales resist enimies therethe citie hereford fortified harold residue people came backe vnto hereford recouered towne caused great mightie trench cast realme england duke vse according ordinance k edward died without issue matth west duke william promised harold daughter marriage performe promise receiued corporall oth whether willinglie win credit forced thereto duke william writer report diuerslie time duke william promised vnto daughter marriage harold couenanted like maner take wife harold returne england reporteth k edward doone beyond sea king said vnto behalfe foresaw comming norman land conquer king edward promised make duke william heire wherein note subtiltie diffention betwixt harold tostie two brother sonnes earle goodwine offer returne home might haue new gouernor renounce tostie require marchar roome tostie displeased getteth flanders king edward dieth manner disposition note woorthie charitie deuotion vertue curing maladie called king euill deriued succeeding king land warned death ring canonized saint last woords spake deathbed wherein vttered stander vision prophesieng england inhabited stranger description england duke william deliuered nephue hacunepolydor kept brother wilnote still pledge went earle harold england declared vnto king edward doone said vnto tell thee thou wouldest doo thing whereof thou shouldest repent thee procure mischiefe follow vnto thy countrie god mercie turne euill hap realme least pleasure must need come passe yet staie till day harolds purposed going ouer normandie doo gather king edward foresaw comming norman meant nothing lessewhen promise made king edward make 〈◊〉 william 〈◊〉 heire performe promise made vnto duke william adopt heire promise séeme made time banishment stood néed friendship maner men case promise much euer intend fulfill rather maie thought king edward made promise perceiued ambitious desire duke william therefore would anie occasion ministred vnto take hold wherefore loth harold go ouer vnto least might happen happened déed foure twentieth last yéere king edward reigne hen hunt matth west fabian falling betwixt brother therabout fell variance betwixt two brother earle harold earle tostie windsor court lay much earle harold caught tostie haire head king presence stroke heervpon tostie departing court great anger came hereford march wale harolds seruants preparing king comming maisters housethe cruell dealing earle tostie seruants tooke slue chopping péeces threw hogshead wine leg barrell sider arme vessell ale head lome meth tub brine liquor bestowed part dead car • ass brother seruants sending king woord prouided brother manor cōming good plentie sowse powdred meat whatsoeuer find beside rumor cruell deed sprang ouer realme wherevpon northumbers whome gouerned space ten yéeres verie cruellie tooke occasion rebell himthe northumbers r • bell tostie earle slue seruants englishman dane spoiled house tooke awaie horsses armour good houshold stuffe chiefest cause remembred writer mooued northumbers thus rise rebell tostie detestable murther certeine gentleman countrie seruants vnto gospatrike queene behalfe hir brother caused slaine court treason fourth night christmas last past also reuenge noble men last yéere tostie himselfe commanded murthered owne chamber yorke whither allured come vnder colour concluding peace also gréeuous paiments wherewith charged people countrie set great rage king aduertised héereof liked dooings doone without commandement commission therefore sent earle harold armie chastise themwil malm strong inough withstand assembled armour togither people lincolneshire notinghamshire darbishire hauing marcharus malcharus sonne earle algar come farre northhampton much hurt part therabouts howbeit haue king peace offered returne home might haue earle appointed plainlie protested freeman borne bred bondage might suffer anie cruell gouernor rule ouer taught ancestor either liue libertie die defense thereof therefore might please king assigne marcharus son earle algar ruler see obedient subiects would prooue shew themselues vsed reasonable courteous manner thing considered request seemed reasonable least thought necessarie granted marcharus malcherus made earle northumberlandmarcharus made earle northumberland tostie great displeasure wife child sailed ouer flanders remained till deceasie king edward finallieit edward departed life courteous prince king edward reigned thrée twentie yeeressimon dun seuen moneths od day departed life london fourth ianuarie buried church westminster life time roiallic repared statelie sort church day like therevnto within realme afterwards patorne built forme edward prince vertuous disposition mindk edward maners disposition mind described fame holinesse sprang ouer abhorred warres shedding bloud much liued banished man normandie saieng oftentimes mouth rather liue priuate life euer obteine kingdome slaughter death anie man could abide haue people oppressed tribute exaction much caused paiment called danegilt continued space almost fortie yéeres ceasse hath beene said collector monie subsidie got huge quantitie treasure togither brought vnto laid altogither vpon heape delight eiesa diuell fetching gambol declaring saw diuell plaieng fetching gambol heape monie commanded awaie restored againe whome leauied diet apparell spare nothing sumptuous although high feast ware rich apparell became maiestie roiall personage yet shewed proud loftie countenance rather praising god bountifull goodnesse attempt conquest england harold harfager tostie power arriue humber fight northumbers vnder conduct edwine marchar discomfit harold leuieth armie rare valiantnes norwegian souldior harfager tostie iudgement dispose realme england wise gouernance therof fall maner hand william duke normandie haue thought good enter historie come conquest realme made foresaid duke normandie set downe pedegrée thereby shew descended first duke countrie named rollo receiuing baptisme called robert said rollo rou sonne great lord denmarke called guion hauing two son said rou gourin appointed depart countrie lot fell according maner vsed time people increased greater number countrie able susteine refused obeie order made warre king yet end practise found meanes slea foresaid guion sonne gourin rou rollo hauing thus lost father brother compelled forsake countrie holpe father make warre king thus driuen séeke aduentures length became christian created duke normandie gift charles king france surnamed le simple whose daughter ladie gilla also maried departing life without issue maried popée daughter earle bessin baieulx whome kept wife baptised hir sonne named william longespée daughter named gerlota william longespée longaspata wife ladie sporta daughter hubert earle senlis whome issue richard second name duke normandie married ladie agnes daughter hugh le grand earle paris whome issue procéeded hir deceasse maried second wife gentlemwoman named gonnor daughter kinght danish line thrée sonnes richard duke normandieye must note one richard duke normandie rollo third name robert mauger also hir three daughter agnes otherwise called emma married first egelred king england k cnute helloie otherwise alix bestowed vpon geffrey earle britaine mawd coupled marriage euldes earle charter blais richard third name maried iudith sister geffrey earle britaine whome issue thrée sonnes richard robert william manie daughter alix married reignold earle burgogne elenor married baldwine earle flanders third died yoong affianced alfonse king nauarre mother deceassed beene married ten yéeres duke richard married secondlie ladie estric sister cnute king england denmarke whome purchased diuorsed married gentlewoman called pauie whome issue two sonnes william earle arques mauger archbishop rouen richard fourth name duke normandie eldest sonne richard third died without issue brother
